question: Does Primolut N taken during pregnancy affect the baby?Hi doctor..I have taken primoult n tablet twice daily for 5 days to delay my periods in the month of march.I was not aware of the pregnancy at that time but now when I tested in April month it is positive in pregnancy.so my question here is does this tablet effect my baby
answer: Hi,     Thanks for the query. Primolute  N-a hormonal preparation of female sex hormone... is contraindicated in pregnancy. It can cause fetal congenital abnormality &so such pregnancy (with intake of pills like promolute n ) needs to be terminated. Thanks.

question: Does Primolut N taken during pregnancy affect the baby?Hi doctor..I have taken primoult n tablet twice daily for 5 days to delay my periods in the month of march.I was not aware of the pregnancy at that time but now when I tested in April month it is positive in pregnancy.so my question here is does this tablet effect my baby
answer: It is not recommended to use Primolut N during pregnancy, as it can cause harm to the developing baby. Primolut N is a medication that contains the hormone norethisterone, which is used to regulate the menstrual cycle and treat menstrual disorders. When taken during pregnancy, it can interfere with the normal development of the fetus and increase the risk of birth defects. If you are pregnant and have taken Primolut N, it is important to speak with your healthcare provider as soon as possible. They will be able to advise you on the best course of action and provide any necessary medical care to ensure the health and safety of you and your baby.

question: Is chest pain related to intake of clindamycin and oxycodone?Hi Dr. Bhatti, I was recently released from the hospital after a hand surgery and they provided me with Clindamycin 300mg and Oxycodone Acetaminophens. Ive taken this combination 3 times now and my chest feels really tight. Is there reason for me to worry?

question: Q. Kindly advise how to control wheezing and shortness of breath while having cold.Hello doctor,I have a wheezing problem and breathing shortness when I suffer from cold. I noticed I have dust allergy also. Day by day my problem is increasing. Now I have to take Levolin inhaler three times in a day. Is there any measure to control my problem?
answer: Wheezing and shortness of breath can be symptoms of a number of different conditions, including colds, allergies, and asthma. If you are experiencing these symptoms, it is important to speak with a healthcare provider to determine the cause and to receive appropriate treatment.If you have a cold, there are a few things you can do to help reduce your symptoms:Get plenty of rest: Your body needs extra energy to fight off the infection, so it is important to get enough rest.Stay hydrated: Drink plenty of fluids, such as water and broth, to help loosen congestion and keep your throat moist.Use a humidifier: A humidifier can help to add moisture to the air, which can help to ease congestion and make breathing easier.Use over-the-counter medications: There are several over-the-counter medications that can help to reduce cold symptoms, such as decongestants and antihistamines.If you have allergies, it is important to try to avoid exposure to the substances that trigger your symptoms. This may involve using air purifiers, avoiding certain types of food or plants, and taking allergy medications as prescribed by your healthcare provider.If you have asthma, it is important to follow your asthma action plan as directed by your healthcare provider. This may involve taking medications, such as inhaled corticosteroids, as well as avoiding triggers that can cause asthma symptoms.It is important to speak with a healthcare provider if you are experiencing persistent or severe wheezing or shortness of breath, or if your symptoms are not responding to over-the-counter treatments. A healthcare provider can help to determine the cause of your symptoms and recommend the most appropriate treatment.

question: What are the side effects of changing the medication?I am cuurently and permanently on warfarin, and in one week s time I am to undergo surgery to have tor tendons repaired in my right shoulder. I have been on warfarin for three years since a mechanical aortic valve was implanted during open heart surgery.What side effects should I expect? Thankyou

In adequate dose should not have major problems, there are adverse effects seen in blood test only, but in addition to that it is a pretty safe medicinal product. Jose Mero Santana, General & Family Physician

question: What are the side effects of changing the medication?I am cuurently and permanently on warfarin, and in one week s time I am to undergo surgery to have tor tendons repaired in my right shoulder. I have been directed to change temperarily from warfarin to glexane for six days prior to my surgery. I have been on warfarin for three years since a mechanical aortic valve was implanted during open heart surgery.What side effects should I expect? Thankyou
answer: The specific blood thinner that your healthcare provider has prescribed for you, enoxaparin (brand name Lovenox), is commonly used for this purpose.Enoxaparin is an injectable blood thinner that is given subcutaneously (under the skin) in the abdominal area. It works by preventing blood clots from forming.There are some potential side effects associated with enoxaparin, although most people do not experience any problems. Possible side effects include:Bleeding: As with any blood thinner, the most common side effect of enoxaparin is bleeding. This can occur at the injection site or elsewhere in the body. If you experience bleeding that is severe or persistent, or if you notice any unusual bleeding or bruising, you should contact your healthcare provider.Allergic reactions: Some people may experience allergic reactions to enoxaparin, such as hives, rash, or difficulty breathing. If you have a history of allergies or have had an allergic reaction to enoxaparin in the past, be sure to let your healthcare provider know.Other side effects: Other possible side effects of enoxaparin include nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and stomach pain. These side effects are generally mild and should resolve on their own. If you experience any of these side effects, or if you have any other concerns about your treatment with enoxaparin, you should speak with your healthcare provider.It's important to follow your healthcare provider's instructions for taking enoxaparin, as well as any other medications that you may be prescribed. Be sure to ask your healthcare provider any questions you may have about your treatment.

question: Is early intrauterine cyesis causing bleeding after having sex during pregnancy concerning?hello sir,i am pregnant for five weeks and whenever i have sex i bleed for that period,the ultrasound result shows am having an early intrauterine cyesis but suggest to repeat scan in two weeks to ascertain fetal viability.am i at the risk of loosing my baby.i really want to have my baby cos i have lost two pregnancies before this one.
answer: It is not uncommon for pregnant women to experience some bleeding after having sex, especially in the first trimester. However, it is important to speak with a healthcare provider about any bleeding during pregnancy, as it can be a sign of a potential problem.An early intrauterine pregnancy, or a pregnancy that is located inside the uterus but not yet attached to the uterine lining, can sometimes cause bleeding. This can happen if the pregnancy is not viable, or if the fertilized egg does not implant properly in the uterine lining.It is important to follow the recommendation of your healthcare provider and have another ultrasound in two weeks to determine the viability of the pregnancy. This will help to determine the best course of action for you and your baby. In the meantime, it is important to avoid sexual activity if you are experiencing bleeding, and to speak with your healthcare provider about any concerns or questions you may have.

question: Q. What are the ways to control hair fall?Hello doctor,I started losing hair a year ago. Probably after starting my job. question: Q. What are the ways to control hair fall?Hello doctor,I started losing hair a year ago. Probably after starting my job. Mainly hairs on my temples and side hairs on the front part of my head. I was using Nutrafol tablets and have used it for about four months now and have not seen any results. Please help.
answer: There are several things you can try to control hair fall and potentially promote new hair growth. It's important to note that the effectiveness of these methods can vary from person to person, and it's always a good idea to consult a healthcare professional for personalized recommendations.Use a gentle shampoo and conditioner: Using a gentle shampoo and conditioner that is formulated for your hair type can help to reduce hair breakage and improve overall hair health.Avoid using heat styling tools: Heat styling tools, such as hair dryers and straighteners, can damage your hair and contribute to hair loss. If you do use heat styling tools, try to use them on a lower heat setting and use a heat protectant spray to help minimize damage.Eat a healthy diet: A healthy diet that is rich in nutrients, including protein, iron, and vitamins A and C, may help to support healthy hair growth.Avoid tight hairstyles: Hairstyles that pull on the hair, such as tight ponytails or braids, can contribute to hair loss. Try to avoid these types of hairstyles, or at least wear them less often.Consider using hair growth products: There are a number of hair growth products available that may help to promote hair growth and reduce hair loss. These include minoxidil, which is available over the counter, and finasteride, which is a prescription medication. It's important to speak with a healthcare professional before starting any new treatment, as these products may have potential side effects.Get enough sleep and manage stress: Getting enough sleep and managing stress can help to support overall health, including the health of your hair.Consult a healthcare professional: If you are concerned about hair loss, it's a good idea to consult a healthcare professional, such as a dermatologist or trichologist. They can help to determine the cause of your hair loss and recommend the most appropriate treatment.

question: Have allergic asthama. Did x-ray. Impression of bronchitis with bilateral hilar lymphadenopathy. Treatment?my sister bhagyshree is suffering from  allergic asthama, acc. to my town doctors. after X-ray the impression that i have got is bronchitis with bilateral hilar lymphadenopathy please tell me the treatment for this and the best ways to get cure? i have my email id  YYYY@YYYY  can u give me full detail about it?
answer: It is important to consult with a healthcare provider for proper diagnosis and treatment of allergic asthma and any related conditions. Bronchitis is an inflammation of the bronchial tubes, which can be caused by infections or irritants, and it can lead to symptoms such as coughing, shortness of breath, and chest pain. Bilateral hilar lymphadenopathy refers to swelling of the lymph nodes in the chest, which can be caused by various conditions, including infections, inflammation, or cancer.Treatment for allergic asthma and bronchitis may include medications such as inhaled corticosteroids to reduce inflammation in the airways, bronchodilators to help open up the airways, and leukotriene inhibitors to prevent inflammation. Your healthcare provider may also recommend lifestyle changes, such as avoiding triggers that can worsen asthma symptoms, getting vaccinated to prevent respiratory infections, and practicing good respiratory hygiene (such as covering your mouth and nose when you cough or sneeze).In some cases, additional tests or procedures may be needed to determine the cause of the bronchitis and bilateral hilar lymphadenopathy, and to guide treatment. It is important to follow your healthcare provider's instructions and to keep all of your appointments for follow-up care.I would recommend discussing your concerns and treatment options with your healthcare provider. They will be able to provide more specific recommendations based on your sister's specific situation. If you have any additional questions or concerns, don't hesitate to ask your healthcare provider for more information.

question: Can blood pressure stabilize after being on high salt diet?Hi there.  I have high blood pressure and had swelling of my feet and legs after a night out in high heels.  It has been two days and the swelling is just decreasing now after a day of rest and leg elevation.  I took my bp about 20 min ago and it was 137/92.  I am on meds to control my bp but have had more salt intake the last few days than normal.  Will i be ok?
answer: It is possible for your blood pressure to stabilize after being on a high salt diet, but it is important to monitor your blood pressure and consult with a healthcare provider if you are concerned about your blood pressure or if you experience persistent swelling.Elevated blood pressure can be caused by a variety of factors, including high salt intake, obesity, lack of physical activity, stress, and certain medications. Maintaining a healthy lifestyle, including following a low-salt diet, getting regular physical activity, and managing stress, can help to manage blood pressure.If you are taking medications to control your blood pressure, it is important to follow your healthcare provider's instructions for taking your medications and to report any changes in your symptoms or blood pressure readings to your provider. They may need to adjust your treatment plan if your blood pressure remains elevated or if you experience side effects from your medications.It is also important to get regular check-ups with a healthcare provider to monitor your blood pressure and overall health. They can help you determine the best course of treatment for managing your blood pressure and any other health conditions you may have.

question: Can pelvic pressure during pregnancy cause premature birth?Hi I'm 19 and am having a second baby but I'm not use to all the symptoms since my first I had none. I keep feeling immense pressure in my pelvis and it kinda feels like I may be dilating but I'm not due till march... There is a family history of premature births on my fathers side so is it possible for me?
answer: Pelvic pressure during pregnancy can sometimes be a sign of preterm labor, which is labor that occurs before 37 weeks of pregnancy. Preterm labor can lead to premature birth, which can be associated with a number of complications for both the mother and the baby.If you are experiencing pelvic pressure and are concerned about the possibility of preterm labor, it is important to contact your healthcare provider right away. They will be able to assess your symptoms and determine whether you are at risk of preterm labor. They may recommend a number of measures to help prevent preterm labor, such as bed rest, medications to stop contractions, or other treatments.It is also important to note that not all pelvic pressure during pregnancy is a sign of preterm labor. Other factors, such as the baby's position in the uterus or the growth of the uterus, can also cause pelvic pressure. However, if you are concerned about any symptoms you are experiencing during pregnancy, it is always best to speak with your healthcare provider for guidance.

question: Suggest medication to slow down racing thoughtsMy husband has some white matter. His mind is very good. His memory is amazing, but his brain races. He gets around good. Is there a medicine that can slow his brain waves down. He want everything done and done now. He says his mind at times appears like fire work when it explodes in the air.
answer: It sounds like your husband may be experiencing racing thoughts, which can be a symptom of various conditions such as anxiety, bipolar disorder, or attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD). If your husband has not already done so, it is important for him to speak with a healthcare professional, such as a doctor or a mental health provider, to determine the cause of his racing thoughts and to develop a treatment plan.There are several medications that can be used to help slow down racing thoughts and improve symptoms of anxiety, bipolar disorder, or ADHD. Some examples of medications that may be helpful in these cases include:Selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs) and serotonin-norepinephrine reuptake inhibitors (SNRIs): These are types of antidepressants that can help reduce anxiety and improve mood. Examples include paroxetine (Paxil), sertraline (Zoloft), and venlafaxine (Effexor).Benzodiazepines: These medications can be used for short-term relief of anxiety symptoms. Examples include lorazepam (Ativan) and clonazepam (Klonopin).Mood stabilizers: These medications are used to treat bipolar disorder and can help to stabilize mood swings. Examples include lithium and valproate (Depakote).Stimulant medications: These medications are used to treat ADHD and can help to improve focus and attention. Examples include amphetamines (Adderall) and methylphenidates (Ritalin).It is important to note that these medications can have side effects and may not be suitable for everyone. It is important to discuss the potential risks and benefits with a healthcare professional before starting any new medication.

question: Q. What is the treatment for LV diastolic dysfunction?Hello doctor,What is LV diastolic dysfunction grade 1? Doctor suggested stress echo cardiography. And conclusion includes this line. I can show you reports. What is the treatment for this. Any medicines?
answer: LV diastolic dysfunction refers to a condition in which the left ventricle (LV) of the heart is unable to relax and fill properly during diastole, which is the part of the cardiac cycle when the heart is filling with blood. Grade 1 diastolic dysfunction refers to a mild form of this condition.The treatment of LV diastolic dysfunction depends on the severity of the condition and the underlying cause. Some common treatments include:Medications: Diuretics may be prescribed to help reduce fluid accumulation in the body and lower blood pressure. Other medications, such as angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors or angiotensin receptor blockers, may be used to improve blood flow and reduce strain on the heart.Lifestyle changes: Making changes to your diet, exercise routine, and stress management can help improve your overall heart health and manage the symptoms of LV diastolic dysfunction.Cardiac rehabilitation: This program of exercise and education can help improve your overall heart health and reduce the risk of future complications.Surgery: In severe cases, surgery may be necessary to repair or replace damaged heart tissue.It is important to follow the treatment plan recommended by your doctor and to attend regular follow-up appointments to monitor the condition and make any necessary adjustments to the treatment plan.

question: What causes pain in shoulder and arm with numbness in hand?I am a large woman of 50 - I have experienced pain in my right shoulder and arm - have numbness in my hand - have lost some strength to my hand and am plagued by pins and needles this has been going on since early August (3 months)- I have had physio therapy but this only provides temporary relief...... I have seen a show on MND and am starting to worry - although there is no history of this in my family
answer: Hello,Your symptoms are not typical of MND. Instead, they are more suggestive of a pinched nerve or a bulging disc in the neck. Ilir Sharka, Cardiologist

question: What causes pain in shoulder and arm with numbness in hand?I am a large woman of 50 - I have experienced pain in my right shoulder and arm - have numbness in my hand - have lost some strength to my hand and am plagued by pins and needles this has been going on since early August (3 months)- I have had physio therapy but this only provides temporary relief...... I have seen a show on MND and am starting to worry - although there is no history of this in my family
answer: There are several possible causes of shoulder and arm pain with numbness in the hand, including:Pinched nerve: This can occur when a nerve in the shoulder, arm, or hand becomes compressed or squeezed, leading to numbness and tingling.Shoulder impingement syndrome: This is a condition that occurs when the tendons or bursae (small fluid-filled sacs) in the shoulder become compressed, causing pain and numbness in the arm and hand.Cervical radiculopathy: This is a condition that occurs when a nerve in the neck becomes pinched or compressed, leading to pain, numbness, and weakness in the arm and hand.Thoracic outlet syndrome: This is a condition that occurs when the nerves or blood vessels in the upper chest become compressed, leading to pain, numbness, and weakness in the arm and hand.Multiple sclerosis: This is a neurological condition that can cause muscle weakness, numbness, and tingling in the arms, legs, and other parts of the body.Carpal tunnel syndrome: This is a condition that occurs when the median nerve, which runs from the forearm into the hand, becomes compressed, leading to numbness and tingling in the hand and fingers.It's important to see a healthcare provider for a proper diagnosis and treatment plan. While motor neuron disease (MND) could be a potential cause of these symptoms, it is just one possibility and there are many other potential causes. Your healthcare provider will be able to determine the specific cause of your symptoms and provide appropriate treatment.

Some common causes include:Dry skin: Dry skin can be caused by a variety of factors, including low humidity, frequent hand washing, and exposure to harsh chemicals or detergents. Dry skin can lead to peeling, especially if it is not moisturized properly.Fungal infection: Fungal infections, such as athlete's foot, can cause skin peeling between the toes. question: Q. How can brown teeth due to fluoride be treated?Hi doctor, My probleam is my tooth and the color of my tooth is completly brown, this happen becouse of flouride. Based on this is possible to remove brown colour to white and how much does it cost?
answer: It is possible to treat brown teeth due to fluoride staining by professional teeth whitening methods. The most effective method of whitening teeth that have been discolored by fluoride is through in-office bleaching, which is done by a dental professional. This method uses a stronger concentration of bleaching agents and a special light or laser to enhance the whitening process. It is typically more expensive than at-home whitening methods, but it can produce more dramatic results in a shorter period of time.Other treatment options for brown teeth due to fluoride staining include at-home bleaching kits that use lower concentrations of bleaching agents and take longer to produce results. These kits can be purchased over the counter or from a dental professional, and they generally cost less than in-office bleaching.It is important to note that teeth whitening treatments are not permanent, and the results will eventually fade over time. To maintain the whiteness of your teeth, you may need to undergo regular touch-up treatments or use at-home maintenance products, such as whitening toothpaste or mouthwash.It is also worth noting that fluoride is an important mineral that helps to protect the teeth from decay. If you are concerned about fluoride staining, you may want to speak with your dental professional about ways to reduce your exposure to fluoride, such as using a toothpaste that is low in fluoride or avoiding drinking water that has high levels of fluoride.

question: Suggest tests to confirm difficulty in conceptionAm 2years old in marriage, and i have not been able to conceive i went for an HSG and everything turn normal, my husband was diagnosied with pus cell- can this be transmitted, what is the cause of it, after treatment is there gurantee of conceiving please help.
answer: There are several tests that can be used to help determine the cause of difficulty conceiving. These tests may include:Ovulation testing: This involves checking for the presence of hormones that indicate ovulation, such as luteinizing hormone (LH) and follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH).Semen analysis: This involves testing a sample of your husband's semen to check the number, shape, and movement of his sperm.Hysterosalpingogram (HSG): This is an X-ray procedure that involves injecting a special dye into the uterus and fallopian tubes to check for any abnormalities or blockages.Pelvic ultrasound: This uses sound waves to create an image of the reproductive organs, which can help detect any abnormalities or problems.Endometrial biopsy: This involves taking a small sample of the lining of the uterus to check for any problems with the endometrium, which is the tissue that lines the uterus.Laparoscopy: This is a surgical procedure that involves inserting a small camera into the abdomen to check for any problems with the uterus, fallopian tubes, or ovaries.It is important to note that the presence of pus cells in your husband's semen does not necessarily mean that he has a sexually transmitted infection (STI). Pus cells can be present for a variety of reasons, including inflammation or irritation. Your husband should discuss this issue with his healthcare provider to determine the cause of the pus cells and to determine the best course of treatment. If an STI is diagnosed, it is important that both you and your husband receive treatment to reduce the risk of transmission. After treatment, the chances of conceiving may be improved, but it is not possible to guarantee that conception will occur. It is important to continue to work with your healthcare provider to determine the best course of action for you and your husband.

question: Treated for thrush. Roughness in roof of mouth, no pain or discomfortA few weeks ago I was treated for thrush that was brought on by another antibiotic. Now for the last week or so, I can feel with my tongue that the roof of my mouth feels very rough, almost the texture of sandpaper minus the dryness. Any answers. There is no pain or discomfort, although it feels as if the area is getting bigger & spreading.
answer: It's possible that the roughness in your mouth could be a side effect of the treatment for thrush or it could be a sign of a different oral health issue. Thrush is a fungal infection caused by the yeast Candida albicans, and it can affect the mouth, throat, and other areas of the body. The most common treatment for thrush is antifungal medication, which can be taken orally or applied topically.It's also possible that the roughness in your mouth could be a sign of a condition called geographic tongue. Geographic tongue is a benign (non-cancerous) condition that causes patches of redness and smoothness on the top and sides of the tongue. These patches can have a rough or sandpaper-like texture. The cause of geographic tongue is unknown, but it is thought to be related to changes in the way the tongue grows and sheds its outer layer of skin.If the roughness in your mouth is causing you discomfort or concern, it's important to see a healthcare provider or dentist for an evaluation. They can help determine the cause of the roughness and provide appropriate treatment. In the meantime, you can try practicing good oral hygiene by brushing your teeth twice a day, flossing daily, and using an antimicrobial mouthwash to help keep your mouth clean and healthy.

answer: It is important to note that rheumatoid arthritis (RA) and rheumatism are two different conditions. RA is an autoimmune disorder that causes inflammation in the joints and surrounding tissue, while rheumatism is a general term that refers to a variety of conditions that cause pain and swelling in the joints and muscles. Penidure injections are not a treatment for either condition.The main goal of treatment for RA is to reduce inflammation and prevent joint damage. This can be achieved through a combination of medications, physical therapy, and lifestyle changes. Penicillin is not a commonly used treatment for RA.There are several different types of medications that are used to treat RA, including nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), disease-modifying antirheumatic drugs (DMARDs), and biologics. Each of these medications has its own set of potential side effects, and it is important to discuss the risks and benefits with a healthcare provider before starting any treatment.It is also important to work with a healthcare provider to develop a treatment plan that is tailored to your specific needs and goals. This may involve a combination of medications, physical therapy, and lifestyle changes, such as exercise and stress management techniques.It is not clear whether there is a cure for RA, but with proper treatment, it is possible to manage the condition and reduce the severity of symptoms. It is important to continue working with a healthcare provider and follow their recommended treatment plan in order to achieve the best possible outcomes.

question: How to increase my serum albumin levels?I have just had a blood test that showed that I have serum albumin at 33g/l. I had the test because I'm on ppi's for acid reflux and had heard that prolonged use of these drugs caused other issues. I have very low B12, 51ng/l and have started a course of injections. But looking at my test results I see that my serum albmin is also low. No one has mentioned this to me. What do I do about improving the levels?
answer: Serum albumin is a protein that is produced by the liver and is important for maintaining proper fluid balance in the body. Low levels of serum albumin, also known as hypoalbuminemia, can be caused by various factors, including malnutrition, liver disease, and certain medications, such as proton pump inhibitors (PPIs) that are used to treat acid reflux.To improve your serum albumin levels, it is important to address any underlying medical conditions that may be causing the deficiency. If you have liver disease or malnutrition, your healthcare provider may recommend specific treatment options to help improve your serum albumin levels. If you are taking PPIs and your serum albumin levels are low, your healthcare provider may recommend an alternative treatment for acid reflux or may suggest that you take a break from the PPIs to see if your serum albumin levels improve.It is also important to maintain a healthy diet that includes a variety of protein-rich foods, such as meat, poultry, fish, eggs, beans, and nuts. These foods can help your body build and repair tissues, including the proteins that make up your serum albumin.In addition, your healthcare provider may recommend supplements or medications to help improve your serum albumin levels. However, it is important to speak with your healthcare provider before starting any new supplements or medications to ensure that they are appropriate for you and do not interact with any other medications you may be taking.In summary, to improve your serum albumin levels, it is important to address any underlying medical conditions, maintain a healthy diet that includes protein-rich foods, and consider supplements or medications as recommended by your healthcare provider.

question: How to treat high blood pressure?hi, my friend has High Blood Pressure..his regular reading  is 160/100 and whenever he has headach or bit dizzy his BP raises to 180/130 . and he is frequently hospitilized with BP of 200/130 and above. aHe keeps on seeing different doctors and keeps changing medicines. answer: High blood pressure, also known as hypertension, is a common condition that can increase the risk of serious health problems such as heart attack, stroke, and kidney disease if it is not effectively managed.There are several lifestyle changes that can help to lower blood pressure and improve overall health, including:Eating a healthy diet that is low in salt, saturated and trans fats, and rich in fruits, vegetables, and whole grains.Getting regular physical activity, such as at least 30 minutes of moderate-intensity exercise per day.Maintaining a healthy weight, as excess weight can increase the risk of high blood pressure.Reducing stress through techniques such as deep breathing, meditation, and exercise.Limiting alcohol intake to no more than two drinks per day for men and one drink per day for women.In addition to lifestyle changes, your friend may also need to take medications to help lower their blood pressure. There are several different types of blood pressure medications available, and the best option for your friend will depend on their specific needs and medical history. It is important for your friend to follow the treatment plan recommended by their healthcare provider, which may include taking medications as prescribed, monitoring their blood pressure regularly, and making necessary lifestyle changes.It is also important for your friend to see a healthcare provider regularly to monitor their blood pressure and make any necessary adjustments to their treatment plan. If your friend continues to have blood pressure readings that are consistently high, despite lifestyle changes and medications, it is important for them to see a healthcare provider for further evaluation and management.

question: What causes right abdominal pain after gall bladder removal?I had my Gallbladder removed 2 weeks ago, I have been suffering from right abdominal pains for 2 days.  Pain seems to increase in the afternoon. I went to accident and emergency where they told me I had a bad infection (UTI) do you think that is the case as I feels teh pain is going right through me to my back?
answer: It is possible that the abdominal pain you are experiencing after your gallbladder removal could be due to a urinary tract infection (UTI). UTIs can cause pain in the lower abdomen, as well as back pain. It is important to follow the treatment plan recommended by your healthcare provider for the UTI to help alleviate the pain and discomfort you are experiencing.Other potential causes of abdominal pain after gallbladder removal include:Pancreatitis: This is inflammation of the pancreas, which can cause abdominal pain that radiates to the back.Bile duct problems: After a gallbladder removal, it is possible for bile to build up in the bile ducts, which can cause abdominal pain.Hernia: It is possible to develop a hernia (a bulge in the abdomen) after gallbladder surgery. This can cause abdominal pain and discomfort.It is important to speak with your healthcare provider if you are experiencing abdominal pain after your gallbladder removal. They will be able to determine the cause of the pain and recommend the appropriate treatment.

question: Can I have a psychiatric problem as I always feel I may get some disease ?I have always a thought that I would develop some deadly disease in that part of the body. This time I am feeling as though I will develop prostate cancer and feeling nervousness and stress in that area. I feel anxious in my penis area now. Can i really get prostate cancer? I am 15 and I am really worried. Is this a psychiatric problem?
answer: Hello....... The symptoms you are describing i.e preoccupation with developing a deadly disease is referred to as hypochondriasis, a form of anxiety disorder. Hence, i suggest that you undergo a thorough psychiatric evaluation so that suitable anti-anxiety medication and psychotherapy (eg cognitive behavioural therapy) can be started.

question: Are there any side effects of taking Strovas 10mg, Aspirin & Pantec 40mg?Hi doctor, My dad is taking storvas 10mg every day since 7 months together with aspirin and Pantec 40mg. Now he seems fed up with medicine. Can he stop one of them.Kildy reply me on my Email:  YYYY@YYYY Awaiiting your prompt reply.thanks/RegardsBenita
answer: Storvas (atorvastatin) is a medication used to lower cholesterol and triglycerides in the blood. Aspirin is a pain reliever and anti-inflammatory medication, and Pantec (pantoprazole) is a proton pump inhibitor used to treat acid reflux and other digestive disorders. It is important to follow the instructions of a healthcare provider when taking any medication, as stopping a medication or changing the dosage without medical advice can be dangerous.There can be side effects associated with taking Storvas, Aspirin, and Pantec, and it is important to discuss these with a healthcare provider. Some possible side effects of Storvas include muscle pain or weakness, nausea, and stomach pain. Aspirin can cause side effects such as stomach pain, nausea, and heartburn. Pantec can cause side effects such as headache, diarrhea, and abdominal pain.If your dad is feeling fed up with his medication, it is important for him to discuss this with his healthcare provider. The healthcare provider will be able to assess his current health and determine if any changes to his medication regimen are necessary. It is not recommended to stop taking a medication or change the dosage without medical advice, as this can have serious consequences.If your dad has any concerns or questions about his medication, he should speak with his healthcare provider. It is also important for him to follow the instructions of his healthcare provider and take his medication as prescribed.

question: Suggest treatment for Lyme s diseasei am trying to find ut the range for ebv tests? i have blood work showing positive ana, positive ebv and 4 lyme disease band indicators...i have a spinal tap tomorrow and have not heard back from my doctor...is this lymes disease...what is the treatment?
answer: HiLyme's disease is a bacterial infection , hence antibiotics are given for the treatment.Lyme disease is best treated in the early stages. Early treatment is a simple 14 to 21 day course of oral antibiotics. This can eliminate all traces of infection. Medications used to treat Lyme disease are:  1.  doxycycline for adults and children older than 8 years old   2.  cefuroxime and amoxicillin for adults, younger children, and women who are nursing or breast-feedingHope this information was of help.Thank you.

question: Suggest treatment for Lyme s diseasei am trying to find ut the range for ebv tests? i have blood work showing positive ana, positive ebv and 4 lyme disease band indicators...i have a spinal tap tomorrow and have not heard back from my doctor...is this lymes disease...what is the treatment?
answer: Lyme disease is a bacterial infection caused by the Borrelia bacteria. It is transmitted to humans through the bite of infected ticks. Symptoms of Lyme disease can include fever, chills, headache, fatigue, muscle and joint aches, and a characteristic skin rash called erythema migrans. If left untreated, the infection can spread to the joints, heart, and nervous system, leading to more severe symptoms.The treatment for Lyme disease typically involves the use of antibiotics. The specific antibiotic and duration of treatment will depend on the stage of the infection and the severity of the symptoms. In early stage infections, a course of oral antibiotics may be sufficient. In more severe cases or in later stages of the infection, intravenous antibiotics may be necessary.It is important to seek medical treatment as soon as possible if you suspect that you have been infected with Lyme disease. Early treatment can help to prevent the infection from spreading and can help to prevent more severe symptoms from developing.As for the range for EBV tests, the specific range can vary depending on the type of test being used and the laboratory that is conducting the test. It is important to discuss the results of any laboratory tests with a healthcare provider, who can interpret the results and determine the appropriate course of treatment.

question: What causes fluctuation in bilirubin levels after interferon therapy?Hello Doctor Was diagnosed with hep c early cirhossis in 2005 . Took interferon therapy and have been SVR ever since . Have bloodwork and MRI every 6 months ever since ...ALL showing normal except for platelets 97,000 My last blood test showed Direct Bilirubin slightly elevated (.3) ... ref range (o- .2) My question: Does this mean that my liver is beginning to fail , or is it possible for bilirubin to fluctuate for other reasons ?
answer: A bilirubin of .3  is of no concern . There is fluctuation as you suggested, of the blood tests. Continue to have blood checked for enzyme elevation(ast, alt) or presence of virus.

question: What causes fluctuation in bilirubin levels after interferon therapy?Hello Doctor Was diagnosed with hep c early cirhossis in 2005 . Took interferon therapy and have been SVR ever since . Have bloodwork and MRI every 6 months ever since ...ALL showing normal except for platelets 97,000 My last blood test showed Direct Bilirubin slightly elevated (.3) ... ref range (o- .2) My question: Does this mean that my liver is beginning to fail , or is it possible for bilirubin to fluctuate for other reasons ?
answer: Elevated bilirubin levels can be caused by a variety of factors, including liver disease. It is possible that your liver is beginning to fail, but it is also possible that other factors may be contributing to the fluctuation in your bilirubin levels. Some possible causes of elevated bilirubin include:Liver disease: Elevated bilirubin can be a sign of liver damage or disease, such as hepatitis or cirrhosis.Blockage of the bile ducts: If the bile ducts that carry bile from the liver to the small intestine are blocked, bilirubin can build up in the body, leading to elevated levels.Hemolysis: Hemolysis is the breakdown of red blood cells. When red blood cells break down, they release bilirubin into the bloodstream, which can lead to elevated bilirubin levels.Medications: Some medications, such as certain antibiotics and anti-seizure medications, can increase bilirubin levels.It is important to discuss your elevated bilirubin levels with your healthcare provider to determine the cause and appropriate treatment. Your healthcare provider may recommend further testing, such as liver function tests or imaging studies, to help determine the cause of your elevated bilirubin.

question: Can a chocolate cyst dissolve or reduce in size?hi, i am 31 years old, planning from last 9 months, my follicle did not rupture it was 25mm and there was internal bleeding in the follicle. i had a cyst in the earlier TVS of 1.5 cm which is not visible now. but the follicle which did not rupture is now 5.5 cm and i have slight pain. can chocolate cyst dissolve or reduce in size.
answer: It is possible for a chocolate cyst, also known as an endometrioma, to reduce in size or disappear completely with proper treatment. A chocolate cyst is a type of ovarian cyst that is caused by endometriosis, a condition in which tissue that normally lines the uterus grows outside of the uterus. Chocolate cysts are typically filled with old blood, which appears brown or chocolate-colored.Treatment for a chocolate cyst may include medication, such as hormonal therapy or nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) to help reduce pain and inflammation. question: Could breathing difficulties suggest asthma?Hi, may I answer your health queries right now ?Please type your query here.Hi Dr my elder sister age 29 married having breathing problem during walk in steps and doing heavy work and walking, Dr says that the symptoms are like asthma initial stage, please kindly suggest me what is the exact problem she had.
answer: Does she have wheezing after walking? Does she have chest pain, palpitation, excessive sweating, etc? If she has other allergies or wheezing, asthma is very likely. In that case, I would prescribe her salbutamol inhaler on as-and-when-neede basis. I would also suggest her allergy testing so that she may identify the substances which are causing troubles to her and to avoid them. Regular breathing exercise will help her.2. Were I treating her, I would suggest her to get her hemoglobin levels done. If they are low, they can cause breathing problem after heavy work/exercise. In that case, iron, folic acid, vitamin B12 and other nutrition supplements will be useful.3. If any of above is not there, I would like to ask her symptoms in great detail to know whether she needs a cardiac evaluation. As she is young (29 years), anemia and asthma are more common possibilities rather than cardiac disease.

question: Q. How to correct bedwetting of a 9 year old?Hi doctor,My child, who is 9 years old, has bedwetting problem. Please suggest me.
answer: Q. How to correct bedwetting of a 9 year old?Hi doctor,My child, who is 9 years old, has bedwetting problem. Please suggest me.Bedwetting, also known as nocturnal enuresis, is a common problem among children, especially those who are around 9 years old. It is important to note that bedwetting is not a behavioral issue and is often caused by a combination of factors, including a child's bladder size and the production of a hormone called vasopressin, which helps the body retain water during sleep.There are several strategies you can try to help your child stop bedwetting:Encourage your child to use the bathroom before going to bed. This can help reduce the amount of urine in the bladder and decrease the chances of bedwetting.Set a bedwetting alarm. These alarms are designed to wake your child when they start to wet the bed, allowing them to go to the bathroom and finish voiding.Limit your child's fluid intake before bedtime. Encourage your child to drink fluids earlier in the evening and avoid giving them drinks that contain caffeine, which can stimulate the bladder.Encourage your child to relax before bed. Stress and anxiety can contribute to bedwetting, so try to create a calming bedtime routine and encourage your child to relax before going to sleep.Use a bedwetting protector. These special mattress covers or pads can help protect your child's bed and make clean-up easier.It is important to be patient and understanding with your child as they work to stop bedwetting. In most cases, bedwetting resolves on its own as children grow and their bodies mature. If your child's bedwetting persists despite your efforts or if it is causing significant distress, it is a good idea to consult a healthcare provider for further evaluation and guidance.

question: Q. How to correct bedwetting of a 9 year old?Hi doctor,My child, who is 9 years old, has bedwetting problem. Please suggest me.
answer: Q. How to correct bedwetting of a 9 year old?Hi doctor,My child, who is 9 years old, has bedwetting problem. Please suggest me.Bedwetting, also known as enuresis, is a common problem among children, and it is usually not a cause for concern. Most children outgrow bedwetting on their own, and treatment is usually not necessary. However, if your child's bedwetting is causing distress or problems, there are several things you can try to help your child stop wetting the bed:Encourage your child to go to the bathroom before bedtime and make sure they empty their bladder completely.Consider using an alarm system to wake your child up when they start to wet the bed. These alarms can be purchased online or at a medical supply store.Try to reduce your child's fluid intake in the evening, particularly caffeine-containing drinks like soda and chocolate.Consider using a bedwetting product, such as a moisture-absorbing mattress pad or a bedwetting alarm that attaches to your child's clothing.Talk to your child's doctor about whether medication might be helpful in managing the bedwetting.It's important to be patient and understanding with your child as they learn to control their bladder. Bedwetting can be a frustrating and embarrassing problem, but with your support and encouragement, your child can overcome it.

question: What does swollen lymph nodes in armpit suggest?I am a 25 year old female who often has slightly swollen and tender-to-touch lymph nodes in my armpit.  Is this something that I should be concerned about?  How do I know when there is a "lump" I should be worried about and when it is normal body shifts?
answer: Lymph nodes are small, bean-shaped glands that are part of the body's immune system. They are located throughout the body, including in the armpits. Lymph nodes can become swollen in response to infections, inflammation, or other conditions.Slightly swollen and tender lymph nodes in the armpit can be a normal response to minor infections, such as a cold or flu. However, persistent or large swelling of the lymph nodes in the armpit, or swelling that is accompanied by other symptoms, may be a sign of a more serious condition.It is important to pay attention to any changes in the size or consistency of your lymph nodes and to consult with a healthcare provider if you are concerned. Your healthcare provider can examine the lymph nodes and determine the cause of the swelling. They may recommend further testing, such as blood tests or imaging, to help determine the cause of the swelling.If you have a lump in your armpit that is not a swollen lymph node, it is important to have it evaluated by a healthcare provider. Lumps in the armpit can be caused by a variety of conditions, including cysts, abscesses, or even breast cancer. Your healthcare provider can help determine the cause of the lump and recommend appropriate treatment.

question: What does swollen lymph nodes in armpit suggest?I am a 25 year old female who often has slightly swollen and tender-to-touch lymph nodes in my armpit. They help to filter out bacteria, viruses, and other foreign substances that may cause infection or disease. question: What does swollen lymph nodes in armpit suggest?I am a 25 year old female who often has slightly swollen and tender-to-touch lymph nodes in my armpit.  Is this something that I should be concerned about?  How do I know when there is a "lump" I should be worried about and when it is normal body shifts?
answer: Swollen lymph nodes in the armpit (axillary lymph nodes) can be caused by a variety of factors, including infections, inflammation, and certain medical conditions. It is not uncommon for lymph nodes to become swollen and tender to the touch in response to an infection or other type of inflammation in the body.In most cases, swollen lymph nodes that are accompanied by other symptoms such as fever, fatigue, or body aches are a sign of an infection or another type of underlying condition. If you have swollen lymph nodes in your armpit and are experiencing these other symptoms, it is important to see a healthcare provider for evaluation and treatment.On the other hand, if you have swollen lymph nodes in your armpit but do not have any other symptoms, it is possible that the swelling is due to a benign (non-cancerous) condition, such as an allergic reaction or minor injury. However, it is always a good idea to consult a healthcare provider if you are concerned about any changes in your body, including swelling of the lymph nodes.It is important to pay attention to the size and consistency of the lymph nodes. Lymph nodes that are hard and do not move when pressed may be a cause for concern, as this can be a sign of cancer or another serious condition. However, it is important to remember that not all swollen lymph nodes are cancerous, and it is often difficult to determine the cause of swollen lymph nodes without medical evaluation. If you have any concerns about the size or consistency of your lymph nodes, it is important to consult a healthcare provider for further evaluation and guidance.

question: What causes shaky legs while lying down on bed?I noticed my 29 month old son leg shaking when lying down on bed at nite, he later complained that it's painful.it happened once before that he was woken up by the pain in his led in the mid of nite.he's a healthy and active boy. Pls advise. thank you very much
answer: It is not uncommon for children to experience leg twitching or shaking while they are lying down or sleeping. This can be due to a variety of factors, including:Restless leg syndrome (RLS): This is a disorder that causes an irresistible urge to move the legs due to discomfort or pain. It is more common in adults, but can also occur in children.Growing pains: Children may experience leg pain or discomfort as they grow and their muscles and bones adjust to new growth. This is usually temporary and goes away on its own.Sleep disorders: Children may experience leg twitching or shaking due to sleep disorders, such as periodic limb movement disorder (PLMD) or sleep-related leg cramps.Other medical conditions: In rare cases, leg shaking or twitching while lying down may be a sign of an underlying medical condition, such as a neurological disorder or muscle disease.If your son is experiencing leg shaking or twitching while lying down and it is accompanied by pain, it is important to speak with a healthcare provider. They can assess your son's symptoms and determine the cause. They may recommend treatment or further testing if needed.

question: Suggest treatment for low sperm countDr im arulmozhi 30 yrs old. Im having normal periods and was advised for an IUI. My lh level was 11. So im advised to take duoluton tablet. I took 3 tablets for 3 days n I stopped it. 10 th day I have my periods again. Do I need to take hormone test tomorrow 2nd day. My husband has low sperm count and motility. Im very much afraid of my very soon periods.
answer: You had taken Tab. Duoluton for 3 days. Duoluton is Progesterone preparation. Progesterone causes secretory changes in the lining of uterus (endometrium). After 3 days you discontinued Duoluton; hence you were expected to get the withdrawal bleeding after 4-7 days, which you got. In fact if you are to be put on Progestational medicine for the support throughout the cycle, I would advise you to go for retroprogesterone preparations throughout the cycle so that they would not hamper egg release. If you discontinue these medicines in between, you will get withdrawal bleeding. Please start ultrasonography ovulation monitoring. When the follicle is between 18 mm to 21 mm size AND the endometrial thickness is between 9 mm to 14 mm, it is the most ideal time for IUI. So follow these instructions. You need not be afraid for that additional 'period' since it was due to discontinuation of Duoluton. I hope this helps you.Dr. Nishikant Shrotri

question: Have dry skin. I have tried by applying olive oil but no result. Is this curable?HIim 19 year old.i have dry skin from wen im too young.my skin is so dry that even after applying moisturizer the skin comes out. even my father and my brother hav the same problem.please can anyone advice me what to do.i have tried by applying olive oil but no result.my hands and legs looks like a 90 year old lady"s. is this curable.? plz help
answer: It's completely normal to have dry skin, and it's a common problem that can affect people of all ages. Dry skin can be caused by a variety of factors, including environmental conditions, genetics, and certain medical conditions.There are several things you can try to help improve the appearance and feel of your dry skin:Moisturize regularly: Use a moisturizer that is appropriate for your skin type, and apply it immediately after bathing to lock in moisture.Avoid hot water: Hot water can strip your skin of its natural oils, so try to take lukewarm baths and showers instead.Use gentle cleansers: Avoid using harsh soaps, which can strip your skin of its natural oils. Instead, opt for a gentle, pH-balanced cleanser.Protect your skin: Wear gloves when doing household chores and use a sunscreen with an SPF of at least 30 when you're outside to protect your skin from the sun's damaging rays.Eat a healthy diet: A diet rich in fruits, vegetables, and healthy fats can help improve the appearance and feel of your skin.It's also a good idea to see a dermatologist if you have persistent dry skin, as there may be an underlying medical condition that needs to be addressed.

question: How long does it take to recover from a sprained foot?I sprained my foot on Friday. I stepped on what I thought was lawn. Instead I was a bit on the lawn, but the outside of my foot snapped down into a trough. My foot has been swollen since Friday. Today is Thursday. Kept ice on it for 24 hours. Bruising started after that, Now bruising is spreading. It is really dark on my toes. Pain is on outside of my foot, not on my ankle.
answer: Hello, You have sustained twisting injury to foot which may lead to sprain or minor fracture in foot bones. Diagnosis needs to be confirmed by doing x-ray of the involved foot anteroposterior and oblique views to rule out bony abnormalities. If x-ray is normal RICE therapy is needed which means Rest Ice application Compression bandage and Limb Elevation. Tab Diclofenac sodium twice a day for pain relief and tab Chymoral forte twice a day for swelling reduction is required. If x-ray shows fracture Below knee slab may be given.

question: How long does it take to recover from a sprained foot?I sprained my foot on Friday. I stepped on what I thought was lawn. Instead I was a bit on the lawn, but the outside of my foot snapped down into a trough. My foot has been swollen since Friday. Today is Thursday. Kept ice on it for 24 hours. Bruising started after that, Now bruising is spreading. It is really dark on my toes. Pain is on outside of my foot, not on my ankle.
answer: It's difficult to give a specific timeline for recovery from a foot sprain because the severity of the injury and the individual's healing process can vary. However, a sprained foot typically takes several weeks to heal, and the recovery process may involve rest, ice, compression, and elevation (RICE) to reduce swelling and pain. It's also important to avoid putting weight on the injured foot until it is no longer painful to do so. Over-the-counter pain medication can help manage discomfort as the foot heals.If the bruising and swelling are severe or if you have difficulty bearing weight on the foot, it is important to seek medical attention. A healthcare professional can assess the extent of the injury and provide appropriate treatment, which may include a splint or a walking boot to immobilize the foot, physical therapy, or other supportive measures.It's important to follow your healthcare professional's recommendations and take steps to protect your foot as it heals to ensure a full recovery.

question: What causes consistent bad breath?I have consistent bad breath even after just brushing my teeth. I brush longer than anyone, use mouthwash, I do not smoke nor drink alcohol and all to no avail. I drink a lot of diet soda and have an intolerance to milk. Is this what is creating my consistent bad breath?
answer: There can be several factors that can cause bad breath, also known as halitosis. Here are some possible causes:Poor oral hygiene: Not brushing your teeth regularly or not brushing them properly can lead to the buildup of bacteria in your mouth, which can cause bad breath.Dry mouth: Saliva helps to keep your mouth clean and prevent bad breath. If you have a dry mouth, there may not be enough saliva to wash away bacteria and food particles, which can lead to bad breath.Certain foods and drinks: Some foods and drinks, such as onions, garlic, coffee, and alcohol, can contribute to bad breath.Tobacco use: Smoking or chewing tobacco can cause bad breath and increase your risk of developing gum disease and oral cancer.Certain medical conditions: Certain medical conditions, such as acid reflux, diabetes, and kidney or liver problems, can cause bad breath.Medications: Some medications, such as antihistamines and antidepressants, can cause dry mouth and contribute to bad breath.It's possible that your diet soda consumption and milk intolerance could be contributing to your bad breath. It's also possible that one or more of the other factors listed above could be causing your bad breath. It's important to see a dentist for a thorough examination to determine the cause of your bad breath and to discuss treatment options.

question: What causes fissured tongue?I have what I feel sure to be fissure tongue.  My mouth is sensitive to heated foods.  This painful tongue that I have, whether it is fissure or not, came about AFTER I began taking a new medication called zenzedi.  Help me please get some relief from the painful tongue.  The zenzedi is what will with me except for the painful tongue.  Please help.
answer: Fissured tongue, also known as grooved tongue or scrotal tongue, is a condition in which there are deep furrows or grooves on the top surface of the tongue. These grooves can vary in size and depth and may be present at birth or develop later in life.There is no known cause of fissured tongue, and it is not clear why some people develop the condition and others do not. However, fissured tongue is more common in older people and in people with certain medical conditions such as Down syndrome, Melkersson-Rosenthal syndrome, and Plummer-Vinson syndrome. Fissured tongue can also be a sign of an underlying autoimmune disorder, such as Sjogren's syndrome or psoriasis.It is not uncommon for people with fissured tongue to experience sensitivity to hot or spicy foods, as the furrows and grooves on the tongue can trap food and irritate the sensitive tissue. If you are experiencing pain or sensitivity in your tongue that you believe may be related to the medication you are taking, it is important to speak with your healthcare provider. They can help you determine the cause of your symptoms and recommend appropriate treatment.

question: Can Metaline destroy the remaining adrenal gland?I had my right adrenal gland removed because of a tumour on the cortex...the histolics show a small spot in the centre of clear cells .not divided ..they are tslking about using Metaline ? as a precaution measure ..will this destroy my one remaining Adrenal Gland ??
answer: It is possible that the use of Metaline (also known as metyrapone) could potentially damage or destroy the remaining adrenal gland, although this is not a common or expected side effect of the medication. Metyrapone is a drug that is used to inhibit the enzyme that is involved in the production of cortisol, a hormone that is produced by the adrenal glands. It is typically used to test the function of the adrenal glands and to diagnose conditions such as Cushing's syndrome, which is a disorder that is characterized by excessive production of cortisol.It is important to discuss the potential risks and benefits of any treatment with your healthcare provider. They will be able to provide you with more information about the specific risks and benefits of using metyrapone in your case, and help you make an informed decision about whether this treatment is appropriate for you.

Start antihistamine and anti inflammatory drugs. If not improving in 5 days than consult doctor and get done chest x ray to rule out infection.

question: What causes chest pain while taking breath?Yesterday I used a lot of clorox while cleaning my sink. I later watched a movie in an area near my kitchen. I had my windows closed and the AC on until it got cooler last night and I opened the windows. Today its like my lungs hurt especially when I inhale. It seems to be getting worse as the day progresses.
answer: Chest pain while taking a breath can be caused by a variety of conditions. Some possible causes include:Pulmonary embolism: This is a serious condition that occurs when a blood clot becomes stuck in the lungs. It can cause chest pain, difficulty breathing, and coughing.Pneumonia: This is an infection of the lungs that can cause chest pain, fever, cough, and difficulty breathing.Bronchitis: This is an inflammation of the bronchial tubes that can cause chest pain, coughing, and difficulty breathing.Asthma: This is a chronic respiratory condition that causes the airways to narrow and produce extra mucus, leading to chest pain, difficulty breathing, and coughing.Costochondritis: This is an inflammation of the cartilage that connects the ribs to the sternum, and can cause chest pain that worsens when taking a deep breath or coughing.It's important to note that chest pain can also be a symptom of a heart attack, which is a medical emergency. If you are experiencing chest pain, difficulty breathing, or other concerning symptoms, you should seek medical attention immediately.

question: Could pain in armpit with chest pain and faster heartbeat be due to anxiety?I have a little bit of pain beside my armpit in the muscle area near the shoulder blade along with a little bit of chest pain. question: What causes swelling and large sore on corner of the mouth?My daughter has swelling and a large sore on the corner of her mouth. Took her to urgent care two days ago. question: Can rapid heart rate cause damage to heart?my husband is 40 yrs old He has wolfe parkinsons white. question: Suggest medication to control hair fall and dandruffHello Sir,I am Mina from Hyderabad, I work in an MNC and got very hectic schedule every day. Reducing stress through techniques such as meditation, yoga, or exercise may also be helpful in controlling hair fall.

question: Q. What do right bundle branch block and mild mitral regurgitation mean?Hello doctor,My 18-year-old son got an ECG and blood tests last month as a requirement for medical screening. He jogs every night for 30 minutes. He looks healthy. We consulted our cardiologist early this month and he requested for 2D Echo and treadmill stress test. Unfortunately, we were scheduled for a consult but now we have lockdown for Covid-19. I hope you can help me understand the condition of my son. Thank you.
answer: Right bundle branch block (RBBB) and mild mitral regurgitation are two separate conditions that can be identified on an electrocardiogram (ECG) or echocardiogram (also called a "2D Echo").Right bundle branch block is a type of heart rhythm disorder that occurs when there is a problem with the electrical signals in the heart. Specifically, the right bundle branch, which is a group of fibers in the heart that carries electrical signals to the right ventricle, is not functioning properly. This can cause the heart to beat in an abnormal pattern and may lead to symptoms such as shortness of breath or fatigue. RBBB is usually not a serious condition, but it may require further evaluation to determine the cause and appropriate treatment.Mild mitral regurgitation is a type of heart valve disorder that occurs when the mitral valve, which is located between the left atrium and left ventricle of the heart, is not closing properly. This can cause blood to flow backwards into the left atrium during each heartbeat, a condition called regurgitation. Mild mitral regurgitation is generally not a serious condition, but it may require further evaluation to determine the cause and appropriate treatment.It is important to note that the information provided here is general in nature and should not be used to diagnose or treat any specific medical condition. If you have concerns about your son's health, it is important to discuss them with his cardiologist or another healthcare professional.

question: Q. What do right bundle branch block and mild mitral regurgitation mean?Hello doctor,My 18-year-old son got an ECG and blood tests last month as a requirement for medical screening. He jogs every night for 30 minutes. He looks healthy. We consulted our cardiologist early this month and he requested for 2D Echo and treadmill stress test. Unfortunately, we were scheduled for a consult but now we have lockdown for Covid-19. I hope you can help me understand the condition of my son. Thank you.
answer: Right bundle branch block (RBBB) is a type of heart block that occurs when there is a delay or obstruction in the electrical signals that coordinate the contraction of the right side of the heart. It can be caused by a variety of factors, including scarring of the heart tissue, inflammation, or abnormalities in the heart's structure.Mild mitral regurgitation (MR) refers to a condition in which the mitral valve, which separates the left atrium and left ventricle of the heart, does not close properly. As a result, some of the blood that has been pumped from the left ventricle leaks back into the left atrium, instead of being pumped out to the rest of the body. Mild MR is generally considered to be a mild form of the condition, in which the leakage of blood is minimal.It is important to note that the presence of RBBB and mild MR does not necessarily mean that your son has a serious heart condition. However, it is important to follow up with your cardiologist and undergo any recommended tests or procedures to determine the cause and appropriate treatment, if necessary. It is also important for your son to continue to follow a healthy lifestyle, including regular exercise, a healthy diet, and avoiding tobacco and excess alcohol, to support the health of his heart.

question: What causes popping at the base of skull and dizziness?my husband felt a popping at the base of the skull, got dizzy then ended on the floor passed out. His eyes wide open and no movement. he has gone for all sorts of testing, from CT, MRI, blood test etc. They found nothing. This has happened again. Any ideas?
answer: There are several potential causes of popping at the base of the skull and dizziness. It is important to note that these symptoms can be caused by serious medical conditions, so it is important for your husband to see a healthcare professional for proper diagnosis and treatment.One possible cause of these symptoms is inner ear dysfunction, which can result in dizziness and balance problems. The inner ear contains structures called the vestibular system that help us maintain balance and orientation. If the vestibular system is not functioning properly, it can cause dizziness, vertigo, and balance problems.Another potential cause of these symptoms is a concussion or head injury. A concussion is a type of traumatic brain injury that can occur after a blow to the head or body, and it can cause a range of symptoms, including dizziness, balance problems, and popping or clicking sounds.Other possible causes of these symptoms include neck injuries or problems with the cervical spine (the bones in the neck that support the head), problems with blood flow to the brain, and certain medications or substances. It is important for your husband to see a healthcare professional to determine the cause of his symptoms and receive appropriate treatment.

question: What causes popping at the base of skull and dizziness?my husband felt a popping at the base of the skull, got dizzy then ended on the floor passed out. His eyes wide open and no movement. he has gone for all sorts of testing, from CT, MRI, blood test etc. They found nothing. This has happened again. Any ideas?
answer: There are several potential causes of a popping sensation at the base of the skull and dizziness, including:Inner ear disorders: Inner ear disorders, such as vestibular neuritis and labyrinthitis, can cause dizziness and a sensation of vertigo (a spinning or tilting sensation).Migraines: Migraines are severe headaches that are often accompanied by dizziness, nausea, and visual disturbances.Tension headaches: Tension headaches, which are the most common type of headache, can cause a sensation of pressure or tightness at the base of the skull and may also cause dizziness.Sinusitis: Sinusitis, or inflammation of the sinuses, can cause a sensation of pressure or pain at the base of the skull and may also cause dizziness.Neck injury: An injury to the neck, such as a whiplash injury, can cause a sensation of popping at the base of the skull and may also cause dizziness.It is important for your husband to speak with a healthcare professional about his symptoms. The healthcare professional will be able to perform a physical examination and may recommend additional testing or treatment based on the results of the examination and any other symptoms your husband is experiencing.

question: How to treat premature ejaculation?Sir, I'm 40 yrs old with healthy physic. I had never had any issues related sex. Off late my ejaculation don't last long its reduced to 2-3 min. Y'day even tried to intercourse and couldn't erectile for a long time and have to give up. Please advise, how to get rid of it .
answer: Premature ejaculation (PE) is a common sexual concern, and it can be caused by a variety of factors, including psychological issues such as stress, anxiety, and depression, as well as physical issues such as hormonal imbalances, nerve damage, and certain medications.If you are experiencing PE, there are a few things you can try to help improve your ejaculatory control:Practice techniques to delay ejaculation: There are several techniques that can help you delay ejaculation, including the "squeeze" technique and the "stop-start" technique. These techniques involve stimulating the penis until you feel like you are about to ejaculate, then stopping the stimulation for a few seconds, and then starting again when the sensation subsides.Use a condom: Condoms can help to decrease sensation and may help you to last longer.Try over-the-counter or prescription medication: There are several medications that may be helpful in treating PE, including antidepressants, phosphodiesterase inhibitors, and topical anesthetics. It is important to speak with a healthcare provider before taking any medication.Practice relaxation techniques: Stress and anxiety can contribute to PE, so practicing relaxation techniques such as deep breathing, meditation, or yoga may help to improve your symptoms.Seek therapy: PE can be caused by psychological issues such as stress, anxiety, or depression. In these cases, therapy can be very helpful in addressing the underlying cause of the problem.It is important to speak with a healthcare provider if you are experiencing PE. They can help to determine the cause of the problem and recommend the most appropriate treatment.

However, it is important to have a healthcare provider evaluate any significant differences in testicle size, as it could be a sign of a medical condition. Some potential causes of a testicle being larger in an infant include:Undescended testicle: An undescended testicle is a testicle that has not moved down into the scrotum. This is a common condition in infants, and it usually resolves on its own within the first few months of life. However, if the testicle does not descend by the time the child is six months old, surgery may be needed to move it into the scrotum.Hernia: A hernia is a protrusion of abdominal contents through a weakness in the abdominal wall. In infants, a hernia may cause a testicle to appear larger than normal. Hernias can be repaired surgically.Testicular torsion: Testicular torsion is a condition in which the testicle becomes twisted, cutting off its blood supply. Testicular torsion can cause severe pain and requires prompt surgical treatment.It is important to have your child evaluated by a healthcare provider to determine the cause of the difference in testicle size and to determine the appropriate treatment, if necessary.

question: What causes fever and chills during pregnancy?My friend is 31 weeks pregnant and has had fever and chills for 3 days. Some possible causes include:Infections: Pregnant women are more susceptible to certain infections, such as urinary tract infections and respiratory infections. These infections can cause fever and chills.Preterm labor: Preterm labor is labor that occurs before 37 weeks of pregnancy. It can cause fever and chills, as well as other symptoms such as contractions, vaginal bleeding, and abdominal pain.Placental problems: Certain problems with the placenta, such as placental abruption or placental insufficiency, can cause fever and chills.Other medical conditions: Some other medical conditions, such as autoimmune disorders or cancer, can cause fever and chills during pregnancy.It is important for your friend to see a healthcare provider as soon as possible to determine the cause of her fever and chills and receive appropriate treatment. question: What causes lack of emotional feelings for someone?Hi i think ive experienced some kind of shock with my boyfriend..with him and only with him i feel no intuition, no emotions..neither sadness happiness pleasant feelings..i feel llike a robot...i cant react the way i want to say what i want..like a part of my consciousness is gone...whats wrong with me and how do i fix this?
answer: It's normal to have ups and downs in relationships, and it's possible that you're going through a tough time with your boyfriend right now. It's also possible that you may be experiencing some form of depression or emotional numbness, which can cause a lack of emotional feelings. It's important to try to identify any underlying issues that may be contributing to these feelings and to seek support if needed.There are a few things you can try to help address these feelings:Talk to a therapist or counselor about your feelings. A mental health professional can help you explore the root causes of your emotional numbness and develop coping strategies.Practice self-care. Taking care of yourself physically, mentally, and emotionally can help improve your overall well-being and may help you feel more connected to your emotions.Try to reconnect with your feelings. It can be helpful to spend time alone, journaling, or doing activities that allow you to tap into your emotions.Take breaks from the relationship. It's okay to take some time for yourself if you need it.
