question: Q. I have a pain on the inside of my calf muscle after playing a sport. What do I do?Hi doctor,I think I have a posterior tibial stress fracture. I am a long-distance runner. I play many sports but after playing frisbee, I have a pain on the inside of my calf muscle. I was advised by friends and family to take rest and do strength training. I did both but, neither worked. This pain is triggered only after playing frisbee. What do I do?
answer: It's important to seek medical attention if you are experiencing pain that persists or worsens despite taking rest and trying self-care measures. A posterior tibial stress fracture is a type of fracture that occurs in the bone that runs along the inside of the lower leg (the tibia). This type of fracture is often caused by overuse or repetitive stress on the bone, which can occur during activities such as running or playing sports.If you think you may have a posterior tibial stress fracture, it's important to stop participating in activities that may be causing the fracture to worsen and to seek medical attention. Your doctor can examine you and order imaging tests, such as an x-ray or MRI, to determine the extent of the fracture and recommend the appropriate treatment. Treatment for a posterior tibial stress fracture may include rest, physical therapy, and in some cases, surgery.In the meantime, you can try the following self-care measures to help manage the pain and reduce the risk of further injury:Rest: It's important to rest the affected leg and avoid activities that may cause further stress on the bone.Ice: Applying an ice pack to the affected area for 15-20 minutes at a time can help reduce inflammation and numb the area to provide pain relief.Compression: Wearing a compression bandage or sleeve can help reduce swelling and provide support to the affected area.Elevation: Elevating the affected leg above the level of your heart can help reduce swelling.Over-the-counter pain medication: Taking over-the-counter pain medication, such as acetaminophen or ibuprofen, can help reduce inflammation and manage pain.It's important to follow your doctor's recommendations for treatment and to seek medical attention if you experience any worsening of symptoms or if the pain does not improve with self-care measures.

Some examples include:Robitussin DM: This product contains dextromethorphan and guaifenesin, an expectorant that helps to thin and loosen mucus in the airways.Vicks DayQuil Cough: This product contains dextromethorphan, guaifenesin, and acetaminophen, a pain reliever.NyQuil Cough: This product contains dextromethorphan, doxylamine succinate (a sedating antihistamine), and acetaminophen.Delsym: This product is a liquid form of dextromethorphan that can be taken orally or added to water and used as a throat spray.It's important to follow the dosing instructions on the packaging and not exceed the recommended dose. Consuming large amounts of ice can lead to constipation, as it can reduce the amount of water in your stool and make it harder to pass. It is important to speak with a healthcare professional if you are concerned about your ice-eating habits.

question: Q. Kindly explain whether my cytology report shows metastatic breast cancer cells.Hi doctor,I had my cytology report from pelvic wash before hysterectomy. I need some clarifications on the pathology report. The report showed atypical cells - reactive mesothelial cells, enlarged and crowded nuclei, positive for calretinin and negative for Ber-EP4. answer: Hi. You have not mentioned the reason for which hysterectomy was done. Before giving a comment, the location of mass should be known. So, mention where the tumor or mass located and accordingly further comment can be given. And histopathology examination is advised for reaching the final diagnosis. question: What does high ferritin level indicate?Hi my mom’s ferritin level is sky high. It was 930 one month ago and we just rechecked it and it was 937. She used to take iron supplements everyday and she stopped taking it after the first ferritin level. Im wondering why did it go up by 7 even though she stopped taking iron supplements. Other histories are hypertension and bilateral plantar fasciitis.
answer: Ferritin is a protein that stores iron in your body. High ferritin levels, also known as hyperferritinemia, can indicate that there is excess iron in the body. This can be due to several factors, including iron overload (also known as hemochromatosis), certain types of anemia, or chronic inflammation.It is unusual for ferritin levels to increase significantly within a short period of time, such as a month. It is possible that your mother's ferritin levels were elevated due to an underlying condition that was not previously diagnosed. It is important for her to speak with a healthcare professional to determine the cause of the high ferritin levels and to determine the appropriate course of treatment.It is also worth noting that ferritin levels can be affected by other factors, such as recent blood transfusions, liver disease, and certain medications. It is important to consider these factors and discuss them with a healthcare professional as well.

question: What does high ferritin level indicate?Hi my mom’s ferritin level is sky high. It was 930 one month ago and we just rechecked it and it was 937. Other histories are hypertension and bilateral plantar fasciitis.
answer: A high ferritin level (also known as hyperferritinemia) can indicate the presence of excess iron in the body. This can be caused by a variety of factors, including hereditary conditions that cause iron overload (such as hemochromatosis), excessive intake of iron supplements, or certain medical conditions that cause the body to produce excess amounts of ferritin. It is also possible that a high ferritin level can be caused by inflammation or liver damage.It is important to consult a healthcare professional to determine the cause of a high ferritin level and to develop an appropriate treatment plan. Your mom's healthcare provider will consider her medical history and other factors, such as her diet and any medications she is taking, in order to determine the cause of her high ferritin level and recommend the appropriate treatment. It is also important to note that stopping iron supplements may not immediately lower ferritin levels, as the body may continue to store excess iron for a period of time after the supplements are stopped.

question: Suggest treatment for overlapping toes deformity in childrenI m a nursing student. While observing a youtube video, also saw overlapping toes deformity bilaterally on child. Child was undernourished and very small for age. Not familiar with this birth defect. Surgery was off the table at that time. What are possible treatments?
answer: the most common reason for toes to be deformed at a young age is a tendon imbalance between the flexors and extensors of the foot. for example, having a high arch or a cavus type foot, leads to the extensor tendons bowstringing and hammertoe formation. Using a custom orthotic from a foot and ankle specialist may help balance deforming forces. others have advocated taping the toes in an improved position but I never tape children's toes as it potentially can strangulate the toes and cause gangrene. with a certain type of flatfoot, the fourth and fifth toes turn inward due to imbalance of intrinsic tendons of the foot. although these may be cosmetically unappealing I would never consider surgery until all growth plates close after around 18 years of age, and usually don't ever cause negative symptoms

question: Suggest treatment for overlapping toes deformity in childrenI m a nursing student. While observing a youtube video, also saw overlapping toes deformity bilaterally on child. Child was undernourished and very small for age. Not familiar with this birth defect. Surgery was off the table at that time. What are possible treatments?
answer: Overlapping toes, also known as congenital hallux varus or metatarsus adductus, is a condition that occurs when the big toe (hallux) is turned inward toward the other toes. This can occur in one or both feet and can be present at birth or develop during early childhood.There are several possible treatment options for overlapping toes in children, including:Observation: For mild cases of overlapping toes, it may be possible to simply observe the condition and see if it improves on its own as the child grows and develops.Footwear modifications: Wearing shoes that have a wide, deep toe box and avoiding tight or constricting footwear can help to improve the alignment of the toes.Stretching exercises: Specific stretches and exercises can be prescribed by a physical therapist to help improve the range of motion and alignment of the toes.Splinting or bracing: In some cases, a splint or brace may be used to help gently guide the toes into proper alignment.Massage: Massage techniques, such as cross-fiber friction or myofascial release, can help to loosen tight muscles and improve the alignment of the toes.Surgery: In more severe cases of overlapping toes, surgery may be necessary to correct the deformity. This typically involves cutting and repositioning the bones in the foot to improve alignment.It is important to work with a healthcare professional, such as a pediatrician, orthopedic surgeon, or physical therapist, to determine the best treatment plan for a child with overlapping toes.

question: Suggest treatment for overlapping toes deformity in childrenI m a nursing student. While observing a youtube video, also saw overlapping toes deformity bilaterally on child. Child was undernourished and very small for age. Not familiar with this birth defect. Surgery was off the table at that time. What are possible treatments?
answer: Overlapping toes, also known as crossed toes or clinodactyly, is a common birth defect that affects the shape of the toes and can cause discomfort or difficulty with walking. In children, the condition is often caused by a lack of space in the womb, which can result in the toes becoming bent and overlapping. Treatment options for overlapping toes in children may include:Splinting: Using a splint or special shoe inserts can help straighten the toes and improve the alignment of the foot.Stretching exercises: Stretching exercises can help improve the flexibility and range of motion in the toes.Orthotic devices: Custom-made orthotic devices, such as insoles or arch supports, can help realign the foot and improve the alignment of the toes.Massage: Massaging the toes and feet can help improve circulation and reduce stiffness in the toes.Surgery: In severe cases, surgery may be necessary to correct the deformity. However, surgery is generally reserved for cases where other treatment options have not been successful or if the deformity is causing significant discomfort or difficulty with walking.It's important to note that treatment for overlapping toes in children may vary depending on the severity of the deformity and the age of the child. It's best to consult with a healthcare professional, such as a pediatrician or a podiatrist, to determine the best course of treatment for your child.

And due to some factors it might relapse...Remember it is a controllable disease. And there is no perfect treatment in ayurvedic or homeopathy.You take him to consult nearby dermatologist for firm diagnosis and perfect treatment.I would like to suggest few things as follow....- acitretin 25 mg daily- methotraxate 15 mg weekly in three devided doses of 5 mg 12 hourly.- Blood tests ..routine & LFT may be done at regular intervals- Steroid with salicylic acid oint may be applied twice a day on the psoriatic lesions...on trunk and extremities- But, please avoid the use of betnovate on psoriatic lesions on foreskin and soft tissue areas..as it is a moderately strong steroid....apply mild steroid cream like mometasone.- Soap bath should be avoided.- All precautions may be taken to avoid dryness of skin. question: What is the treatment for psoriasis?My brother is suffering from psoriasis ..we have had taken help of so many homeopathy..now a days he is continuing with alopathy drugs.but it seems that no body can cure him.till age of 10 to12 he was fine no symptoms of diseases..but gradually symptoms had started ,now it is covered on almost all parts pf his body .doc can you tell me the way to get rid pf.
answer: There is no cure for psoriasis, but it can be managed with treatment. The goals of treatment are to slow the growth of skin cells, reduce inflammation, and alleviate symptoms such as itching, redness, and scaling. Treatment options for psoriasis include topical medications, light therapy, and oral or injectable medications. The specific treatment plan will depend on the type and severity of the psoriasis, as well as the individual's preference and overall health.Topical medications, which are applied to the skin, include corticosteroids, vitamin D analogues, and topical retinoids. These medications can help to reduce inflammation and slow the growth of skin cells. Light therapy, also known as phototherapy, involves exposing the skin to controlled amounts of natural or artificial light. This can help to reduce inflammation and slow the growth of skin cells.Oral or injectable medications, also known as systemic therapies, are taken by mouth or injected into the body. These include medications such as methotrexate, cyclosporine, and biologics. Biologics are a newer type of medication that targets specific parts of the immune system. These medications can be effective, but they can also have serious side effects, so they are usually reserved for more severe cases of psoriasis or when other treatments have not been successful.It is important to work closely with a dermatologist or other healthcare provider to determine the best treatment plan for you or your loved one. It may take some time to find the right combination of treatments that effectively manage the psoriasis, but with proper treatment, it is possible to reduce the severity of symptoms and improve quality of life.

question: What causes flushing in face and lips?Hello. I'm a 45 yr old male and my lips often get flushed, sometimes bright red, and today my face feels flush as well. More symptoms/suspicions if you need them. Thanks.
answer: Flushing of the face and lips can be caused by a number of things, including:Alcohol consumption: Alcohol can cause blood vessels to dilate, leading to flushing of the skin.Spicy foods: Spicy foods can cause flushing due to their effect on blood vessels and the release of histamine.Hot weather or physical activity: Both of these can cause an increase in body temperature, leading to flushing of the skin.Menopause: Flushing can be a common symptom of menopause due to changes in hormone levels.Rosacea: This is a skin condition that can cause redness and flushing of the face, particularly the cheeks and nose.Carcinoid syndrome: This is a rare condition that can cause flushing and other symptoms due to the production of excess hormones by a type of tumor called a carcinoid tumor.It's important to note that flushing can also be a sign of an allergic reaction, so if you have not had these symptoms before or if they are accompanied by other symptoms such as difficulty breathing or swelling, you should contact a healthcare professional for further evaluation.

question: What causes flushing in face and lips?Hello. I'm a 45 yr old male and my lips often get flushed, sometimes bright red, and today my face feels flush as well. More symptoms/suspicions if you need them. Thanks.
answer: Flushing, or the sensation of warmth and redness in the face and lips, can have many different causes. Some common causes include:Alcohol or caffeine consumption: These substances can cause blood vessels to dilate, leading to flushing.Spicy foods: Spicy foods can also cause blood vessels to dilate, leading to flushing.Menopause: Flushing is a common symptom of menopause, when estrogen levels drop.Rosacea: This is a skin condition that causes redness and flushing in the face.Allergies: Allergies can cause flushing as part of an allergic reaction.Medications: Some medications, such as niacin (vitamin B3) and some blood pressure medications, can cause flushing as a side effect.It's also possible that flushing could be a sign of an underlying medical condition, such as an infection or autoimmune disorder. If you are experiencing flushing frequently or if it is accompanied by other symptoms, it is important to speak with a healthcare professional to determine the cause and receive appropriate treatment.

question: What is the treatment for alopecia areata?I'm suffering from the disease alopeciaAnd all my body hair fell from about 5 yearsCorticosteroids have been used for several sessions and suspended himI am 25 years oldAnd 160 linearWeight 52I hope to visit any specialist in any place in India for treatmentI am from Saudi Arabia
answer: Alopecia areata is an autoimmune disorder that causes hair loss. The treatment for alopecia areata can vary depending on the severity and extent of hair loss. Some treatment options for alopecia areata include:Corticosteroids: Corticosteroids are medications that can be applied to the skin or injected into the affected area to help stimulate hair growth.Topical immunotherapy: This treatment involves applying a chemical to the scalp to stimulate an immune response and promote hair growth.Light therapy: Light therapy, also known as phototherapy, involves exposing the affected area to certain types of light in order to stimulate hair growth.Platelet-rich plasma (PRP) therapy: PRP therapy involves injecting a concentrated solution of platelets into the affected area to stimulate hair growth.If you are interested in seeking treatment for alopecia areata in India, you may want to consult with a dermatologist or trichologist (a specialist in hair and scalp disorders). It is also a good idea to research different treatment options and discuss them with your healthcare provider to determine the best approach for you.

question: What causes short-term memory loss for a duration of 8 hours?last Thursday I had a period of 8 hour of short term memory lost. During that time I acted normal and knew basic answers to questions I should know but was unable to remember what I had done 5 minutes earlier. That short term memory lost last for about 8 hours. I was on vacation and out of my daily routine.
answer: There are several potential causes of short-term memory loss that could last for 8 hours. It's important to note that memory loss can be a symptom of various medical conditions, so it's important to speak with a healthcare provider to determine the cause and receive appropriate treatment.One potential cause of short-term memory loss is a concussion or other head injury. A concussion is a type of traumatic brain injury that can cause temporary memory loss and other symptoms, such as dizziness, nausea, and headache. If you have experienced a head injury or any other trauma, it's important to seek medical attention to determine the extent of the injury and receive proper treatment.Another potential cause of short-term memory loss is stress or anxiety. High levels of stress or anxiety can interfere with the brain's ability to process and retain new information, which can lead to temporary memory loss. In these cases, addressing the underlying stress or anxiety and finding ways to manage it can help improve memory function.Other potential causes of short-term memory loss include sleep deprivation, alcohol or drug use, and certain medical conditions, such as a stroke or transient ischemic attack (TIA), also known as a "mini-stroke." It's also possible that you may have experienced a temporary disruption in your sleep-wake cycle while on vacation, which can affect your ability to remember events.Again, it's important to speak with a healthcare provider to determine the cause of your short-term memory loss and receive appropriate treatment. They will be able to ask you questions and perform tests to help determine the cause of your symptoms and develop a treatment plan.

question: How to treat a back bruise caused by a fall?my girls friend has a bruise on her back after she fell off of a manically bull that stared off as a small light bruise on her lower back, and now four days later it's a big reddish bruise that its taking up most of her back, her age is 23 and she is 5feet 4 inches
answer: A bruise on the back can be painful and can take several days or weeks to heal. To help treat a back bruise, it is important to follow the RICE method:Rest: It is important to rest and avoid activities that may cause further injury or strain on the affected area.Ice: Applying ice to the bruise can help reduce swelling and discomfort. Wrap an ice pack or a bag of frozen vegetables in a towel and place it on the affected area for 15-20 minutes at a time, several times a day.Compression: Wearing a compression bandage or wrap can help reduce swelling and support the affected area.Elevation: Keeping the affected area elevated above the level of the heart can also help reduce swelling.In addition to these measures, over-the-counter pain medication such as acetaminophen or ibuprofen can help manage any discomfort. If the pain is severe or if the bruise is large and spreading, it is important to seek medical attention.

question: Is "follicle size of 18mm with endometrial thickness of 5.7mm" a side effect of 'fertyl'?Hi i am 30 years old. This cycle i took fertyl 50mg starting 3 day for 5 days. Follicle monitoring done on 11 january shows follicle of size 18mm but endometrial thickness is just 5.7mm. Is this the side effect of fertyl. Will progynova 2mg help solve the problem. Last menstruation period date was 3 january.
answer: Hallow, Fertyl is clomiphene citrate. It is basically used for egg release (ovulation) where natural ovulation is a problem. It is in particular useful in Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome where the follicles are maturing to varied extent and still the ovulation failure is noted. Clomiphene citrate is also having antioestrogenic effect. So it may hamper  growth of endometrium. Hence, in women where Endometrial growth is low, gonadotropin hormones may be preferred for induction of ovulation. Endometrial thickness between 9 mm to 13 mm has proved to be most conducive for implantation of fertilized ovum or blastocyst. Ovulation occurring when endometrium is just 5.7 mm is likely to end in 'no pregnancy'.So long as the follicular size is concerned, it has been reported for many decades that the ova discharged from the follicles of size between 18 mm to 21 mm are the healthiest one and give maximum fertilization rate and continuation of pregnancy success rate. Progynova is a synthetic hormone replacement for oestrogen. It is used to build up the lining of the uterus in preparation for embryo transfer during a thaw cycle for women who do not ovulate regularly. However, you should not wait for the ovulation beyond the follicular size more than 21 mm. If it takes longer for the endometrium to grow, you may waste this cycle and start Progynova earlier in next cycle and have ovulation at proper follicular size. I hope this information is useful to you for further decisions. Dr. Nishikant Shrotri

Again, it is important to consult with your healthcare provider for personalized recommendations.

answer: Pancytopenia is a condition in which there is a low count of all three types of blood cells: red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets. The exact cause of pancytopenia can vary and may be due to a variety of underlying conditions, such as bone marrow disorders, autoimmune diseases, or certain medications.Leucovorin and Livogen are medications that are used to treat various conditions, including anemia (a low red blood cell count). Leucovorin is a form of folic acid, which is a vitamin that is necessary for the production of red blood cells. However, as with any medication, there is a potential for side effects. Some common side effects of Leucovorin may include stomach pain, diarrhea, and nausea. Livogen may cause side effects such as constipation, nausea, and stomach pain.It is important to follow the instructions of your healthcare provider and to report any side effects or concerns to them. They will be able to monitor your condition and adjust your treatment as needed. It is also important to continue following up with your healthcare provider regularly to ensure that your treatment plan is effective and to address any changes in your condition.

question: What does it mean by tropozoite: intestinal parasite seen,Pus cells: 2-4/hpf in fecalysis of my 8 months old?Hi, my sons fecalysis result shows Macroscopic examination : color: brown, consistency: watery Microscopic examination: Ova or cyst: no ova or cyst of any tropozoite: intestinal parasite seen Pus cells: 2-4/hpf Red blood cells: TNTC /hpf What is the interpretation of the above result? He is an 8 mos old.
answer: Tropozoites are a stage in the life cycle of some parasites, specifically those that belong to the Plasmodium species, which cause malaria. If tropozoites are seen in a fecal examination, it means that the person being tested is infected with a parasitic infection.Pus cells, also known as polymorphonuclear leukocytes or PMNLs, are a type of white blood cell that is involved in the immune response to infections. The presence of 2-4 pus cells per high power field (hpf) in a fecal examination suggests that there is some inflammation or infection present in the gastrointestinal tract.Red blood cells (RBCs) in the stool can indicate bleeding in the digestive tract. TNTC stands for "too numerous to count," which means that there are so many RBCs present that it is not possible to accurately count them. This can be a sign of bleeding in the gastrointestinal tract.Overall, the results of the fecal examination suggest that your 8-month-old son has a parasitic infection and some inflammation or infection in the gastrointestinal tract, as well as possible bleeding. It is important to follow up with a healthcare provider for further evaluation and treatment.

question: What is the treatment for foot pain?i have foot pain that started as gout but now my doctor says it is arithritis. this started in may this year. the pain travels around both my feet; sometimes on one foot sometimes on both and when it is the ankles, normally both ankles hurt. the pain is also inconsistent.

question: What is the treatment for foot pain?i have foot pain that started as gout but now my doctor says it is arithritis. this started in may this year. the pain travels around both my feet; sometimes on one foot sometimes on both and when it is the ankles, normally both ankles hurt. the pain is also inconsistent.
answer: Foot pain can be caused by a variety of conditions, including gout and arthritis. Treatment will depend on the underlying cause of the pain and may include a combination of self-care measures and medical treatments.Self-care measures for foot pain may include:Resting your feet: Avoid standing or walking for long periods of time, and take breaks if you do.Ice: Apply ice to your feet for 15-20 minutes at a time, several times a day, to help reduce swelling and inflammation.Over-the-counter pain medication: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) such as ibuprofen or naproxen can help reduce inflammation and pain.Stretching: Gently stretching your feet can help alleviate pain and improve flexibility.Orthotic inserts: Shoe inserts that provide support and cushioning can help alleviate foot pain.Medical treatments for foot pain may include:Prescription medication: Your doctor may prescribe stronger pain medication or medication to reduce inflammation, if over-the-counter options are not effective.Physical therapy: A physical therapist can teach you exercises and stretches to help alleviate foot pain and improve mobility.Corticosteroid injections: These injections can help reduce inflammation and pain in the foot.Surgery: In severe cases, surgery may be necessary to correct a structural issue in the foot that is causing pain.It is important to consult with a healthcare professional for an accurate diagnosis and appropriate treatment plan for your foot pain.

question: Why is my bilirubin level elevated to a level of 7.4?My bilirubin was 7.4 has never been elevated, I do have fatty liver , high cholesterol and sugar is borderline at 111 , I recently started exercising due to needing to lose weight and having a sedentary job- the provider says we will recheck it again in two weeks but I am so worried and reading things on the internet that have me in a panic. Parth Goswami,General & Family Physician

question: Why is my bilirubin level elevated to a level of 7.4?My bilirubin was 7.4 has never been elevated, I do have fatty liver , high cholesterol and sugar is borderline at 111 , I recently started exercising due to needing to lose weight and having a sedentary job- the provider says we will recheck it again in two weeks but I am so worried and reading things on the internet that have me in a panic. My bilirubin has never been elevated before but LFT s were slightly.
answer: Elevated bilirubin levels can be a sign of liver damage or dysfunction. A bilirubin level of 7.4 is considered very high and may indicate a more serious underlying condition. Some possible causes of elevated bilirubin include:Liver disease: Liver diseases such as hepatitis, cirrhosis, and fatty liver can cause bilirubin levels to rise.Hemolytic anemia: This is a type of anemia in which red blood cells are destroyed faster than the body can replace them. This can lead to an excess of bilirubin in the blood.Blockage of the bile ducts: Bile ducts carry bile from the liver to the small intestine. If these ducts are blocked, bilirubin can build up in the blood.Alcohol abuse: Excessive alcohol consumption can damage the liver and cause bilirubin levels to rise.It is important to see a healthcare provider for further evaluation and treatment of your elevated bilirubin level. It is not advisable to diagnose or treat yourself based on information you find on the internet, as self-diagnosis can be dangerous and may delay proper treatment. Your healthcare provider will be able to determine the cause of your elevated bilirubin and recommend appropriate treatment.

question: Q. Kindly suggest the glasses that can be used while working on laptop.Hello doctor,I am 27 years old, male, pursuing PG. This is the dissertation writing time for me. For that, I have to rely on a laptop most of the time. It makes my eyes uncomfortable (red and dry). So, would be glad to have suggestions. Any glasses that I could use while working on a laptop?
answer: Hi. People who spend much time in front of digital screens like a laptop, mobiles, etc., are at higher risk of developing dry eyes also called computer eye syndrome. Usually, we blink 8 to 12 times per minute but while using digital devices blink rate is decreased 2 to 3 times per minute. That is why tear film is disturbed and eyes get dry. So keep using Refresh Tears and try to modify the habits like blinking every 10 to 15 seconds during laptop use and try to avoid any humid environment. I hope these simple things will help you a lot.

question: Q. Kindly suggest the glasses that can be used while working on laptop.Hello doctor,I am 27 years old, male, pursuing PG. This is the dissertation writing time for me. For that, I have to rely on a laptop most of the time. It makes my eyes uncomfortable (red and dry). So, would be glad to have suggestions. Any glasses that I could use while working on a laptop?
answer: Using glasses specifically designed for computer use may help reduce eye strain and discomfort while working on a laptop. These glasses often have a special coating that filters out blue light, which is a type of light that is emitted by computer screens and can contribute to eye strain. They may also have a larger lens area to help reduce the amount of dry air that hits your eyes, which can cause dryness and discomfort.It's a good idea to have an eye exam to determine if you have any specific vision problems that may be causing your eye discomfort while using a laptop. An eye doctor can recommend the best glasses for your needs, taking into account your individual vision prescription and any other factors that may be contributing to your eye discomfort.In addition to using specialized computer glasses, there are a few other things you can do to reduce eye strain and discomfort while working on a laptop:Take frequent breaks: Make sure to take breaks from looking at your screen every 20 minutes or so. Close your eyes for a few seconds or look away from the screen and focus on something in the distance.Blink frequently: Blinking helps to moisten and refresh your eyes, which can help reduce dryness and discomfort.Adjust your screen: Make sure your screen is at a comfortable distance and angle, and adjust the brightness and contrast to a level that is comfortable for you.Use proper lighting: Avoid working in a room with bright or harsh lighting, as this can contribute to eye strain. Instead, try to work in a room with softer, indirect lighting.Use a humidifier: Dry air can contribute to eye dryness and discomfort. Using a humidifier can help add moisture to the air and reduce dryness.

question: Is IRBBB dangerous?my 11 yr old son was told he has IRBBB. Naturally as parents we are so stressed. He is VERY athletic and loves sports. Sometimes gets a little short of breath with endurance sports like Basketball.. we have a dr's appt next week. Hopefully will get news... but how serious is IRBBB?
answer: IRBBB is Incomplete Right Bundle Branch Block. First of all, you need to understand basis of bundle branch to understand IRBBB. There are two bundle branches in heart which transmit the impulse from atria to ventricle. Right and left. Any block in this transmission, can cause problem in transmission of impulse from atria to ventricle and hence ventricle will not function properly. In pediatric patient, most common cause for this is developmental defect. So right ventricle is not functioning well. Right ventricle is connected to lungs, so he feels shortness of breath on exertion. Honestly speaking, this is serious health issue and this can worsen with the age. So consult cardiologist as soon as possible for this  IRBBB. I will be happy to help you further. Thanks.

question: Is IRBBB dangerous?my 11 yr old son was told he has IRBBB. Naturally as parents we are so stressed. He is VERY athletic and loves sports. Sometimes gets a little short of breath with endurance sports like Basketball.. we have a dr's appt next week. Hopefully will get news... but how serious is IRBBB?
answer: It's understandable that you would be concerned about your son's diagnosis of IRBBB (incomplete right bundle branch block). However, it's important to note that IRBBB is a relatively common finding on an electrocardiogram (ECG or EKG) and is often benign, meaning it is not a serious or life-threatening condition.IRBBB is a type of heart rhythm abnormality that occurs when the electrical signals that coordinate the contraction of the heart's muscle are disrupted. This can cause the heart to beat less efficiently and may lead to symptoms such as shortness of breath, fatigue, and chest pain. However, many people with IRBBB have no symptoms at all and live normal, active lives.It's always important to follow your doctor's recommendations and to have regular check-ups to monitor your son's heart health. In the meantime, it's generally safe for your son to continue participating in sports and other physical activities as long as he feels comfortable doing so. If he experiences any unusual symptoms while exercising, such as shortness of breath or chest pain, he should stop immediately and consult with a doctor.

question: How to deal with an angry partner?Hi I m a worried mother of a 24 year old young man who won t take charge of his life and carries a part time job. It's important to remember that it is not helpful or productive to try to address his anger or blame by getting upset or defensive yourself. Instead, try to approach the situation calmly and with empathy.Here are a few steps you can try:Set boundaries: It's important to set clear boundaries and communicate them to your son. This can include things like not tolerating threats or disrespectful behavior.Encourage open communication: Encourage your son to open up about his feelings and concerns. Let him know that you are willing to listen and try to understand his perspective.Seek outside help: If the situation is becoming too difficult to handle on your own, consider seeking the help of a therapist or counselor. question: Does GABA supplement really help for anxiety and nervousness disorders ?Hi, does GABA supplement really help for anxiety and nervousness disorders ? if yes, then after how long of consuming the supplement ? thanks !
answer: There is limited scientific evidence to support the use of GABA supplements as a treatment for anxiety or nervousness disorders. GABA (gamma-aminobutyric acid) is a neurotransmitter that plays a role in regulating brain activity and is involved in feelings of relaxation and calmness. However, it is not clear whether GABA supplements can effectively increase GABA levels in the brain or whether this would be beneficial for reducing anxiety symptoms.Some studies have suggested that GABA supplements may have a calming effect and may be helpful for reducing anxiety and promoting relaxation. However, these studies have been small and have had mixed results, so more research is needed to fully understand the effectiveness and safety of GABA supplements for anxiety.If you are considering using GABA supplements as a treatment for anxiety or nervousness, it is important to speak with a healthcare provider. They can help you determine whether GABA supplements are appropriate for you and can provide guidance on the proper dosage and duration of use. It is also important to note that GABA supplements should not be used as a substitute for evidence-based treatments for anxiety, such as therapy or medication.

question: Q. Is diarrhea a side-effect of diabetes medication?Hello doctor,I am a type 2 diabetic, and today I had a low blood sugar episode. question: Does gonadotropins injection help in conceiving?Hi,I got married before 1.5 years.. We are planning for a baby.I haven't got conceived yet.We checked with the doctor & she confirmed that i have PCOS..Now she advised to take gonadotropins injection..pls suggest how will it help me to get conceived
answer: Gonadotropins are hormones that stimulate the production and release of eggs in women and sperm in men. Injections of gonadotropins are often used as part of fertility treatment to help women with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) or other fertility issues ovulate and become pregnant.Gonadotropins are administered by injection and are typically given in a series of doses over the course of several weeks. The specific regimen will be determined by your doctor based on your individual needs and medical history.It's important to note that fertility treatments, including gonadotropins, are not guaranteed to be successful. However, they can be effective in helping some women with fertility issues ovulate and become pregnant. It's also important to work closely with your doctor to monitor your progress and make any necessary adjustments to your treatment plan.

answer: It's always important to speak with a healthcare professional about any health concerns you may have. However, here are some general treatment options for the conditions you mentioned:Rheumatoid arthritis: Treatment for rheumatoid arthritis typically involves a combination of medications and lifestyle changes. Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) and disease-modifying antirheumatic drugs (DMARDs) can help reduce inflammation and slow the progression of the disease. Over-the-counter pain relievers such as acetaminophen or ibuprofen can often be effective in relieving mild to moderate headaches. More severe headaches may require prescription medications or other treatments. It's important to speak with a healthcare professional to determine the appropriate treatment for your specific headache.Jaw pain: Jaw pain can be caused by a variety of factors, including teeth grinding, jaw injury, or temporomandibular joint (TMJ) disorder. Treatment will depend on the underlying cause of the jaw pain. In some cases, over-the-counter pain relievers or ice packs can help reduce inflammation and relieve discomfort. Other treatments may include physical therapy, bite guards, or medication to relax the muscles in the jaw.Low blood pressure: Low blood pressure, also known as hypotension, can be caused by a variety of factors, including dehydration, certain medications, and underlying medical conditions. Treatment for low blood pressure may include increasing fluid intake, increasing salt intake, and taking medications to raise blood pressure. It's important to speak with a healthcare professional to determine the appropriate treatment for your specific case of low blood pressure.Tinnitus: Tinnitus is the perception of noise or ringing in the ears that is not caused by an external source. There is no cure for tinnitus, but there are several treatment options that can help manage the symptoms. These may include sound therapy, counseling, and medications to relieve anxiety or depression. It's important to speak with a healthcare professional to determine the best treatment approach for your specific case of tinnitus.Again, it's important to speak with a healthcare professional about your specific health concerns and treatment options. They will be able to take into account your individual circumstances and medical history to recommend the most appropriate treatment plan for you.

question: Suggest treatment for high SGPT and SGOT levelsMy brother is under treatment in hospital for Dengu.His blood platlattes came to normal from 36000 to 148000 during this treatment.But his SGPT & SGOT levels are higher than 1000.Please advise me about,1.specialist doctor in this area to consult in Pune or in ahmednagar.2.what is probabalie desease ..?Hepatatis ?3.Precaution to take regarding diet and other if any 4.If possible let me know name of medicins that can cure this.
answer: Elevated SGPT (also known as ALT) and SGOT (also known as AST) levels can be caused by several factors, including liver disease, viral infections, and certain medications. It is important to determine the underlying cause of the elevated levels in order to determine the most appropriate treatment.If your brother is currently hospitalized for dengue fever, it is possible that the elevated SGPT and SGOT levels are related to the dengue infection or to the use of medications to treat the dengue infection. If this is the case, the treatment may involve supportive care, such as fluids and electrolytes, and monitoring of liver function tests.If the elevated SGPT and SGOT levels are due to liver disease, such as hepatitis, the treatment will depend on the specific type of liver disease and may include medications to reduce inflammation and scarring, as well as lifestyle changes, such as avoiding alcohol and following a healthy diet.It is important for your brother to consult with a specialist, such as a liver specialist (hepatologist) or infectious disease specialist, to determine the cause of the elevated SGPT and SGOT levels and to determine the most appropriate treatment. In Pune or Ahmednagar, you may be able to find a specialist through a hospital or medical center, or by asking for recommendations from your brother's primary care doctor or other healthcare providers.As for precautions to take regarding diet, it is generally recommended to eat a healthy diet that is high in fruits, vegetables, and whole grains, and low in processed foods and saturated and trans fats. It is also important to drink plenty of water and to avoid alcohol, as alcohol can further damage the liver.It is not appropriate for me to recommend specific medications as the appropriate treatment will depend on the underlying cause of the elevated SGPT and SGOT levels and the specific needs of your brother. It is important for your brother to follow the treatment plan recommended by his healthcare provider and to discuss any concerns or questions about the treatment with his healthcare provider.

question: Is there any safe methods to remove amalgam without side effects ?Hi i believe i have mercury poisoning from my amalgam fillings, i am currently waiting for my blood tests to come in, my question is  if i get  the teeth removed with the amalgam will there be any mercury released in my system from that or  is that a safe method to remove the amalgam without the side effects. i removed 3 amalgams fairly safely with a dentist but i still had terrible side effects.
answer: Amalgam fillings, also known as silver fillings, contain a mixture of metals including mercury, silver, tin, and copper. There is ongoing debate about the safety of amalgam fillings, with some concerns about the potential health effects of the mercury they contain. However, the overwhelming weight of scientific evidence suggests that amalgam fillings are safe and do not pose a significant health risk when used in dental restorations.If you are concerned about the potential health effects of your amalgam fillings and are considering having them removed, it is important to consult with a qualified dental professional. The process of removing amalgam fillings can release small amounts of mercury vapor, which can be inhaled. However, proper safety measures can be taken to minimize the release of mercury vapor during the removal process.Your dentist should use appropriate precautions to minimize exposure to mercury vapor during the removal process, such as using a high-volume evacuation system to remove the vapor, providing a rubber dam to isolate the tooth being worked on, and using a cold water spray to minimize the release of vapor. In addition, your dentist should provide you with a mouthguard to wear during the procedure to protect your oral tissues and reduce the amount of vapor you inhale.It is also important to keep in mind that the removal of amalgam fillings carries some risks, such as the possibility of damaging the tooth or surrounding tissues. Therefore, it is important to carefully weigh the potential benefits and risks of amalgam removal with your dentist before making a decision.

question: Is it dangerous to have sickle beta thalassimia disease repeatedly?I have sickle beta thalassimia diease and I have had a sickle crisis before and I have been having them for almost 2 years repeated ly is this dangerous. Deformed RBCs cannot pass through the splenic microcirculation which can lead to dreaded consequences like hypoxia and autosplenectomy. 3. Hemolysis is also known to occur with this situation worsening the anemia.4. Yes, you need to get a consultation and appropriate treatment.Hope it helps.Any further queries, happy to help again.

question: Is it dangerous to have sickle beta thalassimia disease repeatedly?I have sickle beta thalassimia diease and I have had a sickle crisis before and I have been having them for almost 2 years repeated ly is this dangerous. And do I need to go the hospital. Every time I have a crisis I seem to stay sick and catch things easily
answer: Sickle cell disease, including sickle beta thalassemia, is a chronic condition that can lead to serious health complications. Having repeated sickle cell crises can be dangerous and can lead to further complications such as organ damage, infections, and an increased risk of stroke. It is important to seek medical attention whenever you are experiencing a sickle cell crisis. It is also important to follow the treatment plan recommended by your healthcare provider, which may include regular blood transfusions, antibiotics to prevent infections, and other medications to help manage your symptoms. It is also important to take steps to prevent sickle cell crises, such as getting enough rest, staying well hydrated, avoiding extreme temperatures, and avoiding activities that could cause injury or overexertion.

question: What causes a white spot inside the nostrils?I am a 58 year old woman who just visited the dentist. In his office he is using a CT scan to get 3D pictures of the jaw, neck, face, etc. On mine, he noticed a white spot just to the side of my right nostril. What could this possibly be? He said I needed a more specific scan to that area to get a better picture. would a deviated septum show up like that?
answer: There are several potential causes for a white spot inside the nostril. It is possible that the white spot is a benign growth, such as a nasal polyp or a wart. It could also be a sign of a fungal or bacterial infection. In some cases, the white spot may be caused by a condition called leukoplakia, which is a thickening of the skin inside the nostril. It is important to have the white spot evaluated by a medical professional to determine the cause and appropriate treatment.A deviated septum, which is a condition in which the bone and cartilage that divides the nostrils is crooked or misaligned, would not typically cause a white spot inside the nostril. However, it is possible that the white spot could be related to a deviated septum if it is a result of irritation or inflammation caused by the misalignment of the septum.If the dentist has recommended a more specific scan to get a better picture of the white spot, it is important to follow through with this recommendation so that the cause of the white spot can be accurately identified and appropriate treatment can be provided.

question: Would paracetamol overdose cause labyrinthitis?Hi just over a weak ago i took 24 500mg tablets of paracetamol at once, I did not experience any vomitting or side effects at the time. 5 days ago i started feeling very dizzy and unsteady and the doctor told me I had labyrinthitis, could this be anything to do with the paracetamol overdose?
answer: Hi,Overdose of Parecetamol is unlikely to be the cause for labyrinthitis. The most common toxic effects due to paracetamol overdose is nausea, vomiting, right upper abdominal pain, liver dysfunction, fatigue, fever and jaundice. Mohammed Taher Ali, General & Family Physician

question: Would paracetamol overdose cause labyrinthitis?Hi just over a weak ago i took 24 500mg tablets of paracetamol at once, I did not experience any vomitting or side effects at the time. 5 days ago i started feeling very dizzy and unsteady and the doctor told me I had labyrinthitis, could this be anything to do with the paracetamol overdose?
answer: It is possible that an overdose of paracetamol could cause labyrinthitis, although it is not a common side effect. Labyrinthitis is an inner ear disorder that can cause dizziness, vertigo (a sensation of spinning or dizziness), and balance problems. It is usually caused by an infection or inflammation of the inner ear, although it can also be caused by other factors such as head injury, exposure to certain medications or toxins, or a viral illness.If you have taken an overdose of paracetamol, it is important to seek medical attention immediately, as this can be a serious and potentially life-threatening situation. Paracetamol overdose can cause liver damage and can be fatal if not treated promptly. If you are experiencing dizziness or other symptoms that may be related to an overdose of paracetamol, it is important to seek medical attention right away.

question: Q. Does excruciating back pain in a 37-week pregnant woman mean labor?Hello doctor,I am 37 weeks pregnant and I have been having excruciating back pain since last night. It does not seem to go away no matter what I do. It hurts to move or do anything. Could I be in labor? And do I need to go to the hospital?
answer: Hello. The sudden onset back pain in a full term pregnant patient is likely to be due to lightening when the baby's head goes down in pelvis and the sacrum and coccyx bone extend to accommodate the presenting part. If there is no abdominal tightness and contractions which are of increasing intensity and lasting for more than 15 to 20 seconds each, then unlikely that you are in labor.

question: Why does bruises getting bigger redder while suffering from diabetes?I m type 1 diabetic. I fell on the ice a month ago on my knee. My bruiseis spreading and getting redder. answer: It's normal for bruises to change color as they heal. When you first get a bruise, it will typically appear red or purplish as blood from damaged blood vessels collects under the skin. As the bruise heals, the blood is absorbed and the color will change to green, yellow, or brown as the bruise fades.If you have diabetes, it is possible that you may have slower healing times and your bruises may take longer to resolve. It is also possible that the redness and swelling you are experiencing could be due to an infection. If you are concerned about a bruise or any other injury, it is always best to consult with a medical professional for proper evaluation and treatment.

answer: Epistaxis, or nosebleeds, can be a common occurrence in children, especially those between the ages of 3 and 10 years old. In most cases, nosebleeds are benign and can be easily treated at home. Here are some suggestions for treatment:Encourage your child to sit upright and lean slightly forward to help prevent blood from flowing down the back of the throat.Have your child pinch the soft part of the nose closed with their thumb and index finger, and hold this position for at least 5-10 minutes.If the bleeding does not stop after 10-15 minutes, you may apply a cold compress or ice pack to the bridge of the nose to help constrict the blood vessels and stop the bleeding.If the bleeding continues, or if your child experiences frequent or recurrent nosebleeds, it may be helpful to use a saline nasal spray or apply a thin layer of petroleum jelly to the inside of the nostrils to keep the nasal passages moist and prevent drying and cracking.If the nosebleeds are severe or recurrent, it may be necessary to see a healthcare provider for further evaluation and treatment.It is not uncommon for children to experience episodic nosebleeds, especially during cold and flu season. In most cases, the nosebleeds will resolve on their own and do not represent a serious health concern. However, if your child experiences frequent or severe nosebleeds, or if the nosebleeds are accompanied by other symptoms such as difficulty breathing, it is important to seek medical attention.

question: What does the brain MRI report indicate?What does the following MRI of the brain report mean? There is a small chronic lacunar infarct versus a dilated perivascular space in the posterior left centrum semiolale. A small chronic lacunar infarct in the left thalamus is observed. There is no evidence of restricted diffusion to suggest acute infarction in the brain parenchyma. There is a mildly prominent CSF overlying the cerebral hemispheres secondary to moderate generalized cerebral and cerebellar volume loss rathat than subdural hygromas. The ventricles and basilar cisterns are normal in size.
answer: An MRI of the brain is a medical imaging test that uses strong magnetic fields and radio waves to produce detailed images of the brain. The report you provided describes several findings on the MRI scan.A lacunar infarct is a type of small stroke that occurs when a small blood vessel in the brain becomes blocked, disrupting blood flow to a small area of brain tissue. The presence of a small chronic lacunar infarct means that there is a small area of brain tissue that has been damaged due to a previous stroke.A dilated perivascular space is a small fluid-filled area around a blood vessel in the brain. The presence of a dilated perivascular space in the posterior left centrum semiolale suggests that there may be some swelling or inflammation in this area of the brain.The MRI report also mentions a small chronic lacunar infarct in the left thalamus, which is an area of the brain involved in movement, sensory processing, and regulation of sleep and wakefulness.The report states that there is no evidence of restricted diffusion, which means that the MRI did not detect any areas of the brain that are experiencing a sudden lack of blood flow, which can occur during an acute stroke.The report mentions that there is a mildly prominent cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) overlying the cerebral hemispheres, which may be due to moderate generalized cerebral and cerebellar volume loss. This means that there is an abnormal amount of CSF present in the brain, which may be due to a decrease in the volume of brain tissue.The ventricles and basilar cisterns, which are fluid-filled spaces within the brain, are described as being normal in size.Overall, the MRI report suggests that there are some areas of brain tissue damage and swelling present, but no evidence of an acute stroke or other serious brain injury. It is important to note that this interpretation is based on the information provided in the report and a complete evaluation of the MRI scan would require a more detailed review by a healthcare professional.

question: What is the treatment for interstitial lung disease?Hi there...I am currently being tested for Interstitial Lung disease related to connective tissue in the uterus. I have no breathing problems, but suffer from chest pain and joint ache related to my hormonal cycle. I am 39, 120 pds, in the gym every day! If I do have this, is it treatable? Is it life threatening?
answer: Interstitial lung disease (ILD) is a group of lung disorders that cause scarring in the tissue around the air spaces in the lungs. The treatment for ILD depends on the specific type of ILD and the severity of the condition.Treatment options may include:Oxygen therapy: This involves using oxygen to help improve breathing and increase the amount of oxygen in the blood.Medications: Corticosteroids, immunosuppressive drugs, and other medications may be used to reduce inflammation and slow the progression of ILD.Pulmonary rehabilitation: This involves a program of exercise, education, and support to help improve breathing and quality of life.Lung transplant: In severe cases, a lung transplant may be necessary.It is important to work closely with your healthcare team to determine the best treatment plan for your specific situation.In terms of prognosis, ILD can range from mild to severe, and some types may be more serious than others. It is important to get an accurate diagnosis and follow your treatment plan to help manage the condition and improve your quality of life. It is also important to continue to follow up with your healthcare team regularly to monitor your condition.

question: Should i take anti rabies vaccination after a dog bite?good day doctors ,, i've been beaten by a dog last jan 5 2012 and i've been vaccinated 3 times after 5 months i am plying with my new 1.5months old puppy then he beat me and then ive been vaccinated anti rab. booster. then tonight he beat me again should i boost again ...
answer: It is important to seek medical attention as soon as possible after being bitten by a dog, especially if you are not sure if the dog is up to date on its rabies vaccinations. If you have received a series of rabies vaccinations in the past and have completed the series, you should not need to receive any additional booster doses unless you have been exposed to rabies. However, if you have not received a series of rabies vaccinations or if it has been more than five years since you completed the series, you should receive a booster dose as soon as possible after being bitten by a dog.It is also important to note that the effectiveness of rabies vaccinations can vary depending on the individual and the specific vaccine used. Some people may not develop an adequate immune response to the vaccine, which means that they may not be fully protected against rabies even if they have received the vaccine. In these cases, it may be necessary to receive additional booster doses or to undergo additional treatment to protect against rabies.If you have any concerns about your risk of rabies after being bitten by a dog, it is important to speak with a healthcare provider. They will be able to assess your specific situation and determine the best course of action to take to protect you against rabies.

question: Suggest remedy to treat submucous fibrosisi used to chew guthka.... now i am suffring from submucous fibrosis ........i hav learnt the lesson i cant eat any spicy dishes.... my mouth is not opening......not even two fingers wide... help me with some prescriptions since we dont have a dentist in our town ...... is pineapple effective for this since it has muscle degrading agents....should i eat pineapple
answer: Submucous fibrosis is a condition that causes thickening and scarring of the tissue inside the mouth, leading to difficulty in opening the mouth and chewing food. Chewing tobacco, including gutka, is a major risk factor for developing submucous fibrosis.Treatment for submucous fibrosis typically involves a combination of approaches, including:Stopping the use of tobacco and other substances that may be causing or contributing to the condition. This is the most important step in managing submucous fibrosis.Physiotherapy: This may involve exercises to stretch and strengthen the muscles in the mouth and jaw.Surgical intervention: In severe cases, surgery may be necessary to remove excess tissue and improve the ability to open the mouth.Medications: Corticosteroids and other medications may be prescribed to help reduce inflammation and scarring.It is important to note that pineapple is not a recommended treatment for submucous fibrosis. While pineapple contains bromelain, an enzyme that can break down proteins, there is no scientific evidence to support its use as a treatment for submucous fibrosis or any other condition. It is important to follow the treatment plan recommended by a medical professional and not to self-treat with unproven remedies.If you are experiencing difficulty opening your mouth or have other symptoms of submucous fibrosis, it is important to see a medical professional for proper diagnosis and treatment. If there is no dentist available in your town, you may be able to see a doctor or a specialist in oral medicine for further evaluation and management of your condition.

question: Is it normal to have pain in chest after an year of bypass surgery?hi,this is a question about a 62 year old man (my father). he got his bypass surgery done a year ago and he has a pain in the center of his chest even after the surgery. do you suggest any test for the same or this is normal. his BP is also always high with 150-120 ratio.
answer: Hello! This pain, can be hardly considered normal. After excluding any possible sternotomy complications by a careful local examination, I would recommend a resting ECG, some blood tests (including cardiac enzymes), and a cardiac ultrasound. If suspicions are raised about a possible myocardial ischemia, then some additional tests are necessary (cardiac stress tests, perfusional cardiac imagine tests, even coronary angiography).Meanwhile, a modulation of antihypertensive therapy is necessary, to maintain his blood pressure values under control.Hope to have been helpful to you. Greetings! Dr. Iliri

question: Is it normal to have pain in chest after an year of bypass surgery?hi,this is a question about a 62 year old man (my father). he got his bypass surgery done a year ago and he has a pain in the center of his chest even after the surgery. do you suggest any test for the same or this is normal. his BP is also always high with 150-120 ratio.
answer: It is not uncommon for some individuals to experience chest pain after bypass surgery. However, it is important to speak with a healthcare professional if you are experiencing chest pain, as it could be a sign of a potential issue. It is also important to monitor your blood pressure, as high blood pressure can be a risk factor for heart disease and stroke.There are several tests that your healthcare professional may recommend to determine the cause of your chest pain. These may include:Blood tests: These tests can help determine if there is any inflammation or infection in the body.Electrocardiogram (ECG): This test measures the electrical activity of the heart and can help identify any potential issues with the heart's rhythm.Stress test: This test involves exercising on a treadmill or stationary bike while being monitored by a healthcare professional. question: Suggest treatment for HBsAG positiveHELLO, DOCTOR                    MY NAME IS JITENDER KUMAR SINGH I AM WORKING IN MERCHANT NAVY. I HAVEING HBsAG + SO I AM UNABLE TO JOIN THE SHIP BECAUSE OF THIS .SO I WANT SOME GIDUENCE FROM U WHAT TYPE OF TREATMENT SHOULD I TAKE FOR IT AND IT IS STABLE FOR LIFE TIME IN BODY OR WE CAN CLEAR IT ALSO
answer: HBsAg, or hepatitis B surface antigen, is a protein found on the surface of the hepatitis B virus. A positive HBsAg test result means that you are infected with the hepatitis B virus and can transmit the virus to others.Treatment for HBsAg positive individuals typically involves taking antiviral medications to suppress the virus and prevent liver damage. The specific antiviral medication and treatment plan will depend on several factors, including the stage of your infection, your overall health, and whether you have any underlying liver conditions.It is important to work closely with a healthcare provider to determine the best treatment plan for you. In some cases, treatment may be able to clear the virus from your body and lead to a sustained virologic response (SVR), meaning that the virus is no longer detectable in your blood. However, in other cases, the virus may persist and treatment may be necessary to manage the infection.It is also important to practice safe behaviors to prevent the transmission of the hepatitis B virus to others. This includes avoiding sharing needles or other injection equipment, practicing safe sex, and washing your hands regularly.I hope this information is helpful. It is important to discuss your treatment options with a healthcare provider to determine the best plan for you.

question: What causes child to not eat anything while at daycare?My daughter 2 year old eats well at home but  does not eat anyt in the daycare except milk. She loves to go to the daycare and is happy there. She eats well on weekends or other days when she is there at home. I send the same food to her as I feed her at home.
answer: There can be a number of reasons why a child may not eat while at daycare. Here are a few possibilities:Stress or anxiety: Being in a new environment with unfamiliar people and routines can be stressful for young children. This stress may cause them to lose their appetite.Distractions: Children may be more easily distracted at daycare, especially if there are other children present. This can make it harder for them to focus on eating.Different routines: Children may be more used to eating at certain times or in certain ways at home. At daycare, the routines may be different, which can make it harder for them to eat.Changes in appetite: Children's appetites can vary from day to day, and it's common for them to eat more on some days and less on others.It's important to talk to your child's daycare provider about your concerns and see if they have any suggestions or observations about your child's eating habits. It may also be helpful to try to pack foods that are familiar to your child and that you know they enjoy, and to provide positive reinforcement for eating, such as praising your child for trying new foods or for eating a good meal.

question: What do elevated liver enzymes indicate?Hi, I have elevated liver enzymes, ALT = 196 and AST 181. The nurse (almost a doctor) I go to thinks I should have a liver biopsy. When it first went up I was on a medication that was known to elevate the liver enzymes but I got off of the 7 years ago. It never did go down. What is your opinion? thank you! Melanie
answer: Elevated liver enzymes can indicate a variety of conditions, including liver inflammation or damage. The enzymes alanine transaminase (ALT) and aspartate transaminase (AST) are two enzymes that are commonly measured to assess liver health. In your case, it sounds like the medication you were taking may have contributed to the elevation of your liver enzymes. However, it is also possible that there is another underlying cause for the elevated levels.A liver biopsy is a procedure in which a small sample of liver tissue is removed and examined under a microscope to determine the cause of the elevated liver enzymes. This can help your doctor determine the best course of treatment for your condition. However, a liver biopsy is not always necessary and there may be other ways to diagnose and treat the cause of the elevated liver enzymes.It is important to discuss the risks and benefits of a liver biopsy with your healthcare provider. They can help you determine whether a liver biopsy is appropriate in your case, and help you understand the potential risks and benefits of the procedure.

question: What is the mediastynum cyst on the right side of my chest?Hi Doctor. I just got back from my CT scan. 3 months ago they located a 2 cm mediastynum cyst on the right side of my chest. My doctor sent me to get another CT 3 months later to see if it grew. Thy told me that it looks the same and that it is on the right side of my body near my heart. What should I do? And what is it?
answer: A mediastinal cyst is a fluid-filled sac that occurs in the mediastinum, which is the space in the chest between the lungs. The mediastinum contains many important structures, including the heart, trachea, esophagus, and blood vessels. Mediastinal cysts are relatively rare and can occur at any age. They can be classified into various types based on their location and contents.It is important to have a medical professional evaluate and diagnose the specific type and cause of your mediastinal cyst. The treatment for a mediastinal cyst will depend on the type and location of the cyst, as well as any symptoms it may be causing. In some cases, no treatment may be necessary if the cyst is not causing any problems. However, if the cyst is causing symptoms or is at risk of causing problems in the future, treatment may be necessary. This could include medications, drainage of the cyst, or surgery to remove the cyst.It is important to follow your doctor's recommendations and to have any recommended follow-up evaluations to monitor the cyst. It is also important to let your doctor know if you experience any new or worsening symptoms, such as difficulty breathing, chest pain, or swelling in the neck or face.

question: What causes fluctuations in the BP level in a lung and liver cancer patient?Someone I know has been on this for awhile and has been getting great results I have noticed her belly is getting big and her blood pressure is going up and down. She has been diagnosed with stag 4 cancer liver lung pelvis cancer do you know if this mean it is getting close to dieing I am close to the family I just want to be prepared for them or is it hard to say thanks
answer: It is difficult to determine the specific cause of fluctuations in blood pressure (BP) in a lung and liver cancer patient without more information. Cancer itself can also affect BP, as it can lead to inflammation and other changes in the body that can alter BP. Additionally, liver cancer and other forms of advanced cancer can lead to complications such as ascites (fluid accumulation in the abdomen) and malnutrition, which can also affect BP.It is important to note that fluctuations in BP can be normal, especially in individuals with advanced cancer, and do not necessarily indicate that the patient is close to dying. It is always best to consult with a healthcare professional for an accurate assessment of the patient's condition and to discuss any concerns you may have.

question: Why has doctor told me to do barium CT scan?I have been told that from an ultrasound I had looking at my gallbladder that the gallbladder checked out fine but that there is a shadow at the tip of my pancreas. I have been told that I need a berium CT scan follow up. Is this something that is serious. I am a 30 year old male with no other medical conditions.
answer: A barium CT scan is a type of imaging test that can be used to visualize the digestive system, including the pancreas. It involves swallowing a liquid that contains barium, which coats the lining of the digestive tract and makes it easier to see on the CT scan. The test can be helpful in identifying abnormalities or problems in the pancreas or other parts of the digestive system.The fact that you have been advised to undergo a barium CT scan following an ultrasound that showed a shadow at the tip of your pancreas suggests that your doctor is concerned about this finding and wants to further evaluate it. It is important to follow your doctor's recommendations and undergo the recommended testing to determine the cause of the shadow and determine the appropriate course of treatment, if necessary. It is not possible to determine the severity of the problem without further evaluation, but it is important to address any potential concerns with your doctor.

question: Is lump after banged to the coffee table something wrong?Hi, I have just banged my leg on the corner of my coffee table. It may last a few days before receding. In the meantime, take paracetamol and ibuprofen for the pain. A compression knee support may help. Also try a cool compress to the area. Hope this helps you.

question: Is lump after banged to the coffee table something wrong?Hi, I have just banged my leg on the corner of my coffee table. answer: It's normal for a bump or lump to form after you've banged your leg on a hard surface like a coffee table. This is because the impact can cause swelling and inflammation in the affected area. The lump you're feeling is likely a combination of swelling and blood that has pooled under the skin. It's important to keep an eye on the lump and monitor it for any changes in size or appearance. In the meantime, you can try applying an ice pack to the affected area to help reduce swelling and pain.
