question: What can cause Herpes?Hi, last night I found a growth on my boyfriend's penis that looks like a mole that has just developed over the past 2 weeks, also, everytime we have have sex my labia becomes grossly edematous afterward. I thought at first that it was just due to the friction, but now with seeing this growth I'm worried that it's herpes. Could it be anything else? he has a history of unprotected sex as well with multiple partners
answer: Genital herpes is caused by the herpes simplex virus (HSV). There are two types of HSV: HSV-1 and HSV-2. HSV-1 is typically associated with oral herpes, which causes cold sores or fever blisters around the mouth, but it can also cause genital herpes. HSV-2 is usually the cause of genital herpes, but it can also cause oral herpes.It is possible for someone to have herpes and not be aware of it, as the virus can cause symptoms that are mild or may not even be noticed. It is also possible for someone to have the virus and not experience any symptoms at all.If you are concerned that you or your boyfriend may have herpes, it is important to see a healthcare provider for an evaluation and testing. The growth that you described on your boyfriend's penis may be related to herpes, but it could also be caused by something else. Only a healthcare provider can give you a definitive diagnosis.In the meantime, it is important to practice safe sex to reduce the risk of transmitting the virus to your partner or acquiring it from a partner. This includes using condoms or dental dams during sexual activity and avoiding sexual contact when symptoms are present. It is also a good idea to talk to your partner about their sexual history and whether they have been tested for STIs, including herpes.

question: What causes reactive HbSAg, high AST and ALT?my daughter donated blood at a camp. they sent her a note saying her HbSAg was reactive and her AST was 52 ( the normal level is 5 to 40) and her ALT was 77 (the normal range is 5 to 40) her T Bilirubin is 0.5 (0.2 to 1.3) and Anti-HbC is negative. D Bilirubin is 0.1 (0 to 0.4) T Protein is 7.2 (6 to 8) Albumin 4.4(3.5-5). what does it mean
answer: Hello,the presence of HBsAg means that an individual has come into contact with hepatitis B virus. There are some rare exceptions to this rule. If the core antibody (anti-HBc) is negative then there are two possibilities.

question: What causes reactive HbSAg, high AST and ALT?my daughter donated blood at a camp. they sent her a note saying her HbSAg was reactive and her AST was 52 ( the normal level is 5 to 40) and her ALT was 77 (the normal range is 5 to 40) her T Bilirubin is 0.5 (0.2 to 1.3) and Anti-HbC is negative. D Bilirubin is 0.1 (0 to 0.4) T Protein is 7.2 (6 to 8) Albumin 4.4(3.5-5). what does it mean
answer: HbSAg stands for Hepatitis B surface antigen. A reactive result means that you have been exposed to the hepatitis B virus and that the virus is present in your body.AST and ALT are enzymes found in the liver. High levels of these enzymes in the blood can be a sign of liver damage or disease. The normal range for AST is 5 to 40 units per liter and the normal range for ALT is 7 to 56 units per liter, but these values can vary slightly depending on the laboratory that performs the test.Elevated levels of AST and ALT can be caused by a number of different conditions, including viral hepatitis (such as hepatitis B), alcohol abuse, non-alcoholic fatty liver disease, and certain medications.It is important for your daughter to follow up with a healthcare provider to determine the cause of the elevated AST and ALT levels and to receive appropriate treatment. The healthcare provider will likely recommend additional testing to determine the specific cause of the liver enzyme abnormalities and to develop a treatment plan.

question: What procedure needs to be followed after extracting molar tooth?Hi, I had an upper back tooth extracted on Monday, now Wednesday, I used salt water and think the blood clot has come away. Iam now left with a hole again... I have no bleeding and no pain (yet) what are the chances of having dry socket and what should I do next? Thanks :)
answer: It is normal for some bleeding and swelling to occur after a tooth extraction, and it is important to follow the aftercare instructions provided by your dentist or oral surgeon to promote proper healing. This typically includes keeping the extraction site clean and avoiding certain activities that could disrupt the blood clot, such as vigorous rinsing or spitting, sucking on straws, or smoking.If you think the blood clot has come away, it is important to contact your dental care provider for further instructions. It is possible that you may be at risk for a condition called dry socket, which occurs when the blood clot at the extraction site is lost or doesn't form properly. Dry socket can cause pain and delay healing. Your dental care provider can recommend treatment to help prevent or manage this condition.In the meantime, you can try gently rinsing your mouth with warm salt water to help keep the area clean and reduce any swelling or discomfort. It is also important to continue taking any prescribed medications as directed and to follow any other aftercare instructions provided by your dental care provider.

question: How can front teeth positions be corrected?hello, I am an 18 yr old male. I got my braces off 2 years back. I wore my retainers for about 10 months and then i discontinued wearing them. Now i feel that my front teeth are shifting forward from the root! What is the best way to correct them. I dont want braces again. Thanks
answer: It's natural for teeth to shift over time, especially if you are no longer wearing retainers. If your front teeth have shifted significantly and you are unhappy with the way they look, there are a few options that you could consider to correct their position:Orthodontic treatment: This may involve wearing braces or aligners to gently guide your teeth back into position. This is usually the most effective way to correct misaligned teeth, but it can be time-consuming and may not be the most convenient option for you.Bonding: If your teeth have only shifted slightly, you may be able to correct their position using dental bonding. This involves applying a composite resin material to your teeth and sculpting it into the desired shape. Bonding can be completed in a single office visit, but it may not be as durable as other treatment options.Veneers: If you want to make more significant changes to the appearance of your front teeth, you may want to consider veneers. Veneers are thin shells that are applied to the front of your teeth and can be used to correct misalignment, as well as other cosmetic issues. Veneers are more expensive than bonding and require more than one office visit to complete.It's important to consult with a dentist or orthodontist to determine the best course of treatment for your specific needs. They can help you weigh the pros and cons of each option and choose the one that will be most effective and appropriate for you.

question: Suggest remedy for excessive awakening in the night and foul smelling urineMy 10 month old daughter has recently began wakening during the night numerous times. If your daughter is drinking a lot of water and waking up frequently, it could be a sign of increased thirst, which could be related to her sweating. It is also possible that she has an infection or another underlying medical issue that is causing her to drink more water and wake up frequently.Foul-smelling urine can also be a sign of an infection or other underlying medical issue. It is important to speak with your daughter's healthcare provider to determine the cause of her symptoms and to determine the appropriate treatment. Your healthcare provider will be able to perform a physical examination, ask about your daughter's symptoms and medical history, and possibly order tests to help diagnose the cause of her symptoms.In the meantime, you can try to help your daughter stay hydrated by offering her water or electrolyte-rich fluids, such as breast milk or formula, throughout the day. question: What causes itching sensation in feet/thighs/arms/wrist?Hello, I'm having itching sensations in my feet, inner thighs, my arms, and my wrist. Any clue what this might be? I'm coming off of prescription pain medicine from years of being on it and my friend passed away recently. I'm past the withdrawal phase from my medicine tho.
answer: Some common causes include:Dry skin: Dry skin can cause itching, especially in the winter months when the air is dry.Allergies: Allergies to certain foods, medications, or substances in the environment can cause itching.Skin conditions: Certain skin conditions, such as eczema, psoriasis, and scabies, can cause itching.Infections: Infections, such as fungal infections of the skin or sexually transmitted infections, can cause itching.Chronic kidney disease: Chronic kidney disease can cause a buildup of waste products in the body, which can cause itching.Liver disease: Liver disease can cause a buildup of bile in the body, which can cause itching.Side effect of medications: Some medications, such as antihistamines and opioids, can cause itching as a side effect.It's important to see a healthcare provider for an accurate diagnosis and appropriate treatment. It's also important to consider the psychological effects of your friend's recent passing and the stress of coming off of prescription pain medication. It may be helpful to speak with a mental health professional if you are experiencing significant stress or grief.

question: Can buprenorphine lead to confusion, memory loss and emotional hallucinations?a friend recently prescribed buprenophin 2 times a day 8 mg,however days may be skipped due to lack of funds,and they might be injecting the pill themselves they also have severe depression and a past head injury.he is slurring his words and pointing it out himself that his speech isent right.and confusion memory loss,emotional,hallucinations, is this the meds?is this in the morphine family?
answer: Buprenorphine is a prescription medication that is used to treat opioid addiction and manage moderate to severe pain. It is a partial opioid agonist, which means that it activates opioid receptors in the brain to a lesser extent than full opioid agonists, such as morphine.Buprenorphine can cause a range of side effects, including confusion, memory loss, and emotional changes. These side effects are more likely to occur when buprenorphine is taken in high doses or when it is taken with other medications or substances that can interact with it. It is important to use buprenorphine exactly as directed by a healthcare provider and to let the provider know about any other medications or substances being taken.Injecting buprenorphine can be dangerous and is not recommended. Injecting the medication can lead to serious side effects, such as infection and abscesses at the injection site, as well as an increased risk of overdose.If your friend is experiencing confusion, memory loss, and emotional changes, it is important for them to speak with their healthcare provider as soon as possible. The provider can determine the cause of these symptoms and provide appropriate treatment. It is also important for your friend to follow their treatment plan as directed, including taking the medication as prescribed, to ensure that they receive the full benefits of treatment.

question: What causes difficulty to support weight while standing?Hello, my daughter is 9 months old and cannot support her own weight in a standing position. When I try to let her stand she bends forward at the waist. When she stands upright, it is on her toes and only for a few seconds. answer: It is normal for infants to develop the ability to support their own weight and stand upright at different ages. Most infants begin to pull themselves up to a standing position around 9-12 months of age and can stand unsupported around 12-15 months of age. However, every child is different and some may develop these skills earlier or later than others.There are several factors that can affect an infant's ability to support their own weight and stand upright. These include muscle strength and coordination, balance, and overall physical development. Infants also need to learn how to use their muscles to control their movements and maintain their balance.If your daughter is 9 months old and is having difficulty supporting her own weight and standing upright, it is possible that she simply needs more time to develop the necessary muscle strength and coordination. question: Does almond and English walnut normalise uric acid?himy age is 38female i have heelpain in my right leg my sugarpoint is140infasting i take everyday 2almond and 1 english wallnut in everymorning is good for uricacid or notmy weight 60 kg my hight is 143 inches also suffering from irregular menstrualproblem  thanx doctor
answer: It is not clear whether almonds and English walnuts can normalize uric acid levels in the body. Uric acid is a waste product that is produced when the body breaks down purines, which are substances that are found naturally in the body and in certain foods. High levels of uric acid can lead to the development of gout, a type of arthritis that causes pain and swelling in the joints.There is some evidence to suggest that nuts, including almonds and English walnuts, may be beneficial for people with gout or high uric acid levels. Nuts are a good source of antioxidants, which may help to reduce inflammation in the body. They are also high in fiber, which can help to lower cholesterol levels and may reduce the risk of heart disease.However, it is important to note that the relationship between diet and gout is complex, and the impact of specific foods on uric acid levels can vary from person to person. It is always a good idea to speak with a healthcare provider or a registered dietitian for personalized advice on how to manage gout or high uric acid levels. They can help you to develop a treatment plan that is right for you, which may include dietary changes, medication, and other lifestyle modifications.

question: What is the treatment for compound fracture?Hi, I was recently diagnosed with a old compound fracture of my L1 vi a x ray I am wondering what the usual procedures are to resolve this problem .. i had a bone density done this past Sept. and no on mentioned it before.. just looking for some proactive answers ...dr.appt. set for this mo...my am 5.6 nd weigh 135 so, I am not overweight name is Cathy, I am a Truck driver I
answer: A compound fracture, also known as an open fracture, is a type of broken bone in which the bone has broken through the skin. This type of fracture is considered a medical emergency because it carries a higher risk of infection.The treatment for a compound fracture typically involves the following steps:Control bleeding: If the bone has punctured the skin, there may be significant bleeding. The first priority is to control the bleeding by applying direct pressure to the wound and elevating the injured limb above heart level, if possible.Administer pain medication: The patient will likely be given pain medication to help manage the pain associated with the fracture.Clean the wound: The wound will need to be thoroughly cleaned to reduce the risk of infection. This may involve using a sterile solution or irrigation to clean out any debris or dirt.Set the bone: Once the wound has been cleaned and the bleeding has been controlled, the bone will need to be set back into place. This may be done using traction, splinting, or surgery.Close the wound: If the wound is small, it may be closed using sutures (stitches). If the wound is larger or if there is significant tissue damage, the wound may need to be left open and allowed to heal on its own.Rehabilitation: After the bone has been set and the wound has been closed, the patient will likely need to undergo physical therapy to help restore strength and mobility to the injured limb.It's important to seek medical treatment as soon as possible for a compound fracture. If left untreated, this type of fracture can lead to serious complications, such as infection, nerve damage, or amputation.

answer: Hi every patient with chf does not need a pacemakerthere are some indications for pacemaking in a patient iof congestive cardiac failure i am mentioning some of them, it depends on the stage of chf and how well it is controlled by medicines,Thirty to 50 percent of patients with advanced congestive heart failure have major intraventricular conduction defects, chf along with intraventricular conduction defect is a indication forpacemaking,especially complete left bundle branch block have been shown to be independent predictors of mortality.Delayed activation of the left ventricle as a result of left bundle branch block has been shown to produce significant dyssynchrony in left ventricular contraction and relaxation.

question: What are the benefits of having a pace maker?I have a 95 year old mother that is suffering from congestive heart failure and atrial defiberation she takes medicine for high blood pressure. Her doctor said that she doesn t need a pace maker. What would be some of the reasons that he thinks she would not benefit from a pacemaker. I neglected to ask him that question.
answer: A pacemaker is a small device that is implanted in the chest to help regulate the heartbeat. It sends electrical signals to the heart to help it beat at the right rate and rhythm. Pacemakers are often used to treat arrhythmias, which are abnormal heart rhythms that can cause symptoms such as dizziness, fainting, and shortness of breath.There are several reasons why a person with congestive heart failure and atrial fibrillation may not benefit from a pacemaker. Some of these reasons may include:The person's heart rhythm is not caused by a problem with the heart's natural pacemaker (the sinoatrial node) or the electrical conduction system of the heart.The person's heart rhythm can be adequately controlled with medications.The person has other medical conditions that make them ineligible for a pacemaker, such as a bleeding disorder or an infection.The person's heart function is too weak to support the added strain of a pacemaker.It is important to discuss the potential risks and benefits of a pacemaker with a healthcare provider. They will consider the person's specific medical history and the severity of their symptoms when deciding whether a pacemaker is the best treatment option.

If your husband is not taking his medications as directed, this could be contributing to his high blood pressure.Undiagnosed or uncontrolled underlying medical conditions: Certain medical conditions, such as kidney disease, sleep apnea, or an overactive thyroid gland, can contribute to high blood pressure. question: What causes breathlessness during nights?I am constantly out of breath. Just getting into bed makes me out of breath. I cant do anything without feeling this way. I also have no motivation. answer: Breathlessness during the night can be caused by a variety of factors. Some possible causes include:Asthma: Asthma is a chronic lung condition that can cause difficulty breathing, especially at night.Heart problems: If you have a history of heart problems, such as blocked arteries, you may be more prone to breathlessness during the night.Obstructive sleep apnea: This condition occurs when your airway becomes partially or completely blocked during sleep, causing you to wake up frequently to gasp for air.Allergies: Allergies can cause congestion and inflammation in the airways, leading to difficulty breathing.Anemia: Anemia is a condition in which you have a low red blood cell count. Red blood cells carry oxygen to the body's tissues, so if you have anemia, you may feel out of breath.Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD): COPD is a group of lung conditions that can cause difficulty breathing, especially during physical activity.It's important to speak with your doctor about your symptoms to determine the cause and receive proper treatment. question: What causes an anteroseptal infarct on ECG?if an ecg states that you have had an anteroseptal infart on several different occasions and an echocardiogram shows a thickened septal area and it is nearly a year since the incident that makes you think that you have had an mi, what is the likelihood that the anteroseptal event actually happened and was not just something like indigestion
answer: These changes are quite specific and characteristic and it is not likely that other medical conditions like indigestion would have produced them. Also, since these changes were seen on several different occasions, this makes an anteroseptal infarct  quite certain.After an infarct the damaged area of the heart muscle undergoes scarring and it may also result in thickening of that area as seen on the Echocardiogram.Some patients, especially diabetics, do not have symptoms like chest pain when they are having their heart attacks, so it is possible to just see the EKG changes of an "old MI" old myocarial infarction on an EKG while the patient does not even know that they had a heart attack.Typically an acute heart attack causes severe chest pain, Shortness of breath and makes one very ill and treatment in the hospital is required , where blood tests are done to confirm a diagnosis of so called acute MI.Hope this helps you understand this issue.Wishing you best of health.

question: What causes an anteroseptal infarct on ECG?if an ecg states that you have had an anteroseptal infart on several different occasions and an echocardiogram shows a thickened septal area and it is nearly a year since the incident that makes you think that you have had an mi, what is the likelihood that the anteroseptal event actually happened and was not just something like indigestion
answer: An anteroseptal infarct on an electrocardiogram (ECG) is caused by a blockage in the blood flow to the front and center of the heart muscle, also known as the septum. This blockage can be caused by a clot in one of the coronary arteries that supplies blood to the heart. If the blockage is not promptly treated, it can lead to damage or death of the heart muscle tissue in the affected area, known as a myocardial infarction or heart attack.If an ECG shows evidence of an anteroseptal infarct on several different occasions and an echocardiogram shows a thickened septal area, it is highly likely that the anteroseptal infarct actually occurred. It is not uncommon for people who have had a heart attack to experience recurrent symptoms or ECG changes, as the damage to the heart muscle may not be fully reversible.It is important to seek medical attention if you are experiencing symptoms that may be related to a heart attack, such as chest pain, shortness of breath, or discomfort in the neck, jaw, arms, or back. Indigestion or other non-cardiac causes of chest discomfort should also be ruled out, as it is important to accurately diagnose and treat the underlying cause of the symptoms.

question: Q. Please give me some advice or medication for fatty liver.Hi, a pleasant day..i have a problem with my liver,i just have an ultrasound last month, to found out i have a moderate fatty lever grade 2,,my problems is sometimes i feel some soreness in my stomach. if i to rate the pain 1-10,10 being the highest ,around 3-4..may i ask for sum advice..or medication for it
answer: Fatty liver, also known as hepatic steatosis, is a common condition that occurs when there is an accumulation of excess fat in the liver. It is important to address fatty liver as it can lead to more serious liver problems, such as nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) or cirrhosis.The most effective way to treat fatty liver is to adopt a healthy lifestyle, which includes:Maintaining a healthy weight: Losing weight can help reduce the amount of fat in the liver.Eating a healthy diet: A diet that is low in calories, saturated and trans fats, and added sugars can help reduce fat in the liver. Choose foods that are high in fiber, such as fruits, vegetables, and whole grains.Exercising regularly: Regular physical activity can help you lose weight and improve your overall health.Avoiding alcohol: Alcohol can worsen fatty liver, so it is important to limit your alcohol intake or avoid it altogether.Managing other health conditions: If you have diabetes, high blood pressure, or high cholesterol, it is important to manage these conditions to reduce the risk of developing fatty liver.Medications may also be used to treat fatty liver, but they are usually reserved for more severe cases. Your doctor will be able to recommend the most appropriate treatment plan for you based on the severity of your condition and any other underlying health conditions you may have.It is important to follow your doctor's advice and adhere to your treatment plan to manage your fatty liver and reduce the risk of developing more serious liver problems.

question: What could cause recurred cough with sensation of smoke while breathing?Hi.  I had a bad chest infection 5 months ago that took 3 months to clear.  My chest & lung X-Rays were clear.  I was also coughing badly but that improved although never went away alltogether.  I am now coughing badly again and now have a sensation of being in a smokey atmosphere when I breathe.  This has been going on for 5 months now and I am beginning to despair that I shall ever get better
answer: There are several possible causes of a recurrent cough and a sensation of smoke while breathing. Here are some possible explanations:Post-infectious cough: It's possible that the cough you had 5 months ago was caused by an infection, and that the cough has persisted even after the infection has cleared. This is called a post-infectious cough, and it can take several weeks or even months to resolve.Allergic bronchitis: It's also possible that you are experiencing allergic bronchitis, which is inflammation of the bronchial tubes caused by an allergic reaction. Allergic bronchitis can cause symptoms such as coughing, wheezing, and shortness of breath.Asthma: Another possibility is that you have asthma, a chronic respiratory condition that causes inflammation and narrowing of the airways, leading to symptoms such as coughing, wheezing, and difficulty breathing.Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD): COPD is a group of lung conditions that includes chronic bronchitis and emphysema, and it can cause coughing, wheezing, and difficulty breathing.It's important to see a healthcare provider to determine the cause of your cough and other symptoms. They can evaluate your medical history, perform a physical examination, and possibly order tests such as a chest x-ray or lung function tests to help diagnose the cause of your symptoms. Once the cause is determined, your healthcare provider can recommend the appropriate treatment.

question: What are the symptoms of potential dengue?My husband is suffering from fever on and off, with muscle pains, mild diarrhea and a bad headache. Is it dengue ? Discovered some spots on his legs too. If i'm not wrong, there's no treatment for dengue, how would a dengue patient recover? And what are the signs that he is recovering?
answer: Dengue fever is a viral illness transmitted by mosquitoes. It can cause a wide range of symptoms, including fever, headache, muscle and joint pain, and rash. Some people may also experience mild bleeding, such as nosebleeds or bruising. The rash associated with dengue fever typically appears on the chest, arms, and legs and may be accompanied by itching.If your husband is experiencing fever, muscle pains, and a headache, it is possible that he may have dengue fever. However, it is important to note that these symptoms can also be caused by other conditions, so it is important for him to see a healthcare provider for a proper diagnosis.There is no specific treatment for dengue fever. The mainstay of treatment is to relieve symptoms and prevent complications. This may include taking over-the-counter pain medications to reduce fever and muscle pain, drinking plenty of fluids to prevent dehydration, and getting plenty of rest. In severe cases, hospitalization may be necessary to provide supportive care, such as intravenous fluids.The signs that a person with dengue fever is recovering include a decrease in fever, improvement in muscle and joint pain, and resolution of the rash. It is important to continue to monitor for any worsening of symptoms and seek medical attention if necessary.

question: Is Prednisone effective in the treatment of cough and bronchitis?I have had an upper respiratory virus and cold with congestion, coughing Itchy irritated throat and malaise. answer: Prednisone is a corticosteroid medication that can be used to treat a variety of conditions, including respiratory conditions such as cough and bronchitis. It can be effective in reducing inflammation in the airways and may help to relieve symptoms such as cough and congestion. However, prednisone is not a first-line treatment for bronchitis and is usually only used in cases where other treatments have not been effective.It's important to keep in mind that prednisone can have significant side effects and should be used only under the guidance of a healthcare provider. question: Suggest treatment for dog bite woundMy dog bit my pinky finger last night and it was bleeding and still is intermittently. He had a rabies shot. Dog bites can be serious and can cause infection if not properly treated.Here are some steps you can take to care for the wound until you can see a healthcare provider:Clean the wound: Use soap and water to gently clean the wound. Avoid scrubbing the wound, as this can cause further damage to the tissues.Stop the bleeding: If the wound is bleeding heavily, apply direct pressure using a clean cloth or bandage. If the bleeding does not stop after 10-15 minutes, or if it is difficult to control, seek medical attention immediately.Protect the wound: Cover the wound with a sterile bandage or clean cloth to keep it clean and prevent further injury.Watch for signs of infection: Look for signs of infection, such as redness, swelling, warmth, or pus coming from the wound. If you notice any of these signs, seek medical attention.Take over-the-counter pain medication: You can take over-the-counter pain medication, such as acetaminophen or ibuprofen, to help reduce pain and swelling.It's important to see a healthcare provider as soon as possible to determine the extent of the injury and to receive proper treatment. The provider may need to clean the wound more thoroughly, remove any debris, and may prescribe antibiotics to prevent infection. In some cases, the provider may need to suture the wound to help it heal properly.

question: What is the remedy for PCOS since long i am suffering with ?Hi i have a long history of PCOS I never responded with clomid FSH injectionsThis cycle i had HMG injections 75iu for 5 days starting day 3 On 8th day follicular study I have 2 folliculars one with size 25mm and other with 16mm what do u suggest? answer: Polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) is a hormonal disorder that affects the menstrual cycle, fertility, and appearance of women. It is characterized by high levels of androgens (male hormones) in the body, irregular or infrequent periods, and the presence of multiple small cysts on the ovaries.There are several treatment options available for PCOS, and the best option for you will depend on your specific symptoms and goals. Some common treatments for PCOS include:Oral contraceptives: These can help regulate menstrual cycles and reduce androgen levels.Metformin: This medication is often used to treat type 2 diabetes, but it can also help regulate menstrual cycles and improve insulin resistance in women with PCOS.Anti-androgens: These medications can help reduce androgen levels and improve symptoms such as excess hair growth and acne.Lifestyle changes: Making lifestyle changes, such as losing weight, exercising regularly, and following a healthy diet, can help improve symptoms of PCOS.In terms of fertility treatment, in vitro fertilization (IVF) may be an option for women with PCOS who are having difficulty getting pregnant. Your doctor will be able to discuss the treatment options that are most appropriate for you based on your specific situation.It's important to remember that treatment for PCOS is often a long-term process and may involve a combination of medications and lifestyle changes. It's important to work closely with your doctor to develop a treatment plan that is right for you.

They are about the size of an apple seed and can be found in a variety of environments, including homes, hotels, and other buildings. Bed bugs are known to bite humans, and their bites can cause a variety of symptoms, including itching, swelling, and redness. It is possible for a bed bug bite to lead to bleeding, but this is not a common occurrence. If you think you may have been bitten by a bed bug, you should clean the area with soap and water and apply an over-the-counter anti-itch cream to help alleviate any itching or discomfort. If you have a severe allergic reaction to the bite or if you develop a skin infection, you should seek medical attention. If you are concerned about the possibility of bed bugs in your daycare, you may want to consider contacting a professional pest control company to assess the situation and recommend a course of action.

question: Suggest treatment for sacroiliac joint dislocationMy chiropractor says my sacroiliac is out of place on my right side with pain reaching around to my hip and abdomen. Chiropractic adjustments have helped a bit but after 5 of them in 6 days I usually would feel better. What else can I do to heal or put the joint back in place?
answer: Treatment for a sacroiliac (SI) joint dislocation typically involves a combination of manual therapy, physical therapy, and home exercises. The specific treatment plan will depend on the severity and cause of the dislocation, as well as the individual's age, overall health, and preferences.Here are some treatment options that may be recommended:Manual therapy: This may include chiropractic adjustments, massage, or other techniques to help realign the joint and reduce muscle spasms and inflammation.Physical therapy: A physical therapist can teach you exercises to improve flexibility, strength, and stability in the SI joint and surrounding muscles. These exercises may include stretches, strengthening exercises, and balance and coordination exercises.Home exercises: Your chiropractor or physical therapist may recommend specific exercises to do at home to help improve SI joint stability and reduce pain. These may include stretches, strengthening exercises, and balance and coordination exercises.Medications: Your doctor may recommend over-the-counter or prescription medications to help reduce pain and inflammation. These may include nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) or muscle relaxants.Bracing: Wearing a sacroiliac joint belt or other type of supportive brace may help to stabilize the joint and reduce pain.It's important to follow your treatment plan as prescribed and to communicate with your healthcare provider if you have any concerns or questions. It may take some time for the SI joint to fully heal, but with proper treatment and a commitment to your rehabilitation program, you should be able to manage your symptoms and improve your function.

question: Suggest treatment for mouth sore and ulcerHi, I was taking Amoxcillin antibiotics 2 capsules twice a day for tooth pain. From the past 2 days i am having sever dryness in mouth i have 3 tiny white bumps on the left side of my tongue and also a collectionof white spots on the gums in my upper lip...is there any way to treat this mouth sore/ulcer?
answer: Mouth sores and ulcers can be uncomfortable and painful. It's important to identify the cause of the sores in order to determine the most appropriate treatment.If you have recently started taking amoxicillin, it is possible that the sores and ulcers are a side effect of the medication. In this case, it is important to speak with your healthcare provider about the best course of treatment. They may recommend that you stop taking the medication or switch to a different antibiotic.If the sores and ulcers are not caused by the medication, there are several things you can do to alleviate discomfort and promote healing:Rinse your mouth with a saltwater solution. Mix 1/2 teaspoon of salt with 8 ounces of warm water and rinse your mouth with it several times a day. This can help to reduce pain and inflammation.Avoid spicy, acidic, or rough foods that can irritate the sores.Use a soft-bristled toothbrush and avoid brushing or flossing near the sores.Apply a topical cream or ointment to the sores. Over-the-counter products such as topical anesthetics or corticosteroid creams may help to reduce pain and inflammation.Drink plenty of fluids to help keep your mouth hydrated.If the sores and ulcers do not improve within a week or if you have a fever, difficulty swallowing, or difficulty breathing, it is important to see a healthcare provider as these could be signs of a more serious condition.

question: Should DTP and Hepatitis B be given after 45 days of birth?My baby is 45 days old i.e. 1.5 months we need to immunize her. Doctor has recommended couple of vaccines like DTP/DTaP, Hepatitis-B -2nd dose, HiB, Polio two questions i have regarding this vaccines 1) Are all these important vcaccines & if there is any more vaccines to be given. 2) What are cost of each vaccines. Please advice as the matter is to know if i am not getting cheated.
answer: The vaccines that you mentioned, DTP/DTaP (diphtheria, tetanus, and pertussis), Hepatitis B, HiB (Haemophilus influenzae type b), and polio, are all important vaccines that can help protect your baby from serious illnesses.DTP/DTaP vaccine is given in a series of three or four doses to protect against diphtheria, tetanus, and pertussis (whooping cough). The first dose is typically given at 2 months of age, with subsequent doses given at 4 months, 6 months, and 15-18 months of age. A booster dose is also typically given at 4-6 years of age.The Hepatitis B vaccine is also given in a series of three doses. The first dose is typically given at birth, with the second and third doses given at 1-2 months and 6-18 months of age, respectively.The HiB vaccine is given in a series of two or three doses, depending on the specific vaccine used. The first dose is typically given at 2 months of age, with the second dose given at 4 months of age and the third dose given at 12-15 months of age.The polio vaccine is given in a series of three or four doses, depending on the specific vaccine used. The first dose is typically given at 2 months of age, with subsequent doses given at 4 months, 6-18 months, and 4-6 years of age.It is important to follow the recommended vaccination schedule to ensure that your child is fully protected against these serious diseases. If you have any concerns about the recommended vaccines or the vaccination schedule, you should discuss them with your healthcare provider.It is not appropriate for me to provide information about the cost of specific vaccines, as the cost can vary depending on a number of factors, including where you live and the specific vaccine being used. You should discuss the cost of the vaccines with your healthcare provider or pharmacist.

answer: It sounds like you have undergone a follicular study, which is a test that tracks the development of the follicles in the ovaries. The follicles contain the eggs that are released during ovulation. It appears that your right ovary is smaller than your left ovary, and there is no fluid present in your uterus.Polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) is a common cause of irregular menstrual cycles and difficulty conceiving. It is characterized by the presence of multiple small cysts on the ovaries and an imbalance of hormones, including high levels of androgens (male hormones) and insulin. PCOS can lead to problems with ovulation, as well as other reproductive and metabolic issues.It's important to discuss your fertility concerns and the results of your follicular study with your healthcare provider. They can provide more information about your specific situation and recommend appropriate treatment options. This may include lifestyle changes, medications, or assisted reproductive technologies such as in vitro fertilization (IVF). question: My 6 years old son cannot seem to make it to the toilethi doctor, my son is almost 6 years old. He can't seem to make it to the toilet, sometimes he has accidents, but his pants are always wet. We have tried special medicine from our GP, not drinking after 6. answer: It's completely normal for young children to have accidents and difficulty with toilet training. It's important to be patient and understanding as your child is still learning and developing the skills needed for toilet training. Here are a few things you can try to help your child with toilet training:Encourage your child to use the toilet frequently: Encourage your child to try sitting on the toilet every hour or so, even if they don't feel the urge to go. This can help them get used to the routine and establish good habits.Use positive reinforcement: Praise your child for making an effort to use the toilet, even if they have an accident. This can help build their confidence and encourage them to keep trying.Make it fun: You can make toilet training more enjoyable for your child by letting them pick out their own special toilet seat or by giving them stickers or small rewards for successfully using the toilet.Keep the process relaxed: Avoid pressuring your child or making them feel like they are being punished for having accidents. This can increase their anxiety and make the process more difficult.Seek medical advice: If your child is experiencing frequent accidents or discomfort while using the toilet, it's important to consult with a healthcare professional. They can help identify any potential medical issues that may be contributing to the problem.It's important to be patient and understand that toilet training can take time. Every child is different and it's normal for it to take longer for some children to master this skill.

question: Is it normal to have intrusive thoughts?hello.i have been getting some intruisive thoughts since 2 monthsfirst it was only thoughts but when i started accepting and feeling comfortable with those thoughts .then suddenly again one day i became hyperaware about swallowing my saliva,then breathe then blinking.though now it is more comfortable than before.i used to have panic attacks before but now it is just a little frustration.i wanted to know if this is ocd or some other mental health issue?
answer: Intrusive thoughts are a common experience, and it is normal to have them from time to time. However, if you are having intrusive thoughts frequently and they are causing you distress or interfering with your daily life, it is possible that you may be experiencing obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) or another mental health condition.OCD is a type of anxiety disorder that is characterized by repetitive and distressing thoughts, images, or urges (called obsessions) and behaviors or mental acts (called compulsions) that an individual feels driven to perform in response to these obsessions. Obsessions and compulsions can take many forms and can vary from person to person.It is important to note that having intrusive thoughts does not necessarily mean that you have OCD or any other mental health condition. However, if you are concerned about your thoughts or are experiencing significant distress, it is important to seek help from a mental health professional. They can assess your symptoms and provide you with a diagnosis and treatment plan if necessary.

question: What causes narrowing of bile duct inspite of ERCP?have a bile duct stucture a result of gall blader surgery.  I have had 10 ERCP done to strech the bile duct, it continues to narrows. what is the min. size it could be. I'm trierd of getting these ERCP's done and i have had some complaction with there procedurs
answer: There are several potential causes of narrowing of the bile duct following gallbladder surgery or after endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography (ERCP). These may include scarring or inflammation of the bile duct, abnormal growths or tumors, or the formation of stones or other debris within the bile duct. In some cases, the bile duct may be naturally narrow or have a congenital abnormality that makes it prone to narrowing.It is not uncommon for the bile duct to narrow following ERCP, especially if the procedure was performed to remove stones or other debris from the duct. The bile duct may also narrow as a result of inflammation or scarring that occurs during the procedure. In some cases, the bile duct may narrow due to the formation of new stones or debris following the procedure.The minimum size of the bile duct that is considered normal can vary, but in general, the bile duct should be at least 6-8 mm in diameter. If the bile duct becomes significantly narrower than this, it may be difficult for bile to flow through the duct properly, which can lead to a range of symptoms and complications.If you are experiencing complications or are tired of undergoing ERCP procedures, it is important to speak with your doctor about your concerns and discuss alternative treatment options. Your doctor will be able to provide you with more information about the specific cause of your bile duct narrowing and recommend the most appropriate course of treatment.

I still believe there something to be wrong, any advice would be appreciated.
answer: It's possible that you have a wrist sprain or strain, or even a ligament injury, if you're experiencing pain and difficulty moving your wrist after an injury. Sprains and strains occur when the ligaments or muscles in the wrist are stretched or torn, and they can be quite painful. Ligament injuries can also cause pain and difficulty moving the wrist. It's important to see a doctor or a physical therapist for an accurate diagnosis and treatment plan. They may recommend rest, ice, and over-the-counter pain medication to help reduce inflammation and pain. They may also recommend physical therapy exercises to help improve strength and mobility in the wrist. If the pain persists or becomes worse, it's important to follow up with a medical professional for further evaluation and treatment.

question: Diagnosed with bicornuate uterus by color doppler scan. Will I be able to conceive?Hi, I am married since 1 year. I am diagnosed with bicornuate uterus (with single cervix ) by color doppler scan by the gynecologist? I have not get conceived yet. Is there any difficulties to get conceive with bicornuate uterus? What will I do to get conceive? What are the treatment plans available to treat this?
answer: Hi! A bicornuate uterus may be an incidental finding alone, and may or may not have an impact on fertility, though the chance of miscarriage can be increased. No surgery should be done for a bicornuate uterus unless there is a history of recurrent miscarriage or there is some other strong clinical indication for surgery.

question: Diagnosed with bicornuate uterus by color doppler scan. Will I be able to conceive?Hi, I am married since 1 year. I am diagnosed with bicornuate uterus (with single cervix ) by color doppler scan by the gynecologist? I have not get conceived yet. Is there any difficulties to get conceive with bicornuate uterus? What will I do to get conceive? What are the treatment plans available to treat this?
answer: A bicornuate uterus, also known as a heart-shaped uterus, is a type of uterine abnormality that can affect fertility and pregnancy. It is characterized by a uterus that has two horn-like structures rather than a single, pear-shaped structure. While it is possible for people with a bicornuate uterus to become pregnant, they may have a higher risk of miscarriage, preterm labor, and other complications during pregnancy.If you are trying to conceive and have a bicornuate uterus, it is important to discuss your options with a fertility specialist or obstetrician. They can help you understand your fertility potential and recommend the best course of treatment for your situation. Treatment options may include medications to help regulate your menstrual cycle and improve the chances of pregnancy, or surgery to repair or correct the shape of the uterus.It is also important to follow a healthy lifestyle, including eating a nutritious diet, getting regular exercise, and managing stress, as these can all contribute to your overall fertility and pregnancy health. If you have any concerns about your fertility or pregnancy, it is important to speak with a healthcare provider who can help you understand your options and provide the support and guidance you need.

question: Is there any medicine in Ayurveda to completely cure nephrotic syndrome?Is there any medicine for nefrotics syndrome in ayurveda to cure it comletely? can it reoccur again? My child 2.5 years now was suffering from this syndrome last year. was cured that time. But there are chances for relapse & no medicine in allopathy which can rule out the same in allopathy. So I wanted to know that is there anything in ayurvedy or homeopathy to rule out the same completely My mail id is YYYY@YYYY
answer: Nephrotic syndrome is a medical condition that affects the kidneys and can cause protein to leak from the kidneys into the urine. It can be caused by a variety of underlying conditions, such as kidney damage, inflammation, or immune system disorders.In Ayurveda, nephrotic syndrome is known as "Mutraghata" and is believed to be caused by an imbalance of the three doshas (vata, pitta, and kapha) in the body. Ayurvedic treatment for nephrotic syndrome typically involves the use of herbs, dietary changes, and lifestyle modifications to address the underlying imbalances and support kidney function. Some common herbs used in Ayurvedic treatment of nephrotic syndrome include Gokshura, Varun, Punarnava, and Shirish.It is important to note that Ayurvedic treatment is not a substitute for conventional medical treatment and should be used in conjunction with, not instead of, standard medical care. If your child has been diagnosed with nephrotic syndrome, it is important to work closely with a qualified healthcare provider to determine the best course of treatment.As for the question of whether nephrotic syndrome can be completely cured, the answer is not straightforward. In some cases, nephrotic syndrome can be effectively managed and the symptoms controlled with appropriate treatment. However, in other cases, the condition may recur or persist despite treatment. The likelihood of a complete cure and the risk of relapse can depend on a variety of factors, including the underlying cause of the condition, the severity of the kidney damage, and the individual's response to treatment.It is important to work closely with your healthcare provider to determine the most appropriate treatment plan for your child and to monitor their progress. If you have any concerns or questions about your child's condition or treatment, it is important to discuss them with your healthcare provider.

However, even with a severely leaking valve, it is possible for someone to live for many years with proper medical treatment and management of the condition.It is also important to note that the prognosis for someone with two leaking heart valves may be different than for someone with only one leaking valve, as the presence of multiple leaking valves may increase the risk of complications and affect the person's overall health.It is important for someone with a leaking heart valve to work closely with their healthcare team to identify the best treatment options and to manage their condition effectively. question: Could coughing, vomiting and dry throat be an aftermath of accident?I was in a car accident yesterday, someone hit us from behind, I think I have whiplash as my shoulders and neck are sore, but what s worrying me is directly after the accident I started coughing and I still am...it has gotten so bad, I ve vomited and my throat is now raw. Is this a result of the accident or just a coincidence?
answer: It is possible that coughing, vomiting, and a dry throat could be symptoms related to a car accident. Whiplash, which is a common injury sustained in a car accident, can cause muscle spasms in the neck and shoulders, leading to coughing. Vomiting can also be a symptom of whiplash, as well as a result of stress or anxiety related to the accident. A dry throat can be caused by a number of things, including dehydration or difficulty swallowing due to muscle spasms or pain.It is important to seek medical attention if you are experiencing these symptoms after a car accident. It is possible that you may have sustained other injuries that need to be treated, and a medical professional will be able to assess your condition and provide the necessary care. In the meantime, you can try to alleviate your symptoms by drinking plenty of fluids and taking over-the-counter pain medication as recommended by a pharmacist or medical professional.

question: What causes lump near groin?I have a lump near my groin. It seems to be a swollen lymph node but it s also showing signs of being a hernia. Is there any way I can figure it which one it may be before going to the doctor, if needed. And if it is a lymph node, will things like straining, masturbation, or further irritation make it worse?
answer: Lumps near the groin can have a variety of causes, including swollen lymph nodes, hernias, and other conditions. It is important to have any new lump or growth checked by a healthcare provider in order to determine the cause and appropriate treatment.Swollen lymph nodes are a common cause of lumps in the groin area. Lymph nodes are part of the immune system and can become swollen in response to infection or inflammation. Straining, masturbation, and irritation are not likely to cause swollen lymph nodes, but certain activities such as heavy lifting or straining to have a bowel movement could potentially cause a hernia.A hernia is a protrusion of an organ or tissue through a weak point in the muscle or surrounding tissue. In some cases, a hernia may be accompanied by discomfort or pain, especially when coughing, laughing, or lifting heavy objects.It is not possible to determine the cause of a lump without a medical evaluation. If you are concerned about a lump near your groin, it is important to see a healthcare provider for an examination and proper diagnosis. They can determine the cause of the lump and recommend appropriate treatment.

question: What causes pink vaginal spotting during pregnancy while having uterine septum?I am 8 weeks pregnant and I have started spotting. It is light and pinkish red in color. I have a uterine septum as well. I had an ultra sound this past Friday and she said everything looked ok. Should I go to the ER or can I wait to see my Dr. tomorrow?
answer: Vaginal spotting or bleeding during pregnancy can be caused by a variety of factors and can be concerning. It is important to speak with a healthcare provider as soon as possible if you are experiencing bleeding during pregnancy, especially if you have a uterine septum or any other underlying medical condition.A uterine septum is a congenital abnormality in which the uterus is divided into two separate cavities by a wall of tissue. This can cause problems with fertility and pregnancy, and may increase the risk of complications such as miscarriage, preterm labor, or placental abnormalities.If you are experiencing pink vaginal spotting during pregnancy and have a uterine septum, it is important to speak with your healthcare provider as soon as possible. They can evaluate the cause of the bleeding and advise you on the best course of action. If you are unable to reach your healthcare provider, or if the bleeding is heavy or accompanied by severe abdominal pain or cramping, it may be necessary to go to the emergency room for further evaluation and treatment.

question: Suffering from fatty liver, highs triglycerides. Taking Rosav and Liv tablets. Suggest diet?I am sufferring from fatty liver,highs triglycerides. .tell me d rite healthy diet so I can cure these things in short period of time..my s triglyceride level is 288..even i am taking rosave f 10 after dinner..anď taking liv 52 tablet....I m taking green tea for atleat 4 cups a day..and drinking water around 12 to 14 glasses
answer: Fatty liver and high triglycerides can be improved through lifestyle changes, including diet. Here are some dietary recommendations that may help:Eat plenty of fruits and vegetables: Aim for at least 5 servings of fruits and vegetables per day. These are high in fiber, vitamins, and minerals and can help lower triglycerides.Choose lean proteins: Choose lean proteins such as chicken, turkey, fish, and plant-based proteins like beans and tofu. Avoid high-fat meats such as bacon, sausage, and beef.Limit refined carbs: Refined carbs like white bread, pasta, and sugar-sweetened beverages can raise triglycerides. Instead, choose whole grains such as whole wheat bread, quinoa, and brown rice.Reduce saturated and trans fats: Saturated and trans fats can raise triglycerides. Avoid fried foods, fast food, and processed snacks, and choose healthier fats such as olive oil, avocado, and nuts.Eat moderate amounts of healthy fats: Healthy fats such as monounsaturated and polyunsaturated fats can help lower triglycerides. These can be found in foods like olive oil, nuts, and fatty fish like salmon.Limit alcohol: Alcohol can raise triglycerides, so it's important to limit your intake or avoid it altogether.It's also important to speak with your healthcare provider about your diet and any recommended changes. They can provide personalized guidance based on your specific needs and medical history.

question: Suggest treatment for neck stretchesI have neck pains that make sleeping difficult. It is very difficult getting the right position to balance the neck o avoid pains. This pain is from the back of the neck and when seated and I bend the head forward, I could feel the muscles stretching which is painful. Bending the neck side ways also bring on a measure of pain that sometimes shoot to the back side of the shoulders.
answer: There are several treatment options that you can try for neck stretches to help relieve your neck pain and improve your sleep. Here are a few suggestions:Over-the-counter pain medication: Taking over-the-counter pain medication such as ibuprofen or acetaminophen can help reduce inflammation and relieve pain.Heat or cold therapy: Applying heat or cold to your neck can help reduce inflammation and alleviate pain. You can use a heating pad, hot water bottle, or a warm towel to apply heat to your neck, or try using a cold pack or ice wrapped in a towel to apply cold to your neck.Stretching and strengthening exercises: Gentle stretches and neck strengthening exercises can help improve the flexibility and strength of your neck muscles, which can help reduce pain. Some examples of neck stretches include:Neck tilt: Tilt your head slowly to the right, then to the left, and then back to the center.Neck rotation: Slowly turn your head to the right, then to the left, and then back to the center.Neck side bend: Slowly bend your head to the right, then to the left, and then back to the center.Chiropractic care: Chiropractic care involves manual adjustments of the spine and neck to improve alignment and relieve pain.Massage therapy: Massage therapy can help relax tense muscles and improve circulation, which can help reduce pain and improve sleep.It's important to note that neck pain can be caused by a variety of factors, so it's always a good idea to consult with a healthcare professional to determine the cause of your pain and the most appropriate treatment.

question: Q. Can we opt growth hormone to increase the height?Hello doctor,My son is 5'6 in height. He is 17 years old and wants to be taller. We want to try growth hormone. Is this possible? Kindly suggest the treatment.
answer: Hello. Well, but it depends on many factors such as the mid-parental height, ethnicity, nutritional status, etc. Since he is below the third percentile for age for boys for height, I would suggest a proper work-up to rule out hormonal deficiencies such as, 1. Thyroid function test. 2. IGF-1 (insluin-growth fractor) and IGFBP-3 (insulin-like growth fractor binding protein). 3. LH (leutinizing hormone) and FSH (follicle stimulating hormone) routine tests like CBC (complete blood count), ESR (erythrocyte sedimentation arte). 4. Liver function test. 5. Renal function test.6. Urinalysis, and X-ray of left hand and wrist. If the hormone analysis comes out abnormal or in other words, there is a deficiency of any of the above hormones, and then I would suggest MRI pituitary gland. Because short constitutional stature is not a disorder but a variation in normal growth, therefore, medical treatment is not usually necessary.So I would not suggest any hormonal treatment as it will not benefit him at this age as his bones have matured by now. Although some studies do suggest the use of testosterone injections or patches to achieve growth and sexual maturation if necessary. Growth hormone is not recommended if any of the above tests turn out to be normal as it is associated with a lot of adverse effects. I hope my advice is of some benefit to you.

question: Q. Can we opt growth hormone to increase the height?Hello doctor,My son is 5'6 in height. He is 17 years old and wants to be taller. We want to try growth hormone. Is this possible? Kindly suggest the treatment.
answer: Growth hormone (GH) is a hormone produced by the pituitary gland that plays a role in growth and development. While GH can help to stimulate growth in children and adolescents, it is generally not effective for increasing adult height.Human growth hormone is usually prescribed for children and adolescents who are growth hormone deficient, or who have certain other medical conditions that affect growth. It is not usually prescribed for the purpose of increasing adult height.If your son is interested in increasing his height, it is important to first determine the cause of his current height. There are several factors that can affect growth and development, including genetics, nutrition, and medical conditions. If your son's height is within the normal range for his age and there are no underlying medical conditions that may be affecting his growth, it is unlikely that growth hormone treatment will be effective in increasing his height.It is important to speak with a healthcare provider about your son's concerns about his height and any treatment options that may be appropriate. The healthcare provider will be able to assess your son's medical history and overall health, and provide recommendations based on his individual needs.

question: Q. Why was the period has been very light after abortion ?Hi doctor,I am 26 years old. I had an abortion 6 months ago using the suction method. Since then, my period has been very light and lasts only a day. I had an abortion earlier too using the same method and did not experience anything as such. What could be the problem? What do you advise for this?
answer: Hi. The symptoms you described indicate that it is due to either estrogen deficiency or a condition called Asherman's syndrome (adhesion or fibrosis of the endometrium after dilation and curettage). Though this is uncommon after an abortion by suction method, it is usually seen when abortions are done with metal instruments and done very vigorously. This results in adhesions in the inner uterine lining which result in less blood flow during the period. This could be either due to stress or mental anxiety. Try a hysteroscopy to diagnose Asherman's syndrome. It will not be diagnosed with an ultrasound. For further information consult an obstetrician and gynaecologist online --> https://www.icliniq.com/ask-a-doctor-online/obstetrician-and-gynaecologist

question: Q. Why was the period has been very light after abortion ?Hi doctor,I am 26 years old. I had an abortion 6 months ago using the suction method. Since then, my period has been very light and lasts only a day. I had an abortion earlier too using the same method and did not experience anything as such. What could be the problem? What do you advise for this?
answer: It is not uncommon for the menstrual cycle to be irregular after an abortion, especially in the first few cycles. However, if your periods continue to be very light and last only one day for an extended period of time, it is important to speak with a healthcare provider. There could be various reasons for this change in your menstrual cycle, such as hormonal imbalances, certain medications, or underlying health conditions.It is also possible that the abortion itself may have caused damage to the uterus or cervix, which could affect the menstrual cycle. It is important to rule out any underlying causes and address any potential health concerns.I recommend speaking with a healthcare provider to discuss your concerns and undergo any necessary evaluations. They can assess your overall health and determine the cause of the change in your menstrual cycle. They can also provide you with recommendations for treatment or management, if necessary. It is important to take care of your reproductive health and address any concerns you may have.

question: Why do I experience bloating and stomach pains after having alcoholic beverages ?I have days of bloating and stomach pains & discomfort after drinking a can of soda pop or a glass of wine or alcoholic beverage. Why does this occur?
answer: There are several possible reasons why you might experience bloating and stomach pain after consuming alcoholic beverages. Some of the most common causes include:Alcohol can irritate the lining of the stomach and intestines, leading to inflammation and pain.Alcohol can stimulate the production of acid in the stomach, which can cause heartburn and other types of digestive discomfort.Alcohol can interfere with the absorption of nutrients from food, which can lead to bloating and other digestive symptoms.Alcohol can also interfere with the normal functioning of the digestive system, leading to changes in bowel movements and abdominal discomfort.Finally, alcohol can have a diuretic effect, which can lead to dehydration and bloating.It's worth noting that different people may have different reactions to alcohol, and that some people may be more sensitive to its effects on the digestive system than others. If you're experiencing persistent bloating and stomach pain after consuming alcohol, it's a good idea to speak with a healthcare provider to determine the cause and receive appropriate treatment.

question: What causes soreness on the thigh muscles?I woke up this morning with muscle soreness in both thighs and both biceps and it s not from exercising. I m on warfarin (4 mg/day) due to previous DVT in left leg (clotted from groin to ankle in 2002, Greenfield vena cava filter present). Also take 40 mg/day simvastatin and 250 mg/day metformin. Thanks, YYYY@YYYY
answer: There are several possible causes of muscle soreness in the thighs. Some common causes include:Overuse: If you have recently increased the intensity or duration of your physical activity, it is possible that you are experiencing muscle soreness as a result of overuse. This type of muscle soreness is known as "delayed onset muscle soreness" (DOMS) and is a normal response to increased physical activity. It usually occurs a day or two after the activity and can last for a few days.Inactivity: If you have been inactive for an extended period of time and then suddenly engage in physical activity, you may also experience muscle soreness. This is because your muscles are not used to the activity and need time to adjust.Poor posture: Poor posture can put additional strain on your muscles, leading to soreness. For example, if you sit in a chair all day with poor posture, your leg muscles may become sore.Medical conditions: Certain medical conditions, such as fibromyalgia and rheumatoid arthritis, can cause muscle soreness. It is also possible that your muscle soreness could be related to your warfarin treatment or other medications.If your muscle soreness is persistent or severe, it is a good idea to consult with a healthcare provider for further evaluation and guidance. They can help determine the cause of your muscle soreness and suggest appropriate treatment options.

question: What causes muscle spasms, chills and deep breaths?my wife just had an attck type of muscle spasm and chills. she was basically immobilized for about 10 minutes. i wrapped her up in blankets and she started taking some deep long breaths and it subsided after 10=15 minutes. any idea what this might be?
answer: Muscle spasms, chills, and deep breaths can have a variety of causes. question: What course of treatment should be done for multiple myeloma and bone metastases?my husband has been diagnosed with multiple myeloma and bone metastases. Aventyl and Ketoralac are making him extremely tired while he waits for his bone marrow biopsy results and start of treatment.
answer: Multiple myeloma is a cancer of the plasma cells, which are a type of immune cell found in the bone marrow. It often causes bone lesions, or areas of abnormal bone growth, and can also lead to bone fractures and pain. The treatment of multiple myeloma and bone metastases typically involves a combination of approaches, including chemotherapy, radiation therapy, and medications to strengthen bones and control pain.The specific treatment plan for multiple myeloma will depend on a number of factors, including the stage of the disease, the patient's overall health, and the presence of any other medical conditions. Some common treatment options for multiple myeloma and bone metastases include:Chemotherapy: Chemotherapy involves the use of drugs to kill cancer cells. These drugs may be given orally or intravenously (through a vein) and can be used alone or in combination with other treatments.Radiation therapy: This treatment uses high-energy beams of radiation to kill cancer cells. It is often used to treat bone lesions and may be used in combination with chemotherapy or other treatments.Bone-strengthening medications: These medications, such as bisphosphonates, can help reduce the risk of bone fractures and improve bone density in patients with multiple myeloma.Pain medications: Patients with multiple myeloma and bone metastases may experience pain due to bone lesions or fractures. Pain medications, such as nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) or opioids, can be used to manage pain.It's important to discuss all treatment options and their potential side effects with your healthcare team. They can help you determine the best course of treatment for your specific situation.

question: Suggest treatment for small blood clots in the lungsI just got discharged today I had a DVT and they also found small clots in my lungs and signs of past small clots that have gone through my lungs. I smoke marijuana and was wondering if it would be a bad to try to use marijuana as a pain killer instead of percocets at this point?
answer: It is not recommended to use marijuana as a treatment for blood clots in the lungs. Blood clots in the lungs, also known as pulmonary embolisms, can be a serious and potentially life-threatening condition. Treatment usually involves anticoagulant medications, which help to prevent new clots from forming and allow existing clots to dissolve. In some cases, other treatments such as thrombolytics (medications that break up blood clots) or mechanical thrombectomy (a procedure that removes blood clots using specialized equipment) may be necessary.It is important to follow your healthcare provider's recommendations for treatment and to take all prescribed medications as directed. It is also important to follow a healthy lifestyle, including not smoking and avoiding substances that could increase your risk of blood clots or interfere with your treatment. If you are currently using marijuana, you should discuss this with your healthcare provider to determine whether it is safe for you to continue doing so.

question: What causes elevated GGT level in blood?HiDoes protein powder increases GGT level? I scored a GGT level score of 113 after getting diagnosed with a viral infection. When i took the blood test I was on Augmentin antibiotic (twice per day). I had taken 4 pills by the time of the test. What usually increases GGT level? Please advise Thanks
answer: Elevated gamma-glutamyl transpeptidase (GGT) levels in the blood can be caused by various factors, including liver disease, bile duct obstruction, and certain medications. Alcohol consumption can also cause an increase in GGT levels. It is not clear whether protein powder can increase GGT levels.It is possible that the viral infection and the Augmentin antibiotic that you were taking at the time of the blood test may have contributed to the elevated GGT level. Antibiotics, particularly those that are metabolized by the liver, can sometimes cause liver enzymes, including GGT, to become elevated. However, it is important to note that a single elevated GGT level may not necessarily indicate a health problem. Further testing and evaluation by a healthcare professional is needed to determine the cause of the elevated GGT level and to determine the appropriate treatment, if necessary.

question: How is seizure disorder treated and which hospital can I get treatment from ?i am suffring from sezier disorder (NCC). HOW COULD I GET TREETMENT FROM YOUR HOSPITAL
answer: Seizure disorder, also known as epilepsy, is a neurological condition that causes seizures. Seizures are sudden, uncontrolled electrical disturbances in the brain that can cause a range of symptoms, including convulsions, loss of consciousness, and changes in behavior.Treatment for seizure disorder typically involves medications called antiepileptic drugs, which can help reduce the frequency and severity of seizures. In some cases, surgery may be recommended to remove the part of the brain that is causing the seizures. Other treatment options may include dietary changes, such as following a ketogenic diet, or vagus nerve stimulation, which involves the use of a device to stimulate the vagus nerve in the neck.It is important to work with a healthcare professional to determine the most appropriate treatment for your specific situation. You can find a hospital or healthcare provider by searching online or contacting your insurance company for a list of in-network providers. It is also a good idea to speak with your primary care doctor or a specialist, such as a neurologist, for recommendations on where to seek treatment.

question: How can an infected cat scratch wound be treated?My cat scratched my big toe last Friday, between the nail and the quick. By the next morning it was infected. I ve been soaking it and treating it as best I can, but it doesn t seem to be healing. Today I noticed that it s starting to feel kind of tingly and numb. What should I do?
answer: It's important to seek medical attention if you think you have an infected cat scratch wound. Cat scratch disease is caused by bacteria called Bartonella henselae, which is found in the saliva of infected cats. The bacteria can be transmitted through a scratch or a bite from an infected cat. Symptoms of cat scratch disease may include swelling, redness, and pain at the site of the scratch, as well as fever, fatigue, and swollen lymph nodes.To treat an infected cat scratch wound, you should:Clean the wound thoroughly with soap and water to remove any dirt or debris.Apply an antibiotic ointment or cream to the wound to help prevent infection.Keep the wound covered with a sterile bandage to protect it from further infection.Take over-the-counter pain medication, such as acetaminophen or ibuprofen, to help reduce pain and swelling.If the infection does not improve after a few days of home treatment, or if the symptoms are severe, you should see a doctor. Your doctor may prescribe antibiotics to help clear the infection.If you are experiencing numbness or tingling in your toe, you should see a doctor as soon as possible. Numbness and tingling can be a sign of nerve damage, which can be serious if left untreated.

question: Suggest treatment for pain in the sinuses and earI have had ear ache for a few weeks now and have had a course of amoxicillin which didn t help. My GP thinks it is all sinus related as I have sinus pain, and swollen glands and sore throat (all on the same side - right). How can I relieve the symptoms and how long might they go on for?
answer: There are several things you can try to relieve the symptoms of sinus and ear pain:Over-the-counter pain relievers: You can take acetaminophen (Tylenol) or ibuprofen (Advil) to help manage the pain.Nasal decongestants: These can help to reduce swelling in the nasal passages and make it easier to breathe. In most cases, sinus and ear pain will resolve on their own within a week or two. If your symptoms persist for longer than that, or if you have a fever, severe headache, or difficulty breathing, you should contact your healthcare provider for further evaluation and treatment.
