question: How can cough and cold be treated during a pregnancy?Last week i took pregnancy test it came positive and my last periods   started  at 25 of September and i have cough and cold i went to physician  he did not gave me any medicine what should i do iam not able to sleep and cough is horrible does it will stop me to become pregnant
answer: Cough and cold during pregnancy can be treated with rest, fluids, and over-the-counter cold and cough medications that are safe to use during pregnancy. It is important to consult with your healthcare provider before taking any medication during pregnancy, as some medications may not be safe to use during this time.Your healthcare provider may recommend the following measures to help alleviate your symptoms:Get plenty of rest: Try to get as much rest as possible, as this can help your body fight off the infection and allow you to recover more quickly.Drink fluids: Make sure to drink plenty of fluids, such as water, juice, and broth, to help thin out mucus and keep your throat moist.Use a humidifier: Using a humidifier in your room can help to keep the air moist, which can help to soothe a sore throat and reduce coughing.Try over-the-counter medications: There are several over-the-counter medications that are considered safe to use during pregnancy, such as acetaminophen (Tylenol) for pain and fever, and saline nasal spray to help clear congestion. However, it is important to consult with your healthcare provider before taking any medication, as some medications may not be safe to use during pregnancy.Try home remedies: Some home remedies that may help to alleviate your symptoms include gargling with warm salt water, using a vaporizer or hot shower to help clear congestion, and using a saline nasal spray to help clear your nasal passages.It is important to follow the advice of your healthcare provider and to get plenty of rest, drink fluids, and take any prescribed medications as directed. If your symptoms persist or worsen, be sure to contact your healthcare provider for further evaluation and treatment.

question: Why my wife's HGA1C is 11.4 and her BS is > 400?My wife is 16 months post surgical removal of pancreas and spleen due to diagnosis of Pancreatic cancer. She has had clead PET/CT and was not having to take insulin. Now her HGA1C is 11.4 and her BS is > 400.  Is this suspicious for cancer coming back or just the remaining portion of Pancreas shutting down? Notes she had a clean margins when the pancreas was removed and did not have a whipple.
answer: Since you said her PET CT is normal, there is no cancer recurrence. High HB A1C indicates poor control of blood sugars. That means her antidiabetic medication is not proper. It has nothing to do with cancer recurrence

question: Why my wife's HGA1C is 11.4 and her BS is > 400?My wife is 16 months post surgical removal of pancreas and spleen due to diagnosis of Pancreatic cancer. She has had clead PET/CT and was not having to take insulin. Now her HGA1C is 11.4 and her BS is > 400.  Is this suspicious for cancer coming back or just the remaining portion of Pancreas shutting down? Notes she had a clean margins when the pancreas was removed and did not have a whipple.
answer: It is possible that your wife's high HbA1c (a measure of blood sugar control over the past 2-3 months) and high blood sugar levels could be due to the remaining portion of the pancreas not functioning properly. The pancreas plays a key role in regulating blood sugar levels by producing the hormone insulin, which helps the body use glucose (a type of sugar) for energy. If the pancreas is not functioning properly or has been removed, it can lead to high blood sugar levels.However, it is also possible that these high blood sugar levels could be due to a recurrence of pancreatic cancer. Pancreatic cancer can sometimes cause the production of substances called tumour markers, which can lead to high blood sugar levels. It is important for your wife to speak with her healthcare team about her high blood sugar levels and discuss any potential underlying causes and treatment options. They will be able to assess her individual situation and provide appropriate medical guidance.

question: Have PCOD. Follicular study done. What are my chances of getting pregnant?hi Doctor, hello Dr, I am 24yrs married lady.and i have a PCOD issue my doc has suggested me to do the follicular study and today is my 14th DAY and f1 is 21m and f2 14 and end thick is 7mm i wanted to know wht is changes of me getting pregnant and if the size is 7mm is there any issue . and wht precaution should i take.
answer: It is difficult to determine the chances of getting pregnant based on the information provided. The size of the follicles, as measured by a follicular study, can be one factor that affects fertility, but it is not the only factor. Other factors that can affect fertility include the quality and quantity of the eggs, the thickness of the uterine lining, and the presence of any underlying medical conditions such as endometriosis or uterine fibroids.If you are trying to get pregnant and have been diagnosed with PCOS (polycystic ovary syndrome), it is important to work closely with your healthcare provider to manage your condition and improve your chances of conceiving. This may involve a combination of lifestyle changes (such as diet and exercise), medication, and other treatments. It is also important to follow your healthcare provider's recommendations for monitoring your fertility and planning for pregnancy.If you are concerned about the size of your follicles or any other aspect of your fertility, it is important to discuss your concerns with your healthcare provider. They can provide you with more information and guidance on the best course of action for you.

question: Constipation in 18 months old babyhi my son had conastpation from 1 year he is 18 month
answer: Constipation is a common issue in infants and young children, and it can be caused by a variety of factors such as a change in diet, lack of physical activity, or underlying medical conditions. If your 18-month-old child is experiencing constipation, here are a few things you can try:Encourage your child to drink plenty of fluids, especially water. Water can help to soften stools and make them easier to pass.Offer your child foods that are high in fiber, such as fruits, vegetables, and whole grains. These can help to bulk up the stools and make them easier to pass.Encourage your child to be physically active. Exercise can help to stimulate the bowel and promote regular bowel movements.If your child is formula-fed, you may want to try a different type of formula. Some formulas can be constipating, while others may be easier on the digestive system.Talk to your child's healthcare provider about using a gentle stool softener or other medication to help alleviate constipation.It's important to note that if your child is experiencing severe constipation, prolonged abdominal pain, or bloody stools, you should contact their healthcare provider right away.

It's important to speak with a healthcare provider about your options for managing your PCOS and regulating your menstrual cycle.The total fertility supplement you mentioned may not be appropriate for you, as it is marketed as a supplement to support fertility in women trying to conceive. If your goal is to regulate your menstrual cycle, you may want to discuss other options with your healthcare provider.There are a variety of treatment options available for managing PCOS and regulating menstrual cycles. These may include birth control pills, other types of hormonal contraceptives, and medications to regulate insulin levels or androgens (male hormones). Your healthcare provider can help you determine the best treatment option for you based on your specific needs and goals.It's also important to note that lifestyle changes, such as maintaining a healthy weight and engaging in regular physical activity, can also help manage PCOS and regulate menstrual cycles. question: Is elevated PSA level symptom of cancer?HI I recently finished a 21 day course of cipro for an elevated psa of 4.46 which was discovered in May. The end result was an increase of my psa to over 5. I might add that I am 66 years old and less than a year ago my count was 2.9. I am to have a biopsy done in one weeks time. Does this signal that I have cancer?
answer: High PSA levels can also be due conditions other than prostate cancer like : prostatitis,  enlarged prostate, etc. Clinical examination and imaging studies like Ultrasound may be advised to pinpoint the cause along with biopsy. Examination of tissue under the microscope is always the definitive diagnosis of prostate cancer.

question: Is elevated PSA level symptom of cancer?HI I recently finished a 21 day course of cipro for an elevated psa of 4.46 which was discovered in May. The end result was an increase of my psa to over 5. I might add that I am 66 years old and less than a year ago my count was 2.9. I am to have a biopsy done in one weeks time. Does this signal that I have cancer?
answer: An elevated PSA level can be a symptom of cancer, but it is not necessarily a definitive indicator. PSA stands for prostate-specific antigen, and it is a protein produced by cells in the prostate gland. The PSA test measures the level of PSA in the blood.Elevated PSA levels can be caused by a variety of factors, including prostate cancer, an enlarged prostate (also known as benign prostatic hyperplasia), prostatitis (inflammation of the prostate), and even certain medications. It is important to keep in mind that having an elevated PSA level does not necessarily mean that you have cancer.It is important to undergo further testing, such as a prostate biopsy, to determine the cause of an elevated PSA level. During a prostate biopsy, a small tissue sample is taken from the prostate and examined under a microscope to check for cancer cells.It is also important to discuss your concerns and any symptoms you may be experiencing with your healthcare provider. They will be able to provide you with more information and guidance on your specific situation.

question: Diagnosed with renal colic, have a sedentary working style. Best remedy and preventive measures?I am a 31-year-old male, sedentary worker diagnosed with renal colic a month ago. What is the best remedy for renal colic and how to take preventive measures?
answer: Hi there. I will do my best to help you. The prevention of kidney stone is a complex subject and there is loads of good information on this on the Internet. I would recommend the Mayo Clinic's web site as an excellent place to start. Also, you need to discuss this with you own doctor or urologist. This has to be determined. Most stones are calcium based. Dietary restrictions in calcium is however no longer recommended. This is because it does not seem to work and, in any case, calcium is an important mineral for proper bodily functioning. Some stones are composed of uric acid in which case allopurinol, to lower uric acid levels, may be prescribed. All recurrence rate of all stones can be reduced by increasing daily fluid intake. The cheapest way to achieve this is by drinking lots of water. The aim should be to increase fluid intake to the point where you are passing at least four pints of urine every day. If you have anymore questions please contact me again anytime. Dr Andrew Rynne. www.doctorrynne.com

question: Diagnosed with renal colic, have a sedentary working style. Best remedy and preventive measures?I am a 31-year-old male, sedentary worker diagnosed with renal colic a month ago. What is the best remedy for renal colic and how to take preventive measures?
answer: Renal colic is a type of abdominal pain that occurs when a kidney stone passes through the ureter, the tube that carries urine from the kidney to the bladder. The pain can be severe and may come in waves.The best remedy for renal colic is to drink plenty of fluids, especially water, to help flush the stone out of your system. Pain medications such as ibuprofen or acetaminophen can also help to relieve the pain. In some cases, your doctor may prescribe a medication to help relax the muscles in your ureter and make it easier for the stone to pass.To prevent kidney stones from forming, it is important to drink plenty of fluids, especially water, to help flush excess calcium and other substances out of your system. You should also aim to get enough calcium in your diet, but avoid taking high doses of calcium supplements, as these can increase your risk of developing kidney stones.It is also a good idea to limit your intake of sodium, as high levels of sodium in the diet can increase the risk of kidney stones. You should also aim to eat a healthy, balanced diet that is rich in fruits, vegetables, and whole grains, and avoid foods that are high in sugar, salt, and unhealthy fats.If you have a sedentary lifestyle, it is important to get regular physical activity to help prevent kidney stones. Aim for at least 30 minutes of moderate-intensity activity, such as brisk walking, most days of the week.It is also a good idea to speak with your doctor about any other lifestyle changes or treatments that may be appropriate for you, based on your specific situation.

question: Could broken condom during sex result in pregnancy?I Had Sex 8 Days Ago, & The Condom Broke While In Doggy Style Position. He Claims He Didnt Cum Because His Penis Wouldve Been On Soft As Usual As He Say. After finding Out It Broke I Immediately Put On My CLothes Then 20Mins Later Peed. I Feel Fine But Am i Pregnant?
answer: It is possible to become pregnant if a condom breaks during sex. Condoms are not 100% effective at preventing pregnancy, even when used correctly. The effectiveness of condoms at preventing pregnancy is about 82% with typical use, meaning that about 18 out of 100 people who use condoms as their only form of birth control will become pregnant over the course of one year.If the condom broke during sex and your partner ejaculated inside you, there is a chance that you could become pregnant. It is important to remember that sperm can live inside the female reproductive tract for up to five days, so pregnancy is still possible even if you had sex several days ago.If you are concerned about the possibility of pregnancy, you can take a pregnancy test or speak with a healthcare provider to find out more. Pregnancy tests are most accurate when taken at least a week after a missed period. It is also a good idea to consider using emergency contraception, such as the "morning-after pill," to help reduce the risk of pregnancy.It is important to use condoms consistently and correctly to help reduce the risk of unintended pregnancy and sexually transmitted infections (STIs). If you have had a condom break during sex, it is important to use another form of contraception, such as the pill or an IUD, and to consider getting tested for STIs.

question: What is Topiramate prescribed for?My husband is bi polar and being treated with Topiramate (topomax) I read that this is an anti-seizure medication or one used for migraines. Is this a common med prescribed for bi polar issues or is there a better one. He now has Dupuytren s Disease. I know that this is genetic; however I read that anti-seizure medication can trigger it or make it worse. Can it?
answer: Topiramate, also known as Topamax, is a medication that is primarily used to treat seizures and prevent migraines. It can also be used to treat certain types of nerve pain and to prevent binge eating in people with binge eating disorder.Topiramate has also been used off-label to treat certain psychiatric conditions, including bipolar disorder. However, it is not a first-line treatment for bipolar disorder and is typically used in combination with other medications to manage the condition.It is possible that topiramate could make Dupuytren's disease worse or trigger its development in people who are genetically predisposed to the condition. Dupuytren's disease is a condition that causes thickening and contracture of the skin and connective tissue in the hand, leading to bent fingers. It is not clear exactly what causes Dupuytren's disease, but it is thought to have a genetic component.If you have concerns about your husband's treatment with topiramate, it is important to discuss these concerns with his healthcare provider. They can assess his specific situation and determine the best course of treatment for his bipolar disorder and any other medical conditions he may have.

question: Suggest treatment for swelling in eyelids in a childI HAV 1.7 YRS OLD DAUGHTER TODAY WHEN SHE WAKE UP ,SHE COULDN T OPEN HER LEFT EYE , SEALES WITH DISCHARGE, & HAD SWELLING IN UPPER & LOWER LID & somewhat around the eye,able to wash & wipe the discharge ogg with cold water & clean cloth but what about swelling

The treatment will depend on the underlying cause of the swelling.In the meantime, you can try using a cold compress to help reduce the swelling. question: Should the tonsils be removed due to recurrent tonsillitis?hi.. i M from Manila, I just want to consult about my daughter having recurrent toncillitis, since she was 6, she is now 8 yo. We had a throat swab and she is was found to have heavy growth enterobacter spp... will it be better if we have her toncillitis removed?? thank you
answer: Tonsillectomy (surgical removal of the tonsils) is generally not recommended for the treatment of recurrent tonsillitis unless the tonsillitis is causing severe problems such as difficulty swallowing, sleep apnea, or other significant health issues. In most cases, tonsillitis can be effectively treated with antibiotics and other medical treatments.Before considering tonsillectomy as a treatment option, it is important to discuss the potential risks and benefits with a healthcare provider. Some of the potential risks of tonsillectomy include bleeding, infection, and difficulty swallowing. It is always a good idea to speak with a healthcare provider to determine the best course of treatment for your daughter's specific case.

question: What causes appearance of green and orange patches on tongue?My son has orange and green patches on his tongue! What is this? It occured first when he was about a month old and was treated for thrush which took several months to clear up. Now a couple weeks later, the orange and green patches are appearing again. He is 5 months old, about 14 1/2 pounds and 27 inches long.
answer: Green and orange patches on the tongue can be caused by a variety of factors, including infections, allergies, or other underlying health conditions. It is important to have your son evaluated by a healthcare provider to determine the cause of the patches and appropriate treatment.Thrush is a fungal infection that can cause white or yellow patches on the tongue, cheeks, and gums. It is more common in infants and can be treated with antifungal medication. If your son has been treated for thrush in the past and the patches are reappearing, it is possible that he may have a recurrent infection or another underlying condition that is causing the patches.Other potential causes of patches on the tongue include:Allergic reactions: Allergic reactions to certain foods or substances can cause red or white patches on the tongue.Oral lichen planus: This is a chronic inflammatory condition that can cause white or red patches on the tongue and other areas of the mouth.Geographic tongue: This is a benign condition that causes patches of missing or inflamed papillae (small bumps) on the tongue. It can appear as red or white patches on the tongue.Vitamin deficiencies: Deficiencies in certain vitamins, such as folic acid or vitamin B12, can cause changes in the tongue, including patches or changes in color.It is important to have your son evaluated by a healthcare provider to determine the cause of the patches and the appropriate treatment. The provider may recommend a physical examination, laboratory tests, or other diagnostic tests to help identify the underlying cause.

question: What causes dark spots on the heart?Hi my twin brother had a test on his heart done and was told he had 2 black spots. He has to have another cath done and the cardiologist seem to be really concerned about the spots. What might they be or how can I look up info on this? Also with us being twins should I be checked? I have MVP with regurgitation and an enlarged left ventricle.
answer: Dark spots on the heart, also known as heart muscle abnormalities or myocardial abnormalities, can have various causes. They may be due to problems with the heart's blood supply, such as blockages in the coronary arteries or inflammation of the heart muscle. Other potential causes of heart muscle abnormalities include previous heart attacks, viral infections, and certain genetic conditions.If your twin brother has been told that he has dark spots on his heart and the cardiologist is concerned, it is important for him to follow the recommended treatment plan. This may include further testing, such as a cardiac catheterization (cath) or additional imaging studies, to help determine the cause of the spots and the best course of treatment. It is also important for him to work with his healthcare provider to manage any underlying medical conditions and make lifestyle changes, such as eating a healthy diet, exercising regularly, and not smoking, to help support the health of his heart.As for you, it is always a good idea to discuss your health concerns with a healthcare provider. If you have MVP with regurgitation and an enlarged left ventricle, it is important to follow the recommended treatment plan and manage these conditions to help support the health of your heart. It is also important for you to maintain a healthy lifestyle and to seek medical attention if you experience any new or worsening symptoms.

question: Suggest treatment for injury mediated head bumpHi, I hit my forehead on a pole today while I was changing for pe. I didn t get any concussion symptoms except some pain right after I hit it, but the pain went away in 2 minutes. There s a small but noticeable bump on my head, what do I do to make it go away faster?
answer: It's generally not necessary to do anything to make a bump on the head go away faster, as most bumps will resolve on their own within a few days. However, you can take the following steps to help reduce any pain or discomfort:Apply ice to the bump for 15-20 minutes at a time, several times a day. This can help reduce swelling and pain.Take over-the-counter pain medication, such as acetaminophen (Tylenol) or ibuprofen (Advil), to help reduce any pain or discomfort.Avoid activities that could cause further injury to your head, such as contact sports or activities that involve a lot of physical activity.Get plenty of rest and avoid strenuous activity until you are feeling better.If you experience any symptoms of a concussion, such as headache, dizziness, nausea, vomiting, or difficulty thinking or remembering, you should seek medical attention right away. It's also important to seek medical attention if you have any signs of a more serious injury, such as a deep cut, severe headache, or loss of consciousness.

question: What causes runny and painful bowel movement in a baby?my 4 month old baby is always screaming in pain when he has a bowel movement, he goes every day, sometimes a few times a day, they are soft stools, often very soft and runny, he also spends the whole day in pain trying to go. I have just started weaning him, this has made no difference, its as though he is constantly constipated without actually being constipated?
answer: There could be several potential causes for your baby's symptoms. Here are a few possibilities:Infection: A bacterial or viral infection could cause diarrhea and abdominal pain in your baby.Food intolerance or allergy: Your baby may be reacting to a new food that you have introduced as part of the weaning process. It's also possible that your baby may be allergic to a certain food or ingredient.Constipation: Although your baby's stools are soft and runny, it's possible that they may still be constipated. Constipation can cause discomfort and pain when passing stools, even if the stools are soft.Anal fissures: These are small tears in the skin around the anus that can be caused by hard or large stools. Anal fissures can cause pain and discomfort during bowel movements.It's important to speak with your baby's healthcare provider about these symptoms, as they can help determine the cause and provide appropriate treatment. question: Q. What to do for itching around the private parts?Hi doctor,I am suffering with itching like eczema around my private parts for the last two years. Please help.

question: Q. What to do for itching around the private parts?Hi doctor,I am suffering with itching like eczema around my private parts for the last two years. Please help.
answer: Itching around the private parts can be caused by a variety of factors, including irritation, allergies, and infections. In order to determine the cause of the itching and recommend appropriate treatment, it is important to see a healthcare provider. They will be able to examine the area and may recommend a course of treatment, such as over-the-counter or prescription medication, to help relieve the itching.In the meantime, there are a few steps you can take to help manage the itching:Keep the area clean and dry: Gently wash the area with warm water and a mild soap, and make sure to thoroughly dry the skin afterwards. Avoid using scented products or rough toilet paper, as these can irritate the skin.Wear loose, breathable clothing: Tight or synthetic clothing can trap moisture and heat, which can exacerbate itching. Instead, opt for loose, breathable clothing made of natural fibers like cotton.Avoid scratching: Scratching can make the itching worse and can also cause the skin to become more inflamed and damaged. If you find it difficult to resist the urge to scratch, try keeping your nails trimmed short and wearing gloves at night to prevent accidental scratching.Apply a cool compress: Placing a cool, damp cloth on the affected area can help to soothe itching and reduce inflammation.Try over-the-counter creams: There are several creams and ointments available over the counter that can help to relieve itching. These include hydrocortisone creams and calamine lotion.Again, it is important to see a healthcare provider to determine the cause of the itching and receive a proper diagnosis and treatment plan.

Use the cervical collar, do hot water fermentation for neck and static neck exercises for stabilizing the cervical spine. Most cases responds well to conservative management.

question: What causes numbness and stiffness in hand?Hello. I have been experiencing numbness and stiffness in my right hand in the mornings. Today my left hand seems to be staring. The joints of my middle right finger are extremely stiff for a while and I cannot move my fingers smoothly - they seem to pop when I open and close my hand. I am only 25.
answer: There are several potential causes of numbness and stiffness in the hands. Some common causes include:Carpal Tunnel Syndrome: This is a condition that occurs when the median nerve, which runs from the forearm to the hand, becomes compressed as it passes through the wrist. Symptoms may include numbness, tingling, and stiffness in the hand and fingers.Arthritis: Inflammation of the joints can cause stiffness and discomfort in the hands, particularly in the morning.Repetitive Strain Injury (RSI): Repetitive hand movements, such as typing or using a mouse, can lead to swelling and inflammation in the tendons and muscles of the hand, resulting in numbness and stiffness.Pinched nerves: Nerves can become pinched or compressed anywhere along their path, leading to numbness and tingling in the affected area.It's important to speak with a healthcare professional for a proper diagnosis and treatment plan. They may recommend rest, physical therapy, medication, or other treatments to help alleviate your symptoms.

question: What could be the bruises accompanied by tiredness and dizzy spells?grand daughter age 15 - been complaining of having no energy, tired, headaches & dizzy spells and now unexplained bruises which seem to have a white middle with bruising around outside ??  been to her gp this morning and has to go back on thurs for bloods - no indication what it could be, any ideas please ?
answer: Hi. Unexplained bruises may be because of some defect in her blood clotting mechanism( either platelets or clotting factor defect) . It can also be due to some infections,  autoimmune disorder or rarely malignancy(blood cancer)   . Also her tiredness etc can be due to Anemia which may be because she is loosing blood because of clotting mechanism . question: What could be the bruises accompanied by tiredness and dizzy spells?grand daughter age 15 - been complaining of having no energy, tired, headaches & dizzy spells and now unexplained bruises which seem to have a white middle with bruising around outside ??  been to her gp this morning and has to go back on thurs for bloods - no indication what it could be, any ideas please ?
answer: Bruises accompanied by tiredness, dizziness, and other symptoms can have several possible causes, and it is important for your granddaughter to see a doctor for proper diagnosis and treatment. Some possible causes of bruises and other symptoms include:Anemia: Anemia is a condition in which there is a deficiency of red blood cells or hemoglobin, which can cause fatigue, dizziness, and other symptoms.Vitamin deficiency: Deficiencies in certain vitamins, such as vitamin B12 or vitamin C, can cause bruising and other symptoms.Infection: Infections, such as those caused by bacteria or viruses, can cause bruising and other symptoms.Blood disorders: Some blood disorders, such as clotting disorders or platelet disorders, can cause bruising and other symptoms.Medications: Some medications, such as blood thinners, can cause bruising and other symptoms.It is important for your granddaughter to see a doctor for a proper evaluation and diagnosis, as the cause of her symptoms may be something that requires treatment. The doctor will likely perform a physical examination, review her medical history, and order laboratory tests, such as a complete blood count (CBC) or other tests, to help determine the cause of her symptoms.

question: Q. Is it possible to get pulsating tinnitus due to tubes placed in ears?Hello doctor,Can tubes placed in ears cause pulsating tinnitus? I never had this prior to the tubes. I was getting dizzy all the time. So, they placed tubes in my ears.
answer: It is possible that tubes placed in the ears could potentially cause pulsating tinnitus as a side effect. Tinnitus is a subjective sensation of ringing, buzzing, or other sounds in the ears that is not caused by an external sound source. Pulsating tinnitus is a subtype of tinnitus in which the perceived sound is rhythmic and synchronous with the person's heartbeat.There are a number of factors that can cause tinnitus, including hearing loss, exposure to loud noises, certain medications, and certain medical conditions. The placement of tubes in the ears, also known as myringotomy or tympanostomy, is a surgical procedure that is typically performed to treat conditions such as chronic middle ear infections or fluid buildup in the middle ear. While it is possible that the placement of tubes in the ears could cause tinnitus, it is not a common side effect.If you are experiencing pulsating tinnitus after having tubes placed in your ears, it is important to speak with your healthcare provider about your symptoms. They can help determine the cause of your tinnitus and recommend treatment options.

question: What causes throbbing chest pain along with shortness of breath?I have a throbbing pounding pain in the middle of my chest between my breasts. I am not short of breath. answer: In my opinion you are having GERD (Gastro Esophageal Reflux Disease). But as a rule in chest pain, we have to rule out cardiac and pulmonary causes.So get done ECG and 2D Echo to rule out cardiac causes.Get done chest x ray to rule out infection in the lungs.If all the above are normal than it is mostly GERD.It is due to laxity of gastroesophageal sphincter. Due to this acid of the stomach tends to come up in the esophagus and cause the central chest pain.Try to follow these for better control of GERD.1. Avoid hot and spicy food.2. Avoid stress and anxiety. 3. Avoid large meals. Take small meals.4. Start proton pump inhibitors. 5. Go for walk after meals.6.

question: What causes throbbing chest pain along with shortness of breath?I have a throbbing pounding pain in the middle of my chest between my breasts. I am not short of breath. The pain is constant. I noticed today that after swelling my food when it gets to that area it hurts going down. Also hurts more when I bend. The pain is constant and radiates across my back.
answer: Throbbing chest pain along with shortness of breath can be caused by a number of different conditions, including:Angina: This is chest pain caused by reduced blood flow to the heart muscle. It is often described as a squeezing or tightness in the chest and can be accompanied by shortness of breath.Heart attack: A heart attack occurs when the blood flow to a part of the heart is blocked, usually by a blood clot. Chest pain is the most common symptom of a heart attack, and it may be accompanied by shortness of breath, sweating, nausea, and vomiting.Pulmonary embolism: This is a blood clot in the lungs that can cause chest pain and shortness of breath.Pneumonia: This is an infection of the lungs that can cause chest pain and shortness of breath.Costochondritis: This is inflammation of the cartilage that connects the ribs to the breastbone. It can cause chest pain, especially when taking a deep breath or coughing.If you are experiencing throbbing chest pain along with shortness of breath, it is important to seek medical attention as soon as possible. These symptoms can be serious and may require immediate treatment.

question: What are the side effects of depo shots?I just got off the depo shot and im having a brownish discharge. I had one the beginning of last month befo my period and my period lasted 2wks and now ive been discharging for a wk now my shot was due last week but im nit gettin back on it bt that was my first shot. Whats goin on ?
answer: There are several potential side effects of Depo-Provera, a hormonal injection used for birth control. Some common side effects include:Irregular bleeding or spotting: It is not uncommon for people who use Depo-Provera to experience irregular bleeding or spotting during the first few months of use. This may improve over time, but if it persists or is bothersome, you should discuss it with your healthcare provider.Weight gain: Some people who use Depo-Provera may gain weight. This may be due to fluid retention or changes in metabolism.Mood changes: Depo-Provera may cause changes in mood, including irritability, anxiety, or depression.Headaches: Headaches are a common side effect of Depo-Provera.Nausea: Some people who use Depo-Provera may experience nausea.Breast tenderness: Depo-Provera may cause breast tenderness.Decreased bone density: Long-term use of Depo-Provera may cause a decrease in bone density. This may increase the risk of osteoporosis, especially in people who are already at risk.It is not uncommon for people to experience irregular bleeding or spotting after they stop using Depo-Provera. This may take several months to resolve. If you are concerned about the brownish discharge you are experiencing, you should discuss it with your healthcare provider. They will be able to determine the cause and advise you on the best course of action.

question: Q. Will taking medication cure adult ADHD?Hello doctor,I am just curious here. I fully believe I have adult ADHD, and being that I was diagnosed at 11 with it, would this help my case for medication with a psych?
answer: Hi. Both adult and childhood ADHD needs to be treated with medicines. Three medicines are the first line drugs used to treat ADHD namely Methamphetamine (Adderal), Methylphenidate (Concerta) and Atomoxetine (Strattera). The former two drugs are more effective in treating hyperactivity symptoms while the third is more effective in impulsivity symptoms of ADHD. Another drug which has been used with great success in the past is an alpha-2 agonist called Clonidine. It is also used in treating hypertension and urinary retention.

question: What causes tingling in legs in males with bicuspid aortic valve?I am 48 yo male, 5 3 , 140 lbs. I was diagnosed in childhood with a bicuspid aortic valve, so I am quite active, run 30 min 6x a week, and weight lifting 30 min 3x a week. For the past few days I have been experiencing a light tingling in my left leg. My work and commute does involve a lot of sitting, so I m wondering if this may be the cause?
answer: It is possible that the tingling sensation in your left leg could be related to your bicuspid aortic valve or it could be caused by something else. It is important to speak with a healthcare professional to determine the cause of the tingling and determine the appropriate treatment.A bicuspid aortic valve is a congenital heart condition in which the aortic valve, which controls blood flow from the heart to the rest of the body, has only two leaflets instead of three. This can cause the valve to become narrowed or leaky, leading to heart problems. However, tingling in the legs is not typically a symptom of a bicuspid aortic valve.It is possible that the tingling sensation in your leg could be caused by a condition such as peripheral neuropathy, which is damage to the nerves that carry messages to and from the brain and spinal cord to the rest of the body. Peripheral neuropathy can be caused by a variety of factors, including diabetes, vitamin deficiencies, and nerve compression. Prolonged sitting can also contribute to the development of peripheral neuropathy, as it can cause decreased blood flow to the legs.It is important to speak with a healthcare professional to determine the cause of the tingling and determine the appropriate treatment. They may recommend certain lifestyle changes, such as standing up and stretching periodically during periods of prolonged sitting, or they may recommend other treatments depending on the cause of the tingling.

question: What does abdominal aorta atherosclerosis without aneurysm mean?I just had a ultra sound of my stomach and they found [Adbominal aorta atherosclerosis] with out aneurysm.But what does this mean no one will give me a nuts & bolts answer please help.I live in a very small county  with very poor medical care.I could use some direction.Tnank You.
answer: Abdominal aorta atherosclerosis refers to the buildup of plaque, a fatty substance, in the walls of the abdominal aorta, which is the main blood vessel that carries oxygenated blood from the heart to the rest of the body. Atherosclerosis is a common condition that occurs when plaque builds up in the arteries, making them narrow and less flexible. This can reduce blood flow and increase the risk of serious health problems, such as heart attack and stroke.The term "without aneurysm" means that the abdominal aorta has not developed a bulge or swelling, known as an aneurysm. An aneurysm can occur when the walls of an artery become weak and the vessel expands or bulges outward. If the aneurysm ruptures, it can cause life-threatening bleeding.It's important to work with your healthcare provider to manage abdominal aorta atherosclerosis and to discuss any recommended treatment options. This may include lifestyle changes, such as eating a healthy diet, getting regular exercise, and quitting smoking, as well as medications to help lower cholesterol and blood pressure. It's also important to have regular check-ups with your healthcare provider to monitor the condition and make any necessary adjustments to your treatment plan.

question: What treatment is suggested for high IDL around 168?My age is 69-70 range. I have high ldl around 168. However , my ldl/hdl ratio is 3.47 and cholesterol /hdl is 5.29. My weight is normal. I go for regular walking and practice yoga. No heart related family history. BP, sugar normal. Do you advise my taking medicine to lower ldl?
answer: High levels of intermediate-density lipoprotein (IDL) can increase the risk of heart disease. IDL is a type of lipoprotein that carries cholesterol and fats through the bloodstream. Elevated levels of IDL may indicate that you have an excess of cholesterol in your blood, which can contribute to the development of plaque in your arteries.It's important to address high IDL levels to reduce the risk of heart disease. The treatment for high IDL will depend on the underlying cause of the elevated levels and any other risk factors you may have for heart disease. Some potential treatments for high IDL may include lifestyle changes, such as eating a healthy diet, getting regular physical activity, and quitting smoking, as well as medications to lower cholesterol.In your case, it's good to know that you have a normal weight, normal blood pressure and normal blood sugar levels, and that you engage in regular physical activity and have no heart-related family history. However, your high LDL levels and high LDL/HDL ratio are still a concern and may increase your risk of heart disease. It's important to discuss your IDL and cholesterol levels with your healthcare provider to determine the best course of treatment. They may recommend lifestyle changes and/or medications to help lower your LDL levels and improve your overall cardiovascular health.

question: Can i take Aspirin with Lispernol?im currently taking High Blood pressure (Lispernol) 40mg and taking asprin 81mg.. dose the Asprin rule out my high blood pressure medication? I get really dizzy and drowissie when I take both of them and 30 mins later I get dizzy and drowsie. What should I do? I am not taking any other medication.
answer: Aspirin and Lispernol belong to different classes of medications and they may have potential drug interactions when taken together. Aspirin is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) and Lispernol is a beta blocker. Beta blockers, like Lispernol, are commonly used to treat high blood pressure and other heart conditions. They work by blocking the effects of certain hormones and chemicals in the body that can constrict blood vessels and increase blood pressure.Aspirin may interfere with the effectiveness of Lispernol in lowering blood pressure. Additionally, taking aspirin and Lispernol together may increase the risk of bleeding and other side effects.It is important to discuss any concerns about your medication regimen with your healthcare provider. They will be able to advise you on the best course of treatment based on your specific situation and medical history. They may recommend alternative medications or adjust the dosages of your current medications to minimize the risk of interactions and side effects. question: What is the diffrence between tumor and cancer ?HI DOCTOR my mother is 46yrs recently she is diagnised having heterogenous myometrium(tumor in uterus). i wanted to know is it a cancer ?
answer: A tumor is a mass of abnormal cells that can be benign (not cancerous) or malignant (cancerous). Benign tumors are not usually a threat to health and do not spread to other parts of the body. Malignant tumors, on the other hand, are made up of cancer cells that can invade nearby tissues and spread to other parts of the body, a process known as metastasis.It is not possible for me to accurately determine whether or not your mother's tumor is cancerous without more information. It is important for her to speak with her healthcare provider and undergo appropriate testing and evaluation to determine the nature and extent of the tumor. question: Suggest treatment for tremors in a Parkinson s patientHello; I have a friend that has parkinson disease and has severe tremors,when we are deer hunting,yes deer hunting,When he see s a deer he can pick up his gun all the tremors stop when he aims and shoots how can this happen,watch him do this 3 times this winter
answer: This is very characteristic and typical for Parkinson's patients.They have what is called a resting tremor which means the shaking and excessive movements of the hands occur most often when the person is sitting quietly or "resting." When they engage their hands in any activity such as eating, drinking, or shooting deer then, the tremors cease. Now, not to be the bearer of bad news but resting tremor is generally, the way PD patients start out.As the disease progresses the tremors also evolve and will be present upon action and at rest though with action is likely to always be at least slightly better than when the hands are sitting quietly in their laps.

question: Suggest treatment for tremors in a Parkinson s patientHello; I have a friend that has parkinson disease and has severe tremors,when we are deer hunting,yes deer hunting,When he see s a deer he can pick up his gun all the tremors stop when he aims and shoots how can this happen,watch him do this 3 times this winter
answer: Treatment for tremors in patients with Parkinson's disease often includes medications called dopaminergic agents, which help to increase dopamine levels in the brain and improve tremors and other symptoms of the disease. Other medications that may be used to treat tremors in Parkinson's disease include anticholinergics, beta blockers, and benzodiazepines. In some cases, surgery, such as deep brain stimulation (DBS), may be recommended to help control tremors that are not responsive to medications.It is not uncommon for people with Parkinson's disease to experience temporary improvement in tremors and other symptoms when they are engaged in certain activities, such as aiming and shooting a gun. This phenomenon, known as the "shooter's effect," may be due to the increased focus and concentration required for such activities, which can help to reduce tremors. However, it is important to note that the shooter's effect is not a treatment for tremors and does not provide long-term relief from the symptoms of Parkinson's disease.

question: What causes dark urine, thick semen discharge and yellow cast on whites of eyes?Hi, lately I've noticed that my urine is very, very dark, and my discharge of seamen is unregularily thick. These symptoms can be caused by a variety of medical conditions, including liver disease, dehydration, and infections.Liver disease: Dark urine and yellowing of the whites of the eyes (known as jaundice) can be symptoms of liver disease. The liver is responsible for breaking down and removing waste products from the body, and when it is not functioning properly, these waste products can build up and cause these symptoms.Dehydration: Dehydration can cause dark urine and thick semen. When you are dehydrated, your body does not have enough fluids to produce clear urine and thin semen. Dehydration can also cause other symptoms, such as dizziness, fatigue, and dry mouth.Infections: Some infections, such as sexually transmitted infections (STIs) or urinary tract infections (UTIs), can cause dark urine and thick semen. If you have any concerns about the possibility of an STI or UTI, it is important to speak with a healthcare provider.It is always important to speak with a healthcare provider if you are experiencing any unusual symptoms. They can perform a physical examination and may order tests to determine the cause of your symptoms. They can also provide you with appropriate treatment.

question: Suggest remedy for bumps and pain in shoulderMy husband fell on his left shoulder in a softball game about a week ago. His shoulder hurt that night, and is still hurting. question: Is it normal to experience familiar pain long after a cholecystectomy?I had my gall bladder out about 18 years ago. For the past week, I would swear that it never happened. I am experiencing the same pain as I did when my gall bladder was still in me. Could it be my liver? What else could it be.
answer: Hi, This looks to me like so-called postcholecystectomy syndrome which has all these symptoms and this occurs in about 10 per cent of patients who undergo cholecystectomy, usually can be transient, and rarely persistent or lifelong. Symptoms include systemic symptoms such as sweating and heat sense but also dyspepsia, nausea, and vomiting, flatulence, bloating, and diarrhea, Persistent pain in the upper right abdomen. Some individuals may benefit from diet modification, such as a reduced-fat diet, following cholecystectomy since it may be more difficult for digestion of fatty foods. Postcholecystectomy syndrome treatment depends on the identified violations that led to it. Typically, the patient is recommended dietary restriction table with fatty foods, enzyme preparations, antispasmodics, sometimes oral ursodeoxycholic acid can alleviate the condition. Ivan R. Rommstein, General Surgeon

question: Is it normal to experience familiar pain long after a cholecystectomy?I had my gall bladder out about 18 years ago. For the past week, I would swear that it never happened. answer: It is not uncommon for people to experience discomfort or pain in the area where their gallbladder used to be after a cholecystectomy. This is often referred to as "phantom pain," and it can be caused by nerve endings that were damaged during the surgery. These nerve endings can continue to send pain signals to the brain even after the gallbladder is removed.It is also possible that the pain you are experiencing could be caused by something other than your gallbladder. The liver is located in the upper right side of the abdomen, so if you are experiencing pain in that area, it could be related to your liver. question: Does water retention cause swelling in the legs?I have swelling in both legs, the right much worse than the left. I have taken a water pill and have had no relief. my legs, knees, and hips ache horribly daily. My doctor just tells me it s water retention and there s nothing I can do about it. Is this true?

question: What causes light vaginal bleeding after ovulation?I am 25 y/o and have been trying to concieve since last August. During my January cycle everything went as planned and I had some light bleeding 1 week after I ovulated but one week before my period is due. It wasn't enough to cause an alarm but I am curious to know what could be the cause and if I can take this as a good sign.
answer: Light vaginal bleeding after ovulation could be caused by a number of factors. Here are a few possibilities:Implantation bleeding: This is a small amount of bleeding that occurs when the fertilized egg implants itself into the lining of the uterus. Implantation bleeding is usually light and may occur around the time of your expected period.Hormonal changes: Ovulation is accompanied by a surge in certain hormones, including estrogen and progesterone. These hormone fluctuations can sometimes cause light spotting or bleeding.Infection or irritation: Infections or irritation of the cervix or vaginal tissue can sometimes cause bleeding.Polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS): PCOS is a hormonal disorder that can cause irregular periods and spotting between periods.It is always a good idea to speak with a healthcare provider if you have any concerns about bleeding or other changes in your menstrual cycle. They can help determine the cause and provide appropriate treatment, if needed.

question: What causes severe abdominal pain, bloating and diarrhea?Hi, I have severe abdominal pain and it would not stop. I am unable to sleep too. answer: Severe abdominal pain, bloating, and diarrhea can have a variety of causes. Some possible causes include:Gastroenteritis: This is an inflammation of the stomach and intestines that is often caused by a viral or bacterial infection. It can cause symptoms such as abdominal pain, bloating, diarrhea, and vomiting.Food poisoning: This occurs when you eat food that is contaminated with bacteria, viruses, or toxins. It can cause symptoms such as abdominal pain, bloating, diarrhea, and vomiting.Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS): This is a common disorder that affects the large intestine. It can cause abdominal pain, bloating, diarrhea, and constipation.Inflammatory bowel disease (IBD): This is a group of disorders that cause inflammation in the digestive tract. It can include conditions such as Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis, and can cause symptoms such as abdominal pain, bloating, diarrhea, and weight loss.Constipation: This is a condition in which you have difficulty passing stools or have infrequent bowel movements. It can cause abdominal pain, bloating, and diarrhea.If you are experiencing severe abdominal pain, bloating, and diarrhea, it is important to see a healthcare provider for proper diagnosis and treatment. In the meantime, you can try to manage your symptoms by drinking plenty of fluids to prevent dehydration and avoiding solid foods until you feel better.

question: How many times can contraceptive pills be taken?i had unprotected sex on the 23rd December 2013 and i used the emergency contraceptive and again on the 1st of January 2014 ihad unprotectd sex before my period starts. My question is can i use the emergency contraceptive gain while i did not get period? i am very afraid i will fall pregnant
answer: There is no need to use an emergency contraceptive pill around the menstrual period because this is the safe period. Ovulation occurs two weeks prior to the onset of the next period and this is the fertile period. So, in the manner you have described, you cannot get pregnant and hence, there is no need to worry. Also, restrict the use of emergency contraceptive pills to once or twice a year since they have a high hormone content and hence disturb the hormone milieu of the body badly. Hope this helps.

question: How many times can contraceptive pills be taken?i had unprotected sex on the 23rd December 2013 and i used the emergency contraceptive and again on the 1st of January 2014 ihad unprotectd sex before my period starts. My question is can i use the emergency contraceptive gain while i did not get period? i am very afraid i will fall pregnant
answer: Emergency contraception, sometimes called the "morning-after pill," is a type of birth control that can be taken after unprotected sex or contraceptive failure to prevent pregnancy. It is not intended to be used as a regular method of birth control and should not be taken more than once in a menstrual cycle. If you have had unprotected sex on multiple occasions and are concerned about the possibility of pregnancy, it is important to speak with a healthcare provider as soon as possible. They can help you determine the best course of action for your situation.It's worth noting that there are other, more reliable methods of birth control that can be used to prevent pregnancy. These include:Oral contraceptives (the "pill"): These are pills that contain hormones that prevent pregnancy. They are taken daily and are available in different forms, including combination pills (which contain both estrogen and progestin) and progestin-only pills. Oral contraceptives are effective at preventing pregnancy when taken correctly, but they are not foolproof and can fail if you miss a dose or vomit after taking them.Intrauterine devices (IUDs): These are small, T-shaped devices that are inserted into the uterus to prevent pregnancy. There are two types of IUDs: copper and hormonal. Copper IUDs work by releasing small amounts of copper into the uterus to kill or damage sperm, while hormonal IUDs release a low dose of progestin to thicken cervical mucus and thin the lining of the uterus. IUDs are highly effective at preventing pregnancy and can be left in place for several years.Barrier methods: These are physical barriers that prevent sperm from reaching the egg. Examples include male condoms, female condoms, diaphragms, and cervical caps. Barrier methods are effective at preventing pregnancy when used correctly, but they do not provide as much protection as other methods.It's important to choose a birth control method that is right for you and to use it consistently and correctly to reduce the risk of unintended pregnancy. If you have any questions or concerns about your options, it is a good idea to speak with a healthcare provider or a reproductive health professional. They can provide you with information and guidance on the different methods of birth control and help you choose the one that is best suited to your needs.

question: Is it possible to have trigeminal neuralgia like symptoms with supraclinoid aneurysm?Seeking a neurosurgeon to answer my question. Is it possible to have trigeminal neuralgia like symptoms with supraclinoid aneurysm? Symptoms include constant dull ache in face like a tooth ache (dentists have confirmed zero issues with teeth - and physician has recommended CT as he believes it to be TN). No burning sensation.  Dull ache is accompanies by ocean wave that ends with a stab. Then it repeats itself or does not. Thank you.
answer: It is possible for a person with a supraclinoid aneurysm to experience symptoms similar to those of trigeminal neuralgia (TN). However, it is important to note that aneurysms and TN are two separate conditions and it is important to accurately diagnose the cause of the symptoms in order to determine the appropriate course of treatment.Trigeminal neuralgia is a type of facial pain that is caused by irritation or damage to the trigeminal nerve, which is the nerve responsible for sensation in the face. It typically causes brief, severe attacks of facial pain that are triggered by certain stimuli, such as speaking, eating, or touching the face. The pain is often described as a sharp, stabbing sensation that can be severe enough to interfere with daily activities.On the other hand, an aneurysm is a bulge or ballooning in a blood vessel that can occur anywhere in the body. Supraclinoid aneurysms are a type of aneurysm that occur in the blood vessels located above the clinoid process, which is a bony structure in the brain. These aneurysms can cause symptoms such as headache, neck pain, and visual changes, and can be life-threatening if they rupture.If you are experiencing symptoms that you believe may be related to a supraclinoid aneurysm or TN, it is important to speak with a neurosurgeon or other medical professional for a proper evaluation and diagnosis. They can recommend the appropriate course of treatment based on the specific cause of your symptoms.

question: Is open heart surgery the only option for a liver biopsy?My sister has had 2 tubes put in her heart due to an infection. She has MRSA. She has gained 32 lbs, and the doctors say the antibiotics are not working. They are doing a liver biopsy. Say liver not making enough blood. Her heart is beating fine, and fear the infection is spreading through her body. Open heart surgery is the only option?
answer: A liver biopsy is a procedure in which a small sample of liver tissue is obtained for testing. It is usually done to diagnose or monitor a liver condition, such as an infection or a disease. Open heart surgery is not typically necessary for a liver biopsy.There are several methods for obtaining a liver biopsy, including percutaneous liver biopsy, transvenous liver biopsy, and laparoscopic liver biopsy. Percutaneous liver biopsy is the most common method, and it involves inserting a needle through the skin and into the liver to obtain a sample of liver tissue. Transvenous liver biopsy involves inserting a needle through a vein in the neck or chest and into the liver, while laparoscopic liver biopsy involves using a laparoscope (a small, thin tube with a camera on the end) to obtain a sample of liver tissue through a small incision in the abdomen.It is important to note that the method of obtaining a liver biopsy may depend on the patient's overall health, the specific liver condition being evaluated, and other factors. Your sister's doctors will be able to determine the most appropriate method for her based on her specific situation. If your sister has any concerns or questions about the liver biopsy procedure, she should discuss them with her healthcare team.

question: Q. Will Aspirin affect D-dimer test?Hi doctor,My pain started behind knee, but now is causing recurrent chest pains and shortness of breath. I could not do much physical activity. answer: gleixia@163.comQ. Will Aspirin affect D-dimer test?Hi doctor,My pain started behind knee, but now is causing recurrent chest pains and shortness of breath. I could not do much physical activity. There is no previous history of such event. I am currently on Aspirin. I had an EKG, lung x-ray and D-dimer blood test. Is it possible to have a pulmonary embolism with negative D-dimer test? If the clot breaks or moving, then will D-dimer work? What else could cause pulmonary embolism like symptoms?Aspirin is an antiplatelet drug that is commonly used to prevent blood clots. It is not known to affect the results of a D-dimer test.A D-dimer test is used to help diagnose a pulmonary embolism (PE), which is a blockage of an artery in the lungs by a blood clot. The D-dimer test measures the levels of a protein fragment (D-dimer) that is produced when a blood clot breaks down. Elevated levels of D-dimer can be a sign of a blood clot, but a negative D-dimer test does not necessarily rule out the possibility of a PE.There are other conditions that can cause symptoms similar to those of a PE, such as heart failure, pneumonia, and asthma. It is important to discuss your symptoms with a healthcare provider to determine the cause and appropriate treatment. They may recommend further testing or evaluation, such as a CT scan or an echocardiogram, to help diagnose the cause of your symptoms.

question: How can soreness in the tongue be treated?My tongue and the muscles around it are so sore from coughing. My cough is more just hacking and producing little, yet, I keep doing it. I can barely talk or eat.  My throat is red but likely just from coughing. There are no spots on it.  What can I do to lessen the muscle pain?
answer: There are several things you can try to help relieve soreness in your tongue and the muscles around it:Drink plenty of fluids: Staying hydrated can help soothe your throat and loosen mucus, which can help reduce coughing.Gargle with warm salt water: Mix a half teaspoon of salt in a glass of warm water, and gargle for about 30 seconds. This can help reduce inflammation and soothe your sore throat.Use over-the-counter pain medication: Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) such as ibuprofen or acetaminophen can help reduce muscle pain and inflammation. Follow the instructions on the package for proper dosing.Use a humidifier: Dry air can irritate your throat and contribute to coughing. Using a humidifier in your home can help keep the air moist, which can help reduce irritation and soreness.Try throat lozenges or hard candy: Sucking on throat lozenges or hard candy can help stimulate saliva production and coat your throat, which can help soothe irritation and reduce coughing.Avoid irritants: If you smoke or are around secondhand smoke, try to avoid it as much as possible. Smoking can irritate your throat and increase coughing. Similarly, try to avoid exposure to other irritants such as strong perfumes or air pollution.Get plenty of rest: Coughing can be exhausting, so it's important to get plenty of rest to allow your body to heal.If your soreness persists or is severe, or if you have other symptoms such as fever or difficulty swallowing, you should contact your healthcare provider for further evaluation and treatment.

question: Q. What can cause pain in legs while walking and fatty lumps?Hello doctor,I have pain in both legs when I walk fast. There is a fatty lump in both legs, not painful when pressed.

Some potential causes include:Muscular or skeletal conditions: Leg pain while walking can be caused by conditions such as shin splints, muscle strains or tears, or osteoarthritis.Nerve conditions: Leg pain while walking can also be caused by nerve conditions such as sciatica, which is pain that radiates down the leg due to irritation or compression of the sciatic nerve.Vascular conditions: Leg pain while walking may be caused by vascular conditions such as peripheral artery disease, which is a narrowing of the arteries that supply blood to the legs.Fatty lumps: Fatty lumps, also known as lipomas, are benign (noncancerous) growths that consist of fat tissue. question: What treatment is suggested for accidental intake of toilet cleaner?A 11 year kid I know drank Harpic Toiler Cleaner by mistake. He has been rushed to a hospital A 11 year kid I kA 11 year kid I know drank Harpic Toiler Cleaner by mistake. He has been rushed to a hospital and has been given a stomach wash but continues to vomit blood and bubbles...what further medicare...
answer: It is important to seek medical attention as soon as possible if someone has ingested a potentially toxic substance, such as toilet cleaner. Ingesting toilet cleaner can be very dangerous and can cause serious health problems, including burns to the mouth and throat, stomach pain, vomiting, difficulty breathing, and even death in severe cases.If the person has ingested a significant amount of the toilet cleaner, they may need to undergo a procedure called "gastric lavage," also known as a stomach wash, to remove the substance from their stomach. This involves inserting a tube through the person's mouth or nose and into their stomach, and then using a special solution to wash out the stomach.Other treatments may be necessary as well, depending on the specific symptoms and how much of the toilet cleaner was ingested. These may include medications to reduce nausea and vomiting, supportive care to help the person breathe and maintain their vital signs, and possibly even surgery to repair any damage caused by the toilet cleaner.It is important to follow the recommendations of the healthcare professionals caring for the person and to seek medical attention immediately if someone has ingested a potentially toxic substance.

question: Is pregnancy possible due to duphaston?i m trying to concieve since last 4 years,could not suceed,all tests are normal,doctor says we me and my husband both are alright for giving birth to child,this time  i m taking duphaston since 16 days from LMP,will i be pregnant this time,when shud i expect my periods if not pregnant
answer: Duphaston (dydrogesterone) is a synthetic hormone that is similar to the hormone progesterone, which is produced naturally by the ovaries. It is used to treat a variety of conditions that are related to an imbalance of hormones, including irregular menstrual periods, endometriosis, and uterine bleeding caused by hormonal imbalances. It is not used to help people become pregnant.If you are trying to become pregnant, it is important to talk to your doctor about the best course of treatment for you. In cases like this, it is typically necessary to remove the stones in order to provide lasting relief. These may include alpha blockers, which relax the muscles in the ureter and help the stone pass more quickly, or medications to help dissolve the stones.Extracorporeal shock wave lithotripsy (ESWL): This procedure uses shock waves to break the stones into smaller pieces that can be passed more easily through the urinary system.Ureteroscopy: This procedure involves inserting a thin, flexible tube with a light and camera on the end (called a ureteroscope) into the urethra and passing it through the bladder and into the ureter. question: Can immature sperms cause genetic disorder or congenital malformation?i will like to find out the following information about ICSI .I am a man of 40 yrs of age with a condition of obstructive azospermia. testicular biopsy shows evidence of spermatogenesis with immature spermaticlnow i want to know cost of icsi and ivfhow long i will have to stay over in india,what is the effect of immature spermatic i.e can it cause genetic disorder or congenital malformation
answer: In vitro fertilization (IVF) and intracytoplasmic sperm injection (ICSI) are assisted reproductive technologies (ART) that can be used to help couples conceive when other fertility treatments have not been successful. IVF involves retrieving eggs from a woman's ovaries, fertilizing them with sperm in a laboratory dish, and transferring the resulting embryos back into the woman's uterus. ICSI is a specific type of IVF that involves injecting a single sperm directly into an egg to fertilize it.The cost of IVF and ICSI can vary depending on the specific treatment plan, the location, and the individual medical needs of the patient. It is important to discuss the cost of these treatments with a fertility specialist or a fertility clinic to get a better understanding of the expenses involved.As for the effect of immature sperm on the outcome of IVF or ICSI, it is possible that using immature sperm for these procedures may increase the risk of certain genetic disorders or congenital malformations in the resulting offspring. However, it is important to note that the risk of genetic disorders or congenital malformations can also occur with normal, mature sperm. It is also worth noting that the success rates of IVF and ICSI are not significantly affected by the maturity of the sperm used.It is not uncommon for men with obstructive azoospermia (a condition in which the sperm ducts are blocked, preventing sperm from being ejaculated) to have sperm retrieved for use in assisted reproductive technologies such as IVF or ICSI. The specific treatment plan and length of time required for these procedures will depend on the individual circumstances of the patient. It is important to discuss these details with a fertility specialist to determine the most appropriate course of treatment.

question: What can be the reason for the rash which is itchy?I have am very skinny but have a larger butt that folds over, and underneath the fold on my left butt cheek, I have this round red rash that at times is very itchy. it is fit perfectly where my butt folds so I am not sure if it s rubbing and that s what caused it or what. this rash is nowhere else on my body. what could be causing this?
answer: There are several possible causes for an itchy rash on the buttocks. Some common causes include:Contact dermatitis: This occurs when the skin comes into contact with an irritant or allergen, causing redness, itching, and inflammation. This can be caused by things like soap, laundry detergent, or other chemicals that come into contact with the skin.Fungal infections: A fungal infection, such as athlete's foot or jock itch, can cause an itchy rash on the buttocks.Bacterial infections: A bacterial infection, such as folliculitis or impetigo, can cause redness, itching, and bumps on the skin.Allergic reactions: An allergic reaction to something that comes into contact with the skin, such as poison ivy or an insect bite, can cause an itchy rash.Sweating and moisture: If the skin is constantly moist and sweaty, it can lead to irritation and an itchy rash. This is often seen in people who are overweight, or who wear tight clothing that doesn't allow the skin to breathe.If the rash is persistent or causing significant discomfort, it is best to consult a healthcare provider for proper diagnosis and treatment. They can examine the rash and recommend the appropriate treatment based on the cause of the rash.

question: What could cause pain from lower back to the buttocks and legs?I have lower back pain when I wake up that spreads to both buttocksband legs. it is relieved by Howie movement. sometimes it is very painful to push when I have a bm. What could be wrong?
answer: There are several potential causes of lower back pain that radiates to the buttocks and legs. These can include:Herniated disc: A herniated disc occurs when the inner gel-like material of a spinal disc pushes out through a tear in the outer layer. This can cause pain, numbness, and weakness in the lower back, buttocks, and legs.Sciatica: This is a type of pain that occurs when the sciatic nerve, which runs from the lower back through the buttocks and down the legs, becomes compressed or irritated. Sciatica can cause pain, numbness, and tingling in the lower back, buttocks, and legs.Spinal stenosis: This is a condition in which the spaces within the spine narrow, putting pressure on the spinal cord and nerves. This can cause pain, numbness, and weakness in the lower back, buttocks, and legs.Piriformis syndrome: The piriformis muscle is located deep in the buttocks. If it becomes tight or inflamed, it can put pressure on the sciatic nerve and cause pain, numbness, and tingling in the lower back, buttocks, and legs.Muscular strains or sprains: Overuse or injury to the muscles in the lower back, buttocks, or legs can cause pain and discomfort.It's important to see a healthcare provider for a proper diagnosis and treatment plan. In the meantime, you can try applying heat or cold to the affected area, taking over-the-counter pain medication, and doing gentle stretches to help relieve the pain.

question: Q. Why is there weakness and back pain after delivery?Hi doctor,A few days back my wife felt weakness and back pain and today she felt too much pain in backbone while sitting and while laying down. This pain started after delivery. She cannot move fast. This time she is in pain and I am very upset about what to do. She is a child's mother so please help.
answer: It is not uncommon for women to experience weakness and back pain after giving birth. There are several potential causes for this. Some possible causes of weakness and back pain after delivery include:Hormonal changes: During pregnancy, the body produces higher levels of the hormone relaxin, which helps to relax the muscles and ligaments in the pelvis. After delivery, these hormone levels return to normal, which can lead to muscle weakness and back pain.Physical strain: Giving birth can be physically demanding, and the strain on the muscles and ligaments during delivery can lead to weakness and back pain.Posture changes: The weight of the baby during pregnancy can cause the spine to curve, which can lead to back pain after delivery.Dehydration: Dehydration can cause muscle weakness and fatigue, which can contribute to back pain.There are several things that your wife can do to help manage the weakness and back pain after delivery:Get plenty of rest: It is important for your wife to get as much rest as possible during the postpartum period to allow her body to heal and recover.Drink plenty of fluids: Dehydration can contribute to muscle weakness and fatigue, so it is important for your wife to drink plenty of fluids to stay hydrated.Take a warm bath or use a heating pad: A warm bath or a heating pad can help to relax the muscles and reduce back pain.Use over-the-counter pain medication: Over-the-counter pain medication such as acetaminophen (Tylenol) or ibuprofen (Advil) can help to reduce pain and inflammation.It is also important for your wife to see a doctor if the pain is severe or if it is not improving with home treatment. The doctor can assess the cause of the pain and recommend appropriate treatment.

Cysts can occur anywhere in the body and may feel hard or soft.A tumor: A tumor is an abnormal growth of cells. question: Any suggestion for having SGPT level of 133?My age is 42 and male. answer: Elevated levels of SGPT (serum glutamic-pyruvic transaminase), also known as alanine aminotransferase (ALT), can be a sign of liver damage or disease. In your case, it is possible that the dengue fever you had may have contributed to the elevation in your SGPT level.It is important to follow the advice of your healthcare provider and to undergo further testing to determine the underlying cause of your elevated SGPT. Treatment may involve medications, lifestyle changes, or in some cases, surgery.It is also important to maintain a healthy lifestyle, including eating a well-balanced diet, avoiding alcohol or limiting consumption, and exercising regularly to support liver health.

question: What does Flair signal abnormality in the periventricular white matter mean?I had an olfactory Meningioma removed in July 2011. answer: The periventricular white matter is a region of the brain that is located near the ventricles, which are fluid-filled cavities in the brain. An increase in T2 and FLAIR signal in this area can indicate the presence of abnormal tissue, such as scar tissue or inflammation. This could potentially be a sign of a problem, but it's important to note that these findings need to be interpreted in the context of the rest of the MRI and the patient's overall clinical presentation.It's also worth noting that the term "cortical involution changes" refers to changes in the thickness or density of the cortex, which is the outer layer of the brain. These changes can occur naturally with aging, but they can also be caused by other factors such as brain injury or disease.It's important to speak with your doctor about the results of your MRI and any potential implications they may have for your health. Wish you good health. Thanks.

question: What causes the hardness of the vein in the penis?On my penis the vein that runs up the very middle on the top, the dorsal vein maybe, is very very hard. from the very bottom of the penis to around 3/4 up towards the head, when erect it is even harder and feels similar to a guitar string. im also currently suffering ED, lacking morning erections and weak erections
answer: The hardness of the vein in the penis can be caused by various factors. One possible cause is the presence of blood within the vein, which can cause the vein to become more rigid and harder to the touch. This is a normal physiological response that occurs during an erection, as the blood flow to the penis increases and the veins constrict to help maintain the erection.Another possible cause of a hard vein in the penis could be a condition called Peyronie's disease, which is characterized by the formation of scar tissue within the penis. This scar tissue can cause the penis to bend or curve abnormally and can also cause the veins to become more prominent and harder.It's important to note that the presence of a hard vein in the penis alone is not necessarily a cause for concern, and it can be a normal variant in some individuals. However, if you are experiencing ED, lacking morning erections, and weak erections, it is important to speak with a healthcare provider to determine the underlying cause and discuss treatment options. It is also important to practice safe sex and use a condom to reduce the risk of sexually transmitted infections, which can cause ED and other problems with sexual function.
