answer: The consumption of gluten destroys the lining of the small intestine called mucosa. Consequently, essential vitamins and nutrients are not properly absorbed.

question: Diagnosed with celiac disease and have gluten allergyHi doctor, my father is diagnosed with celiac disease and was told he was allergic to gluten. It would be nice if u could give me an insight regarding the above said condition and gluten allergy.
answer: Celiac disease is an autoimmune disorder that affects the small intestine. It occurs when the immune system reacts to gluten, a protein found in wheat, barley, and rye, by damaging the lining of the small intestine. This can lead to problems with nutrient absorption and can cause a range of symptoms, including diarrhea, abdominal pain, bloating, and fatigue.It is important for individuals with celiac disease to follow a gluten-free diet to manage their condition and improve their symptoms. This means avoiding foods that contain wheat, barley, and rye, as well as any products that may have come into contact with these grains during processing.It is also important for individuals with celiac disease to be aware of hidden sources of gluten in their diet, such as medications, vitamins, and supplements that may contain gluten, as well as food additives and flavorings.If you have celiac disease, it is important to work with a healthcare professional, such as a dietitian, to develop a suitable gluten-free meal plan and to ensure that you are getting enough nutrients to maintain good health.

question: What causes brain freeze despite a normal blood report?I HAD BEEN CLEANING ALOT AND THEN I HAD LIKE A BRAIN FREEZE. LIKE WHEN YOU DRINK SOMETHING COLD AND YOU GRT THAT PAIN IN YOUR HEAD. I HAVE HAD MEDICATIONS CHANGED RECENTLY. COULD THAT BE IT. I HAD BLOODWORK DONE RECENTLY AND EVERYTHING WAS EXCELLENT. THAT WAS 2 WEEEKS AGO. I HAVE SEIZURE CONDITION AND ON MEDICATION FOR 14 YEARS. LAST SEIZURE WAS 2004 EEG NORMAL AND MRI NORMAL BUT I HAVE FAMILY HISTORY OF EPILESPY. SO WHAT COULD THIS BE
answer: Brain freeze, also known as ice cream headache or cold-stimulus headache, is a common type of headache that occurs when something cold touches the roof of your mouth, the back of your throat, or your tongue. It typically lasts only a few minutes and is not generally a cause for concern.There are several theories about what causes brain freeze, but the most likely explanation is that the rapid ingestion of cold substances causes a sudden constriction of blood vessels in the head and neck, leading to a reduction in blood flow to the brain. This temporary decrease in blood flow can cause a sensation of pain or discomfort.It is possible that your recent change in medications could be contributing to your brain freeze, although it is not the most likely cause. If you are concerned about this or any other side effects of your medications, you should speak with your healthcare provider for further evaluation and guidance.

question: What causes watery sperm?Hello doctor me and my partner would like to find out why his sperm is watery at times and does that have any affect on me falling pregnant because we have been trying to have a baby for some time now and it s not working I would be very grateful for your advise please . Thanks
answer: There are several possible causes for watery sperm, or semen that appears thin or diluted. These can include:Hydration levels: Dehydration can cause semen to be thinner and more watery.Ejaculation frequency: Men who ejaculate less frequently may have more watery sperm, as the prostate gland and seminal vesicles, which contribute to the production of semen, have more time to secrete fluids.Hormonal imbalances: Certain hormones, such as testosterone, play a role in the production of semen. A deficiency in these hormones can lead to thin, watery sperm.Infections or inflammation: Some infections or inflammation of the reproductive system, such as prostatitis or epididymitis, can cause changes in the consistency of semen.Medical conditions: Certain medical conditions, such as retrograde ejaculation or varicoceles, can also cause watery sperm.It's important to note that the appearance of semen can vary from person to person and can also change over time. If you're concerned about the consistency of your partner's sperm and its potential impact on fertility, it's a good idea to consult with a healthcare provider for further evaluation and guidance.

question: How to treat OCD and delusional issue?My daughter is covered by PeachCare. She has a problem with OCD and delusional issues. Washes her hands and her feet 30 - 50 times a day lies constantly, and I sees things that are not really happening believes there s bugs crawling on her. I m looking for help that my insurance will cover but not just someone who s going to give her medicine and leave her on her own. I believe this needs to be more in-depth care what do you think
answer: Obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) and delusions are serious mental health conditions that can significantly impact a person's daily life and well-being. It's important to seek professional help in order to address these issues and find appropriate treatment.Treatment for OCD and delusions often involves a combination of therapy and medication. Cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) is a type of therapy that can be particularly helpful for treating OCD. It involves working with a therapist to identify and challenge negative thoughts and behaviors, and to develop coping strategies to manage obsessive thoughts and compulsive behaviors.Medications, such as selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs) and antipsychotics, may also be used to help reduce obsessive thoughts, compulsive behaviors, and delusions. It's important to work with a mental health professional to determine the most appropriate treatment plan for your daughter, taking into account the specific symptoms she is experiencing and her overall health and well-being.It's also important to find a mental health provider who is willing to work with you and your daughter to address her needs in a comprehensive and holistic way. This may involve coordinating care with other healthcare professionals, such as a primary care physician or other specialists.PeachCare is a state-funded health insurance program in Georgia that provides coverage for low-income children and pregnant women. It's likely that PeachCare will cover the cost of therapy and medication for your daughter's mental health treatment. You can contact PeachCare directly to find out more about the specific services that are covered by your daughter's insurance plan.

question: Can symptoms of herp and strep be seen in 8 month old kids?Can symptoms of herpes ( 1 and 2) show up in my son 8 months after delivery? He had a severe diaper rash at a week old, thrush at 11 days old and now at 8 months he has these red spots on the roof of his mouth, a creamy white residue and red spots on tongue. Dr said the spots on roof of mouth look like it could be strep but said very rare in children this age.
answer: It is possible for a child to have symptoms of herpes or strep throat at any age, including at 8 months old. However, it is important to note that herpes and strep throat are two different infections caused by different viruses or bacteria.Herpes is caused by the herpes simplex virus (HSV) and can cause cold sores or genital sores. It is possible for a child to be infected with herpes at birth if the mother has genital herpes, but this is relatively rare. It is more common for children to become infected with herpes through close contact with someone who has an active herpes infection, such as through kissing or sharing utensils or cups.Strep throat is caused by the bacterium Streptococcus pyogenes and is a common infection that affects the throat and tonsils. It is most common in children between the ages of 5 and 15, but it can occur at any age. Strep throat is typically spread through close contact with an infected person, such as through coughing, sneezing, or sharing utensils or cups.The symptoms you have described, including red spots on the roof of the mouth and tongue and a creamy white residue, could potentially be caused by either herpes or strep throat. It is important to have your son examined by a healthcare provider to determine the cause of these symptoms and to receive appropriate treatment. The provider may need to perform a physical examination and possibly order some tests, such as a throat culture or a herpes test, to diagnose the cause of your son's symptoms.

The effectiveness of emergency contraception, such as Unwanted 72, can vary depending on a variety of factors, including the timing of when it is taken. question: What causes sudden numbness in right leg and arms?my wife s arms and right leg suddenly went numb and immobile she had no movement in her fingers or toes at all like limp spaghetti. They have done an MRI brain an MRA brain and spinal tap and all have come back negative can you think of any other testing that should be done to find out thecause.please note the movement in her hands and feet has come back intermittently. Your thoughts?
answer: There could be several potential causes for sudden numbness and weakness in the arms and legs. Some possible causes include:Stroke: A stroke is a medical emergency that occurs when blood flow to the brain is disrupted. This can cause numbness and weakness in the arms and legs, as well as other symptoms such as difficulty speaking, trouble seeing, and a sudden severe headache.Pinched nerve: A pinched nerve can cause numbness and weakness in the affected area. This can be caused by a herniated disc in the spine or other structural issues in the spine.Transient ischemic attack (TIA): Also known as a "mini-stroke," a TIA is a temporary disruption of blood flow to the brain. It can cause symptoms similar to a stroke, but they usually resolve within 24 hours.Multiple sclerosis (MS): MS is a chronic autoimmune disorder that affects the central nervous system. It can cause numbness and weakness in the arms and legs, as well as other symptoms such as fatigue, difficulty with balance and coordination, and problems with vision.Guillain-Barré syndrome: This is a rare autoimmune disorder that affects the nerves. It can cause weakness and numbness in the arms and legs, as well as other symptoms such as difficulty speaking and swallowing, and problems with bladder and bowel control.Peripheral neuropathy: This is a condition that affects the nerves outside of the brain and spinal cord. It can cause numbness, tingling, and weakness in the arms and legs.It's important for your wife to see a doctor as soon as possible to determine the cause of her symptoms and receive appropriate treatment. In addition to the tests that have already been done, the doctor may recommend other tests such as an electroencephalogram (EEG), electromyography (EMG), or nerve conduction studies to help diagnose the cause of the numbness and weakness.

question: Can I conceive while taking anti tubercular medicines?Dear doctor, I am 33 yrs old female having anti tubercular medicines for asymptomatic acites with mantoux test positive for 4 months, i am now taking Rcinex 600. i have to take it 2 more months according to my physician. Now i want to know if i can concieve during taking this medicine , is there any harm being pregnant?
answer: Hallow Dear,Tuberculosis affects the fertility by:1. Reducing general health. Mother nature has arranged our body functioning in such a way that whenever there is any risk to life, the reproductory function is jeopardized first. However, Tuberculosis is such commonly wide spread disease in India and still the population is increasing. By and large, Pulmonary tuberculosis in early stage does not affect fertility. 2. By affecting the Reproductory Organs: When there is Genital tuberculosis, the tubes and uterine lining (endometrium) get affected. Affected endometrium is not conducive for implantation of the fertilized ovum and hence pregnancy is not possible. When the tubes get affected, there is tubal block. Along with the tubal block, tubal musculature also gets affected causing dysfunction in the tubal motility. Therefore, even after the surgical correction of the tubal block, if the tubal peristaltic movements are affected, conception is not possible. This is called as Functional Tubal Block; i.e. physically patent still functionally blocked tubes. You are suffering from Tubercular ascites. There is a good chance that due to ascetic fluid and peritoneal tubercular infection, the tubes and uterus also may be affected. Ultrasonography also will be of use for the purpose. Once you are cured, get investigated for fertility potential. Even if you are unable to conceive, you can adopt a child - this will give you a desired child, the child will get parents and still the population will not be increased. I hope this helps you with relevant information. Dr. Nishikant ShrotriDr. Nishikant Shrotri

answer: Improving your concentration can be helpful in making better decisions. question: What causes lumps on hands and fingers?I have these bumps on my hands and fingers that are kind of spread out and on my elbows too. I recently found a cluster of the same bumps on my foot. answer: Some common causes include:Insect bites or stings: These can cause small, red lumps that may be itchy or painful.Contact dermatitis: This is a type of allergic reaction that can occur when the skin comes into contact with certain substances, such as chemicals, detergents, or plants. It can cause red, itchy lumps.Cysts: These are small, fluid-filled sacs that can form under the skin. They may be painless, but they can become infected if they are not treated.Lipomas: These are benign (non-cancerous) tumors that are made up of fat cells. They are usually soft and movable.Ganglion cysts: These are fluid-filled lumps that often occur on the wrist, but can also appear on the fingers. They are usually painless and can be treated with aspiration (draining the fluid) or surgery.It is difficult to determine the cause of your lumps without more information and a physical examination. question: What causes recurring throbbing pain in wrists?I have been getting an on and off severe throbbing pain in my wrists (usually right but sometimes left) and it feels like the pain is in my veins. It has been happening multiple times a day lately but used to come and go over a few days. What is this?
answer: There are a few possible causes of recurring throbbing pain in the wrists, including:Carpal tunnel syndrome: This is a common condition that occurs when the median nerve, which runs from the forearm into the hand, becomes compressed at the wrist. Symptoms include tingling, numbness, and pain in the wrist and hand.Tendinitis: This is an inflammation of the tendons in the wrist, which can cause pain and swelling.Arthritis: Osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, and other types of arthritis can cause inflammation in the joints, including the wrist, leading to pain and stiffness.Fractures: A fracture in the wrist can cause pain and swelling.Other conditions: Other conditions that can cause pain in the wrists include gout, nerve damage, and ganglion cysts.It's important to see a healthcare provider for an accurate diagnosis and appropriate treatment. question: What causes pleural effusion?Hi, I am Anisur Rahman. I had a pain in my right chest. My chest X ray says that RT cp blunt and mild pleurial effusion. ESR in blood test is 78. MT test and sputum test is negative. So what can be the causes of my problem? I am taking antibiotics cefuroxime 500 according to doctor s advice. Should I be very serious? I am afraid. Any suggestion about me?
answer: Pleural effusion is a condition in which fluid builds up in the space between the layers of tissue that line the lungs and the chest wall (pleural space). This can cause chest pain and difficulty breathing. There are several potential causes of pleural effusion, including:Heart failure: When the heart is not able to pump blood effectively, fluid can build up in the lungs and the pleural space.Lung infections: Pneumonia and other lung infections can cause inflammation and fluid accumulation in the pleural space.Cancer: Pleural effusion can be a symptom of certain types of cancer, such as lung cancer or breast cancer.Inflammatory conditions: Inflammatory conditions such as rheumatoid arthritis and lupus can cause pleural effusion.Other conditions: Pleural effusion can also be caused by other conditions, such as pulmonary embolism (a blockage in the blood vessels of the lung) and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).It is important to see a doctor if you are experiencing chest pain or difficulty breathing. Your doctor will be able to determine the cause of your pleural effusion and recommend appropriate treatment. The treatment may include medications, such as antibiotics or diuretics, to help reduce the fluid in the pleural space.

Clomiphene citrate is a medication that is commonly used to treat fertility problems in women who have polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS). It is taken by mouth and works by stimulating the release of certain hormones that help to regulate ovulation, the process by which an egg is released from the ovary.There is evidence to suggest that clomiphene citrate can be effective in helping women with PCOS to ovulate and become pregnant. However, it is important to note that fertility treatments, including clomiphene citrate, are not always successful and may not work for everyone. question: Suggest treatment for gall bladder conditionmy partner was told she had a ulcer or gall stones and is in hospital she has the camera down the throat and there was a lot of acid and bile she is on medication for this and was told she could eat and she tried and got major pain again in her stomach her friend told eating meat was not a good idea was the best diet for her
answer: Treatment for a gallbladder condition such as an ulcer or gallstones may vary depending on the specific condition and the severity of the symptoms. Some possible treatment options may include medications to reduce pain and inflammation, dietary changes to reduce the risk of gallstones, or surgery to remove the gallbladder.If your partner has an ulcer, the doctor may prescribe medications to reduce stomach acid production and promote healing of the ulcer. These may include proton pump inhibitors (PPIs) or H2 receptor antagonists.If your partner has gallstones, the doctor may recommend dietary changes to reduce the risk of further gallstones forming. This may involve avoiding high-fat foods and eating a diet that is low in cholesterol and rich in fruits, vegetables, and whole grains. Your partner's friend's suggestion to avoid meat may be a good idea, as a vegetarian or low-fat diet may help to reduce the risk of gallstones.If the gallbladder condition is severe or if the symptoms are not relieved with medications or dietary changes, surgery to remove the gallbladder (cholecystectomy) may be recommended. This can usually be done laparoscopically, which is a minimally invasive surgical procedure.It is important for your partner to follow the treatment plan recommended by the doctor and to report any new or worsening symptoms. It is also important for your partner to discuss any concerns or questions about the treatment with the doctor.

question: Been masturbating. Have abnormal albumin level. Normal Blood creatnine and Blood Urea Blood cholesterol. SuggestHey doctor. answer: There are small units of the kidney known as gromerular apparatus. answer: while in Active TB, This condition makes you sick and can spread to others. It can occur in the first few weeks after infection with the TB bacteria, or it might occur years later. Signs and symptoms of active TB includes coughing that lasts three or more weeks, Coughing up blood, pleuritic pain, or pain with breathing or coughing, Unintentional weight loss, Fatigue, Fever, Night sweats, and Loss of appetite.

question: What are the symptoms of potential tuberculosis?I had a TB skin test and was required to have a chest film.  Took this film on Wed, and the doctor called today leaving a message that I should come in to discuss the film.   I called but he step out for the weekend, and I was told by the secretary to come back on monday.  If the chest xray was positive for TB, should it be a more urgent call because I could expose others to TB?
answer: Tuberculosis (TB) is an infectious disease that is caused by the bacterium Mycobacterium tuberculosis. It most commonly affects the lungs, but it can also affect other parts of the body. The symptoms of TB vary depending on the part of the body that is affected.If the TB is in the lungs (pulmonary TB), the most common symptoms are:A persistent cough that lasts for more than three weeksCoughing up blood or sputum (phlegm from the lungs)Chest painShortness of breathWeakness or fatigueWeight lossLoss of appetiteNight sweatsIf the TB affects other parts of the body (extrapulmonary TB), the symptoms may vary depending on the location of the infection. For example, TB in the spinal cord (spinal TB) can cause back pain and weakness in the legs, while TB in the abdomen (abdominal TB) can cause abdominal pain and swelling.It is important to note that not everyone who has TB will have symptoms. In some cases, TB can be latent, which means that the bacteria are present in the body but are not causing symptoms. Latent TB is not contagious, but it can progress to active TB if it is not treated.If you have been exposed to TB or are at high risk for TB, you may have been given a TB skin test or a chest x-ray to check for the presence of the bacteria. If you have a positive TB skin test or a chest x-ray that suggests the presence of TB, it is important to follow up with your healthcare provider as soon as possible. It is also important to avoid close contact with others until you have been evaluated and, if necessary, treated to prevent the spread of TB.

This is because iron can irritate the lining of the digestive system and slow down the movement of stool through the intestines. If your wife is experiencing constipation while taking iron supplements, there are several things she can try to help alleviate the symptoms:Drink plenty of fluids: Staying hydrated can help to soften the stool and make it easier to pass.Eat a high-fiber diet: Foods high in fiber, such as fruits, vegetables, and whole grains, can help to add bulk to the stool and promote regular bowel movements.Take a stool softener or laxative: Over-the-counter medications, such as docusate or lactulose, can help to soften the stool and stimulate bowel movements.Exercise regularly: Physical activity can help to stimulate the digestive system and promote regular bowel movements.Consult a doctor: If your wife is experiencing persistent constipation despite trying these remedies, it's important to consult a healthcare professional. They can assess the cause of the constipation and recommend appropriate treatment.As for which iron supplement your wife should take, it's important to consult a healthcare professional for personalized recommendations. There are several different types of iron supplements available, and the best one for your wife will depend on the cause of her low hemoglobin levels and her overall health. A healthcare professional will be able to assess your wife's specific needs and recommend an appropriate treatment plan.

It is also possible that your neurologist is ordering blood tests to confirm the diagnosis of MS or to rule out other conditions that may be causing your symptoms.It is important to remember that a diagnosis of MS is typically made based on a combination of factors, including your medical history, a physical examination, and the results of various tests, including blood tests, imaging studies, and nerve conduction studies. question: What is the treatment for blood in semen?I am 30 yrs old and have been masturbating for many years. recently i experienced blood in my semen. there was no pain or any other symptom. I have just got a urine test done and it shows a minor bacterial infection.please suggest possible cuases and whether it needs further investigation. I am a fit individual otherwise.
answer: It is not uncommon for men to experience blood in their semen, also known as hematospermia, at some point in their lives. In many cases, the cause of hematospermia is unknown and resolves on its own without any treatment. However, it is important to speak with a healthcare provider to determine the cause and rule out any underlying serious conditions.There are several possible causes of hematospermia, including:Infection: A bacterial infection of the prostate, bladder, or urinary tract can cause hematospermia.Inflammation: Inflammation of the prostate, seminal vesicles, or other reproductive organs can cause hematospermia.Trauma: Injuries to the prostate, bladder, or other reproductive organs can cause hematospermia.Abnormal blood vessels: Abnormal blood vessels in the prostate or other reproductive organs can cause hematospermia.Cancer: Rarely, hematospermia can be a sign of cancer of the prostate or other reproductive organs.It is important to speak with a healthcare provider to determine the cause of hematospermia and receive appropriate treatment. Your healthcare provider may recommend further testing, such as a physical exam, blood tests, urine tests, or imaging tests (such as ultrasound or CT scan).In most cases, treatment for hematospermia depends on the underlying cause. If an infection is the cause, treatment may involve antibiotics. If inflammation is the cause, treatment may involve anti-inflammatory medications or other medications to manage symptoms. If cancer is the cause, treatment may involve surgery, radiation therapy, or chemotherapy.It is important to practice safe sex and to maintain good hygiene to reduce the risk of infections and other conditions that can cause hematospermia. If you are experiencing any other symptoms or concerns, it is important to speak with a healthcare provider for further evaluation and treatment.

question: Treatment for bilateral toe ulcer while having type 2 diabetes49yr old female type2 diabetes for 7 yrs...having an bilateral great toe ulcer, non healing for last 1 year. Right:1/2cm left: 3/4 cm Margins irregular HbA1c:9.0% VPT: grossly impaired doppler: normal ABI: Right- 1.01 , Left 0.92 What are the plans regarding treatment of ulcer
answer: Treatment of bilateral toe ulcers in a patient with type 2 diabetes can be complex and may involve a combination of strategies. Here are some potential treatment options that your healthcare provider may consider:Offloading: It is important to take the pressure off the ulcerated area to allow for proper healing. This can be achieved by using special shoes or inserts that redistribute weight away from the affected toes.Debridement: Dead or damaged tissue around the ulcer may need to be removed (debrided) to allow for proper healing. This can be done through surgical or non-surgical means.Wound dressings: A variety of wound dressings may be used to protect the ulcer and keep it moist, which can facilitate healing. These may include hydrocolloid dressings, foam dressings, or alginate dressings.Infection management: If the ulcer is infected, antibiotics may be prescribed to clear the infection.Blood sugar control: Good blood sugar control is essential for proper wound healing. Your healthcare provider may adjust your diabetes medications or insulin regimen to help achieve better blood sugar control.Vascular assessment: The decreased blood flow to your toes (as indicated by the abnormal ankle-brachial index) may be contributing to the slow healing of the ulcers. Your healthcare provider may refer you to a vascular specialist for further assessment and possible treatment.It is important to follow the treatment plan recommended by your healthcare provider and to keep all follow-up appointments. Proper care of the ulcers can help to prevent further complications and improve healing.

question: What causes difficulty in conceiving?I have married in 2 year.my age 25 husbannd age 27 i have trying to a conceive .i have take pfofrt f tablet for 3 month.but not conceive.i have already checked my harmones,thairoid also.but no problem.all very good & normal.but why naot conceive.please help me
answer: Some common causes of infertility in women include hormonal imbalances, problems with the reproductive system (such as uterine fibroids, polycystic ovary syndrome, or endometriosis), and certain medical conditions (such as obesity, diabetes, or autoimmune diseases). It is also possible that the cause of the fertility issue may be unknown or may be a combination of several factors.It is important to keep in mind that it can take time to conceive, and many couples will experience some difficulty getting pregnant. The probability of getting pregnant naturally decreases as a woman gets older, so if you are over 35 years old, it may take longer to conceive. It is also important to consider your lifestyle and habits, as certain behaviors such as smoking, alcohol consumption, and drug use can affect fertility.If you and your husband have been trying to conceive for at least one year without success, it may be helpful to consult with a healthcare provider or fertility specialist to discuss potential causes and treatment options. They can help you identify any potential issues and recommend a plan for moving forward.

question: What causes inflamed gums?i have an inflamed gum area behind the last upper tooth...feels like im biting my gum when i close my teeth together and it pains when i eat...what can i do to ease the discomfort...the area has small bumps as if rashed...i think i must have eaten something and it irritated my mouth...mangos perhaps
answer: There are several potential causes of inflamed gums, including:Gingivitis: This is a common form of gum inflammation that is caused by the buildup of plaque and tartar on the teeth. It can cause red, swollen gums that bleed easily.Periodontitis: This is a more serious form of gum disease that occurs when the gums become infected and pull away from the teeth. It can cause pain, bleeding, and tooth loss if left untreated.Dental abscess: A dental abscess is a pocket of pus that forms in the gum tissue as a result of a bacterial infection. It can cause severe pain, swelling, and fever.Oral cancer: In rare cases, inflamed gums may be a sign of oral cancer. This is more likely to occur in older individuals or those who use tobacco products.To ease the discomfort of inflamed gums, you can try rinsing your mouth with warm salt water, taking over-the-counter pain medication, and avoiding foods that are hot, spicy, or acidic. If the inflammation persists or is severe, you should see a dentist or oral healthcare provider for treatment. They will be able to diagnose the cause of your inflamed gums and recommend appropriate treatment.

question: Is there any research to link motor tics to flu vaccine?My 10 year old son has been diagnosed with a motor tic disorder and PANDAS. This started last year in December. He has severe motor tics. Is there any reasearch to link this to flu vaccine? I have just realized that his symptoms were preceeded by a flu shot last year. His symptoms worsened this year after getting a flu shot.
answer: There is no scientific evidence to suggest that the flu vaccine causes motor tics or PANDAS (Pediatric Autoimmune Neuropsychiatric Disorders Associated with Streptococcal Infections). The flu vaccine is a safe and effective way to protect against influenza, a potentially serious respiratory illness that can lead to hospitalization and even death.PANDAS is a rare condition that is thought to be caused by an autoimmune response to a streptococcal infection, such as strep throat. The exact cause of PANDAS is not fully understood, and it is not caused by vaccines. Motor tics are involuntary, repetitive movements or sounds that can be a symptom of a number of different conditions, including Tourette syndrome, which is a neurological disorder that can cause tics and other behavioral problems.It is important to note that temporal associations, such as the occurrence of symptoms after receiving a vaccine, do not necessarily imply a causal relationship. It is possible that the flu vaccine and your son's symptoms occurred at the same time by coincidence.If you have concerns about your son's health, it is important to speak with his healthcare provider. They can help you understand the cause of his symptoms and provide appropriate treatment.

question: What causes tiredness and breathlessness after pleurisy?I recently had mild pleurisy and i was on antibiotics for a week, its been over a month since i was back to myself but im still feeling tired and my breathing isnt the same as it was before i had pleurisy, i feel breathless and my heart beats faster all the time i have started a cough that wont seem to go, im worried.
answer: Pleurisy is an inflammation of the pleural lining, which is the thin membrane that surrounds the lungs and lines the chest cavity. It is typically caused by an infection, such as pneumonia or a viral respiratory infection, but it can also be caused by other factors, such as a lung injury or a disease that affects the pleural lining, such as cancer or lupus.It's not uncommon for people to experience tiredness and breathlessness after recovering from pleurisy. This can be due to a number of factors, including the underlying cause of the pleurisy, the severity of the inflammation, and any other underlying health conditions that you may have.If you are still experiencing tiredness and breathlessness after recovering from pleurisy, it is important to speak to your healthcare provider. They will be able to determine the cause of your symptoms and recommend treatment options to help you feel better. In the meantime, it is important to get plenty of rest and to stay hydrated. If your cough is persistent or accompanied by other symptoms, such as fever or chest pain, it is important to see your healthcare provider as soon as possible.

question: Suggest treatment for low potassium levelMy father was recently detected with low potassium as went still when we took him to the hospital.  After being admistered with oral and IV potassium he was discharged from the hospital with 3.4 level of potassium.  he also gave oral medication for taking patassium.  After the 4 day we have sent his blood for tests and now his potassium is showing 6.3 .  Ha also had fever and cough because of which he is taking dualin and buedecort.
answer: Low potassium levels, also known as hypokalemia, can be treated with oral potassium supplements or intravenous (IV) potassium. The treatment will depend on the severity of the hypokalemia and any underlying causes. If your father's potassium levels have already been corrected and are now in the normal range, it is important to continue taking any prescribed medications and to follow a healthy diet that includes foods rich in potassium, such as bananas, avocados, nuts, and leafy green vegetables.It is also important to identify and treat any underlying causes of the hypokalemia. This may involve addressing any medical conditions or medications that may be contributing to the low potassium levels. If your father is taking medications for fever and cough, it is important to discuss the potential side effects of these medications with his healthcare provider, as some medications can cause low potassium levels as a side effect.It is important to follow up with your father's healthcare provider to monitor his potassium levels and ensure that they remain in the normal range. The healthcare provider may recommend additional treatment or lifestyle changes if needed to help maintain normal potassium levels.

question: What could abdominal cramps during menses cycle suggest?Hello doctor,I am a 25 yr old female, married and have a 9 month old baby. I am on my midcycle now (35 days menstrual cycle). I have been experiencing cramps in my lower abdomen and back pain for the last 3 days. The cramps are mild but remain throughout the day and get worsened after doing some strenuous work. Please advise.
answer: Abdominal cramps during the menstrual cycle, also known as dysmenorrhea, are a common experience for many women. There are two types of dysmenorrhea: primary and secondary. Primary dysmenorrhea is the most common type and is caused by contractions of the uterus during menstruation. These contractions can cause pain and cramping in the lower abdomen and back. Secondary dysmenorrhea is caused by an underlying medical condition, such as endometriosis or uterine fibroids.If you are experiencing mild to moderate abdominal cramps during your menstrual cycle, it is likely due to primary dysmenorrhea. These cramps can be managed with over-the-counter pain medication, such as ibuprofen or acetaminophen, or by using heat therapy on the lower abdomen. Exercise, such as walking or stretching, may also help to alleviate cramping.If your cramps are severe or if you experience other symptoms, such as heavy bleeding or irregular periods, it is important to speak with a healthcare provider. These symptoms could be signs of an underlying medical condition that requires further evaluation and treatment.

question: Suggest remedy for oral thrush while on FloventI have thrush, have been sick with The flu and a cold for ten days and using a Flovent inhaler twice a day. My throat has been sore but I was so miserable I didn't look in my mouth. I just started feeling better and realized this is going on. Is there a home treatment I can start tonight?
answer: Oral thrush is a fungal infection that affects the mouth and throat. It can be caused by a variety of factors, including certain medications, such as inhaled corticosteroids like Flovent. If you have been using your Flovent inhaler as directed and have developed oral thrush, it is important to speak with your healthcare provider. They can recommend the best course of treatment for your specific situation.In the meantime, there are some things you can try at home to help relieve the symptoms of oral thrush:Rinse your mouth with saltwater: Dissolve 1/2 teaspoon of salt in 8 ounces of warm water, and rinse your mouth with the solution several times a day. This can help to reduce swelling and discomfort.Use a humidifier: Keeping the air in your home moist can help to alleviate dryness in your throat and mouth, which can be a contributing factor to thrush.Avoid acidic or sugary foods: These types of foods can irritate your throat and make the symptoms of thrush worse.Practice good oral hygiene: Brush your teeth twice a day with a soft-bristled toothbrush and floss daily to remove any food particles or plaque that may be irritating your mouth.Drink plenty of fluids: Stay well hydrated by drinking water, clear broths, and other fluids to help keep your mouth moist and prevent dryness.It is important to continue using your Flovent inhaler as directed until your healthcare provider advises you to stop. If your symptoms do not improve or if they get worse, be sure to contact your healthcare provider for further evaluation and treatment.

question: What causes lumps inside the ankle after chemo for mastectomy?I had stage 1 ERPR pos, HER2 pos with a bilateral mastectomy in Aug. last year.  The borders were clear and I had 6 sessions of chemo, 17 o Herceptin, and have been on Tamoxifen for more than a year.  I have a small(about the size of a BB) lump near the inside bone of my ankle. answer: It's possible that the lump in your ankle could be a side effect of chemotherapy or the medications you are taking for your breast cancer. Chemotherapy and other cancer treatments can sometimes cause swelling and fluid accumulation in the body, including in the ankles. This is known as peripheral edema.It's also possible that the lump could be something else entirely, such as a cyst or a benign (noncancerous) tumor. Without further information or a physical examination, it's difficult to say exactly what might be causing the lump in your ankle.I recommend that you speak with your oncologist or primary care doctor about the lump. They will be able to assess your symptoms and determine the best course of action. It's important to have any unusual lumps or bumps checked out by a medical professional, especially if you have a history of cancer.

question: Suggest remedy for pain after L1 compression fractureMy father had a L1 compression fracture when he fall down . It is already 3 days he is having pain when walking or sitting but not very severe. He has taken less food but no vomiting or fever. the local doctor gave pain killer and advised bed rest he is 80 years old. how can we make him comfortable.
answer: There are several things you can do to help your father feel more comfortable after a L1 compression fracture:Encourage him to follow his doctor's recommendations for bed rest and pain management. This may include taking prescribed pain medication as directed and avoiding activities that put strain on the fractured vertebra.Offer support and assistance with daily activities, such as bathing, dressing, and eating.Make sure he has plenty of comfortable pillows to support his back while he sits and sleeps.Encourage him to move around as much as possible, within the limits of his pain and discomfort. Gentle stretches and exercises can help improve circulation and prevent muscle atrophy.Consider using hot and cold compresses to help reduce pain and swelling.Help him maintain good nutrition by preparing healthy meals and encouraging him to drink plenty of fluids.Provide emotional support and encouragement during his recovery. It's normal to feel frustrated and anxious after a fracture, so be patient and understanding.It's important to continue following up with your father's healthcare team to ensure that his fracture is healing properly and to address any additional concerns or issues that may arise.

question: What causes stabbing pain in left lower abdomen?I have a stabbing pain in my lower left back and pain in the left lower abdomen. I am thinking kidneys or bladder. question: What causes dreams that are leading to depression and anxiety?i have a reoccurring dream that i am shot and go to places that people i care about live or i will go to my place and write a letter saying goodbye to my family, i wake up crying and can not fall asleep afterwards, in the dream i feel the pain and it seems so real that when i wake up i check myself for injuries does this mean anything

question: What causes chest pain the day after drinking alcohol?Hi, I am 20 years old, I have been getting pain on the left side of my chest randomly for over a year now and it sometimes goes down my left arm. I went to the doctor and got an ecg done but it was normal. It happens a lot after a night of drinking alcohol. It can be sharp pain or a feel like something is pushing down on my chest. I don't know what to think about it.
answer: Chest pain after drinking alcohol can have several potential causes. One possible cause is alcohol-induced gastritis, which is inflammation of the lining of the stomach that can cause abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting. Alcohol can also irritate the esophagus, leading to heartburn or chest pain. It is also possible that the chest pain is unrelated to the alcohol consumption and could be due to other underlying health conditions.It is important to see a doctor for a thorough evaluation if you are experiencing chest pain, especially if it is persistent or severe. The doctor will be able to determine the cause of the chest pain and recommend appropriate treatment. In the meantime, it may be helpful to avoid drinking alcohol or to limit your intake to reduce the risk of experiencing chest pain.

question: How can varicocele and erectile dysfunction be treated?Hi i had a question about varicoceles. I have had a pain since the last quarter of last year. Ive gone to the ER 2 times and they did not find anything. The third they gave me antibiotics but they proved ineffective. The pain is still there, the vains feel like worms and i have trouble with erections. What should i do ?
answer: Varicoceles are enlarged veins in the scrotum that can cause pain and may also lead to fertility problems in men. Erectile dysfunction is the inability to achieve or maintain an erection sufficient for sexual activity.There are several treatment options for varicoceles and erectile dysfunction, including:Surgical repair of the varicocele: This involves tying off the affected veins to improve blood flow and reduce pain.Medications: Your doctor may recommend medications to treat the underlying cause of your erectile dysfunction, such as phosphodiesterase inhibitors (e.g. sildenafil) or penile injections.Lifestyle changes: Making healthy lifestyle changes, such as exercising regularly and not smoking, can improve blood flow and may help with both varicoceles and erectile dysfunction.It's important to see a healthcare provider for a proper diagnosis and treatment plan. They will be able to determine the cause of your pain and recommend the most appropriate treatment options for you.

question: What is the line of treatment for lump on chest due to changes of bilateral bronchitis and perihilar congestion ?Hi doc My maids son is 5 yrs of age and has a lump on left side of his chest.... He was adviced an ex ray ... The conclusion of the report is ....changes of bilateral bronchitis and perihilar congestion.... Can u pls tell me what that means and the line to treatment

question: What is the line of treatment for lump on chest due to changes of bilateral bronchitis and perihilar congestion ?Hi doc My maids son is 5 yrs of age and has a lump on left side of his chest.... He was adviced an ex ray ... The conclusion of the report is ....changes of bilateral bronchitis and perihilar congestion.... Can u pls tell me what that means and the line to treatment
answer: Bilateral bronchitis refers to inflammation of the bronchi (the large airways in the lungs) on both sides of the chest. Perihilar congestion refers to swelling and inflammation in the area around the hila (the point where the bronchi enter the lungs). These conditions can be caused by a variety of factors, such as respiratory infections, allergies, or environmental irritants.The line of treatment for these conditions will depend on the specific cause and the severity of the symptoms. Treatment options may include:Antibiotics: If the bronchitis is caused by a bacterial infection, your doctor may prescribe antibiotics to help kill the bacteria and clear the infection.Bronchodilators: These medications can help open up the airways and make it easier to breathe. They may be taken by inhaler or nebulizer (a device that delivers medication as a fine mist).Corticosteroids: If the bronchitis is severe or persistent, your doctor may prescribe corticosteroids to reduce inflammation in the airways. These medications may be taken by inhaler, pill, or injection.Mucolytics: These medications can help thin and loosen mucus in the airways, making it easier to cough up and clear.Oxygen therapy: If your child is having trouble breathing, they may need supplemental oxygen to help increase the amount of oxygen in their blood.Chest physiotherapy: This treatment involves using techniques such as vibration, coughing, and deep breathing to help clear mucus from the airways.It's important to follow your doctor's recommendations and take all prescribed medications as directed. If your child's symptoms are severe or persist despite treatment, your doctor may refer you to a specialist (such as a pediatric pulmonologist) for further evaluation and management.

question: What causes high sgpt and sgot levels?hi i am 40 year male i have burning in left upper side of stomach my sgpt 196 & Sgot 146, i have take u dilip 300 one month  what my sgpt 156 & Sgot 132 , in ultrasound liver is showing fatty 1 , my doctor is not find the cause why my sgpt & sgot or high
answer: Elevated levels of SGPT (serum glutamic pyruvic transaminase) and SGOT (serum glutamic oxaloacetic transaminase) are often indicators of liver damage or dysfunction. These enzymes are found primarily in the liver, but they can also be present in small amounts in other organs such as the heart, pancreas, and kidneys. Some common causes include viral hepatitis (such as hepatitis A, B, or C), excessive alcohol consumption, nonalcoholic fatty liver disease, certain medications or toxins, and autoimmune liver diseases. In some cases, the cause of elevated SGPT and SGOT levels may not be clear. It is important to work with a healthcare provider to determine the underlying cause and receive appropriate treatment.

question: How to get rid of cut marks and acne marks?Hi, I m prakash. I have a problem related to my face . There are too many cut-marks and akne marks on my face. I have already tried so many fairness cream and beauty product to remove those but they does not effect on the marks. Please, suggest me better suggestion for this
answer: There are a few things you can try to help reduce the appearance of scars and acne marks on your face:Use over-the-counter topical creams containing ingredients such as salicylic acid, glycolic acid, or retinoids. These can help to exfoliate the skin and promote the growth of new, healthy skin cells.Use a gentle, non-abrasive facial scrub or alpha hydroxy acid (AHA) product to exfoliate the skin. This can help to remove dead skin cells and improve the overall texture and tone of your skin.Consider trying a chemical peel, which uses a solution to remove the top layers of skin, revealing newer, smoother skin underneath.Use a skin-lightening product containing ingredients such as hydroquinone or kojic acid to help fade hyperpigmentation and uneven skin tone.Avoid picking at pimples or squeezing pimples, as this can worsen acne and lead to scarring.Protect your skin from the sun by wearing a broad-spectrum sunscreen with an SPF of 30 or higher. Sun exposure can worsen hyperpigmentation and scarring.Consider seeing a dermatologist or other skin care professional for treatment options such as laser therapy, microdermabrasion, or other medical procedures. These treatments can be more effective at reducing the appearance of scars and acne marks, but they may be more expensive and may require multiple treatments.It's important to note that it can take time for scars and acne marks to fade, and results may vary depending on the individual. It's also important to be patient and consistent with your skin care routine, as it can take several weeks or even months to see improvement.

question: Do i have PTB if my chest x-ray shows minimal PTB?I had 6 months treatment for my ptb and the last result of my sputum test is already negative, yesterday i  went to the hospital for xray as requested by my employer and the result is still the same ptb minimal.  Do i still have ptb and is it again contagious after 6 months of treatment
answer: At present, you are mostly having old, healed, fibrotic lesion on chest x ray. After six months of treatment, active tb lesions on chest x ray heal. Healing takes place mostly in the form of fibrosis, calcification or both (fibro calcification). Complete resolution is rare in tuberculosis. So these healed areas appear as scar lesion on chest x ray. They will be seen as it is for lifetime. So presence of this fibrotic lesion is not suggestive of tuberculosis. Your sputum report is also negative. So you are mostly having healed lesion and not having active tb lesion. But if you really want to rule out active tuberculosis then get done CT thorax and bronchoscopy with BAL (bronchoalveolar lavage) analysis. I will be happy to help you further. Wish you good health. Thanks.

question: Do i have PTB if my chest x-ray shows minimal PTB?I had 6 months treatment for my ptb and the last result of my sputum test is already negative, yesterday i  went to the hospital for xray as requested by my employer and the result is still the same ptb minimal.  Do i still have ptb and is it again contagious after 6 months of treatment
answer: Pulmonary tuberculosis (PTB) is a bacterial infection that affects the lungs. It is caused by the bacterium Mycobacterium tuberculosis. PTB can be latent (inactive) or active. Latent PTB means that you have the bacteria in your body, but it is not causing any symptoms and is not contagious. Active PTB means that the bacteria are actively growing and multiplying in your body, and you may experience symptoms such as coughing, chest pain, and difficulty breathing. If you have had a positive sputum test and were diagnosed with PTB, it is likely that you received treatment to kill the bacteria and prevent the disease from becoming active.If your chest X-ray shows minimal PTB, it may mean that the bacteria are still present in your body but are not causing active disease. This could be because you are still receiving treatment or because the infection is latent. In either case, it is important to continue taking your medication as prescribed by your healthcare provider to ensure that the bacteria are completely eliminated from your body.It is also important to note that even if you are no longer experiencing symptoms and your sputum test is negative, you may still be able to transmit the bacteria to others if you are not taking your medication as prescribed. Therefore, it is important to continue taking your medication as directed by your healthcare provider to ensure that you remain non-contagious. If you have any concerns about your treatment or your risk of transmitting the disease to others, it is important to speak with your healthcare provider.

question: What causes pressure like pain while laughing?I get a significant pressure/tightening type pain when I laugh. Just now started. Not typically a smoker, will have a couple cigarettes if I have had a few extra drinks on the weekends or something. Have had a bit of a dry cough for a few days, but nothing persistent. Have never had this before. What could it be?
answer: There are a few possible reasons why you might experience pressure or pain while laughing. Here are a few possibilities:Muscle strain: Laughing can involve a lot of muscle movement, particularly in the abdominal and chest muscles. If you have strained these muscles, you may experience pain or discomfort while laughing.Chest infection: If you have a chest infection, such as pneumonia or bronchitis, you may experience pain while laughing due to the increased pressure on your chest and lungs.Acid reflux: If you have acid reflux, laughing may exacerbate your symptoms by increasing pressure on your stomach and causing acid to travel up your esophagus.Heart problems: In rare cases, chest pain while laughing could be a sign of a more serious problem, such as a heart attack or angina. If you are experiencing chest pain that is severe or persistent, or if you have other symptoms such as shortness of breath, nausea, or dizziness, it is important to seek medical attention as soon as possible.It's always a good idea to consult with a healthcare professional if you are experiencing unusual or persistent pain or discomfort, to determine the cause and receive appropriate treatment.

question: Suffering from indigestion. Any suggestions ?I have been suffering from indigestion , pllz givem the solution for that.
answer: Indigestion, also known as dyspepsia, is a common digestive disorder that can cause discomfort or pain in the stomach. It is often accompanied by symptoms such as bloating, heartburn, and nausea.There are a number of things you can try to relieve indigestion:Avoid trigger foods: Certain foods and drinks, such as fatty or spicy foods, caffeine, and alcohol, can contribute to indigestion. Try to avoid or limit these foods to see if your symptoms improve.Eat smaller, more frequent meals: Overeating or eating too quickly can cause indigestion. Try eating smaller, more frequent meals throughout the day to allow your stomach time to digest.Avoid lying down after eating: Try to wait at least three hours after eating before lying down or going to bed. This can help prevent the reflux of stomach acid into the esophagus.Stay upright after eating: Sitting up or standing can help keep stomach acid in the stomach, where it belongs.Try over-the-counter remedies: Antacids, such as Tums or Rolaids, can help neutralize stomach acid and provide temporary relief. H-2 receptor blockers, such as Zantac or Pepcid, can also help reduce acid production in the stomach.If your indigestion persists or is accompanied by other symptoms, such as weight loss, difficulty swallowing, or black stools, it is important to see a doctor for further evaluation.

question: What causes pain in the flank region?I have dull flank pain, both sides of my back just under rib cage. Went to emergency room the other night and Urine sample and bloodwork turned out  good and xrays were clear.  made doctors appointment  and just trying to do some research ahead of visit.
answer: There are several possible causes of pain in the flank region, which is the area on either side of the spine between the lower ribcage and the pelvis. Some possible causes include:Kidney stones: One of the most common causes of flank pain is kidney stones, which are hard deposits that can form in the kidneys and cause pain when they move through the urinary tract.Urinary tract infection: A urinary tract infection (UTI) can cause pain in the flank region, as well as other symptoms such as a frequent urge to urinate, pain or burning during urination, and cloudy or foul-smelling urine.Muscular or skeletal problems: Pain in the flank region can also be caused by problems with the muscles, bones, or joints in the back or pelvis, such as a strained muscle, a herniated disk, or osteoarthritis.Digestive issues: Abdominal conditions such as inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) or diverticulitis can cause pain in the flank region.It's important to see a healthcare provider for a proper diagnosis and treatment of your pain. They will be able to examine you, order any necessary tests, and determine the cause of your pain.

question: Constant pain for thornwald't cystI have a Thornwalt cyst 7m and I have had it since 2004. I am in constant pain, my spine is very sensitive and my neck also. I have not been able to work at all. They have not found anything wrong with my back?? Could this be cause by the Cyst??
answer: A Thornwaldt cyst is a rare, benign cyst that can occur in the nasopharynx, which is the area at the back of the nasal cavity and above the throat. These cysts can cause a variety of symptoms, including nasal congestion, sinusitis, headache, and ear pain. It is possible that the Thornwaldt cyst could be causing some of the pain and sensitivity you are experiencing in your spine and neck, although it is also possible that there could be other underlying causes for these symptoms.It is important to speak with a healthcare professional about your symptoms and any potential underlying causes. They can perform a thorough examination and order any necessary tests to help determine the cause of your pain and develop a treatment plan. This may include referral to a specialist, such as an otolaryngologist (ear, nose, and throat specialist) or a neurologist (a doctor who specializes in conditions of the nervous system).It is also important to remember that pain is a subjective experience and can be influenced by a variety of factors, including physical, emotional, and psychological. Seeking the advice of a healthcare professional and possibly working with a pain management specialist can be helpful in managing your pain and improving your quality of life.

question: Q. What causes severe toothache at night?Hello doctor,I am facing a toothache problem, especially at night times. There is higher pain from the last three days. Please suggest me a solution for toothache problem.
answer: There are several possible causes of severe toothache at night:Cavities: Toothaches are often caused by cavities, which are small holes in the teeth that can be caused by a buildup of plaque and bacteria. Cavities can be especially painful at night because there is less saliva in the mouth, which can help to neutralize the acid produced by bacteria.Infection: Toothaches can also be caused by an infection in the tooth or the surrounding gum tissue. Infections can be caused by bacteria that enter the tooth through a cavity or a crack in the tooth.Gum disease: Gum disease, or periodontal disease, can cause toothaches. This is an infection of the gums that can cause inflammation and pain in the teeth and gums.Tooth grinding: Tooth grinding, also known as bruxism, can cause toothaches. This occurs when a person grinds their teeth together, often while they are sleeping.Tooth trauma: Tooth trauma, such as a chipped or broken tooth, can cause toothaches.To find relief from a toothache, you should see a dentist as soon as possible. They will be able to diagnose the cause of the toothache and recommend appropriate treatment, which may include filling a cavity, treating an infection, or repairing a broken tooth. In the meantime, you can try using over-the-counter pain medication to help alleviate the pain.

It is also important to inform your healthcare provider about your history of thyroid and PCOS, as these conditions may need to be managed during pregnancy.If you are unable to see a healthcare provider right away, you can take some precautions to protect your health and the health of your baby. It is important to avoid smoking and alcohol, as these can be harmful to a developing baby. You should also avoid certain medications and foods that could be harmful to a developing baby. It is also important to eat a healthy diet and get enough rest.If you have any concerns or questions about your pregnancy, it is important to speak with a healthcare provider. question: Q. What should I do to manage the fear of death?Hello doctor,Recently after watching a video of a young person dying of heart attack, I have developed a fear of death. Although I am young and have no heart problems, I tend to think about it all the time. Please help me to get rid of this.
answer: Hello. Here are two kinds of fears or phobias. 1) Temporary. 2) Permanent. Temporary lasts for few days after you suffer or witness some traumatic thing. Permanent ones would slightly fall under some psychiatric issues worth paying attention. I would recommend you to wait for some time. Try deep breathing, meditation and running. Everything should be settled by two weeks. If it does not, then consult a psychiatrist for proper evaluation and treatment.

question: Q. What should I do to manage the fear of death?Hello doctor,Recently after watching a video of a young person dying of heart attack, I have developed a fear of death. Although I am young and have no heart problems, I tend to think about it all the time. Please help me to get rid of this.
answer: It's understandable that you might be feeling worried and anxious about death after seeing a video of someone dying from a heart attack, especially if you are young and don't have any health problems. Here are a few things you can try to manage your fear of death:Seek support from loved ones: Talk to someone you trust about your feelings. It can be helpful to have someone to listen and provide comfort and support.Practice self-care: Make sure to take care of your physical and mental health by getting enough sleep, eating well, and engaging in activities that you enjoy and that help you relax.Engage in relaxation techniques: Try practicing relaxation techniques such as deep breathing, progressive muscle relaxation, or meditation. These can help you reduce stress and anxiety.Seek professional help: If your fear of death is affecting your daily life and you are struggling to manage it on your own, consider seeking help from a mental health professional. They can help you address your concerns and develop coping strategies.Remember, it's natural to have thoughts about death and to worry about what might happen in the future. However, it's important to try to focus on the present moment and the things you can control, rather than dwelling on negative thoughts.

question: Suggest the type of specialist to consult for kyphosisCan a chiropractor fix kyphosis or a hump back? What can be done? Its not just me but I have two sisters with the same curve near the neck. I though it was back fat because I have gained 50 pounds in 6years.Unemployment and finally retiring. What can we do?
answer: Kyphosis is a condition characterized by an excessive curvature of the spine, causing a hump or roundness in the upper back. It can be caused by a number of factors, including poor posture, osteoporosis, and certain medical conditions such as scoliosis or ankylosing spondylitis.If you or your sisters are experiencing symptoms such as pain, difficulty standing upright, or difficulty breathing, it is important to consult a healthcare professional for an evaluation and treatment plan. A chiropractor is a healthcare professional who specializes in the treatment of musculoskeletal disorders, including those affecting the spine. However, it is important to note that chiropractors do not have the same level of medical training as medical doctors, and they may not be the best choice for all types of spinal conditions.If you are concerned about kyphosis, it is a good idea to start by consulting a primary care doctor or a spine specialist, such as an orthopedist or a neurosurgeon. These medical professionals will be able to properly diagnose the cause of your symptoms and recommend the most appropriate treatment, which may include chiropractic care, physical therapy, medications, or surgery. It is also important to address any underlying medical conditions that may be contributing to the curvature of your spine.It is not uncommon for people to gain weight as they age, and this can contribute to the development of kyphosis or other spinal conditions. However, it is important to remember that maintaining a healthy weight is important for overall health and wellness. If you are struggling with weight gain, it may be helpful to speak with a healthcare professional or a registered dietitian for guidance on how to make healthy lifestyle changes.

question: Can Truvada prevent STD after anal intercourse?Is truvada used specifically for men engaged in anal intercourse only or is it used as a sort of preventative med helping prevent infection from sucking infected men orally?  Does it insure that there will  be no STD caught as a result of taking this drug?
answer: Truvada is a prescription medication that is used to help prevent HIV infection in people who are at high risk of contracting the virus. It is not specifically intended to prevent sexually transmitted infections (STIs) other than HIV.Truvada is taken as a daily oral pill and is used in combination with other HIV prevention strategies, such as condom use, to reduce the risk of HIV transmission. It is approved for use in both men and women, and can be used by people who engage in anal or vaginal intercourse, as well as by people who may be at risk of HIV transmission through oral sex.While Truvada can help reduce the risk of HIV transmission, it is not a guarantee that you will not contract HIV or other STIs. It is important to continue using condoms and practicing safe sex in order to further reduce the risk of STI transmission. It is also important to get tested regularly for STIs and to inform your sexual partners of your HIV status.

answer: It is normal for children at the age of 26 months to have difficulty with pronunciation, as they are still developing their language skills. Children's ability to understand and use language increases rapidly during the first few years of life, but it takes time for them to develop the fine motor control needed to produce speech sounds correctly.There are a few things you can do to support your child's language development:Talk to your child frequently: Children learn language by listening to and interacting with others, so it is important to engage with your child and provide a rich language environment.Encourage your child to express themselves: Encourage your child to express their thoughts and feelings, even if their pronunciation is not perfect.Read books with your child: Reading with your child can help expose them to new vocabulary and language structures, and can also be a fun and enjoyable activity for both of you.Play with your child: Play can be a great way for children to learn and practice language skills. You can play with dolls, toys, or games that involve taking turns, following directions, and using words to communicate.It is also important to keep in mind that every child is different and develops at their own pace. If you have concerns about your child's language development, it may be helpful to speak with your child's doctor or a speech-language pathologist.

question: What causes tightness around my chest while eating?hiI recently started having tightness around chest while eating food. I have thyroid and is the only medication I take. .25mg capsules.
answer: It is possible that the tightness you are experiencing around your chest while eating could be due to a condition called esophageal spasm. Esophageal spasm is a disorder of the muscle contractions in the esophagus, the tube that carries food from the mouth to the stomach. It can cause symptoms such as chest pain, difficulty swallowing, and the feeling of food getting stuck in the throat.There are several possible causes of esophageal spasm, including acid reflux, a hiatal hernia, and abnormal nerve or muscle function in the esophagus. Consuming hot food may exacerbate the symptoms of esophageal spasm, but it is not the sole cause of the condition.It is important to discuss your symptoms with a medical professional to determine the cause and appropriate treatment. They may recommend medications or other treatments to help alleviate the symptoms of esophageal spasm. In the meantime, it may be helpful to avoid hot or spicy foods, as well as eating large meals, as these can contribute to the symptoms of the condition.

question: Could back problems and narrowing of spinal canal be due to spinal meningitis?hello there, I am Beverly from Indiana,  My husband had spinal menigitis as a child.  And in the past several years his health has went down hill.  He has several back problems and narrowing of the spinal canal.  Could these problems becaused from the spinal meningitis.
answer: It is possible that spinal meningitis could cause back problems and narrowing of the spinal canal. Spinal meningitis is an infection of the membranes that surround the brain and spinal cord. It can be caused by a variety of pathogens, including bacteria and viruses. Spinal meningitis can lead to inflammation and swelling of the membranes, which can put pressure on the spinal cord and nerves. This can cause a variety of symptoms, including back pain, weakness, and numbness. In severe cases, spinal meningitis can lead to complications such as scarring or inflammation of the spinal cord, which can cause permanent damage and lead to long-term disabilities.If your husband has back problems and narrowing of the spinal canal, it is important that he sees a healthcare professional for proper diagnosis and treatment. It is possible that his back problems and spinal canal narrowing may be related to his spinal meningitis, but it is also possible that they could be caused by other factors. answer: It's important to note that liver function tests (LFTs) are just one aspect of evaluating liver health. They can provide important information about how well the liver is functioning, but they cannot provide a definitive diagnosis on their own. Other factors, such as the results of imaging tests, the presence of symptoms, and the patient's medical history, also need to be taken into consideration.With that said, it's difficult to interpret the results of liver function tests without knowing the reference ranges for the specific laboratory that performed the tests. These ranges can vary slightly from lab to lab. It's also important to note that the normal values for LFTs can differ depending on the age and sex of the patient.Here is some general information about the LFTs that were performed on your child:Alkaline phosphatase (ALP): This enzyme is produced in the liver, bone, and small intestine. Elevated levels of ALP in the blood can indicate liver or bone disease.Alanine transaminase (ALT): This enzyme is found primarily in the liver. Elevated levels of ALT in the blood can indicate liver damage or disease.Aspartate transaminase (AST): This enzyme is found in the liver, heart, muscle, and other organs. Elevated levels of AST in the blood can indicate liver damage or disease.Total bilirubin: This is a substance produced when red blood cells break down. Elevated levels of total bilirubin in the blood can indicate liver or blood disorders.Direct bilirubin: This is a subtype of bilirubin that is produced when red blood cells break down. Elevated levels of direct bilirubin in the blood can indicate liver disease.Gamma-glutamyltransferase (GGT): This enzyme is found in the liver, pancreas, and bile ducts. Elevated levels of GGT in the blood can indicate liver or bile duct disease.Albumin: This is a protein produced by the liver. Low levels of albumin in the blood can indicate liver disease or malnutrition.It's important to discuss these results with your child's healthcare provider, as they will be able to provide more specific information about what these results may mean in the context of your child's overall health and medical history.

question: What causes severe pain in back and legs in supine position?Hi, The last two days my one year old had a very bad cold and needed me to hold him all the time while we were both lying down (I never lay down or rest this much).  I have had a slight pain in my lower back but much more pain in both legs, like they are being squeezed very hard ever since.  What can this be?
answer: There are several potential causes of severe pain in the back and legs in the supine position. Some possible causes may include:Muscle strain or sprain: Prolonged periods of lying down in the same position, especially if you are holding a heavy weight (such as a child), can put strain on your muscles and cause pain.Pinched nerve: A pinched nerve, also known as nerve compression, can cause pain in the back and legs. This can be caused by a variety of factors, including poor posture, muscle strain, or a herniated disc.Herniated disc: A herniated disc is a condition in which the soft center of a spinal disc bulges out through a tear in the outer layer of the disc. This can cause pain in the back and legs.Sciatica: Sciatica is a condition in which the sciatic nerve, which runs from the lower back down through the legs, becomes compressed or inflamed. This can cause pain in the back and legs.It's important to see a healthcare provider if you are experiencing severe pain in your back and legs, as they can help diagnose the cause of your pain and recommend treatment options.

question: Will Ofloxacin, INH or Ethambutol have any adverse affects on the fetus?My wife is undergoing lymphnode TB treatment since Aug 2009 & is now 6 month pregnant , she is having Oxfloxacin 400 mg , INH 300 mg , Ethambuntal 800 mg each 1 tablet per day . However, it is important to note that it is not approved for use in pregnant women by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA). There have been some studies that suggest that the use of ofloxacin in pregnant women may be associated with an increased risk of birth defects, but more research is needed to confirm this.Isoniazid (INH) is also an antibiotic that is used to treat tuberculosis (TB). There have been some reports of birth defects in infants exposed to INH during pregnancy, but it is not clear whether the defects were caused by the medication or other factors.Ethambutol is another medication that is used to treat TB. It is not recommended for use during pregnancy due to the risk of birth defects. There have been reports of birth defects in infants exposed to ethambutol during pregnancy, including abnormalities of the eyes, ears, and brain.It is important to discuss the risks and benefits of taking any medication with your healthcare provider. If you are pregnant and taking any of these medications, you should talk to your healthcare provider about the potential risks and whether or not you should continue taking the medication. question: I have diagnose 16mm endometrial, Is it any other treatment beside operation ?Dear Doctor, I have diagnose on the 11th Nov 16mm endometrial. my period started 20 october for 6 days or so. the doctor want to clean out the lining through operation, but I m concert will it be thick again after the operation, and what if the operation will cost infection ? It is important to discuss all of the available options with your doctor and consider your individual circumstances and preferences when making a decision about the best course of action.Medical treatments for an endometrial thickness of 16mm may include hormone therapy, such as oral contraceptives or progestin-only therapy, to help thin the endometrial lining and regulate menstrual cycles.Surgical treatments for an endometrial thickness of 16mm may include a procedure called dilation and curettage (D&C), in which the cervix is dilated and the endometrial lining is removed using a curette, or a hysterectomy, in which the uterus is removed.It is possible that the endometrial lining may thicken again after treatment, and your doctor will recommend ongoing monitoring and follow-up to ensure that the thickness remains at a healthy level. If the endometrial lining does begin to thicken again, additional treatment may be necessary.As with any medical procedure, there is a risk of infection with a surgical treatment for an endometrial thickness of 16mm. Your doctor will take steps to minimize this risk, such as using sterile techniques and prescribing antibiotics as needed.It is important to carefully weigh the potential risks and benefits of any treatment option before making a decision.
