question: Having white patches on faceI have alot of whiteheads on my face, particularly on my chin and lips area. i tried alot of ways but still no results seen. is there anyway i can clear or lessen it? this is getting annoying especially when i have to go out D:
answer: Whiteheads, also known as closed comedones, are a type of acne that form when oil and dead skin cells clog hair follicles. They can appear anywhere on the body, but are commonly found on the face, particularly the chin and around the lips.There are several steps you can take to help clear or lessen the appearance of whiteheads:Keep your skin clean: Wash your face twice a day with a mild, oil-free cleanser to remove excess oil and dirt. Avoid scrubbing your skin, as this can irritate it and make the problem worse.Use salicylic acid: This is a type of beta hydroxy acid that helps to exfoliate the skin and unclog pores. Look for products that contain salicylic acid, such as face washes or toners, and use them as directed.Use a non-comedogenic moisturizer: Choose a moisturizer that is specifically designed for acne-prone skin and won't clog pores. Look for products that are labeled "non-comedogenic" or "oil-free. "Avoid touching your face: Hands can transfer bacteria and oil to the skin, so it's important to avoid touching your face as much as possible.Avoid picking or squeezing whiteheads: This can cause inflammation and may lead to scarring. If you do need to extract a whitehead, make sure to do it gently and with clean hands and tools.Use a gentle exfoliant: Gently exfoliating your skin can help to remove dead skin cells and unclog pores. Look for products that contain alpha hydroxy acids (AHAs) or beta hydroxy acids (BHAs).Use a spot treatment: If you have a single whitehead that you need to treat, you can use a spot treatment that contains benzoyl peroxide or salicylic acid. These products can help to kill bacteria and dry out the whitehead.It's important to remember that it can take time and patience to clear up whiteheads. If you have tried these steps and your whiteheads are still not improving, it may be a good idea to see a dermatologist for further evaluation and treatment.

question: Suggest treatment for folliculitis on penisHello, I was recently diagnosed as having folliculitis and it is showing up on my penis area. Sexual activity irritates it and therefore is becoming difficult. I am taking oral antibiotics and topical treatment but nothing is working. How can I treat this?

It can be caused by a variety of factors, such as bacteria, fungi, or irritation from clothing or other substances.Treatment for folliculitis on the penis will depend on the underlying cause and the severity of the infection. Here are some potential treatment options:Antibiotics: If the infection is caused by bacteria, your doctor may prescribe oral or topical antibiotics to help kill the bacteria and prevent the infection from spreading.Antifungal medications: If the infection is caused by a fungus, your doctor may prescribe antifungal medications to help kill the fungus and clear up the infection.Soothing creams and ointments: Your doctor may recommend using creams or ointments to soothe the skin and help reduce irritation and inflammation.Avoiding irritants: If certain substances or activities are causing irritation or worsening the infection, it may be necessary to avoid them until the infection has cleared up.It's important to follow your doctor's treatment recommendations closely and complete the entire course of treatment as prescribed, even if the symptoms improve. If your symptoms do not improve after a week or two of treatment, or if the infection appears to be getting worse, it's important to follow up with your doctor for further evaluation and possible changes to your treatment plan.

question: Will the pain while peeing be due to kidney stone or UTI?I have a history with kidney stones and normally when i have one i get pain toward the end of urination in my clitorus. i Just got off of an antibiotic for a sinus infection and got a yeast infection and treated it with the 3 day monastat stuff. and now im feeling that pain again in my clit when i pee. is it just a kidney store or is it a UTI, also have some pain during intercorse
answer: It is possible that the pain you are experiencing while urinating and during intercourse could be due to a kidney stone or a urinary tract infection (UTI). However, it is also possible that the pain could be due to something else entirely. It is important to speak with a healthcare provider to determine the cause of the pain and receive proper treatment.Kidney stones are hard masses made of crystals that form in the kidneys and can cause pain when they move through the urinary tract. The pain associated with kidney stones is typically described as a sharp, cramping pain in the lower back, side, or groin area. It is often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and blood in the urine.UTIs are infections of the urinary system, which includes the kidneys, bladder, ureters, and urethra. UTIs can cause symptoms such as pain or burning while urinating, frequent urges to urinate, cloudy or bloody urine, and lower abdominal pain. UTIs can also cause discomfort during intercourse.It is important to see a healthcare provider for a proper diagnosis and treatment. In the meantime, you can try drinking plenty of water to help flush out your urinary system and relieve some of the pain.

question: When can i start drinking alcohol after recovering from jaundice?Hello Doctor, I am a male aged 19, I had Jaundice last year s November for about 3 weeks and after some home remedies that is green food and stuff I was back to regular routine. answer: Jaundice is a symptom of an underlying liver problem, and alcohol can further strain and damage the liver. One drink is equal to 12 ounces of beer, 5 ounces of wine, or 1.5 ounces of hard liquor.It is also important to note that alcohol can interact with medications you may be taking for your liver or any other medical condition. question: Can taking Cellcept be safe for SLE?My son is suffering from Chronic ITP as per reports at Mumbai and some doctors are saying its not ITP it is a SLE. From last 3 years my son is running on Steroids,Ecosprin,HCQS,Shelcal. Now the Delhi doctor is advising to start Cellcept medicine. Please advise me the correct procedure and also where to take him for further treatment.My daughter is also suffering from SLE from last 7 years and now she is taking Cellcept as her regular medicine.
answer: Cellcept (mycophenolate mofetil) is a medication that is commonly used to treat autoimmune diseases, including systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE). It works by inhibiting the production of certain immune cells that can attack healthy tissue in the body, which can help reduce inflammation and prevent damage to organs and other tissues.While Cellcept can be effective in controlling the symptoms of SLE, it is important to keep in mind that it is not a cure and may not work for everyone. It can also cause side effects, such as stomach upset, diarrhea, and an increased risk of infections.If you are considering starting Cellcept for your son, it is important to discuss the potential risks and benefits with his doctor. It is also important to follow the dosing and administration instructions carefully and to report any side effects to the doctor.If you are not satisfied with the treatment your son is receiving or if you have any concerns about his condition, it may be helpful to seek a second opinion from another specialist. It may be useful to consult a rheumatologist, who is a doctor who specializes in the diagnosis and treatment of autoimmune diseases such as SLE.I hope this information is helpful. It is always important to work closely with a healthcare professional to make decisions about your or your loved ones' treatment.

question: What should i do to equalize the uric acid in my blood?Me, Mr. Riyaz  (33)From, KuwaitI checked my Blood full profile and CBCAll results is quite normal except URIC ACID result. 552 umol/L reference range* 150 to 450What should do to equalize the uric acid in by blood?What dose costs if uric acid is higher in blood?Any treatment?
answer: Elevated uric acid levels in the blood, a condition known as hyperuricemia, can be caused by a variety of factors including an overproduction of uric acid, an impaired excretion of uric acid, or a combination of both. It is important to speak with a healthcare provider to determine the cause of your elevated uric acid levels and to develop an appropriate treatment plan.Treatment options for hyperuricemia may include lifestyle changes, such as reducing the intake of purine-rich foods and alcohol, and taking medications to help lower uric acid levels. Medications used to treat hyperuricemia include allopurinol, febuxostat, and probenecid. The specific treatment plan and medication regimen will depend on the severity of your hyperuricemia and any underlying conditions that may be contributing to your elevated uric acid levels.It is important to follow your healthcare provider's recommendations for treatment and to have regular check-ups to monitor your uric acid levels. Left untreated, hyperuricemia can lead to the development of gout, a type of arthritis caused by the accumulation of uric acid crystals in the joints.The cost of treatment for hyperuricemia will depend on the specific medications and other treatment options recommended by your healthcare provider, as well as your insurance coverage. It is important to discuss the costs of treatment with your healthcare provider and insurance provider.

question: Should I be worried about my SGOT and SGPT high levels? What are the diet suggestions?Hi doctor,My SGOT is 75 and SGPT is 145. I am not taking alcohol at all. Please suggest how to reduce this two value to a normal range  by adjusting food habits. Is these two results are really a threat for me?
answer: Elevated levels of SGOT (serum glutamic-oxaloacetic transaminase) and SGPT (serum glutamic-pyruvic transaminase) can indicate liver damage or disease. It is important to speak with a medical professional to determine the cause of the elevated levels and to receive appropriate treatment. Some possible causes of elevated SGOT and SGPT levels include viral hepatitis, alcohol abuse, and certain medications.To help lower your SGOT and SGPT levels, it is important to follow a healthy diet and lifestyle. Some general dietary recommendations include:Eat a balanced diet that is rich in fruits, vegetables, and whole grains, and low in saturated and trans fats.Avoid processed and fried foods, which can be high in unhealthy fats and additives.Choose lean protein sources, such as chicken, turkey, fish, and plant-based proteins.Limit your intake of sugar and sugary drinks.Drink plenty of water to stay hydrated.It is also important to avoid alcohol and to get regular exercise. If you are taking any medications that may be contributing to the elevated SGOT and SGPT levels, be sure to follow your doctor's instructions for taking them. It is also important to follow your doctor's recommendations for any additional treatment or monitoring that may be necessary.

question: Is level of pus cells 3 to 5 high for a child?My baby is 1 year and 4 months , she suddenly gad fever yesterday fo bi reason at all, il visit her doctor this morning and dine urine test m the result is pus cells 3-5..is this very high for a child? The doctorvgave an antibiotics,,thank u, please give me advise
answer: It's not normal for a child to have pus cells in their urine, and an elevated level of pus cells (also known as pyuria) can indicate the presence of a urinary tract infection (UTI). UTIs are fairly common in young children, especially girls, and can be treated with antibiotics. It's important to follow your doctor's recommendations and complete the full course of antibiotics as prescribed to ensure that the infection is fully cleared.If your child is experiencing fever, it's important to monitor their temperature and ensure that they are getting enough fluids. It's also a good idea to wash your hands frequently and encourage your child to drink plenty of fluids to help flush bacteria out of the urinary tract and prevent further infections.In addition to treatment with antibiotics, your child's doctor may also recommend follow-up testing to ensure that the infection has been fully resolved and to check for any underlying causes that may have contributed to the development of the UTI. If your child continues to have recurrent UTIs, further evaluation may be necessary to determine the cause and determine the best course of treatment.

question: What are the medications for the fatty liver?since 12 Dec 2013 , I am taking Udiliv 300 (instead of hepaxa 300) twice a day and Rose day 10mg(instead of Rozat 10) & Febutaz 40... 1.Is there any other alternate medicine for fatty liver other than udiliv 300? 2.Now I am working in foreign country, what should I do to cure fatty liver. I am just 27 Years old.
answer: Fatty liver is a condition in which there is an accumulation of excess fat in the liver. The treatment for fatty liver depends on the underlying cause of the condition. Some common causes of fatty liver include obesity, high levels of triglycerides in the blood, high alcohol consumption, and rapid weight loss.There are several medications that may be used to treat fatty liver, including:Udiliv 300 (ursodeoxycholic acid): This medication helps to dissolve cholesterol in the liver and is often used to treat fatty liver caused by high cholesterol or high levels of triglycerides in the blood.Rose day 10mg (rosiglitazone): This medication is used to treat type 2 diabetes and may be effective in reducing the amount of fat in the liver.Febutaz 40 (febuxostat): This medication is used to treat high levels of uric acid in the blood and may be effective in reducing the amount of fat in the liver.Other medications that may be used to treat fatty liver include statins, which are used to lower cholesterol levels, and vitamin E, which has been shown to be effective in reducing the amount of fat in the liver in some studies.If you are working in a foreign country and are concerned about your fatty liver, it is important to speak with a healthcare provider about your options for treatment. They can help you determine the best course of action based on the underlying cause of your fatty liver and your overall health. It is also important to follow a healthy lifestyle, including maintaining a healthy weight, exercising regularly, and following a healthy diet to help manage your fatty liver and improve your overall health.

question: What is the cause for swelling of the foreskin with red patches after sex?Hello dr a few days ago i had unprotected sex with a new partner 2 days later my foreskin swelled up and i have red patches on the head of my penis. It doesnt burn when i pee but i do have a burning sensation on the head of penis and foreskin. Is this a std or just a yeast infection please help
answer: There are several possible causes for swelling of the foreskin with red patches after sexual activity. It is important to see a healthcare provider to determine the specific cause and receive appropriate treatment. Some potential causes of these symptoms include sexually transmitted infections (STIs), allergic reactions, and irritation or inflammation.STIs, such as gonorrhea, chlamydia, and syphilis, can cause swelling and redness of the foreskin and penis, as well as burning during urination. Other STIs, such as herpes, may cause redness, swelling, and blister-like lesions on the foreskin or genital area.Allergic reactions to condoms, lubricants, or other products used during sexual activity can also cause swelling and redness of the foreskin and penis. These reactions may be accompanied by itching and burning.Irritation or inflammation of the foreskin, known as balanitis, can also cause swelling and redness. This may be caused by a variety of factors, including poor hygiene, tight fitting clothing, or exposure to certain chemicals.It is also possible that you may have a yeast infection, which can cause swelling and redness of the foreskin and penis, as well as itching and burning. Yeast infections are caused by an overgrowth of the fungus Candida and can be treated with antifungal medications.Again, it is important to see a healthcare provider to determine the specific cause of your symptoms and receive appropriate treatment.

question: What causes itching all over the body on taking tab Ovares?Hai i am a Ayur doctor, one of my patient who was eager to concieve visited a infertility specialist (she is Dm2 & Htn under control with PCOS) who prescribed Tab Ovares tid since 3 months and she has been facing itching all over her body with increased itch at the cervical area. pls guide me?
answer: Itching all over the body is a common side effect of Ovares, a brand of the medication clomiphene citrate. Clomiphene citrate is a medication that is used to treat fertility problems in women. It works by stimulating the release of eggs from the ovaries.Itching is a common side effect of clomiphene citrate and can occur in up to 20% of women who take the medication. It is usually mild and goes away on its own within a few days or weeks after treatment is stopped. However, in some cases, the itching can be more severe and persistent.If the itching is severe or persistent, or if the patient is experiencing any other unusual symptoms, it is important to inform the healthcare provider. question: Q. I missed my Depot shot. How would I know if I am pregnant?Hi doctor,I am on Depot injection and I missed the shot for over 10 days now. I have not started bleeding yet. When I was on the shot before, I bled when I get off the shot. Now, how would I know if I am pregnant?
answer: beyonddcdcdcdc@163.comQ. I missed my Depot shot. How would I know if I am pregnant?Hi doctor,I am on Depot injection and I missed the shot for over 10 days now. I have not started bleeding yet. When I was on the shot before, I bled when I get off the shot. Now, how would I know if I am pregnant?If you have missed your Depot shot and are concerned about the possibility of pregnancy, it is important to take a pregnancy test to confirm whether or not you are pregnant. The Depot injection is a long-acting form of birth control that contains the hormone progestin. It is administered by injection every three months and is intended to prevent pregnancy by preventing ovulation (the release of an egg from the ovary). If you have missed a shot, it is possible that you may not be fully protected from pregnancy.There are several types of pregnancy tests available, including home tests that can be purchased at a pharmacy or online. These tests work by detecting the presence of human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG), a hormone that is produced by the placenta after fertilization and is present in the urine of pregnant women. Pregnancy tests are generally accurate when used correctly, but it is important to follow the instructions carefully and to read the results within the recommended time frame.If you think you may be pregnant or are experiencing symptoms such as nausea, vomiting, breast tenderness, or missed periods, it is important to speak with a healthcare provider as soon as possible. They can provide you with further information and advice on how to proceed.

question: What is the prognosis after removing metal pins from a fractured forearm bone?Hi my son broke both bones in his forearm he had pins put in both bones.he is having them out very soon Dr says bone has grown over one end of pin as he s only 10 how will he be after he them removed and will he be back in cast and how long will recovery be
answer: Dear patient In children growth of the bones is fast and  bone growth may also cover the end of pins that are usually left out and hence removal might be difficult. If fracture is united pins can be removed usually after 6 to 8 months of surgery. But as you said bone growth has occurred over the pins removal will be difficult and there is possibility of refracture while pin removal. But with current advanced techniques and availability of iitv chances of complications are rare. you may expect bigger surgery incisions. If removal is successful without complications protection in slab is not needed.

question: What causes pain and swelling near the ankle?i feel a pain near the left side of my right leg ankle and it is also swelling a little since last few days. i dont remember getting hurt there. i am also a high blood pressure patient taking losartan potassium tablets. i also had undergone a master checkup 3 months back which indicated my kidneys functioning properly. what could be the reason of my pain. my age is 54 years and i am a lady.
answer: Some possible causes of pain and swelling in the ankle include:Sprained ankle: This is a common injury that occurs when the ligaments in the ankle are stretched or torn. It can cause pain, swelling, and difficulty walking.Fracture: A fracture is a break in a bone. If the ankle is fractured, it can cause pain, swelling, and difficulty walking.Tendinitis: Tendinitis is inflammation of a tendon, which is a cord of tissue that connects muscle to bone. Tendinitis in the ankle can cause pain and swelling.Gout: Gout is a type of arthritis that is caused by the accumulation of uric acid crystals in the joints. It can cause sudden, severe pain, swelling, and redness in the affected joint.Infection: An infection in the ankle can cause pain, swelling, and redness.Poor circulation: Poor circulation in the legs can cause swelling and pain in the ankles.It is important to see a doctor to determine the cause of the pain and swelling in your ankle. The doctor will ask about your medical history, perform a physical examination, and possibly order additional tests to diagnose the problem. Treatment will depend on the underlying cause.

question: Will Folivite help in getting pregnant?Dear Dr.My self Gajanand Pandey. I am sr. Software Engineer. We are trying for baby since 1 yrs. but my wife is pregnant since 1yrs. Now we have consult to sr. lady doctor she advice for some test. and give one medicine  Folvite 5mg. Why use Folvite 5mg.ThanksGajanand
answer: Folivite is a brand of folic acid, a B vitamin that is important for proper fetal development. It is often recommended for women who are trying to get pregnant or who are in the early stages of pregnancy to help prevent birth defects of the brain and spine. Folic acid can be found in certain foods, such as leafy green vegetables, beans, and fortified grains, but it is also available in supplement form.Taking folic acid before and during pregnancy can help reduce the risk of certain birth defects. It is especially important to get enough folic acid in the early weeks of pregnancy, before many women even know they are pregnant. It is also important for your wife to discuss any concerns or questions she may have about the medication with her doctor.

question: What causes a white discharge with a foul smell?My father was diagnosed with stage 3 rectal cancer.  He has been receiving radiation and chemo to try and shrink the tumor so that it can be removed. Among other issues he just recently in the last three days started with a milky white discharge and a horrific foul smell. Is this common?
answer: No, this is not common. Foul smelling discharge in rectal cancer patient suggest infection at tumour site. Chemotherapy makes patient immunocompromised. So chances of infection are high in these patients. Radiotherapy weakens local defense system. So both these make patient prone to infection. So better to get done culture and sensitivity report of discharge. Culture report will isolate the causative organism and sensitivity report will guide you better about effective antibiotic treatment. Thanks.

question: Is it asthma when I have difficulty breathing during exercises? Why an effort to breath?I have difficulty breathing when sitting down. My doctor seems to think it s asthma but i m absolutely fine whilst doing exercise etc. I do not smoke , never have and i m in good shape. It makes sitting in classrooms extremely difficult as i am constantly conscious of my breathing and teachers always think i m sighing as i have to make a significante effort to get a full breath through my mouth
answer: It is possible that you may have exercise-induced asthma, which is a type of asthma that is triggered by physical activity. This condition can cause symptoms such as difficulty breathing, coughing, and wheezing during or after exercise. It is important to consult with a doctor to determine the cause of your symptoms and to determine the appropriate treatment.It is also possible that you may have another medical condition that is causing your difficulty breathing, such as chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) or other respiratory disorders. Only a medical professional can accurately diagnose the cause of your symptoms and recommend appropriate treatment. question: What step can i take in high albumin in urine ?my albumin level in urine is reported as 495 mg. where as the blood sugar level is 108 ( fasting ) may I have your advice for the next step I should be taking
answer: High levels of albumin in the urine, also known as albuminuria, can be a sign of kidney damage or a kidney disease such as nephrotic syndrome. It is important to speak with a healthcare provider to determine the cause of the high albumin levels and determine the appropriate course of treatment.Treatment for albuminuria may involve managing the underlying cause, such as controlling high blood pressure or diabetes, which can help to reduce the damage to the kidneys. Your healthcare provider may also prescribe medications to help reduce protein loss in the urine and protect the kidneys. In some cases, lifestyle changes such as a change in diet or exercise may also be recommended to help manage the condition.It is important to follow your healthcare provider's recommendations and to regularly monitor your albumin levels and overall kidney function to ensure that the condition is being properly managed.

question: What step can i take in high albumin in urine ?my albumin level in urine is reported as 495 mg. where as the blood sugar level is 108 ( fasting ) may I have your advice for the next step I should be taking
answer: It's important to follow up with your healthcare provider if you have an abnormal albumin level in your urine, as it can be a sign of a kidney or urinary tract problem. High levels of albumin in the urine (a condition called proteinuria) can be caused by a variety of conditions, including kidney damage or disease, uncontrolled diabetes, and certain medications.Here are some steps you can take:Follow your healthcare provider's treatment plan: Your provider will recommend a treatment plan based on the underlying cause of your high albumin levels. It's important to follow this plan and take any prescribed medications as directed.Manage any underlying conditions: If you have diabetes or another condition that may be contributing to your high albumin levels, it's important to work with your healthcare team to properly manage these conditions. This may include making lifestyle changes, such as eating a healthy diet and exercising regularly, and taking medications as prescribed.Monitor your kidney function: Your healthcare provider may recommend regular monitoring of your kidney function to track any changes. This may include blood and urine tests to check your creatinine and glomerular filtration rate (GFR).Seek support: If you have a chronic kidney condition, it may be helpful to speak with a kidney specialist or join a support group to help you manage your condition and make informed decisions about your treatment.It's important to note that the treatment for high albumin levels in the urine will depend on the underlying cause. It's important to follow up with your healthcare provider and follow their recommended treatment plan.

question: How can allergies be permanently cured?Hi , my name is Ahmer & i m allergic since i m a teenager. i dont know what am i allergic to but i have done many courses prescribed by specialists & nothing. My allergy continues & now whenever it comes out , i take a le zyncet tablet & its gone. i want to know , what are the side effects of this medicine or what is the permanent cure to my allergy sickness.
answer: It is not always possible to permanently cure allergies, as they are a type of immune system disorder that can be triggered by a variety of factors such as environmental allergens, certain medications, and food. However, there are several treatment options that can help to manage allergy symptoms and reduce their frequency and severity.One common treatment for allergies is the use of medications such as antihistamines, which can help to alleviate symptoms such as sneezing, itching, and runny nose. Le Zyncet is a brand of cetirizine, which is a type of antihistamine that can be effective for relieving allergy symptoms.There are also other treatment options available, such as immunotherapy, which involves gradually exposing the body to increasing amounts of the allergens that trigger the allergic reaction in order to build up immunity. This can be done through injections or through the use of sublingual (under the tongue) tablets or drops.It is important to work with a healthcare professional to determine the best treatment approach for your specific allergy. They can help to identify the specific allergens that trigger your symptoms and recommend the most appropriate treatment options.As with any medication, it is important to be aware of the potential side effects of Le Zyncet. Common side effects may include drowsiness, dry mouth, and dizziness. It is always important to follow the instructions for use provided by your healthcare provider and to report any adverse reactions to your doctor.

question: How can allergies be permanently cured?Hi , my name is Ahmer & i m allergic since i m a teenager. i dont know what am i allergic to but i have done many courses prescribed by specialists & nothing. My allergy continues & now whenever it comes out , i take a le zyncet tablet & its gone. i want to know , what are the side effects of this medicine or what is the permanent cure to my allergy sickness.
answer: Allergies are a common condition that affects many people. They occur when the immune system mistakes a normally harmless substance for a harmful invader and overreacts to it. Allergies can cause a range of symptoms, including sneezing, itching, and rashes.It is not always possible to permanently cure allergies, as they are often caused by substances that are difficult to avoid, such as pollen or mold. However, there are several ways to manage and treat allergies to reduce their impact on your life.One option is to use medications to control allergy symptoms. These may include over-the-counter or prescription antihistamines, decongestants, or nasal sprays. It is important to follow the instructions for these medications and to use them as directed.Another option is to undergo allergy testing to determine what you are allergic to. This can help you avoid the substances that trigger your allergies and may lead to a reduction in symptoms. Allergy testing can be done through skin tests or blood tests.Immunotherapy, also known as allergy shots, is another treatment option that can help reduce the severity of allergies over time. This treatment involves receiving a series of injections that contain small amounts of the substances that trigger your allergies. These injections help your body become less sensitive to the allergens over time, leading to a reduction in symptoms.It is important to work with a healthcare provider to determine the best treatment options for your specific allergies. They can help you develop a treatment plan that is tailored to your needs and can provide ongoing support and guidance to help you manage your allergies effectively.

question: Pigmentation on neck. Turned brownish after cosmopeel. Will it settle down?I have done a cosmopeel yesterday as I had a lot of pigmentation on my neck n have done sevral supervicial peels that make the pigmentation come back, After the cosmopeel it has become very red n looks brownish is it common n will it settle as really scared that my condition could get worse . answer: It is common for the skin to appear red and brownish after a chemical peel, especially a deep peel like a cosmopeel. This is because the peel removes the top layers of skin and stimulates the production of new skin cells, which can cause redness and swelling.The redness and brownish color should subside over the next few days to weeks as the new skin cells grow and the skin heals. It is important to follow the aftercare instructions provided by your provider, including using sunscreen and avoiding direct sunlight to help minimize the risk of hyperpigmentation (excess pigmentation).If you are concerned about the appearance of your skin or if you experience any unusual symptoms, such as excessive redness, blistering, or peeling, it is important to consult with your provider or a dermatologist. They can assess your skin and provide further guidance on how to care for your skin during the healing process.

question: What causes pain in upper left chest, neck and upper back?Hello.  I have been having constant pain in my upper left chest, neck, and upper back for 8 months. answer: There are several potential causes of pain in the upper left chest, neck, and upper back. Some possible causes include:Musculoskeletal issues: Pain in these areas can be caused by problems with the muscles, bones, or joints. This could include conditions like fibromyalgia, which is a chronic condition characterized by widespread pain and tenderness.Heart problems: Pain in the upper left chest can also be caused by problems with the heart, such as angina (chest pain caused by reduced blood flow to the heart) or a heart attack.Lung problems: Pain in the upper left chest can also be caused by problems with the lungs, such as pneumonia or pleurisy (an inflammation of the lining of the lungs).Digestive issues: Pain in the upper left chest can also be caused by digestive problems, such as acid reflux or gallstones.It's important to see a doctor to determine the cause of your pain and get proper treatment. In the meantime, you can try using over-the-counter pain medication, such as acetaminophen or ibuprofen, and applying heat or cold to the affected area to help relieve your symptoms.

question: Will i face any problem during pregnancy if i am diabetic?Iam 34 yr lady having a child of 5 year.Iam diabetic mellitas , takes no medicine only food control .My first pregnancy period full with insulin and thre was no risk for the child.But after delivery i got all my health and nearly three nears take to restore my health.IF any problem if i become pregnent at this stage at this age.What precautions should I take to better health
answer: It is possible for women with diabetes to have a healthy pregnancy and delivery, but it is important to carefully manage your blood sugar levels and work closely with your healthcare team to reduce the risk of complications. Pregnancy can be a challenging time for women with diabetes, as the increased hormone levels and changes in metabolism can make it harder to control blood sugar levels. However, with proper planning and medical supervision, women with diabetes can have a successful pregnancy.Here are some steps you can take to ensure a healthy pregnancy:Keep your blood sugar levels in good control: It is important to keep your blood sugar levels within a healthy range before and during pregnancy to reduce the risk of complications. This may involve adjusting your diet, increasing physical activity, and taking medications as prescribed by your healthcare provider.Get early and regular prenatal care: Make sure to see your healthcare provider as soon as you find out you are pregnant. Regular prenatal care will help your healthcare team monitor your health and the health of your baby.Take care of your overall health: In addition to managing your blood sugar levels, it is important to take care of your overall health during pregnancy. This includes getting enough sleep, eating a healthy diet, and staying active.Be prepared for emergencies: It is important to be prepared for any potential emergencies that may arise during pregnancy. Make sure you know how to recognize the signs of high or low blood sugar, and have a plan in place for how to manage these situations.Overall, it is important to work closely with your healthcare team and follow their recommendations to ensure a healthy pregnancy.

question: Why ESR increased after having antibiotics for suspected infection?I am 45 years old with controlled type 2 diabetes ,  pco, pain in  left top side of my  back. I have been having  severe headaches. My  esr  increased from  35 t0 55 even when i had taken 250 mg proximexa  as advised by my doctor since he suspected infection. why did my esr increase after 3 days of antibiotics?
answer: ESR is a nonspecific test indicating the presence of an inflammatory condition. This could be due to an infection or to many other causes. The inflammatory process and the change in ESR could be due to the infection and would occur regardless of antibiotic treatment- it is part of the body's response to the infection. If the infection clears up with treatment, the inflammatory process will start to clear up, but signs of it such as the ESR may take some time to return to normal. The ESR is not useful for following the course of an infection. Again, it may also be due to an entirely different condition from the infection, such as arthritis, lupus, response to injuries, etc etc. Hope this helps.

question: Why ESR increased after having antibiotics for suspected infection?I am 45 years old with controlled type 2 diabetes ,  pco, pain in  left top side of my  back. I have been having  severe headaches. My  esr  increased from  35 t0 55 even when i had taken 250 mg proximexa  as advised by my doctor since he suspected infection. why did my esr increase after 3 days of antibiotics?
answer: Erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) is a blood test that measures the rate at which red blood cells (erythrocytes) sediment in a tube over a period of time. It is not a specific test for any particular disease, but it can be elevated in a variety of conditions, including infections, inflammation, and certain types of cancer. It is not uncommon for ESR to increase slightly in response to an infection, as the body's immune system responds to the infection by releasing substances that can cause inflammation.There are several reasons why ESR may increase after starting antibiotics:The infection is causing inflammation: As mentioned above, ESR can be elevated in response to inflammation, and infections can often cause inflammation. If the infection is causing inflammation, then ESR may increase as the body's immune system responds to the infection.The antibiotics are causing inflammation: Some antibiotics can cause inflammation as a side effect. This is not a common side effect, but it is possible. If the antibiotics you are taking are causing inflammation, then ESR may increase as a result.The infection is not responding to the antibiotics: If the infection is not responding to the antibiotics, then ESR may continue to increase despite treatment. This could be due to a number of factors, such as antibiotic resistance or an underlying condition that is making it difficult for the antibiotics to work effectively.It is important to note that ESR is not a specific test for infection, and the presence of an infection does not necessarily mean that ESR will be elevated. Similarly, an increase in ESR does not necessarily mean that an infection is present. It is important to discuss any concerns or questions you have about your ESR with your healthcare provider. They can help interpret the results of your ESR test and determine the best course of treatment based on your individual situation.

answer: It's possible that your son has preauricular pits or sinuses, which are small, shallow pits or dimples located on the front of the ear, near the earlobe. They are usually harmless and do not cause any problems, but in some cases, they can become infected. If you are concerned about the pits, I would recommend discussing them with your pediatrician. question: TB meningitis, taking medicines post surgery, recent scan features suggestive of gliosis. I11 defined csf density in left temporal region-suggestive of gliosis .can i know whats this...is it curing..
answer: Hi ,It seems that you had tuberculous meningitis with tubercular abcess in left temporal region ,for which Left fronto temporal craniotony with evacuation of abcess might be done. Gliosis is a process of scarring in the central nervous system. It results from the proliferation of astrocytes in an injured or diseased part of the brain, causing the formation of a fibrous glial scar. HIV is transmitted through the exchange of body fluids, and the lining of the anus is more prone to tearing and exposure to HIV than the lining of the vagina or mouth. This means that the risk of HIV transmission during anal sex is higher than during other sexual activities.The chances of getting HIV after unprotected anal sex depend on several factors, including the HIV status of the partner, the presence of other STIs, and the presence of any cuts or abrasions on the skin. It is also important to consider the prevalence of HIV in the community where the sexual encounter took place, as HIV is more common in some populations than others.If you are concerned about the possibility of HIV transmission, it is important to get tested as soon as possible. HIV testing should be done at least 3-6 weeks after potential exposure, as it can take that long for the virus to be detectable in the body. You can also be tested for other STIs at this time. It is important to note that some STIs, including HIV, may not show up on a test until several weeks or even months after infection, so it is important to practice safe sex and get tested regularly to ensure that you are not unknowingly transmitting HIV or other STIs to your partners.

question: Could the extreme fatigue, depression and lethargy caused due to the overtaking of Methylprednisolone?I think my wife is accidentally overtaking Methylprednisolone (medrol). Her prescript is for 1 ½ 4 mg. tabs per day. I think she s been taking 6 tabs per day. She is extremely fatigued, depressed, and just has zero energy and is lethargic. Could this be from overtaking the methylprednisolone ?????
answer: It is possible that the symptoms you are describing could be a result of taking too much Methylprednisolone. Methylprednisolone is a corticosteroid medication that is used to treat a wide range of conditions, including inflammation, allergies, and immune system disorders. It is important to take it as directed by a healthcare professional, as taking too much can cause serious side effects.If your wife has been taking more than the prescribed dose of Methylprednisolone, it is important that she stop taking the medication and consult with her healthcare provider as soon as possible. Taking too much Methylprednisolone can cause a range of side effects, including:Weight gainIncreased risk of infectionsWeak bones (osteoporosis)High blood pressureMood changes, including depression and anxietyIf your wife is experiencing any of these symptoms, it is important that she seek medical attention immediately. The healthcare provider will be able to assess her condition and determine the appropriate course of treatment.In the meantime, it is important that your wife stays hydrated and tries to get plenty of rest. It is also important that she does not take any additional Methylprednisolone or any other medications without consulting with her healthcare provider first.

question: Does tugain for hair fall cause side effects?hi m 27 years female i had severe hairfall suddenly which took 80 percent of my hair ,i used tugain with consult of doctor my hairfall stoped but after that i stoped using now i see my hair are not growing long from last 4 months there length is same plz do let me know should i use tugain again m afraid of side effects...

While minoxidil is generally well-tolerated, it can cause some side effects. These may include:Scalp irritation: Some people may experience dryness, itching, or flaking of the scalp when using minoxidil. These symptoms may be relieved by using a mild shampoo and avoiding leaving the minoxidil on the scalp for longer than directed.Allergic reactions: Rarely, some people may have an allergic reaction to minoxidil. Symptoms of an allergic reaction may include rash, hives, difficulty breathing, or swelling of the face, lips, tongue, or throat. If you experience any of these symptoms, stop using the medication and seek medical attention immediately.Other side effects: Minoxidil may also cause dizziness, lightheadedness, or a rapid heartbeat. If you experience any of these side effects, stop using the medication and contact your healthcare provider.It is important to use minoxidil exactly as directed by your healthcare provider. If you are concerned about the potential side effects of the medication or are experiencing any side effects, you should talk to your healthcare provider. question: Why do I feel tender and bruised in stomach with intense discomfort?Hi there. I m trying to conceive and for the last few days, my stomach has felt tender and bruised. I ve also felt slightly nauseous at times I ve passed ovulation and an due on my cycle on the 20th of this month. Its the bruising feeling on my stomach that is uncomfortable...any ideas what this can be down to and how I can ease it? Many thanks
answer: There are a few potential explanations for the tenderness and bruising feeling in your stomach that you're experiencing. Here are a few possible causes:Ovarian cysts: Ovarian cysts are fluid-filled sacs that can develop in the ovaries. They can sometimes cause pain in the abdomen, particularly during ovulation.Endometriosis: Endometriosis is a condition in which the tissue that normally lines the uterus grows outside of the uterus. This can cause pain, particularly during the menstrual cycle.Pregnancy: Pregnancy can cause changes in the abdomen, including tenderness and discomfort. If you're trying to conceive, it's possible that you could be experiencing early pregnancy symptoms.Other gastrointestinal issues: The tenderness and discomfort you're experiencing could also be due to other gastrointestinal issues, such as constipation or indigestion.To help ease the discomfort, you may want to try taking over-the-counter pain medication, such as acetaminophen or ibuprofen. It's also important to stay hydrated and get plenty of rest. If the discomfort persists or becomes severe, you should consult a healthcare provider for further evaluation and treatment.

In most cases, heart palpitations are not a sign of a serious health problem and do not require medical treatment.However, if you experience frequent or persistent heart palpitations that are accompanied by other symptoms such as chest pain, shortness of breath, or fainting, it's important to see a doctor. These symptoms could be a sign of an underlying health condition that needs to be addressed.It's also a good idea to see a doctor if you have a family history of heart problems, or if you have other risk factors for heart disease such as high blood pressure, high cholesterol, or diabetes.

question: What causes pain and numbness in the legs?I have had several injections on my back ,physical therapy chiropractor nothing works don t even help at all what else I m I suppose to do when I m trying to work and my legs are weak can t hardly walk or stand up , it hurts to walk sit legs go numb help pls
answer: Some possible causes include:Pinched nerves: This can occur when a nerve becomes compressed or squeezed, often due to pressure from surrounding tissues or a structural issue in the spine.Herniated disc: This occurs when the soft center of a spinal disc protrudes through the outer layer, potentially pressing on nearby nerves.Spinal stenosis: This is a condition in which the spaces within the spine become narrow, potentially causing pressure on the spinal cord or nerves.Sciatica: This is a type of pain that occurs when the sciatic nerve, which runs from the lower back down the legs, becomes compressed or irritated.Peripheral neuropathy: This is a condition that occurs when there is damage to the nerves outside of the brain and spinal cord, often causing numbness and tingling in the legs and feet.It is important to see a doctor for a proper diagnosis and treatment plan. Your doctor will be able to determine the cause of your symptoms and recommend the appropriate treatment, which may include medications, physical therapy, and/or surgery.

question: Q. Will I be made comfortable during getting anesthesia for wisdom tooth removal?Hello doctor,Today I got my wisdom teeth pulled and they said they were gonna give me a shot in my mouth. There is no way I will be relaxed. Is there any option they would do for me to be more comfortable?
answer: It's understandable that you may be feeling anxious about getting a shot and having wisdom tooth removal surgery. However, there are steps that can be taken to help make you more comfortable during the procedure.First, it's important to choose a dental or oral surgeon that you feel comfortable with and trust. Having a good relationship with your surgeon can help put you at ease. You can also discuss your concerns with the surgeon beforehand and ask about the type of anesthesia that will be used and how it will be administered.There are several types of anesthesia that can be used for wisdom tooth removal, including local anesthesia, intravenous (IV) sedation, and general anesthesia. Local anesthesia numbs the area around the tooth and is often used in combination with other forms of anesthesia. IV sedation involves the administration of medications through a vein to help you relax and feel drowsy. General anesthesia is administered through an IV or by inhaling gases and results in a deep sleep, so you will not be aware of the procedure.Your surgeon will determine the best type of anesthesia for you based on factors such as the complexity of the procedure, your medical history, and your level of anxiety. You should discuss your preferences with the surgeon and ask any questions you have about the anesthesia.It's also a good idea to have a friend or family member present during the procedure to provide support and comfort. They can stay with you in the waiting room or the recovery area and be there when you wake up.Finally, try to relax and take deep breaths during the procedure. This can help calm your nerves and make the experience more comfortable.

question: What causes drop foot?yes, I have a 75 year old relative with a drop foot. He has to drag it and heave or pull it along. He did not have any injury to the leg or knee, non-smoker, non drinker, does not have any symptoms of stroke, speech and cognition is normal. What tests might you suggest and what might be causing this?
answer: Drop foot, also known as foot drop, is a condition in which a person has difficulty lifting the front part of the foot. This can cause the person to drag the foot or trip while walking. Drop foot can be caused by various underlying conditions, such as nerve damage, muscle weakness, or problems with the bones or joints in the foot or ankle.There are several tests that a healthcare provider may suggest to determine the cause of drop foot in your relative. These may include:Physical examination: The healthcare provider will examine your relative's leg and foot, looking for signs of nerve damage, muscle weakness, or other problems.Nerve conduction studies: This test measures how well the nerves are working by sending a small electrical shock through the nerves and measuring the response.Electromyography (EMG): This test measures the electrical activity of the muscles. It can help the healthcare provider determine if the drop foot is caused by a problem with the muscles or the nerves.X-rays: These can help the healthcare provider determine if there are any problems with the bones or joints in the foot or ankle.MRI: This test uses powerful magnets and radio waves to create detailed images of the body's organs and tissues. It can help the healthcare provider see any damage to the nerves or muscles in the foot or ankle.It is important for your relative to see a healthcare provider for a proper diagnosis and treatment. The specific treatment will depend on the underlying cause of the drop foot. It may involve medications, physical therapy, or surgery.

question: What is the cause for child like behavior by a adult? Could it be motor neuron disease?Hi my sister is not well ,she is very confused and gone back to being like a child.she is getting lots of tests and they thought it was a brain tumour but rulled it out ,now they say she has very little sugar in her system and ar testing her for motor nuron desease
answer: It is possible that your sister's behavior could be caused by a medical condition such as motor neuron disease. Motor neuron disease, also known as Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS), is a progressive neurological condition that affects the nerve cells responsible for controlling voluntary muscle movement. Symptoms of motor neuron disease can include difficulty with movements such as walking, speaking, swallowing, and breathing, as well as changes in behavior and cognition. If your sister has been diagnosed with motor neuron disease or is being tested for it, it is important for her to receive proper medical care and support to manage her condition. It is also important for her to have a thorough evaluation to identify the specific cause of her symptoms, as there may be other potential underlying conditions that need to be addressed.

question: Why would a patient with esophageal cancer have a feeding tube inserted surgically into the duodenum ?Why would a patient with esophageal cancer have a feeding tube inserted surgically into the duodenum and not into the stomach? Why would a patient with esophageal cancer have a feeding tube inserted surgically into the duodenum and not into the stomach?
answer: A feeding tube may be inserted surgically into the duodenum (the first part of the small intestine) for a patient with esophageal cancer if the cancer or its treatment has caused significant damage to the esophagus that makes it difficult or impossible for the patient to swallow and get enough nutrition orally. The duodenum is the first part of the small intestine and is located just after the stomach, so a feeding tube placed in the duodenum allows nutrition to bypass the damaged esophagus and be delivered directly to the small intestine, where it can be absorbed and used by the body.Inserting a feeding tube into the duodenum is typically done through a procedure called a duodenostomy. This involves making a small incision in the abdomen and inserting the feeding tube through the incision and into the duodenum. Duodenostomy may be preferred over inserting the feeding tube into the stomach (gastrostomy) because the duodenum is closer to the liver and may be more efficient at absorbing nutrients. Additionally, the duodenum has a thinner wall than the stomach and may be less prone to irritation from the feeding tube.It is important to note that a feeding tube is not the only option for providing nutrition to a patient with esophageal cancer. Other options may include a liquid diet, medications to help with swallowing, or placing a stent in the esophagus to keep it open and allow for easier swallowing. The best approach will depend on the specific circumstances of the patient and will be determined by the healthcare team.

question: Q. I took plan B and had dark brown spotting with cramping and bloating. question: Q. I took plan B and had dark brown spotting with cramping and bloating. Is it due to Plan B?Hello doctor,I took Plan B pills 34 hours after intercourse and one week later I had dark brown spotting. Then, I started having a red bleed during the week of my period, but it was not heavy. Now towards the end of my period, it is very light. I have period cramping and bloating. Is this because of Plan B or could I be pregnant?
answer: It is possible that the spotting and other symptoms you are experiencing could be a side effect of taking Plan B. Plan B is a type of emergency contraception that can be used to prevent pregnancy after unprotected sex or contraceptive failure. These side effects usually go away on their own within a few days, but if they persist or are severe, you should speak with a healthcare provider.It is also possible that the spotting and other symptoms you are experiencing could be due to something else, such as a change in your menstrual cycle or a possible pregnancy. If you are concerned about the possibility of pregnancy, it is important to take a pregnancy test to confirm whether or not you are pregnant. If you are pregnant, it is important to speak with a healthcare provider as soon as possible to discuss your options.

question: Is it safe to have soy isoflavones vitamins along with metformin to get pregnant?I have been taking metformin for 2 months going on 3 months for pcos. Im trying to conceive. I have heard of some women taking soy isoflavones vitamins with metformin and it helping them get pregnant. Is this true and is it safe for me to try this? I have been trying to concieve for 5 years now.
answer: Hallow Dear, In Polycystic Ovarian syndrome, the main disorders are infertility due to failure to release eggs (ovulation) as a result of dysfunction in reproductory hormones, raised insulin levels and raised androgens. Metformin helps bring down the levels of Insulin. It acts as a good adjuvant to the medicines used for induction of ovulation. The success of only Metformin for the treatment of anovulatory infertility is questionable. According to some scientists, Myo inositol brings down the levels of Insulin as well as androgens and hence is more effective in the treatment of infertility due to PCOS. For induction of ovulation, Clomiphene citrate may be tried for 6 cycles (along with Metformin or Myo inositol). If it fails, HMG/hCG combination may be tried. PCOS is characterised by obesity. Soy isoflavones are supposed to improve general health as well as the quality of the eggs, increasing the possibility of successful pregnancy. I hope this will help you to seek for a comprehensive management of PCOS. Dr. Nishikant Shrotri

question: My baby has developed few Pimples on her cheeks, please suggest some remediesi have a 40 days baby and she is develop few pimples on her cheeks(face) what shld i apply? and doctor she has lot og hair on her body..what shld i do? mostly on her face. Is that of concern?

question: My baby has developed few Pimples on her cheeks, please suggest some remediesi have a 40 days baby and she is develop few pimples on her cheeks(face) what shld i apply? and doctor she has lot og hair on her body..what shld i do? mostly on her face. Is that of concern?
answer: It is normal for babies to develop pimples on their skin, especially on their face. These pimples, called neonatal acne, are caused by hormones that are passed from the mother to the baby before birth. They usually appear within the first few weeks of life and resolve on their own within a few months.To help prevent or treat neonatal acne, you can try the following measures:Keep your baby's skin clean by washing their face with water and a mild, fragrance-free baby soap or cleansing bar. Avoid using harsh or medicated cleansers.Pat the skin dry gently after washing. Avoid rubbing the skin or using hot water, as this can irritate the pimples and make them worse.Avoid applying lotions, creams, or oils to the affected area, as these can clog the pores and make the acne worse.If the acne persists or becomes more severe, you may want to consult a pediatrician for further evaluation and treatment. They may recommend a mild topical medication or other treatment options.As for the hair on your baby's body, it is not uncommon for newborns to have a lot of hair, especially on their face. This is called lanugo and is typically temporary, disappearing within a few weeks or months. There is no need to do anything about it, as it will fall out on its own.

question: Blood work showed liver inflammation, not on medicines. Does it heal on its own or is there a treatment plan?I received blood work that shows inflammation of the liver . I was tested in February and it was normal but in September the number came back abnormal . I have been taking a lot of prescription drugs from drugs plus Tylenol for headaches and pain. Can my liver fix it self since I no longer take any meds. Does it heal on its own or is there a treatment plan?
answer: It is not uncommon for the liver to become inflamed due to various causes such as medications, alcohol, viral infections, and certain medical conditions. The treatment and prognosis for liver inflammation (hepatitis) depend on the underlying cause.If the liver inflammation is due to a temporary cause, such as a viral infection or certain medications, it may resolve on its own once the cause is removed. However, if the liver inflammation is due to a chronic condition, such as alcohol abuse or autoimmune hepatitis, it may require ongoing treatment to prevent further damage to the liver.It is important to speak with a healthcare provider about your specific situation and the specific cause of your liver inflammation. They can recommend the appropriate treatment plan for you. In the meantime, it is important to avoid alcohol and other substances that may further damage the liver, and to follow a healthy lifestyle, including eating a balanced diet and getting regular exercise, to support liver health.

question: Suggest treatment for baby suffering from breathing difficulty and nose blockagemy baby is 6 weeks old, it has been 3 days he had difficulties breathing through his nose .his nose seems blocked .i used saline water to blow his nose but no mucus is coming out. shall i take him to the doctor or use nasal spray.can it affect the lungs later on?
answer: It is always best to consult a doctor when your baby is experiencing difficulty breathing, especially if it has been ongoing for several days. A blocked nose can be caused by a variety of things, including a cold or allergies, and it is important to determine the cause in order to determine the appropriate treatment. Saline water can be helpful in loosening and removing mucus, but if it is not effective, your doctor may recommend using a saline nasal spray or drops to help clear the blockage.It is also important to make sure that your baby is getting enough fluids, as a blocked nose can make it difficult for them to eat and drink. You can try using a bulb syringe to gently suction out any mucus that may be blocking their airways.If your baby is having difficulty breathing or is showing other signs of distress, such as a rapid or irregular heartbeat, it is important to seek medical attention as soon as possible. In some cases, a blocked nose can lead to more serious problems, such as pneumonia or bronchitis, if not treated promptly.

question: What causes penis pain during intercourse?I am 50 years old and in reasonable health. I have recently started having pain associated with erection. The pain is located toward the base of the penis. It almost feels like it would if I were pressing down on an erect penis. I ve been looking around to see if this is normal for my age, but don t find anything mentioning pain associated with erectile dysfunction. Any ideas what this is all about?
answer: There are several possible causes of pain during intercourse, including:Infection: Infections, such as sexually transmitted infections (STIs) or urinary tract infections (UTIs), can cause pain during intercourse.Injuries: Injuries to the penis, such as a fracture or tear in the tissue, can cause pain during intercourse.Erectile dysfunction: Erectile dysfunction (ED) can cause pain during intercourse if the penis is not fully erect or if it becomes painful to maintain an erection.Prostatitis: Prostatitis is an inflammation of the prostate gland, which can cause pain in the pelvic area, including the penis.Peyronie's disease: Peyronie's disease is a condition in which scar tissue forms in the penis, causing it to bend or curve abnormally. This can cause pain during intercourse.It's important to see a healthcare provider to determine the cause of your pain and to receive proper treatment. They will ask about your medical history, perform a physical examination, and may recommend tests such as blood tests or imaging studies to help diagnose the cause of your pain.

question: What does a faint line and a deep purple line from pregnancy test indicate?I came off the contraceptive pill  early december and had aperiod on the 15th which was normal. I am due again but it hasnt arrived. As I have been having un protecetd sex I took a test yesterday and a very thin, faint line appeared in test window. I took another straightaway and again a very faint line. The other window had a deep purple line. Am I pregnant/?
answer: A faint line on a home pregnancy test can indicate a positive result, but it can also be a false positive or a very early positive result. If you think you might be pregnant, it's important to confirm the result with a more sensitive test, such as a blood test, or by repeating the test in a few days using the first urine of the day, when the concentration of the pregnancy hormone human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG) is usually highest.The deep purple line in the other window is not related to the pregnancy test result. It is likely a control line that appears in the test window to show that the test is working properly.If you have had unprotected sex and you are experiencing symptoms that could be related to pregnancy, such as missed periods, breast tenderness, nausea, or fatigue, it's a good idea to speak with a healthcare provider for a definitive diagnosis and to discuss your options. It's important to take care of your reproductive health, especially if you are sexually active.

question: What causes numbness in lip and nose?My top right lip and the right side of my nose goes numb sometimes.. answer: There are several possible causes of numbness in the lip and nose. Some possible causes include:Trauma or injury: If you have recently injured your lip or nose, it is possible that the numbness is due to damage to the nerves in the affected area.Pressure on the nerves: Numbness in the lip and nose can be caused by pressure on the nerves that supply sensation to these areas. This can be due to things like sleeping in a position that puts pressure on the nerves, or wearing tight-fitting clothing that restricts blood flow.Diabetes: High blood sugar levels can damage the nerves and cause numbness in various parts of the body, including the lips and nose.Nutritional deficiencies: Certain vitamin and mineral deficiencies, such as a deficiency in B vitamins or vitamin D, can cause numbness and tingling in the lips and other parts of the body.Infections: Infections, such as the herpes simplex virus, can cause numbness and tingling in the lips and other areas of the body.It is important to speak with a healthcare professional if you are experiencing numbness that persists or is accompanied by other symptoms, such as weakness, difficulty speaking or swallowing, or difficulty moving certain parts of the body. A healthcare professional can help determine the cause of the numbness and recommend appropriate treatment.

question: How can tooth infection and swelling in the gum be treated?I currently have either an abscessed tooth or gum infection on an upper molar.  I have taken 500 mg of Penamox (which I believe is Amoxicillin) 3 times per day for two days, and 400 mg of Motrin twice per day for swelling and pain.  Can I switch to Clindamycin for two more days until I can get to a dentist?  If the antibiotic works, how long before I see signs of improvement?Thank you,Mike
answer: Tooth infections and gum infections should be treated by a dentist or a specialist such as an oral surgeon or a periodontist. It is important to see a dental professional as soon as possible because these types of infections can spread and can be serious if left untreated.While taking antibiotics may help to control the infection temporarily, they will not cure the infection on their own. Only a dental professional will be able to properly diagnose and treat the infection.If you are experiencing pain and swelling, it is important to take over-the-counter pain medication such as ibuprofen (Motrin) as directed to help manage your symptoms. You should also try to keep the affected area clean and avoid eating hard or crunchy foods that may irritate the area.It is not recommended to switch antibiotics without consulting a healthcare professional. A healthcare professional will be able to determine the most appropriate treatment based on your specific situation and the type of infection you have.If you are unable to see a dental professional right away, you should continue to take the antibiotics as prescribed and contact your healthcare provider if you experience any worsening of your symptoms or if you have any concerns.

question: Can intake of yasmin cause side effects like thrush/yeast infection?hello ever since I started taking yasmin the contraceptive pill (3months) ive had thrush/yeast infection. Ive never suffered with it before. I have also given it to my boyfriend and his penis is red and sore. im using canestan cream however there doesnt seem to be progress could this be because im taking yasmin?
answer: Hi, Yes, the birth control pill 'yasmin' can cause thrush/yeast infection. Yasmin is a combined oral contraceptive pill that contains two different hormones viz. estrogen and progesterone. Taking these pills can cause hormonal balance which helps the yeast to grow. It is believed that the estrogen in birth control pills can cause the vagina to produce more sugars. These sugars feed the yeast already living in the vagina causing overgrowth and thus infection (vaginal thrush or candidiasis). It is a similar effect to that seen in pregnancy when estrogen levels rise naturally. If the infection bothers you too much you could be switched to a different kind of contraceptive pill with a stronger progesterone component and a weaker estrogen component or consider going on the mini-pill which only contains progesterone. Mohammed Taher Ali, General & Family Physician

question: Can intake of yasmin cause side effects like thrush/yeast infection?hello ever since I started taking yasmin the contraceptive pill (3months) ive had thrush/yeast infection. Ive never suffered with it before. I have also given it to my boyfriend and his penis is red and sore. im using canestan cream however there doesnt seem to be progress could this be because im taking yasmin?
answer: It is possible that the use of Yasmin (ethinyl estradiol and drospirenone) may contribute to the development of thrush or a yeast infection. Hormonal contraceptives, including oral contraceptives like Yasmin, can alter the normal balance of bacteria in the vagina, which can lead to an overgrowth of Candida, a type of fungus that can cause thrush or a yeast infection.If you are experiencing symptoms of thrush or a yeast infection and you have recently started taking Yasmin, it is important to speak with your healthcare provider. They can help determine whether the medication may be contributing to your symptoms and provide you with appropriate treatment. In the meantime, it is important to follow your healthcare provider's instructions for using any prescribed treatment, such as Canestan cream, and to practice good hygiene to help prevent the spread of the infection.

question: What causes vomiting, nausea with dizziness?i am a 20yr old male and i have been having vomiting nausea and dizziness during the last few months, mainly when i am sleeping, or laying down to sleep.  Most of the time i am awoken by sever nausea and i have to run to the bathroom to eject my stomach contents.... whats wrong with me?

Some possible causes of these symptoms specifically when you are sleeping or lying down include:Gastroenteritis: This is an inflammation of the lining of the stomach and intestines, often caused by a viral or bacterial infection. It can cause vomiting, diarrhea, and abdominal pain.Food poisoning: Consuming contaminated food or drinks can lead to food poisoning, which can cause vomiting, nausea, and other symptoms.Inner ear problems: Disorders of the inner ear, such as vestibular neuritis or labyrinthitis, can cause dizziness, vertigo, and balance problems.Migraine: Migraine headaches can cause a variety of symptoms, including nausea, vomiting, and dizziness.Alcohol intoxication: Heavy alcohol consumption can lead to vomiting and dizziness as the body tries to metabolize and eliminate the alcohol.It's important to see a healthcare provider to determine the cause of your symptoms and get the appropriate treatment. Some possible causes of mouth sores with blood clots include:Canker sores: These are small, shallow ulcers that appear on the inside of the mouth, often on the tongue, gums, or inner cheek. They are usually round or oval and have a red border. They can be painful and may cause a person to have difficulty eating or speaking.Cold sores: Also known as fever blisters, cold sores are small, painful blisters that usually occur on the lips or around the mouth. They are caused by the herpes simplex virus and are contagious. Cold sores usually heal on their own within a few days to a week.Oral cancer: Mouth sores with blood clots can be a symptom of oral cancer, which is a type of cancer that affects the mouth, throat, or head and neck. Other symptoms of oral cancer may include a persistent sore throat, difficulty swallowing, and a lump or mass in the mouth or throat.If you have a mouth sore with blood clots, it is important to see a healthcare provider as soon as possible to determine the cause and receive appropriate treatment. In the meantime, you can try the following to help relieve the pain:Rinse your mouth with warm salt waterTake over-the-counter pain medication, such as acetaminophen or ibuprofenAvoid acidic, spicy, or salty foodsApply a topical anesthetic or pain-relieving mouthwashIt is also important to practice good oral hygiene by brushing and flossing regularly and avoiding tobacco and alcohol. These measures can help prevent the development of mouth sores and other problems.

question: Can kidney dialysis be delayed?hello my mother current creatinine level is 5.2.she is suffering from thyroid and high blood pressure from 8-9 years.Her current blood pressure index is 150/100.she suffer from kidney infection last 5 year.doctor suggest to do dialysis.they did dialysis once.is it possible to stop or make delay to do dialysis again.is their any solution.
answer: Kidney dialysis is a treatment that is used to remove excess waste and fluids from the body when the kidneys are no longer able to function properly. It is a life-sustaining treatment for people with kidney failure, and in most cases, it cannot be delayed or stopped unless there is a specific medical reason to do so.However, it is possible that dialysis may be delayed in certain situations, such as if a person with kidney failure is able to improve their kidney function through lifestyle changes or other treatments. This could involve making changes to diet, taking medications to control blood pressure and other health conditions, and participating in regular physical activity.It is important to discuss any concerns you have about dialysis with your mother's healthcare team. They will be able to assess your mother's specific situation and provide guidance on the best course of action. It may be possible to delay or avoid dialysis through lifestyle changes and other treatments, but this will depend on the severity of your mother's kidney failure and her overall health.

question: What causes pain in the kidney with blood in the urine?my boyfriend has been c/o pain in his neck for about a week and then while working out he had a slight pain in his chest with a pulse of 134 and a blood pressure of 143/92 then after two days he has now woke up with slight kidney pain and voiding yellow urine with stringy blood in it what in the world could this be and what should be done?

Some possible causes include:Kidney stones: Kidney stones are hard, pebble-like substances that can form in the kidneys. They can cause pain in the kidneys, as well as blood in the urine.Infection: A urinary tract infection (UTI) or kidney infection can cause pain in the kidneys and blood in the urine. UTIs are caused by bacteria entering the urinary tract, while kidney infections are caused by bacteria entering the kidneys.Inflammation: Inflammation of the kidneys, known as nephritis, can cause pain and blood in the urine. Nephritis can be caused by a variety of conditions, such as infections, autoimmune diseases, and medications.Cancer: Kidney cancer can cause pain in the kidneys and blood in the urine. Other symptoms of kidney cancer include a mass in the abdomen, unexplained weight loss, and fatigue.It is important for your boyfriend to see a doctor as soon as possible to determine the cause of his symptoms and receive appropriate treatment. The doctor will perform a physical examination and may order additional tests, such as a urine culture, blood tests, and imaging studies, to help diagnose the problem.

question: What does elevated ESR and CRP indicate?My daughter has had a low grade fever for approximately two weeks.  She had a similar fever one month ago.  Her Ped ran some blood levels, and told me her ESR and CRP were elevated.  Her other symptoms include a mild cough, and nasal congestion, but she also suffers from seasonal allergies. What could this indicate?
answer: Elevated erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) and C-reactive protein (CRP) levels can be a sign of inflammation in the body. Inflammation is a normal response to tissue damage or infection, and it can be caused by a variety of factors. In some cases, elevated ESR and CRP levels can be a sign of a serious underlying condition, such as a bacterial infection, autoimmune disorder, or cancer.It is important to note that ESR and CRP levels are not specific indicators of any particular condition, and they should be interpreted in the context of other clinical findings and laboratory tests. It is also important to note that both ESR and CRP can be elevated in the presence of infections, such as respiratory tract infections, as well as other conditions, such as allergies.It is important to discuss the results of your daughter's ESR and CRP tests with her pediatrician in order to determine the cause of the elevated levels and the appropriate course of treatment. The pediatrician may recommend additional tests or procedures to help determine the underlying cause of the inflammation and to develop a treatment plan.
