question: Suggest treatment for toe itchiness and dry flakesI do not have redness or blisters or lumps on my toes. But my toes are itchy on top where the knuckles are. They do not look infected but the itch doesn t go away. The creases on top of the knuckles are a little dry and flakey. I m wondering if I have athletes foot and if I need to throw away all my shoes and get new ones.
answer: Itchiness and dry flakes on the toes can be caused by a variety of factors, including athlete's foot, a fungal infection that typically affects the skin on the feet. Other potential causes of itchiness and dryness on the toes could include eczema, psoriasis, or dry skin due to insufficient moisture.To treat the itchiness and dryness, try the following measures:Keep your feet clean and dry. Wash your feet daily, especially between the toes, and dry them thoroughly.Use an over-the-counter antifungal cream or powder. These products can help to treat athlete's foot and other fungal infections.Moisturize your feet. Use a thick, moisturizing cream or lotion on your feet, especially on the heels and toes, to help keep the skin hydrated.Wear moisture-wicking socks. These socks can help to keep your feet dry and reduce sweating, which can contribute to fungal infections.Avoid tight, restrictive footwear. Wear shoes that allow your feet to breathe and that have plenty of room for your toes.Avoid sharing shoes or towels with others. This can help to prevent the spread of fungal infections.If the itchiness and dryness persist despite these measures, or if you develop other symptoms such as redness, blisters, or lumps on your toes, it is a good idea to consult a healthcare provider for further evaluation and treatment. They may recommend additional measures such as prescription antifungal medication or a referral to a dermatologist.It is not necessary to throw away all your shoes if you have athlete's foot or any other fungal infection. However, it is important to thoroughly clean and disinfect your shoes to help prevent the spread of the infection. You can use a shoe disinfectant spray or powder, or you can place the shoes in the sun to help kill the fungus.

question: What causes thrombocytopenia?I'm 17 years old (150 lbs, 5'6") and was diagnosed with thrombocytopenia about two weeks ago.  I'm also suffering from mild depression. Is there any vitamins or supplements I can take to increase the platelet count? Upon admission into the hospital it was 50, then 40, 30 and a week ago, 75. They haven't yet figured out what is causing this but I am curious myself. Thanks.
answer: Thrombocytopenia is a condition in which there is a low number of platelets in the blood. Platelets are small cells in the blood that help the blood to clot when you are injured. A normal platelet count is usually between 150,000 and 450,000 platelets per microliter of blood. In some cases, vitamin or mineral supplements may be recommended to help increase platelet count, but it is important to only take supplements under the guidance of a healthcare provider.

question: Can an acid reflux event cause a rapid heart rate?Can an acid reflux event cause a rapid heart rate? My resting rate is in the high 50's. Recently I had acid reflux in the night and felt the rate was high. It wasn't until after exercise that I realized it was around 155 and apparently had been at that rate for about 7 hours
answer: Hello,Acid reflux or exercise can increase increase heart rate slightly, but 155 persisting for 7 hours is less likely. This can be a cardiac arrhythmia like psvt or atrial fibrillation, in which heart rate suddenly goes up. Blood pressure may fall during these episodes and one has dizziness, fainting, blackouts, sometimes syncope. Usually ecg is normal as it is usually done in between the episodes. ECG done during episodes will show abnormality. You will need 24 hour holter monitoring or get ecg done during high heart rate. Also, hemoglobin and thyroid test should be done. ln order to abort such episodes you should try to cough hard. Is there any stress or anxiety associated. If none of the above is successful then last option is of electrophysiological studies which is invasive test which can diagnose and treat the arrhythmia permanently in most of the cases. Hope this helps you and get back if you have any doubts.

question: Can an acid reflux event cause a rapid heart rate?Can an acid reflux event cause a rapid heart rate? My resting rate is in the high 50's. Recently I had acid reflux in the night and felt the rate was high. It wasn't until after exercise that I realized it was around 155 and apparently had been at that rate for about 7 hours
answer: It is possible for acid reflux to cause an increase in heart rate. Acid reflux, also known as gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), is a condition in which stomach acid flows back up into the esophagus (the tube that connects the mouth to the stomach). This can cause symptoms such as heartburn, chest pain, and difficulty swallowing.In some cases, acid reflux can also lead to other symptoms, including a rapid heart rate. This may occur because the acid irritates the esophagus and can lead to inflammation, which can affect the functioning of the vagus nerve. The vagus nerve helps regulate the heart rate, and when it is irritated or inflamed, it can cause the heart to beat faster.It is important to note that a rapid heart rate can also be caused by other factors, such as stress, anxiety, physical activity, or certain medications. If you are experiencing a rapid heart rate, it is important to speak with a healthcare provider to determine the cause and receive appropriate treatment.

question: What are the treatment options for having stone in interpolar right kidney?I have 4.9mm stone in interpolar right kidney. no hydronephrosisWhat are my treatment options? I had a stone episode 14 months ago and a 6mm stone was removed using ureteroscopy and stent last year from left kidney distal ureter.  The stone is a calcium oxalate stone.
answer: Hi,Thanks for writing in to us.As long the stone is in the kidney there is no problem as it is a small stone. It is possible that the stone might enter the ureter (tube connecting kidney and urinary bladder) and when in the lower part of ureter and at that time it might cause obstruction to flow of urine. You might have pain at this time which will disappear once the stone reaches the urinary bladder. When this happens you might experience severe sharp pain for few days and require pain killers for sometime. Please continue drinking lots of water at that time.Stenting and ureteroscopy is not required unless the stone grows in size and causes obstruction to flow of urine.

question: What are the treatment options for having stone in interpolar right kidney?I have 4.9mm stone in interpolar right kidney. no hydronephrosisWhat are my treatment options? I had a stone episode 14 months ago and a 6mm stone was removed using ureteroscopy and stent last year from left kidney distal ureter.  The stone is a calcium oxalate stone.
answer: There are several treatment options for a kidney stone in the interpolar region of the right kidney. The best option for you will depend on the size and location of the stone, as well as your overall health and medical history. Some common treatment options include:Medications: Your doctor may prescribe medications to help you pass the kidney stone more easily. These may include medications to help relax the muscles in your ureter (the tube that carries urine from the kidney to the bladder), or medications to help break down the stone.Extracorporeal shock wave lithotripsy (ESWL): This is a non-invasive procedure that uses shock waves to break the kidney stone into smaller pieces, which can then pass more easily through the urinary tract.Ureteroscopy: This is a procedure in which a small, flexible tube with a light and camera on the end is inserted through the urethra and up into the urinary tract. The doctor can then use instruments to remove the kidney stone or break it up into smaller pieces.Percutaneous nephrolithotomy (PCNL): This is a surgical procedure in which a small incision is made in the back, and a tube is inserted through the incision and into the kidney to remove the stone.Open surgery: In some cases, open surgery may be necessary to remove a large or complex kidney stone. This involves making a larger incision in the abdomen to access the stone and remove it.Your doctor will discuss the best treatment options for you based on the size and location of your kidney stone, as well as your overall health and medical history. It's important to follow your doctor's recommendations and take any prescribed medications as directed to help manage your kidney stone and prevent future stones from forming.

question: Obsessive compulsive disorder, keeping house clean always, everything has a place, anxiety. Treatment?Hello, I am concered that I may have OCD or another obessive disorder. Everything in my house has to have a spot and if something is misplaced I get really anxious and have to put it back in the correct spot immediently. my house is always clean spotless. I get anxious alot and randomly start moving things around.
answer: It's understandable that you're concerned about your behavior and seeking treatment. Obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) is a type of anxiety disorder characterized by obsessive thoughts and compulsive behaviors. These obsessions and compulsions can interfere with a person's daily life and cause significant distress.If you think you may have OCD, it's important to seek help from a mental health professional. They can help you to understand your thoughts and behaviors, and develop strategies to manage them.Treatment for OCD usually involves a combination of therapy and medication. Cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) is a type of therapy that is often used to treat OCD. It aims to help people understand the thoughts and behaviors that contribute to their OCD, and to develop strategies to manage them.Medications called selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs) are often used to treat OCD. These medications work by increasing levels of serotonin in the brain, which can help to reduce obsessive thoughts and compulsive behaviors.It's also important to take care of your physical health, as this can have a positive impact on your mental health. This may include getting regular exercise, eating a healthy diet, and getting enough sleep.It's natural to feel anxious at times, but if your anxiety is interfering with your daily life, it's important to seek help. A mental health professional can work with you to develop strategies to manage your anxiety and improve your quality of life.

question: Suggest effects of dampness & mouldy environment on healthWe have a damp house, the wardrobes are very smelly & the clothes are slightly mouldy,no seen mould on walls though, my daughter suffers from severe eczema & I can not shake a cough I have had for a few weeks, with no history of asthma, what effects does a slightly damp house have on my family? any link to our health current problems ?
answer: Exposure to dampness and mold in the home can have a range of negative effects on health. Here are a few potential health problems that may be associated with living in a damp, moldy environment:Respiratory problems: Mould and dampness can cause respiratory problems such as coughing, wheezing, and difficulty breathing. People with asthma or other respiratory conditions may be more sensitive to these effects.Allergic reactions: Mould can cause allergic reactions such as sneezing, itching, and runny nose. People with allergies or asthma may be more sensitive to these effects.Skin irritation: Mould and dampness can also cause skin irritation and rashes. If you are concerned about the potential health effects of living in a damp, moldy environment, it is a good idea to speak with a healthcare professional for personalized advice.

question: What could the angiogram results be after being on Warfarin?hi my dad is haveing a angiogram tomorow hes 63 and diabetic and he has bin takeing warfan tabs 4 a very long time now but hes off of them for the last four days count on haveing a angiogram tomorow,im really worried bout this angiogram will he be ok?its really worring me and my family even my da is worried
answer: Warfarin is a blood thinner which is prescribed if a person has propensity to develop or has developed clots in the legs, in patients with irregular heart rate (AF) and in patients post valve replacement. I would be in a better position to help you had you provided the details.Coronary Angiogram is done to evaluate presence of blockages in the heart. On baisi of the findings of angiogram you may be suggested either medical management, or angioplasty or bypass surgery. Angioplasty can be done if there are short blockages on the arteries. It is a 1-3 HR procedure that can be done in the same sitting and the patient usually gets back on his legs on the next day. Bypass surgery is adviced when there are multiple widespread blockages involving the major arteries of the heart. Bypass surgery requires planning, patient preparation etc. Again it takes about 4 days to patient to be back on his legs and some 20 days to recover totally. But the long term results of bypass are very good. Since he is diabetic he has a tendency to develop heart blockages so be prepared for an angioplasty if suggested. Wishing him good health.

question: What could the angiogram results be after being on Warfarin?hi my dad is haveing a angiogram tomorow hes 63 and diabetic and he has bin takeing warfan tabs 4 a very long time now but hes off of them for the last four days count on haveing a angiogram tomorow,im really worried bout this angiogram will he be ok?its really worring me and my family even my da is worried
answer: An angiogram is a procedure that uses x-ray imaging to visualize the blood vessels (arteries and veins) inside the body. It is typically done to help diagnose and treat problems with blood flow, such as blockages or narrowing of the vessels. The procedure involves inserting a thin, flexible tube called a catheter into a blood vessel, usually in the arm or leg, and injecting a dye that can be seen on x-ray images.Warfarin is a medication that is used to prevent blood clots from forming. It works by inhibiting the production of certain proteins that are involved in the blood clotting process. Warfarin is often prescribed to people who are at risk of developing blood clots, such as those with a history of heart attack, stroke, or certain types of arrhythmias.If your father has been taking warfarin for a long time and has recently stopped taking the medication in preparation for the angiogram, it is possible that his blood may be more prone to clotting than usual. However, this does not necessarily mean that the angiogram will be risky or that there will be any complications. The medical team performing the procedure will take steps to ensure the safety of your father during the procedure, such as monitoring his vital signs and administering medications as needed. It is important for your father to follow any pre-procedure instructions provided by the medical team and to inform them of any medications he is taking, including warfarin.

question: What does presence of pus cells in semen indicate?In my semen there are 8 to 10 pus cells . I consulted my doctor who told me that the report is ok . It is not uncommon for a small number of white blood cells to be present in semen, as the prostate gland and other reproductive structures produce small amounts of white blood cells as part of their normal function. However, an increased number of white blood cells in the semen can be a sign of infection or inflammation.It is important to follow up with your doctor for further evaluation and treatment, as untreated infections or inflammation in the reproductive tract can have serious consequences, including reduced fertility and an increased risk of complications during pregnancy. Your doctor will be able to determine the cause of the increased white blood cells in your semen and recommend appropriate treatment.As for the question of pregnancy, the presence of pus cells in the semen alone is not necessarily a barrier to pregnancy. However, if the pus cells are a result of an infection or inflammation, it is important to address and treat the underlying condition in order to optimize your chances of fertility and a healthy pregnancy.

question: Suggest treatment for enursisI have a son who suffers with enursis. We have used the usual methods of the alarm and desmopressin. question: Suggest treatment for enursisI have a son who suffers with enursis. We have used the usual methods of the alarm and desmopressin.  It has been suggested to me to look at his diet and foods which he may be intolerant to.  Please could you offer some advice on this and am I able to get any food allergy tests carried out anywhere. Thankyou
answer: Enuresis, also known as bedwetting, is a common problem that affects many children and can be a source of stress and embarrassment for both the child and their parents. There are several treatment options that may be helpful in managing enuresis, including:Alarm therapy: This involves using an alarm that sounds when the child begins to wet the bed. The child is then trained to wake up and go to the bathroom when the alarm goes off.Medication: Desmopressin is a medication that can be used to reduce the amount of urine produced at night. It is typically taken before bedtime and can be effective in reducing bedwetting.Bladder training: This involves teaching the child to increase the amount of time between urination and gradually increase the amount of fluid they drink. This can help strengthen the bladder muscles and improve bladder control.Limiting fluids before bedtime: Limiting the amount of fluids the child consumes before bedtime can help reduce the likelihood of bedwetting.Diet changes: Some children may have food allergies or sensitivities that can contribute to bedwetting. It may be helpful to eliminate certain foods from the child's diet to see if this makes a difference.You can have food allergy tests carried out at a medical clinic or laboratory. The most common test is the skin prick test, which involves applying a small amount of a suspected allergen to the skin and observing the reaction. Blood tests can also be used to test for allergies. It is important to speak with a healthcare professional before making any changes to your child's diet or starting any new treatment.

question: What kind of physical exercise for arms and neck are recommended while on Vertine?My friend was prescribed VERTINE 8 mg. The medicine gave him only temporary relief. The medicine have affected his eyes, he says. He has been told that more than medicine, neck and arms exercises are necessary. Can you tell me what exercises can he do using arms and neck? Thank you.
answer: VERTINE (betahistine) is a medication used to treat symptoms of vertigo (a sensation of spinning or dizziness) and other balance disorders. While betahistine can be helpful in reducing symptoms of vertigo, it is important to also address any underlying causes of these symptoms and to adopt lifestyle changes that may help to improve balance and reduce the risk of vertigo episodes.Exercises that involve the neck and arms can be a useful addition to treatment for vertigo, as they can help to improve strength and flexibility in these areas, which can in turn help to improve balance and reduce the risk of falls. Some examples of neck and arm exercises that may be helpful include:Neck stretches: Gently tilt your head to the left, right, forward, and back, holding each position for a few seconds. Repeat this sequence several times.Shoulder rolls: Roll your shoulders backwards and forwards, focusing on keeping your neck relaxed and straight.Arm raises: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms by your sides. Slowly lift your arms out to the sides, keeping them straight and parallel to the ground. Hold for a few seconds, then lower your arms back down.Tricep dips: Place your hands on a stable surface, such as the edge of a chair or bench, and straighten your arms. Slowly bend your elbows to lower your body down, then straighten your arms to push back up.It's important to start slowly and gradually increase the intensity and duration of these exercises as your strength and flexibility improve. question: What do these CT scan of brain indicate?My dad's(69 yrs) CT of the brain says:NECT Brain and orbit study reveals:Few lacunar infarcts in bilateral gangliocapsular regions.Generalized cerebral atrophy with periventricular chronic ischemic changes.What does it mean? is it a cause to worry?
answer: A CT (computed tomography) scan of the brain is a type of medical imaging test that uses X-rays to produce detailed images of the brain and head. The results of the CT scan are usually reported in a written document called a radiologist's report.The findings in your father's CT scan suggest that he has a few small areas of damage to the brain tissue (called lacunar infarcts) in both sides of the brain. These infarcts are typically caused by a lack of blood flow to a specific area of the brain, which can lead to damage or death of the brain tissue. The infarcts are located in the gangliocapsular regions, which are areas of the brain that are involved in movement and coordination.The CT scan also shows evidence of generalized cerebral atrophy, which means that there has been a decrease in the size of the brain over time. This can be a normal finding in older individuals, or it can be caused by a variety of factors such as chronic illness, genetics, or a previous head injury.The scan also shows evidence of periventricular chronic ischemic changes, which means that there have been chronic (long-term) changes in the blood supply to the brain, specifically in the areas around the ventricles (fluid-filled spaces in the brain). This can also be a normal finding in older individuals, or it can be caused by various factors such as high blood pressure, diabetes, or heart disease.It is important to note that a CT scan is just one tool that can be used to evaluate the brain and that it is important to discuss the findings with a healthcare provider in order to fully understand the implications and potential next steps. It is also important to consider other factors such as your father's overall health and any symptoms he may be experiencing.

question: How to cure chronic bronchitis completely?female,28 years,height 5.1',weight 80+kg...having chronic bronchitis since childhood.  Right now, dust allergy(continuous sneezing) and sometimes cough & cold due to tension, wheezing very rare....general frequency 3 to 4 times in a year.....lasts for a few days...subsides after taking medicine. seek guidance for complete cure.
answer: Chronic bronchitis is a type of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) that is characterized by inflammation and swelling of the bronchial tubes, which can lead to persistent coughing and difficulty breathing. It is often caused by long-term exposure to irritants such as tobacco smoke, air pollution, and other harmful substances.There is no known cure for chronic bronchitis, but it can be managed with a combination of lifestyle changes and medical treatment. Some steps you can take to manage your chronic bronchitis include:Quit smoking: If you smoke, quitting is the most important thing you can do to improve your lung health and manage your chronic bronchitis.Avoid exposure to irritants: Try to avoid exposure to irritants such as pollution, smoke, and other substances that can worsen your symptoms.Exercise regularly: Exercise can help improve your lung function and overall health.Get vaccinated: Getting vaccinated against the flu and pneumonia can help prevent respiratory infections that can exacerbate your chronic bronchitis.Take medications as prescribed: Your doctor may prescribe medications to help control your symptoms and prevent flare-ups. It's important to take these medications as directed.Practice good hygiene: Washing your hands frequently and avoiding close contact with people who are sick can help prevent respiratory infections.By following these recommendations and working closely with your healthcare team, you can manage your chronic bronchitis and improve your quality of life.

question: What could cause a sudden loss of motor function in legs & arms?67 year old female has had a sudden (within last 6-9months) loss of motor function in legs and arms. Is in a permanent stoop, where she can't stand up straight. Hands jerk all of the time like someone that is nervous. At times can't remember how to sit or stand.  In order to stand has to rock multiple times to get out of a seated position.  When walking takes steps gate is about 3-6 inches.
answer: There are several potential causes of sudden loss of motor function in the legs and arms, including:Stroke: A stroke is a medical emergency that occurs when the blood supply to the brain is disrupted, resulting in damage to brain cells and a loss of function. Stroke can cause weakness or paralysis in the arms and legs, as well as difficulty with balance and coordination.Spinal cord injury: An injury to the spinal cord can result in loss of motor function in the arms and legs, as well as sensory loss and loss of bowel or bladder control.Multiple sclerosis (MS): MS is an autoimmune disorder that affects the central nervous system, causing damage to the protective myelin sheath around nerve fibers. This damage can result in weakness, numbness, and difficulty with movement in the arms and legs.Guillain-Barré syndrome: This is a rare disorder in which the immune system attacks the nerves, resulting in muscle weakness and loss of reflexes. It can affect both the arms and legs.Neurodegenerative diseases: Diseases such as Parkinson's disease, ALS (also known as Lou Gehrig's disease), and multiple system atrophy can all cause progressive loss of motor function in the arms and legs.It is important to note that these are just a few potential causes, and a thorough medical evaluation is necessary to determine the specific cause of the symptoms in this individual. A medical professional should be consulted for a proper diagnosis and treatment plan.

question: Is pregnancy possible while having unruptured egg follicle?Hii I took fertigyn injection on 23dec 10000 and 24dec 5000 IE my 14 & 15 day respectively and today is my day 17 I.e 26 Dec still the egg is not ruptured..Now what should I do and when to have intercourse. And is it not possible now to conceive even if the egg gets ruptured?
answer: It is possible to become pregnant while having an unruptured egg follicle, but it is not very common. The fertilized egg would need to travel through the fallopian tube and into the uterus, where it could implant in the uterine lining and begin to grow. This process, known as fertilization, typically occurs within a day or two after ovulation, which is when an egg is released from the ovary.If you have not yet ovulated, it is possible that the Fertigyn injections you took may cause ovulation to occur. Ovulation typically occurs about 14 days after the start of the menstrual cycle, but this can vary from person to person. However, it is important to note that it is possible to become pregnant at any time during the menstrual cycle, as sperm can live inside the female reproductive tract for several days. If you are trying to become pregnant, it is generally recommended to have regular, unprotected intercourse throughout the menstrual cycle to increase your chances of conceiving.If you are concerned about your fertility or are having difficulty becoming pregnant, it is important to speak with a healthcare provider. They can help you understand your fertility and suggest appropriate treatment options if necessary.

question: What causes swelling and pain in elbow after an injury?I had a football game last night, i had my arm fully extended reaching for a player then another player tackled the guy i was extending for land on my arm and caused a lot of pain. answer: It's possible that you may have strained or sprained the muscles or ligaments in your elbow as a result of the injury. This can cause swelling and pain in the area. It's also possible that you may have fractured a bone in your elbow, although this is less likely if the pain is primarily muscular in nature.If the pain and swelling are severe or if you are unable to move your arm or elbow, you should seek medical attention as soon as possible. question: What causes mid-back pain radiating towards the ribs while having spinal stenosis?I have pain to the right of my mid back which feels like someone punched me in the back. It is worsened with standing or sitting upright and improves if I slouch in a chair. The pain is now radiating to my right ribs. I have had this for 6 months and the radiation is new. I have severe degenerative spine disease with spinal stenosis in my lumbar and cervical spine. Any suggestions?
answer: Mid-back pain that radiates towards the ribs can have a variety of causes, and in your case, it is likely related to your degenerative spine disease and spinal stenosis.Spinal stenosis is a condition in which the spinal canal narrows, placing pressure on the nerves that travel through it. This can cause pain, numbness, and weakness in the affected area. In your case, the pain may be radiating to your ribs because the affected nerve roots or spinal cord are located in the mid-back region and are being compressed by the narrowing of the spinal canal.Some other potential causes of mid-back pain include muscle strain, herniated discs, and spinal fractures. It is important to see a healthcare provider for a proper diagnosis and treatment plan. They will be able to assess your specific situation and recommend the best course of action. This may include medications to manage the pain, physical therapy to strengthen the muscles supporting the spine, and possibly surgery to decompress the nerves or stabilize the spine.It is also important to practice good posture and engage in regular exercise to help maintain the health and strength of your spine. Avoiding activities that put excessive strain on your back, such as lifting heavy objects, can also help to prevent further pain and injury.

question: Are there any supplements to help the brain heal and to restore memory?A brain anuerysm was repaired by the coil method but during the procedure a mild stroke was caused which resulted in a seizure. Some examples include:Omega-3 fatty acids: These are found in fatty fish, such as salmon, and may have anti-inflammatory effects on the brain.Ginkgo biloba: This herb has been traditionally used to improve memory and cognitive function, although the evidence for its effectiveness is mixed.B vitamins: These vitamins, including B6, B12, and folic acid, are important for brain health and may help with memory and cognitive function.Acetyl-L-carnitine: This amino acid has been shown to improve memory and cognitive function in some studies.Curcumin: This compound, found in turmeric, has anti-inflammatory properties and may improve memory and cognitive function.It is important to note that these supplements may not be effective for everyone and may have potential side effects. question: Suggest remedy for foot & ankle swellingWhy am I still having foot ankle and toe swelling after bilateral squamos cell wide excision split level skin graft surgery on May 30th? I have a history of edema, but even with the ace bandages and leg elevation, it will not abate. On anterior legs
answer: It is not uncommon for swelling to occur after surgery, particularly in the feet and ankles. This can be due to a variety of factors, including the surgical procedure itself, the use of certain medications, and underlying health conditions. To help reduce swelling in the feet and ankles, it is important to follow the post-surgical instructions provided by your healthcare provider. This may include:Elevating your feet and legs above the level of your heart as much as possible, particularly when you are resting or sleeping. This can help to reduce swelling by promoting the flow of fluid away from your feet and ankles.Wearing compression stockings or bandages. These can help to reduce swelling by providing gentle pressure on the affected area.Moving around and exercising as directed by your healthcare provider. Gentle movement can help to improve circulation and reduce swelling.Avoiding standing or sitting for long periods of time. If you must stand or sit for long periods, try to take frequent breaks and move around to help improve circulation.Drinking plenty of water and staying well-hydrated. This can help to flush excess fluid out of your body and reduce swelling.If you are still experiencing swelling after following these measures, it is important to consult with your healthcare provider for further evaluation and treatment. They may need to assess for other underlying causes of the swelling and determine the most appropriate course of action.

question: How do I know if I have blunted affect?How do I know if I have blunted affect?
answer: Blunted affect refers to a decrease or lack of emotional expression in a person's behavior, speech, or facial expressions. It is a symptom of several mental health conditions, such as depression, schizophrenia, and personality disorders.Here are some signs that may indicate a person has blunted affect:Lack of facial expression or emotional reactivity: The person may have a flat or unchanging facial expression, even in situations that would normally elicit an emotional response.Decreased emotional intensity: The person may seem less affected by positive or negative events and may have difficulty expressing strong emotions.Lack of enthusiasm or motivation: The person may seem disinterested in activities that they used to enjoy and may have difficulty feeling motivated to do things.Flat or monotonous speech: The person may speak in a monotone voice, with little variation in pitch or inflection.If you are concerned that you or someone you know may have blunted affect, it is important to speak with a mental health professional for an accurate diagnosis and treatment recommendations.

question: Could the chin numbness be associated with diarrhea?My mom has been experiencing chin numbness off and on for a few weeks now. She also thought she had an intestinal bug. It is also necessary to closely monitor her blood electrolytes to investigate for any electrolyte imbalance caused by diarrhea. A good hydration and a lot of electrolytes are necessary in her condition. Hope you will find this answer helpful!Best regards!

question: Suggest treatment for renal carcinomamy friend has a tumor that is attached to his kidney by a small stem of tissue-his urologist is pretty sure he has renal carcinoma, but I am unable to find any information about a cancer outside the kidney that is attached in this manner...would like more information or a name for this type of tumor/cancer..thank you!
answer: Renal carcinoma, also known as kidney cancer, is a type of cancer that originates in the cells of the kidney. It can often be difficult to diagnose early, as it often does not cause any symptoms until it has progressed to a more advanced stage.If your friend's urologist has determined that he has renal carcinoma and the tumor is attached to the kidney by a small stem of tissue, it is possible that he has a type of kidney cancer known as a renal cell carcinoma (RCC). RCC is the most common type of kidney cancer and accounts for about 90% of all kidney cancers.The treatment for renal carcinoma will depend on the stage and grade of the cancer, as well as the overall health of the patient. Treatment options for renal carcinoma may include surgery to remove the cancerous kidney, radiation therapy to kill cancer cells, and chemotherapy to kill cancer cells or slow their growth. In some cases, targeted therapy or immunotherapy may be used to help the body's immune system fight the cancer.It is important for your friend to discuss the treatment options with his healthcare team in order to determine the best course of action for his specific situation. It is also important for him to follow the treatment plan recommended by his healthcare team in order to improve his chances of a successful outcome.

question: Is it necessary to continue stamlo for a long time to control BP?Hi..my blood pressure was 140/90. for emergency, i ate stamlo 10. It is important to follow your healthcare provider's instructions for taking any medication, including blood pressure medications.Stamlo (also known as amlodipine) is a medication that is used to treat high blood pressure and other conditions. If your healthcare provider has prescribed it for you, it is important to take it as directed and to continue taking it as prescribed, even if your blood pressure has normalized.If you have taken a single dose of Stamlo and your blood pressure has returned to normal, it is unlikely that the medication will have any lasting effects on your blood pressure. question: What is the meaning of INFECTIOUS DISEASE SPECIALIST ?What is the meaning of INFECTIOUS DISEASE SPECIALIST? where we can find this specialist?
answer: An infectious disease specialist is a medical doctor who is trained in the diagnosis, management, and treatment of infectious diseases. These are diseases caused by microorganisms such as bacteria, viruses, fungi, and parasites that can be transmitted from person to person or from animals to people. Infectious disease specialists often work in hospitals, clinics, or other healthcare facilities and may also do research on infectious diseases. They are trained to identify the cause of an infection and determine the most effective treatment based on the type of microorganism causing the infection and the patient's individual needs. You can find infectious disease specialists at hospitals, clinics, and other healthcare facilities, as well as in private practice. You can also ask your primary care doctor for a referral to an infectious disease specialist if you have a suspected or confirmed infectious disease.

question: What causes chronic running nose?I have a chronic running nose. I have known seasonal allergies and allergies to pet dander. answer: There are several possible causes of chronic nasal congestion, also known as chronic rhinitis. Some common causes include:Allergies: Allergies to things like pollen, mold, and pet dander can cause chronic nasal congestion.Non-allergic rhinitis: This type of rhinitis is caused by irritants in the environment, such as smoke, perfumes, or strong smells. It can also be caused by changes in temperature or humidity.Sinusitis: This is an inflammation of the sinuses, which can be caused by allergies, infections, or structural abnormalities in the nose.Nasal polyps: These are non-cancerous growths in the lining of the nose that can cause congestion and difficulty breathing.Deviated septum: This is a structural problem with the bone and cartilage that divides the nostrils. A deviated septum can cause nasal congestion and difficulty breathing.It's important to see a healthcare provider to determine the cause of your chronic nasal congestion and to determine the best treatment plan. They may recommend allergy testing, imaging tests, or a physical examination to help diagnose the cause of your symptoms.

question: How to treat nephrotic syndrome?hi doctori want to ask you about my brother who is having high blood pressure yesterday he had a 24 hour urine test in which his count was high doctor asked to redo the test next week is above 6 ft and well built.wat are the  treatment for Nephrotic Syndromehe
answer: Nephrotic syndrome is a group of symptoms that occur when your kidneys are not working properly and are unable to filter waste and excess fluids from your blood. It is usually caused by damage to the glomeruli, which are tiny filters in the kidneys that help remove waste and excess fluids from the blood.The treatment of nephrotic syndrome depends on the underlying cause of the condition. Some common treatments include:Medications: Your doctor may prescribe medications to help control high blood pressure, reduce swelling, and prevent complications such as infections.Diet: Your doctor may recommend a low-salt diet to help control blood pressure and reduce swelling.Blood pressure control: High blood pressure is a common complication of nephrotic syndrome, and it is important to keep it under control to prevent further damage to the kidneys.Immunosuppressive therapy: If the cause of nephrotic syndrome is an autoimmune disorder, your doctor may recommend immunosuppressive therapy to reduce inflammation and prevent further damage to the kidneys.Dialysis: If your kidneys are severely damaged, you may need dialysis to filter waste and excess fluids from your blood.It is important to follow your treatment plan and attend follow-up appointments with your doctor to monitor your condition and adjust your treatment as needed.

question: Is it possible to get pregnant by having sex during menses?Hi Doctor,I have been having my menses regularly, until may, when I had it twice in one month, and since june, 11th, I have not stopped bleeding. answer: It is possible to get pregnant if you have sexual intercourse during your menstrual cycle, including during your period. While the risk of pregnancy is generally lower during this time, it is not completely absent.Sperm can survive in the female reproductive tract for several days, so if you have sexual intercourse near the end of your period and then ovulate (release an egg) shortly thereafter, it is possible for you to become pregnant.It is important to use a reliable method of contraception, such as condoms or a birth control pill, to help prevent unintended pregnancies. If you are concerned about your irregular menstrual cycle or the possibility of pregnancy, it is a good idea to talk to a healthcare provider for further evaluation and guidance.

answer: Degenerative disc disease can be treated with a variety of non-surgical and surgical options. Non-surgical treatments may include physical therapy, pain medication, and other methods of pain management such as epidural steroid injections or radiofrequency ablation. These treatments can help to alleviate the pain and discomfort associated with degenerative disc disease and may allow you to continue with your normal activities.If non-surgical treatments are not effective, or if the condition is severe, surgical options may be recommended. These may include spinal fusion, in which the damaged disc is removed and the vertebrae above and below are fused together, or laminectomy, in which a portion of the vertebrae is removed to relieve pressure on the spinal cord or nerve roots.It is important to work with a healthcare professional to determine the best treatment approach for your specific case of degenerative disc disease. They can help you to understand your treatment options and determine the most appropriate course of action for your individual needs and circumstances.

question: How to confirm guillian barrie syndrome?few FWAVES abnormalities with reduced CMAP S of motor nerves along with near normal conduction valocity(N.C.V.) child of age 4 years 8 mnth unable to walk sit by herself hand griping power less . admitted in hospital treated with 30 gms. gamma iv and monocef 750 doctor suspecting of guillian barrie syndrome.
answer: Guillain-Barré syndrome (GBS) is a rare disorder that occurs when the body's immune system mistakenly attacks the nerves. It can cause muscle weakness and paralysis, and it can be life-threatening if it affects the muscles that control breathing.To confirm a diagnosis of GBS, a healthcare provider will typically perform a physical examination, review the patient's medical history, and order laboratory tests and imaging studies. The healthcare provider may also perform a nerve conduction velocity (NCV) test, which measures the speed at which electrical impulses travel through a nerve. In GBS, NCV is often slowed.Other tests that may be used to confirm a diagnosis of GBS include:Lumbar puncture (spinal tap): This test involves removing a small sample of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) from the lower back. An abnormal CSF protein level may suggest GBS.Electromyography (EMG): This test measures the electrical activity of muscles. It can help confirm nerve damage and determine the extent of muscle weakness.Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI): An MRI can help identify any abnormalities in the brain or spinal cord that may be causing the symptoms.It's important to note that the diagnosis of GBS can be challenging, as the symptoms can vary widely from person to person. A healthcare provider will consider all of the available information to make a diagnosis.

The provider will ask about the individual's medical history, perform a physical examination, and may order tests such as blood work, a CT scan, or X-ray to help determine the cause of the symptoms.

question: What is the reason for lack of growth in follicular study despite taking IUI treatment?I  am taking a treatment of infertitlity my dr told me to take ovitrop hp 75 injection  as my follicular study doesn't show a growth as required . this cycle I have to a iui treatment. Some possible reasons include:Ovarian dysfunction: This can be caused by various factors such as hormonal imbalances, age-related decline in fertility, or certain medical conditions that affect ovarian function.Poor response to medication: Some individuals may not respond well to certain fertility medications, including ovitrop HP 75 injection, which can affect follicular growth.Uterine or cervical abnormalities: Abnormalities in the uterus or cervix can interfere with the ability to become pregnant.Lifestyle factors: Certain lifestyle factors, such as excessive exercise, stress, and poor nutrition, can affect fertility and follicular growth.It is important to consult with your fertility specialist to determine the specific cause of the lack of follicular growth in your case and discuss appropriate treatment options. question: What to do for painful, itchy ringworm on inside of thigh?Hi, I have two ringworms on the inside of my thigh right next to eachother, they are very painful and itchy. I am putting perscribed cream on them and clear finger nail polish. They seem to be getting bigger, and they are leaking a clear fluid. What should I do? Or what can I do until I get to the doctor tomorrow?
answer: Ringworm is a fungal infection that can cause a circular rash on the skin. It is important to see a doctor for proper diagnosis and treatment, as the infection can spread to other parts of the body and to other people if left untreated. In the meantime, you can try the following self-care measures to help manage the symptoms:Keep the affected area clean and dry. Wash the area with soap and water, and pat it dry with a clean towel.Avoid scratching the rash. This can cause the infection to spread and may lead to further irritation and inflammation.Apply an over-the-counter antifungal cream or ointment to the affected area. This can help to kill the fungus and prevent the infection from spreading.Use a cool, damp cloth to help soothe the itchiness.Avoid tight clothing that may irritate the affected area. Wear loose-fitting clothing made of natural fibers, such as cotton.Avoid sharing personal items, such as towels, with others to prevent the infection from spreading.It is important to follow the treatment plan recommended by your doctor to fully resolve the infection. This may include taking antifungal medication orally or applying an antifungal cream or ointment to the affected area for a period of time. If you have any concerns about your symptoms or treatment, be sure to speak with your doctor.

question: What causes reduction in pulse Ox while standing?my pulse ox drops upon standing...why? I am 86 and am having spells when I stand I get weak and fall down. I also see bright lights when this happens. I feel good otherwise and have had everything from head to toe checked all normal except my pulse ox drops when I stand.
answer: Hello,The term is orthostatic hypotension. Reasons are many among which most common is age related (10% to 30% of older people have this). Others are certain drug intake as beta blockers, sugar fluctuations, heart problems, and nervous system disorders. Bhagyesh V. Patel

question: What causes reduction in pulse Ox while standing?my pulse ox drops upon standing...why? I am 86 and am having spells when I stand I get weak and fall down. I also see bright lights when this happens. I feel good otherwise and have had everything from head to toe checked all normal except my pulse ox drops when I stand.
answer: There are several potential causes of a reduction in pulse oximetry (a measure of the oxygen saturation of the blood) when standing, also known as orthostatic hypotension. Some possible causes include:Dehydration: If you are not adequately hydrated, your blood volume may be low, which can cause a drop in blood pressure and a reduction in pulse oximetry when standing.Medications: Some medications, such as diuretics and blood pressure medications, can cause a drop in blood pressure when standing.Heart problems: If you have a heart problem, such as a weak heart or an irregular heartbeat, it can cause a drop in blood pressure when standing.Autonomic nervous system dysfunction: The autonomic nervous system helps regulate blood pressure and heart rate. If there is a problem with this system, it can cause a drop in blood pressure when standing.Anemia: If you have anemia (a deficiency of red blood cells), it can cause a reduction in oxygen delivery to the body's tissues, leading to a drop in pulse oximetry when standing.It's important to speak with your doctor about these symptoms and any concerns you have. They will be able to conduct a thorough evaluation and determine the cause of your symptoms and recommend the appropriate treatment.

question: How to get pregnant if suffering from irregular periods?irregular period we want child. our doctor had given fertyl tablet.please answer me.
answer: If you are trying to get pregnant and have irregular periods, it may be helpful to track your menstrual cycle and try to identify any patterns or predict when you are most likely to ovulate. The length of a menstrual cycle is typically 28 days, but it can range from 21 to 35 days. Ovulation typically occurs around day 14 of a 28-day cycle, but this can vary based on the length of your cycle.Use ovulation predictor kits: These kits are available at pharmacies and can help you predict when you are ovulating by detecting the presence of luteinizing hormone (LH) in your urine. LH surges just before ovulation and can be detected with an ovulation predictor kit.Track your basal body temperature: Your basal body temperature is your body's temperature at rest. It tends to rise slightly after ovulation. By taking your temperature every morning before you get out of bed and tracking it over time, you may be able to identify patterns and predict when you are most likely to ovulate.It is also important to talk to your doctor about any concerns you have about your menstrual cycle and fertility. Your doctor may be able to suggest treatments or medications that can help regulate your menstrual cycle and increase your chances of getting pregnant. For example, the medication Fertyl (clomiphene) is often used to treat infertility in women with irregular periods. However, it is important to use this or any other medication only as directed by a healthcare provider.

question: How can bad behaviour caused by undue imagination be treated?hi my i am 23 years old. I am workin in a IT concern. I have a problem in me. I imagine many things and react for it. I create my own imagination and act accordingly. I am well at work and family. But at times i act bad. wat should i do?
answer: It sounds like you may be struggling with a condition called intrusive thoughts. Intrusive thoughts are unwanted, involuntary thoughts, images, or urges that can be distressing and can interfere with daily life. They can take many forms and can be about a wide range of topics, including things that are disturbing or inappropriate.If you are struggling with intrusive thoughts and they are causing you distress or interfering with your daily life, it may be helpful to seek treatment from a mental health professional. A therapist or counselor can help you learn coping strategies to manage your thoughts and improve your overall well-being.Here are a few things you can try to help manage your intrusive thoughts:Practice mindfulness: This involves paying attention to the present moment and accepting your thoughts and feelings without judgment.Use distraction techniques: Engaging in activities that take your mind off of your thoughts can be helpful in managing them.Challenge your thoughts: Try to look at your thoughts objectively and consider whether they are accurate or not.Seek support: Talking to a trusted friend or family member about your thoughts can be helpful in managing them. You can also seek support from a mental health professional.It's important to remember that having intrusive thoughts does not mean you are abnormal or that there is something wrong with you. Many people experience intrusive thoughts from time to time, and with the right support and treatment, you can learn to manage them and improve your overall well-being.

question: Q. How to manage nosebleed?Hi doctor,My 3 year old daughter has had three nosebleeds in about 3 hours. During the nosebleeds, she said her cheek bone area close to her nose hurts. What to do?
answer: Nosebleeds can be scary, especially for young children, but they are usually not serious and can be managed at home. Here are some steps you can take to manage your daughter's nosebleeds:Have her sit upright and lean slightly forward. This will help reduce the amount of blood that flows down the back of the throat, which can cause nausea or vomiting.Have her pinch the soft part of her nose just below the bony bridge. This will help to close off the blood vessels and stop the bleeding. Have her hold this position for at least 5-10 minutes.If the bleeding doesn't stop after 10 minutes, you can try using a saline nasal spray or applying a thin layer of petroleum jelly inside the nostrils. This can help to moisturize the inside of the nostrils and reduce the likelihood of future nosebleeds.If the bleeding continues or if your daughter experiences repeated nosebleeds, you should contact your healthcare provider. It's also a good idea to contact your healthcare provider if your daughter has any other symptoms, such as fever, headache, or facial pain.In the meantime, try to keep the air in your home humid by using a humidifier or placing a bowl of water near a heat source. Dry air can contribute to nosebleeds.Avoid any activities that might irritate the inside of your daughter's nose, such as picking her nose or blowing her nose forcefully.I hope these suggestions help. If you have any further concerns or questions, don't hesitate to contact your healthcare provider.

MyloCORT cream is a topical corticosteroid used to reduce inflammation and itching in the skin, while Allergex Mepryamine Cream is a combination product containing an antihistamine (mepyramine) and a corticosteroid (hydrocortisone) that is used to treat a variety of skin conditions such as eczema, dermatitis, and insect bites.If your mother is experiencing a severe rash or itching as a result of taking Risperdal, it is important that you speak with her healthcare provider as soon as possible. The provider may recommend a different treatment option or adjust the dosage of the medication to help alleviate her symptoms. In the meantime, it may be helpful to use over-the-counter products such as calamine lotion or hydrocortisone cream to help relieve the itching and irritation.It is not advisable to use MyloCORT cream and Allergex Mepryamine Cream together without consulting a healthcare provider, as using these products together may not be safe or appropriate for your mother's specific situation. It is also important to follow the instructions provided by the healthcare provider and use the products as directed. If your mother's symptoms do not improve or if they worsen, it is important to contact the healthcare provider for further evaluation and guidance.

question: Is Erytop cream good for pimples ?HIi Team, I am 23 years old and have pimples on my face so started using Erytop cream and i am applying in the night and leaving on overnite and washing in the morning. Please advise is that a good option or can i do something better Regards,
answer: Erytop cream is a topical medication that contains the active ingredient erythromycin, which is an antibiotic. It is used to treat acne and other skin infections. While it may be effective in reducing the number of pimples, it is important to use it as directed by your healthcare provider or according to the product's instructions.If you are using Erytop cream to treat pimples and are applying it at night and leaving it on overnight, it is important to wash it off in the morning. Leaving the cream on your skin for an extended period of time may increase the risk of side effects, such as skin irritation or dryness. It is also important to use a gentle cleanser to wash your face in the morning to avoid drying out your skin.In addition to using Erytop cream, there are several other things you can do to help improve the appearance of your skin and reduce the number of pimples:Keep your skin clean: Wash your face twice a day with a gentle, oil-free cleanser. Avoid scrubbing your skin, as this can irritate it and lead to more pimples.Avoid picking or squeezing pimples: This can lead to scarring and further irritation.Use a non-comedogenic moisturizer: Choose a moisturizer that is formulated for acne-prone skin and won't clog your pores.Use oil-free makeup and hair products: Look for products that are labeled "non-comedogenic" or "oil-free," as these are less likely to cause pimples.Eat a healthy diet: A diet rich in fruits, vegetables, and healthy fats may help improve the appearance of your skin.It is always a good idea to speak with a healthcare provider or dermatologist if you have concerns about your skin or the treatment you are using. They can provide personalized recommendations based on your specific needs and medical history.

question: What causes wheezing and persistent cough with bad odour?I have had congestion, very frequent sneezing, runny nose for 5 weeks now. I got put on Amoxicillian for 7 days and that did not help. The last few days I developed a cough and a very smelly odor when I do. I also have bouts of wheezing and crackling sometimes throughout the day and night.
answer: There are several possible causes of persistent cough, wheezing, and bad odour, including:Infections: Cough, wheezing, and bad odour can be caused by infections such as bronchitis, pneumonia, or sinusitis. These conditions are often accompanied by other symptoms such as fever, body aches, and fatigue.Allergies: If you have allergies, you may experience cough, wheezing, and bad odour due to irritation of the airways. Allergic reactions can also cause sneezing, runny nose, and congestion.Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD): COPD is a group of lung conditions that cause breathing difficulties. Cough, wheezing, and bad odour can be symptoms of COPD.Asthma: Asthma is a chronic lung condition that causes inflammation and narrowing of the airways. Cough, wheezing, and bad odour can be symptoms of asthma.Other causes: Other possible causes of cough, wheezing, and bad odour include smoking, exposure to air pollution, and certain medications.It's important to see a doctor to determine the cause of your symptoms and receive proper treatment. Your doctor may recommend medications, lifestyle changes, or other treatments to help alleviate your symptoms and improve your overall health.

question: Can a blood test show the presence of cancer?Can you tell through blood test if you have cancer ? The past 6 months I have been feeling very strange, dizzy low-high blood pressure, hard to breath. I noticed I am looseing 2 pounds a week, even though I am eating very fatning foods & high calorie junk foods. thank you.
answer: Yes, a blood test can sometimes show the presence of cancer or help to suggest the possibility of cancer. However, it's important to note that a blood test alone is not usually sufficient to diagnose cancer. Cancer can often be difficult to diagnose, and a variety of tests and procedures may be needed to confirm the presence of cancer or to rule it out.There are several different types of blood tests that can be used to detect the presence of cancer or to help diagnose cancer. Some of these tests measure levels of specific proteins or substances in the blood that may be elevated in people with cancer. Other tests look for cancer cells or abnormal DNA in the blood, which can sometimes be an early sign of cancer.If you have been experiencing symptoms such as dizziness, low or high blood pressure, difficulty breathing, and unexplained weight loss, it's important to see a healthcare provider as soon as possible. question: What does this chest X-ray indicate?I have a copy of chest x-ray that I had to check for Pneumonia The doctor said no Pneumonia but rather asthmatic bronchitis. I had asthma when I was very young but had outgrown it. The finding said no acute infiltrations slight coarsening of the bronchovascular markings. The costophrenic angles are sharp heart not enlarged aorta is uncoiled. Can you tell me what all this means
answer: Based on the information provided, it sounds like the chest X-ray showed no signs of pneumonia, which is an infection in the lungs. Instead, the doctor mentioned that you have asthmatic bronchitis, which is a condition in which the airways in the lungs (the bronchi) become inflamed due to asthma. The X-ray may have shown slight coarsening of the bronchovascular markings, which refers to the small lines and patterns that can be seen on the X-ray and represent the bronchi and blood vessels in the lungs. The costophrenic angles, which are the corners formed by the ribs and the lining of the lung, are described as being sharp, which is a normal finding. The heart is not enlarged and the aorta, which is the main blood vessel that carries oxygenated blood from the heart to the rest of the body, is uncoiled, which means it is not twisted or turned in an abnormal way. Overall, it appears that the X-ray showed no significant abnormalities or concerns. It is important to note that X-rays can only show the structure of the organs and tissues in the body, and they may not always be able to detect certain conditions or diseases. question: What causes elevated CPK levels in a type II diabetes?I have elevated cpk levels as determined by a blood test.  My doctor took me of liptor as a result.  I have congestive heart failure and type 2 diabetes.  Recently, after performing one test shortly after exercising my Rheum Doctor seem not to be concern with cpk coming from the brain or heart.  Is there a way to lower cpk level?  I weigh 400+ pound so perdiosine (?) is not an option.
answer: Elevated levels of creatine phosphokinase (CPK) can be caused by several factors, including muscle damage, inflammation, and certain medications. In people with type 2 diabetes, elevated CPK levels may be due to muscle damage resulting from poorly controlled blood sugar levels or complications such as neuropathy (nerve damage) or nephropathy (kidney damage). For example, if high blood sugar is causing muscle damage, your doctor may recommend changes to your diabetes management plan or medications to help lower your blood sugar levels.Rest: If muscle damage is the cause of elevated CPK levels, rest can help the muscles heal and lower CPK levels.Exercise: Regular exercise can help strengthen muscles and reduce the risk of muscle damage. However, if you have elevated CPK levels due to muscle damage, it's important to talk to your doctor before starting a new exercise program.Diet: Eating a healthy, balanced diet that includes enough protein can help support muscle health and may help lower CPK levels.Medications: In some cases, your doctor may prescribe medications to help lower CPK levels. However, it's important to talk to your doctor about the potential risks and benefits of any medications before starting them.It's important to note that perdiosine is not a medication. It is not clear what you are referring to. It's important to follow the recommendations of your doctor and to work with them to find the best treatment plan for your individual needs.

question: Suggest treatment for red and swollen kneei fell off of my son s scooter the day before yesterday. question: Q. What can cause panic attacks?Hi doctor,I have been having panic attacks for the past 13 years. I have been to the hospital on multiple occasions and have been diagnosed with anxiety attacks every time. I have had EKGs and blood work done. All the reports are fine. Sometimes, I am having multiple panic attacks in a day and also I am getting these every day. Any help would be greatly appreciated. Thank you.
answer: There are several potential causes of panic attacks, including:Genetics: Panic attacks can run in families, suggesting that there may be a genetic component.Stress: Stressful life events, such as a death in the family, a divorce, or a job loss, can trigger panic attacks.Trauma: Past trauma, such as abuse or a major accident, can also cause panic attacks.Medical conditions: Certain medical conditions, such as hyperthyroidism or heart disease, can cause symptoms that are similar to panic attacks.Substance abuse: Substance abuse, particularly the use of stimulants such as caffeine or amphetamines, can cause panic attacks.Other mental health conditions: Panic attacks can also be a symptom of other mental health conditions, such as anxiety disorders or depression.It is important to work with a mental health professional to determine the specific cause of your panic attacks and develop a treatment plan. Treatment options may include therapy, medication, or a combination of both.

question: Suggest treatment for low appetite in childrenWe cant seem to get my 3 year old Grand Daughter to eat much and she was sick a week ago but now all she seems to have is some diearah and a swollen stomach and all she will eat is yogurt and a some Gatorade and milk. she is still very active should we take her off the milk for a few days.
answer: Low appetite in children can be caused by a number of things, including illness, medication, emotional issues, or problems with the child's environment or diet. It's important to try to identify the underlying cause of the low appetite in order to determine the appropriate treatment.If your grandchild has been sick and has diarrhea, it's possible that her low appetite is related to the illness. In this case, it's important to make sure that she is getting enough fluids to prevent dehydration, as diarrhea can cause fluid loss. Giving her Gatorade and milk can help to replenish fluids and electrolytes, but it's also important to try to get her to eat a well-balanced diet to provide the nutrients she needs for her body to recover.If your grandchild's appetite does not improve after a few days or if she continues to have diarrhea, it's a good idea to consult a healthcare professional for further evaluation and guidance. The healthcare professional will be able to assess your grandchild's overall health and determine if there are any underlying issues that need to be addressed.In the meantime, there are a few things you can try to help increase your grandchild's appetite:Offer small, frequent meals and snacks rather than three large meals. Children's appetites can vary from day to day, and they may be more likely to eat if they are offered smaller amounts of food more frequently.Offer a variety of healthy, appealing foods. Children are more likely to eat if they are offered a variety of foods that they find appealing.Encourage your grandchild to eat at regular mealtimes and create a pleasant, relaxed atmosphere at meal times.Avoid pressuring your grandchild to eat or forcing her to eat certain foods. This can make meal times stressful and may actually decrease her appetite.It's generally not necessary to take your grandchild off milk unless she has a specific allergy or intolerance. Milk is an important source of nutrients, including protein, calcium, and vitamin D, and it can be helpful in promoting healing and recovery after an illness. If you have concerns about your grandchild's diet or nutrition, it's a good idea to consult a healthcare professional for guidance.

question: Suggest treatment for swelling and cellulitis in groin areaMY SON HAD CELLULITIS IN HIS GROIN AREA. THE PACKING CAME OUT IN ONE DAY AND NOW ITS STILL DRAINING AND SWELLED AND HARED IN THAT AREA. IS THIS NORMAL?
answer: It is not normal for an infection to continue to drain and cause swelling after a small incision has been made to drain the infected area. It is important to follow the treatment plan recommended by your healthcare provider and to keep the area clean and covered with a sterile bandage. If the swelling and drainage persist or if you have any concerns about your son's condition, it is important to contact your healthcare provider for further evaluation and treatment.Cellulitis is a serious bacterial infection of the skin and underlying tissue that requires prompt treatment with antibiotics. If left untreated, cellulitis can spread and cause serious complications, including sepsis (a potentially life-threatening infection of the bloodstream).In addition to taking prescribed antibiotics, it is important to keep the affected area clean and dry, and to follow any other instructions provided by your healthcare provider, such as elevating the affected limb or applying warm compresses to the affected area. If your son is experiencing fever, chills, or other signs of a more serious infection, it is important to seek medical attention immediately.

question: What's the cause of frequent swelling of the scrotum?What could be the cause of swelling of the srotum, on the right side of the base  and top left side of the penis.  No pain involved and sex or masterbation has not occured in over a week.  This id the third time in about 6 months. Last two times have ben within about 3 months
answer: There are several possible causes of swelling in the scrotum. Some common causes include:Hydrocele: This is a buildup of fluid around the testicle that can cause swelling. It is usually painless and can be caused by inflammation or injury to the testicle.Varicocele: This is a dilated vein in the scrotum that can cause swelling and a feeling of heaviness in the testicle. It is usually painless and can be caused by an abnormal blood flow to the testicles.Infection: Infections of the testicle or the surrounding tissue can cause swelling and pain. Some common infections that can affect the scrotum include epididymitis, orchitis, and prostatitis.Testicular torsion: This is a medical emergency that occurs when the testicle twists inside the scrotum, cutting off its blood supply. It can cause severe pain and swelling.If you are experiencing swelling in your scrotum, it is important to see a healthcare provider for proper diagnosis and treatment. They will be able to determine the cause of your symptoms and recommend the appropriate treatment.

question: What could cause productive cough with little red streaks and dizziness?I am a healthy 39 yearold female. A productive cough started four days ago. question: What is the reason for lumbar puncture?my father is 63 years old and on sodium valporate for last 9 years now he is having gait problem and he too had mild stroke 2 years back.right now he is on 1500mg dose of sodium valporate.on asking his neurologist,he asked for lumber puncture.what could be reason for that?
answer: A lumbar puncture, also known as a spinal tap, is a medical procedure in which a needle is inserted into the lower back to collect a sample of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) for laboratory testing. There are several reasons why a healthcare provider may recommend a lumbar puncture, including:To diagnose certain neurological conditions, such as meningitis or multiple sclerosisTo evaluate the pressure of the CSFTo determine the cause of certain symptoms, such as headache or confusionTo administer certain medications, such as chemotherapy agents or anestheticsTo relieve pressure on the brain, as in the case of a subarachnoid hemorrhageIt is not possible for me to determine the specific reason why your father's neurologist has recommended a lumbar puncture without more information. I recommend discussing the rationale for the procedure with the neurologist or another healthcare provider. They will be able to provide more information about why the procedure is necessary and how it may help your father's condition.

question: Is ovex safe for thread worm in stomach?My 4 year old son woke on Thursday night with terrible itching in his bottom. Actually recurrence is common in thread worm infestation ,so the dose is repeated after 15 days gap twice-to have complete cure. Thanks.

question: Is ovex safe for thread worm in stomach?My 4 year old son woke on Thursday night with terrible itching in his bottom. He's had threadworm before and as the symptoms were the same I assumed it was threadworm again (despite not seeing any worms or eggs). He had a dose of Ovex on Thursday night but woke up again last night at the same time with itching again. How long does it take for the Ovex to work usually? Should I give him another dose?
answer: Ovex is a medication that is used to treat threadworms, also known as pinworms. It contains the active ingredient mebendazole, which works by inhibiting the production of energy in the worms, causing them to die.It's important to follow the instructions on the Ovex packet carefully and to give the correct dose. It's usually recommended to take a single dose of Ovex and to avoid taking it for more than three consecutive days. If you have given your child a single dose of Ovex and they are still experiencing symptoms after a few days, it's important to speak to a healthcare professional for further advice.In most cases, Ovex is effective at killing threadworms within a few days of taking it. However, it's important to note that it may take several weeks for the symptoms to resolve completely, as the body will still need to clear out the dead worms and eggs. In the meantime, it's important to follow good hygiene practices, such as washing hands regularly and keeping the affected area clean, to help prevent the spread of the infection.If you are concerned about your child's symptoms or if you have any questions about the use of Ovex, it's important to speak to a healthcare professional for further advice. They will be able to advise you on the best course of treatment for your child based on their specific circumstances.

question: What causes locked knees?well my sons legs at the knees bend really far back, when he walk he seems to be ok but when he stands still he gets stuck it that position and he can t move and when i unbend his legs he cries out in pain, is this something really serious? what should i do?

This can be caused by a number of factors, including muscle imbalances, ligament laxity, or structural abnormalities in the bones of the legs. In some cases, genu recurvatum may be present at birth, while in others it may develop over time due to underlying medical conditions or injuries.If your son is experiencing pain when his knees are bent backwards, it is important to have him evaluated by a healthcare provider. In the meantime, it may be helpful to try to keep your son's legs straight as much as possible and avoid activities that cause his knees to bend backwards, as this can exacerbate the condition and cause additional discomfort.

Ovary none, EM 4.9 , D11-rt.ovary 1.7× 1.7cm EM 6.4, D13 - rt. Ovary same. EM 8.9,D15- EM 9.8 ovary is rapsar..... It is the normal result? When is get pregent? That is the big problem or not? Plz tell my. Give me good way.
answer: Follicular studies, also known as follicle tracking or ovulation monitoring, involve monitoring the growth and development of the ovarian follicles, which contain the eggs. The results of a follicular study can provide useful information about the timing of ovulation and the potential for pregnancy. However, it is important to note that there are many factors that can influence a person's fertility and their chances of getting pregnant, and a follicular study alone is not a reliable predictor of pregnancy.There are a few things that can be gleaned from the information you provided about your follicular study. It appears that you have one functioning ovary, as there is no mention of a left ovary. On days 9, 11, 13, and 15 of your cycle, the size of the follicles in your right ovary increased, with the largest follicle measuring 9.8mm on day 15. This suggests that ovulation may have occurred around this time or shortly thereafter.It is also worth noting that the size of the follicles and the timing of ovulation can vary from cycle to cycle, and what is considered "normal" can vary from person to person. You may also want to consider speaking with a healthcare provider or a fertility specialist to discuss any potential fertility issues and receive guidance on how to increase your chances of getting pregnant.
